story:
NIGHT OF THE WEIRDOS SYNOPSIS 

The year is 1999...

The Backstreet Boys play on repeat on most radio stations...

Audience members still have no idea who the Phantom Menace is... 

Countless hours are wasted playing "Snake" on the Nokia 3210...

And the world fears for the worst as Y2K approaches...

 

Yet, for the children who reside in Mrs. Norris' home for orphans, this year is going to suck the life out of them...literally!

As an ancient evil in the form of a seductive woman awakens, her hunt for those in the orphanage has just begun!

 

OK...BUT WHAT IS THIS BOOK ABOUT???

Night of the Weirdos centers around a group of special children, all from different backgrounds, but connected by the orphanage that they all live in. As normal as their lives could possibly be, they are unexpectedly faced with a world ending entity. For reasons unknown to them, they are being hunted down by a woman with divine powers. This woman is an unstoppable evil from a long forgotten time and she is absolutely bent on wiping out the entire world. This book chronicles the horrific but epic tale of the children who will, one day, be known around the world as "The Weirdos".    

(I know, I just reworded the synopsis and broke it down for all my slow people.)

 

SAMPLE PAGES FROM VOLUME 1 (INCLUDING THE COVER FOR VOLUME 1)

 

Purchase a perk to see what happens next!!!

 

Meet Our Protagonists:

TRISTAN

 

NICK

 

VARGAS

 

SIMON

 

ALICE

 

GIMPLEY

 

HARPER

 

ROOSEVELT

 

Meet Our Antagonist: 

LILITH

 

BRIEF MESSAGES 

FROM

WRITER & CREATOR: H.J. MAESTRE

Night of the Weirdos is the first book in a long series of novels. The idea was birthed at 2am during one of my graveyard shifts, working as a valet attendant, in 2011. I had grown up with an admiration for film and my desire to direct a full length feature had always been one of my dreams. With that urgent appetite of creating a film, I sat at a laptop and I asked myself, "What would you like to see on a big screen one day?"

I immediately envisioned a dark muscle car racing through a highway, and I could see it chasing after a mountain troll, who was throwing cars behind him, in an attempt to stop their pursuer. I knew the people in the cars being thrown were at risk of being seriously hurt, so I decided a small goblin with the ability to teleport, could go in and out of each car, and teleport them to safety. And lastly, I figured it'd be cool to add a massive werewolf running on all fours, with it's sights on this mountain troll. 

And that's how it all started.

10 years later...I am proud to finally unveil the first entry to a saga of stories centering around a humble group of orphans. Together, we'll journey through the path that lies before them. 

 

 

ARTIST: AMALTEA MONTERO

We were blessed to have Artist "Tero" as the artist to Night of the Weirdos. Her artwork fueled the vision that I had for this particular story. The best way to describe her style is Cinematic and thought provoking. Every detail and shade added, depicts a deeper sense of the danger and threat that this book's universe faces. For those seeking their own artistic desires and would like to work with Tero. I encourage you to reach out to her professional IG account @amalteamontero

 

 

COVER ARTIST: ANASTASIA KOLTYSHEVA

 

Anastasia came into the project towards the end of the first volume, and she injected her a new level of energy into the book. Her cover is the first thing that a reader will be drawn to and it's just a perfect set up to what follows once the reader opens their book. Once again, I encourage everyone to check out her IG account to gaze upon her artwork @amaranthlatoe

story:
What's Habibteh, Pada?

Habibteh, Pada follows a 10-year-old African immigrant as she navigates her scary, fantastical new home.

Set in the Levant, the bulk of each episode is without dialogue: we hear Arabic but (like Pada) we don't have the luxury of subtitles! To make things worse, a single magical event breaks the realism in each episode. Giant birds, ogre chefs, and ugly djinns threaten Pada and her new friends. Fear not! Across each episode, Pada hears a new Arabic word that will eventually help fight the monster. Together, we build our vocabulary and understanding of this magical new world...

I wrote a screenplay because I would ultimately like to turn it into a Children's TV show. However, I want a high level of autonomy for my artistic vision and rather than pitch the screenplay to LA folks who've never heard of me, I'm turning it into a graphic novel!

 

This is where YOU come in!

Comic book artwork, it ain't cheap baby! Each page will cost $150 and Chapter One will run around 40 pages - THAT'S $6,000!!! GASP!

I'm asking you guys to contribute what you will to help me bring my project to life. Every little bit helps and every little bit is very much appreciated

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If indiegogo isn't your preferred platform, you can donate directly  

Venmo: Ameen-Beydoun (https://venmo.com/code?user_id=1477620306804736894)
PayPal: ameenbey@gmail.com (https://www.paypal.com/paypalme/ameenbeydoun)

If you have broader issues with the monetization of our consumer society, no worries! You can follow and share 

Instagram: ameen_bey  (https://www.instagram.com/ameen_bey/)
Facebook: Ameen Dabbous Beydoun 


Where did the project come from?

In February 2020, I found myself quarantining at my parent's home in Queens, NYC. I had just quit my tech job in Nairobi, Kenya and was looking to restart my filmmaking career. I did some research on Writer's Rooms that I was interested in and saw that Sesame Street's deadline was closing soon. I decided to write a spec script for it and episode one of Habibteh, Pada was born. The project is very telling of who I am as a person - I'm a Lebanese-American filmmaking student who lived across Sub-Saharan African from 2012 - 2020. I'm currently writing to you from San Diego, my new home.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Jamaal "Malley" Simpson, I am the creator and writer of They Call Him: Marvelous, Stretchsika and the Freedom Friends, and The Adventures of Mister Shorty.  I am a inspiring comic book writer who wants to tell a exciting and entertaining like Stan Lee, Paul Dini, and Mike Imboden.
  • This is the third and final installment of a three issues miniseries called They Call Him: Marvelous a neo-blaxploitation action dramedy superhero series.  I always wanna do a series to express my love for superheroes and blaxploitation film in general.
  • I took a long detour on this series due to naysayers but with your help we can be a step closer in finishing this miniseries and y'all enjoying reading it and enjoy a couple of rewards that's goes with this campaign.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • I need $1,500 to fund this project
  • Special catch up perks for those who missed out on the kickstarter of the first two issues of the They Call Him: Marvelous miniseries plus variant covers version of the first issue only.
  • If this campaign is successful or close to successful the funds will go upon shipping out the third issue of the miniseries plus the first two issues of the miniseries if anyone missed out on the kickstarter version.  And if I have any money leftover it'll goes towards the fourth and final issue of the miniseries and possibly the new issue one.

The Impact

  • I have one successful kickstarter with They Call Him: Marvelous Issue 1 and 2 of the miniseries under the Champion Comics logo.
  • All excitement aside I'm gonna be real with y'all this campaign is gonna be a challenge but if it successful I'm gonna try my best to make sure that your books and rewards will be mailed out in a orderly fashion.

Risks & Challenges

The Book is done.  The toughest part of the job is dealing with shipping. If this project funds I'll consider using a fulfillment house or even hire a staffer to help stuff envelopes and manage mailing lists.

I like to thank David Jaxon, Shaun Barbour, Thyago Brandao, Francisco Zamora, and Alexander Malyshev for their part in this book.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The more you share this campaign, the more backers come in and the more we buff out the book for everyone! Please share the link, let your friends know and use the Indiegogo share tools to push this out to all of your social media outlets.

story:
Lead by Nightevil, the Sisterhood of Lilith is one of the most powerful infernal cults in Chicago. Their main goal: to ready the world for the return of their goddess, who will then enslave those who worship her and eradicate the rest. The children of their breeders, (Neo Nephilim or Neo-Nephs) infest the city, but are kept in check by Victor Locke, Decoy and other Chicago based hunters.

 

Iron Sights and The Abductables artist Ibai Canales 

 

Posters by Nathyn Masters, KARNxJiro and colors by Lelia Pacheco

 

The children of SOL breeders, (Neo Nephilim or Neo-Nephs) are infesting the city, but one child, a magic adapt named Damious is found to completely human, thus now, as a man, he will be forced to marry. While able to choose from many brides, he knows where such union will lead. Like former member Hanover Blake, he seeks to escape, but knows there's no hope.     

 

Meanwhile The Rise of Magic, headed by the very rich and mystically powerful sorcerer Natas Talbane has created a corporation built on magic and hopes to eventually rise to power in the government. His biggest problem; Loren Talbane, his hard partying, troublemaking daughter. But his fixer Owl Wiess has fatal plans for her.    

 

Frank Stein Industries, founded on the back of the Frankenstein family lineage, continues its research through its "Resurrection Sciences" division. Hooker Cassie Riser, discovers first hand the secrets of their "science". Reanimated with a stitched up body and a taste for human flesh Cassie takes revenge on those who mistreated her as she seeks her killer.   

 

Creative Team

Story: Nathyn Brendan Masters

Art: Joseph Canave, Really Ruds, KARNxJiro and Nathyn Brendan Masters

2017 Cover: Really Ruds

New Cover: Ibal Canales

Colors: Kayla Swain and Lelia Pacheco

Letters: Blackout Texture Shop

 

The Books: Epitaph Bread and Salt, Demon Noir and Decoy

 

Funding Goals: The High Cost of Living

We're seeking a minimum of $1000 to get the books into the hands of backers, but the more we make, the better deals we can get. This is a compilation of the Epitaph Bread and Salt books "Beginning of the End" and "The Darksiders," it also includes "Zombie Girl Ravenous" and the unpublished "Missing Chapter". The funding is mainly to publish this compilation and get it into people's hands.  Books will be signed by series creator Nathyn Brendan Masters. 

 

The Impact: Fight the Good Fight

Epitaph Bread and Salt is the creation of independent writer artist and filmmaker Nathyn Brendan Masters. Ten years in the making and several revisions and a full length movie prequel, this series is the core of the Night Phoenix Press Universe, with this campaign we seek to bring you the definitive telling of this story before moving into phaze two.

Epitaph Bread and Salt is not only a story, but a launch pad for multiple characters and stories that are seeking an audience. The goal is to make you a long term member of that audience. We seek to tell old school Heaven and Hell, action, horror and superhero stories. 

 

Risks & Challenges: Death and Destruction

Because this is a compilation there are very few risk and challenges and very few modifications will be made. While complications can happen, the main goal is to get the complete original story out to older fans and make new ones.

 

Other Ways You Can Help: Spread the Message

If you can't contribute, you can help in the most basic ways possible which are sharing and posting the link and talking about it with people especially when talking about comics and pop culture. You can share the campaign easily with Indiegogo's share tools.

 

Stretch Goals

$3,000 STRETCH GOAL: All books ship with new cover by Iron Sights Artist Ibai Canales!

$5,000 STRETCH GOAL: All tiers get an extra trading card by a guest artist.

$10,000 STRETCH GOAL: A new poster added to the $50 and up tiers by a guest artist.

story:
New pre-order option is now here - https://igg.me/at/sos3preorder/x/416911

 

 

The mag will be in 16cm x 24cm format, full colour, perfect bound with high quality printing. (Page count to be finalized as creators are added but so far 56 pages and counting!)

Work from really rather super talented writers and artists from around the world. With a great cover by Jessica Meyrick.

Some of the glowing reviews:

"Excellent!" - Ian Rankin

"Definitely worth a look" - The Quietus

"stunningly impressive" -  disclaimermag.com

"to be commended for striving to do something new and interesting" -  forbiddenplanet.co.uk

"Pretty impressive if I do say" - David Graeber

The Save Our Souls manifesto...

 To be a place that promotes and encourages high quality work while being informative and fun.

To help fight the 'work for free and exposure' culture that is infecting the creative fields.

To work hard to be a publication that is unique, groundbreaking and 'must own'.

To meet our goals we...

We hand-pick and invite our writers and creators fresh from the farm to make sure this will be like nothing produced in the UK before.

Includes articles and reports on wide ranging topics and experiences by some of the best writers currently being published in major newspapers, magazines and websites.

We crowdfund each issue.

                         Photo: Issue #2

 

 

 

The funds we raise to publish Save Our Souls goes to...

High quality printing that does justice to the very lovely artwork and design.

So that the first 15 pages of the magazine doesn't have to be full of watch and perfume adverts.

We can pay the contributors for their work! The more crowdfunding we raise the more we can pay the creators so please support us all and spread the word!

Apart from the mag, what can I get?

You can pick a pretty perk like this lovingly printed limited edition, A4 print of the SOS #3 stunning back cover artwork by Cole Ott!

 

 

 

And readers of the previous issues love it...
"...an important publication, mixing articles with illustration, and doing both fantastically well." - @TomboyPrincess

"I have the first two and think they are tremendous and wish there was more of that sort of thing in the world" - @SirSandGoblin

"Both introduced me to so many new artists and inspired me! Good to know creators were paid as well!" - @Arkolina

"I've got the first two issues and excited about the next - it's fantastic art & is definitely saving my weary soul" - @Sassgee

"Wonderful stuff" - @hilliatfields

"Vol 1 got me through some depressing health issues. I laughed out loud in the hospital clinic. Stories were insightful and fresh." - @danger_kittens

                         Photo: Issue #1

story:
Tommy Delaney is KID ANARCHY. He's a troubled 15 year old punk rocker adrift in the year 1984. Tommy is upset with his mother for her drinking and abandonment then he's forced to go live with his relatives in Mississippi. He has no rights, no father, and no plans for a future other than forming a band and playing the Antenna Club in Memphis. However, Tommy is too young to ever be allowed into this counter-culture dive bar.

When Tommy arrives in Mississippi and is forced to make new friends, he is quick to judge. He finds solace in playing bar chords on his beat up guitar (his hero is Johnny Ramone). Tommy has no inspiration to write his own song until he meets Nina, his English teacher who assigns a book report on Orwell's "1984". Slowly he discovers that rebellion comes in many different shapes and sizes and somewhere there is a balance between rule and ruin. When these new friends speak to Tommy's heart, he must re-evaluate the life he is living and the direction he is headed. 

KID ANARCHY is a character and a comic books series that was originally created in 1982 by Mike McCarthy (artist) and George Cole (writer). Cole and McCarthy met in Design class at Northeast Mississippi Junior College.

Born in the last years of the baby boom, the teenage boys immediate connection was music, albeit on different sides of the cultural landscape: Cole gave McCarthy homemade mix tapes featuring English and American punk bands that McCarthy had never heard of. In this, there was an ulterior motive. Cole needed a guitar player for his punk rock band and was hoping to make a convert out of McCarthy. It didn't take long for McCarthy to abandon his tastes in southern rock and heavy metal for the punk and pop sounds of his own generation.  McCarthy, a fledgling cartoonist, turned Cole onto the alternative comics scene of the early '80's, especially the work being published by Fantagraphics Books. If they could create a story that Fantagraphics would publish that encompassed their unique take on "punk", as the Hernandez Bros. had done with Love & Rockets, yet infused with the culture clash of southern characters, they would have a winner. That idea became KID ANARCHY. 

KID ANARCHY was published by Fantagraphics Book for 3 issues from 1990-1993.

Flash-forward 23 years: KID ANARCHY is now a screenplay loosely based on the 90's comic book about an ‘80’s culture. The screenplay was written from 2012 through 2016 by George Cole, Mike McCarthy, with friend and co-writer Bart Shannon. 

The proposed 100 page graphic novel will be based on the KID ANARCHY screenplay. If the graphic novel ultimately helps get the movie version made, all the better, but McCarthy wants the story to LIVE (regardless of format). It just so happens McCarthy can illustrate the entire screenplay (with your support!)

Cartooning was McCarthy's original passion before he started making films. Now he’s looking forward to returning to comics with a cast of characters that he and George Cole started out with so long ago. The new graphic novel will again be published by Fantagraphics Books around 2019.

Since KID ANARCHY was a three issue series that came out back in the early '90's, Fantagraphics publisher Gary Groth suggested using a different title now to avoid confusion with the earlier books. Therefore the new graphic novel will be called THE ANGRY REDNECKS: (A KID ANARCHY ADVENTURE).

In the story, Tommy forms a punk rock band composed of himself on guitar and lead vocal with his best friends Sam Boone on drums and Sherman Krellberg on bass. Sam and Sherman have no previous experience playing in a punk band but according Tommy, that's a PLUS. Tommy must revert the 'brain damage' inflicted upon Sam by the sounds of Ted Nugent, Molly Hatchet, and other hard rockers for whom Tommy shows a stomach-churning disdain. Will punk win out over the corporate interests of the day?  Will friendships be tested along the way?

The Angry Rednecks band made no appearances in the '90's version of Kid Anarchy comic books. However, there was a real (albeit short-lived) Angry Rednecks band composed of George Cole, John Prescott, and Mike McCarthy (pictured below) circa 1983. Supporting character Sherman Krellberg's eventual backstory was based somewhat on John Prescott.

The real "Angry Rednecks" practiced in an old Mississippi shed which was quite a distance from McCarthy's house and required many long orange extension cords to power the noisy chaos where 60 years earlier, McCarthy's grandfather had parked his Model T Ford. 

The Angry Rednecks had several after-school practices performing short bursts of energy like "Mississippi" and "Skoal Patrol" before they were unceremoniously unplugged one day by an unemployed, gap-toothed Chuck Moonchow. This was literally and symbolically the end of the real Angry Rednecks. They were waiting for a sign.

Chuck Moonchow is a self-taught painter, a self-proclaimed "ridge runner" from West Virginia, an exile from the planet Murania, and an expert Dungeons & Dragons player. In fact, the Angry Rednecks shed would soon become the location for 6 months of heated D&D encounters with Cole, Prescott, and McCarthy (as Dungeon Master) while Chuck antagonized as an evil wizard. Many of Chuck's zany quotes from these 1983 games (and fanzine interviews) will be used verbatim in "The Angry Rednecks" graphic novel. The real Chuck is very similar to the cartoon Chuck because he blurred the lines of fantasy and reality.

Chuck met Mike McCarthy in 1978 and quickly became an antidote for McCarthy's pre-punk lackadaisical existence in Mississippi . There are numerous Chuck Moonshow references in many of McCarthy's film projects. Simply put, Chuck Moonchow is Mike McCarthy's guru. 

After the move to Memphis in 1984, George and Mike would form a new rock & roll band that needed a name if they were to play the "world famous" Antenna Club. McCarthy asked Moonchow to come up with a band name. Chuck suggested the monicker "Distemper”. The rest was history (of an underground sort).

If McCarthy and Cole weren't collaborating on comics, they were playing together in bands. In the Eric Page photograph below, McCarthy (singing) and Cole (far right) play their last Distemper gig at the Antenna in December, 1986. Luckily, when the bands (or the films) played out, there was always comics books. 

In the The Angry Rednecks comic book world of 1984, Chuck Moonchow gives "The Angry Rednecks" it's very name and mission by encouraging Tommy, Sam, and Sherman to destroy at will. Tommy takes this advice too literally.

The Angry Rednecks (A Kid Anarchy Adventure) graphic novel is set in 1984 for many reasons. It's the year that Cole and McCarthy transitioned from Mississippi to Memphis. McCarthy attended the Memphis Art Academy and George took a job as a draftsman. Their band Distemper played the first all-ages show at the Antenna Club, opening for Dagnasty and the Descendants. Meanwhile Reagan became a poster boy for the hardcore punk movement. 

During this period, Cole and McCarthy were inspired by old comics like Archie and Peanuts and new comics artists like Peter Bagge and Dan Clowes in building stories around the Kid Anarchy characters (over a diet of frozen pizza and chocolate Yoo Hoo's).

1984 was memorable for the release of many punk anthems, specifically Husker Du's ZEN ARCADE, Minutemen's DOUBLE NICKELS ON THE DIME, REM'S RECKONING, The Ramones TOO TOUGH TO DIE, and The Replacements LET IT BE.

The Dead Kennedy's PLASTIC SURGERY DISASTERS 8 track played in George Cole's car in heavy rotation. All these new sounds were the core principles of McCarthy and Cole's musical identity and informed the once and future amalgamation of Tommy Delaney.

In fact, Tommy is quite surprised when his English teacher Nina Reid already knows the lyrics to "California Uber Alles". It should also be mentioned that Dead Kennedy's singer Jello Biafra once took a dump at George Cole's home (in the bathroom, naturally) and is awaiting his cameo in the movie or graphic novel. We love you Jello!

1984 was the first full year that McCarthy and Cole spent in Memphis following their move from Mississippi. In The Angry Rednecks (A Kid Anarchy Adventure) script, the same becomes true for Tommy - but in reverse. When he is forced to move to Mississippi, he fears the type of people he will have to hang out with. English teacher Nina gives George Orwell's "1984" as a reading assignment. Time passes, Tommy develops a huge crush on Nina while he struggles to finish the book (and the year) before he, like Winston Smith, meets an uncertain fate. Luckily for Tommy, his new friends will pull him through and his damning perspective of Mississippi will change.

The Kid Anarchy screenplay placed in the top 15% of the 2016 Austin Screenplay Competition (out of 9,100 entries). The story was selected as the campaign with the most potential by Indie GoGo from several dozen entries at the Indie Memphis Film Festival in the same year. Fantagraphics Books has agreed to publish the book, sight unseen. When we look around the current landscape, note that George Orwell's book "1984" hit #1 on the NY Times best seller list (again after 70 years) ... and 1970's and '80's punk music is more relevant than ever.

It seems that there is a market for a graphic novel that speaks to those young people back in the early '80's who listened to punk and thought they would never grow old, or were already older than their years. "The Angry Rednecks: A Kid Anarchy Adventure" is also for anyone who appreciates American pop culture and loves a good story and good cartooning. Cole, McCarthy, and Shannon wrote in a style that is reminiscent of filmmakers like John Hughes or Richard Linklater or author S.E. Hinton, while McCarthy’s vast knowledge of 20th century American comic book art influences an evolved style that is familiar and accessible. 

Hey folks! I’m asking for 10K to illustrate “The Angry Rednecks: A Kid Anarchy Adventure”. With 10K, I pay myself $100 a page for illustrating a 100 pages of art (minus the cost of creating and mailing out the perks). This is a decent page rate for underground comics work. That's pencils, inks, lettering, and the intense amount of time it takes to adapt and edit the screenplay into the graphic novel. Color may also be added as the pages are finished which I will pay for.

It will likely take me two years to draw the estimated 100 pages - as well as the covers. Fantagraphics Books will take an additional year to schedule the book for printing. The scope of the entire project, from screenplay inception to published graphic novel looks to be about 8 years! Meanwhile, Producer John Crye will seek out investment for a possible feature film. Therefore, this is more than just another art assignment, it's a way of life. Your contribution will help keep the lights on in my attic studio and give me the enthusiasm and purpose to finish the job. With you, this happens.

We want to give the audience something entertaining. At the same time, the message should be personal and have a deeper and long-lasting value. The ‘80’s punk scene spoke to my generation. Punk offers a framework in this ‘coming of age’ story. It’s not easy being different, but sometimes its your only option. The Angry Rednecks (A Kid Anarchy Adventure) uses punk culture and pop culture to tell a story that is universal and multi-generational.

Thanks for your time and your thoughtful contribution to this campaign. If this is not a good time for you to contribute, please share this project with a friend.

Mike McCarthy, Memphis, TN
story_txt: Tommy Delaney is KID ANARCHY. He's a troubled 15 year old punk rocker adrift in the year 1984. Tommy is upset with his mother for her drinking and abandonment then he's forced to go live with his relatives in Mississippi. He has no rights, no father, and no plans for a future other than forming a band and playing the Antenna Club in Memphis. However, Tommy is too young to ever be allowed into this counter-culture dive bar.When Tommy arrives in Mississippi and is forced to make new friends, he is quick to judge. He finds solace in playing bar chords on his beat up guitar (his hero is Johnny Ramone). Tommy has no inspiration to write his own song until he meets Nina, his English teacher who assigns a book report on Orwell's "1984". Slowly he discovers that rebellion comes in many different shapes and sizes and somewhere there is a balance between rule and ruin. story:
*I must warn that these previews contains strong language and gore*

*SUGGESTED FOR MATURE READERS*

 

Rorschach cover and pages 1 to 9:

What even is Damned Nation of the West?

DNotW is an upcoming and ongoing post-apocalyptic fantasy horror comic series that will focus on the trials, tribulations and freedom of its desolate landscape and its remnants - every issue has much to digest with an ongoing story that takes it time for readers to resonate with gripping, spirited and enthralling story arcs sprinkled with wit on it. 

With your help this story of a post-apocalyptic American tale with a smirk on its face will shock and awe.

Update: Now this is the overall logline of the series as a whole and as issue 1 starts and takes place in the eve of the outbreak it isn't reflective of issue 1's plot --

“In the distant upon an outbreak that’s left the Americas in a crippled state, the remaining few of a demolished shelter trek their way across the lands, in an everyday fight against feral creatures, drifters alike, and themselves... This unforgiving Epic is the plague for their mistakes.”

Issue 1 (Black Matter part one) follows detectives Gabriele Rossi and Oliver Clinton in the middle of the job as their lives are forever changed in this bloody night with twists and turns along the way.

 

The beginnings.

And ends.

 

Stretch Goals

£5,000 STRETCH GOAL *LOCKED* a 10x10 canvas print perk added to the roster.

£7,500 STRETCH GOAL *LOCKED* Damned Nation of the West  issue 2: Black Matter part two (consisting of 35 pages in the current draft of the script) - an Indiegogo exclusive edition that will combine the 2 issues into a seamless double feature - a tier for you to become a character in issue 2.

£8,000 STRETCH GOAL *LOCKED* a 2nd 10x10 canvas print to go along with issue 2 and be a companion piece of the 1st canvas print. 

I'm open to add more perks and options but I'll stick to the things I'm more confident of attaining for now.

The Risks and Challenges

The only things needed to complete issue 1 are a handful of retouches on certain panels throughout issue 1, remastering 3 full pages. Update: issue 1 is now complete and I've sent a handful of digital copies to be reviewed! adding an additional double page spread in the middle and the completion of the last page. 

Of course, at the time of typing this, issue 2 has yet to be started in the art phase but you have a merchant's promise that the product will be ready in its highest quality. Another potential challenge (in the time being) attaining a printer provider, preferably a Newsprinter.

Since this is my first published work it's been an interesting creative outburst where I had to get out of my comfort zone and vastly develop as a more fluent line artist and colourist the further I got into completing this comic. Of course, it has and is a challenge to balance and manage the time to work on DNotW since there's people and life in the way. 

Nonetheless, DNotW is my objective in life and will always be a priority, especially now. 

What Happens After the Campaign?

Now that you've gotten this far I have to say you have great fucking taste in comics, and most importantly, I'd just like to state in the moment I've published this campaign and this comic has officially been revealed to public eyes Damned Nation of the West will be my upmost priority - my magnum opus - and my plans for what will come next after this campaign is over is to of course ship the perks to customers, and to expand the reach of DNotW and get a distributor to get it into CB stores - even beyond CB stores even, but that's just my ambition talking. 

 

Again, publishing this Indiegogo campaign prides me to work tirelessly to bring this book in your hands in January of 2019. You won't be disappointed. 

If there are any questions about this project, my email is lhagomesart@gmail.com - I'm always open on Twitter, and my Instagram is where behind the scene snipbits are posted.

Even if not financially, simply sharing on social media could make a difference in helping out a lot and is most appreciated! 

Cheers,

Luis Henrique Gomes

story:
The Story of Great Changes as It Was

We are a team of enthusiasts, we want to tell the world that great changes should be achieved with love and tolerance. We believe that the best way to share our ideas is art. And to make it more impressive and interesting, we make comics.

MAYRO team gathered amazing artists, who share with us our pacifism.  The story's uniqueness is that it's based on real events which have even much action than the fantasy has.

Love and Solidarity

The first part of the book, for which we've started this campaign, tells about the beginning of the revolution, about leaders and their walking campaign.

The extreme concentration of power in the hands of president and his party, the continuing falsifications of elections, economic, legal and social problems, the dominant position of the oligarchs, and the existence of monopolies have long provoked and discontent and distrust of the majority of the people towards the authorities.

To show their protest, leaders of the revolution started their life-changing walk complain from one of the cities and did 300 000 steps to get to the capital, where there was a huge crowd waiting for them to oppose.

 

 

 

 

The opposition adopted the strategy of open hands an non-violence. 

There are many epic moments, like the one, where protesters are capturing the public radio building. Or the one, which shows the clash between protesters and police. 

 

 

Sometimes, it seemed, that the criminal regime won

again...

BUT... 

What We Need & What You Get

We want the story of Velvet Revolution to be known worldwide, so we've created this crowdfunding campaign to be able to finish, publish and ship the first part of the book. After that we will start working on the other parts of the comics. 

When we get our first goal, 10 000$, we will publish the first part of comic book and start shipping.   

20 000$ and we will add extra pages and new perks for 1st part.

50 000$  and we will start working on second and third parts of the book. 

100 000$ and we'll increase our team, publish all 5 parts of the book. 

200 000$ and we'll publish new comic books from MAYRO about Armenian mythology and tales. 

 

Did you like it? Share to your friend!
story_txt:
The Story of Great Changes as It Was
We are a team of enthusiasts, we want to tell the world that great changes should be achieved with love and tolerance. We believe that the best way to share our ideas is art. And to make it more impressive and interesting, we make comics.

MAYRO team gathered amazing artists, who share with us our pacifism.  The story's uniqueness is that it's based on real events which have even much action than the fantasy has.
Love and Solidarity
The first part of the book, for which we've started this campaign, tells about the beginning of the revolution, about leaders and their walking campaign.
The extreme concentration of power in the hands of president and his party, the continuing falsifications of elections, economic, legal and social problems, the dominant position of the oligarchs, and the existence of monopolies have long provoked and discontent and distrust of the majority of the people towards the authorities.

To show their protest, leaders of the revolution started their life-changing walk complain from one of the cities and did 300 000 steps to get to the capital, where there was a huge crowd waiting for them to oppose.
 

 

 

 
The opposition adopted the strategy of open hands an non-violence. 
There are many epic moments, like the one, where protesters are capturing the public radio building. Or the one, which shows the clash between protesters and police. 
 

 

Sometimes, it seemed, that the criminal regime won
again...

BUT... 

What We Need & What You Get
We want the story of Velvet Revolution to be known worldwide, so we've created this crowdfunding campaign to be able to finish, publish and ship the first part of the book. After that we will start working on the other parts of the comics. 
When we get our first goal, 10 000$, we will publish the first part of comic book and start shipping.   
20 000$ and we will add extra pages and new perks for 1st part.
50 000$  and we will start working on second and third parts of the book. 
100 000$ and we'll increase our team, publish all 5 parts of the book. 
200 000$ and we'll publish new comic books from MAYRO about Armenian mythology and tales. 
 
Did you like it? Share to your friend!

story:
Thank you for visiting our page!


WHO ARE WE?

Growing up in eastern North Carolina, Micah Peterson and Tim Davis were both big comic book and science fiction fans. In Spring 2016, Micah decided to try his hand at illustrating his first comic book hero. After seeing this, Tim, who had the gift of storytelling and writing, suggested that they form their own company. Thus, PD Comics was born!


WHY YOU SHOULD CARE!

Are you a fan of comic books or films? Science Fiction? Exciting stories?


If you answered, “Yes,” to any of these questions, then that’s why you should care!

After nine months of brainstorming and writing character ideas, stories, and plots, PD Comics first full issue of Lineage is nearly complete!

That’s where you come in!

While this project has been a great joy for us both, and will certainly be completed at whatever pace we can manage… We would love to see our comics and stories on store shelves and in the hands of our friends, family, and future fans before they qualify for retirement. Moreover, this has grown into more than just a hobby for us both, and we would love to one day turn this into a full-time career as writers and illustrators!

 

WHAT WE NEED

We are looking to raise a total of $15,000 through this campaign in order to see Lineage, our premier series; finished, printed, advertised, published, and distributed to stores.

List of expenses:

  1. Various legal fees (trademarks, copyrights, etc.) = $500
  2. Printing Fees (This amount varies greatly depending on the chosen printing source, the total number of copies to be printed due to the final donation total, the individual donation amounts, etc.) = $1,200
  3. Tools for "Efficiency" = $3,500
    • a computer for our writer Tim Davis
    • a digital Wacom tablet for our artist Micah Peterson
  4. Marketing & Advertising = $1,000
    • business cards
    • t-shirts
    • stickers
    • web ads
    • posters & banners
    • a website
  5. Passes and travel to local events and "Cons" (to help spread the word!) = $1,000
  6. Unforeseen / Extra expenses = $1,000
  7. Payment to various contractors (logo designer, audio engineer, campaign host) = 13% of total earnings
  8. Supplemental income (for us to get the project done in a timely manner.) = $4,850 (remainder)

While this is certainly a project by and from Micah Peterson and Tim Davis, it is their greatest hope that this becomes something for all our members, fans, and loved ones! 


WHAT YOU GET!

  1. A formal “Thank You Letter” and regular updates on the project.
  2. The digital issue of "Lineage" OR "Spectrum" #1 upon completion.
  3. Paperback issue of "Lineage" OR "Spectrum" #1 from the first round of mass printings.
  4. A signed paperback issue of "Lineage" OR "Spectrum" #1 from the first round of mass printings.
  5. Alternate Covers.
  6. A subscription to the first year/season of digital issues.
  7. Subscription for the first year/season of physical paperback issues.
  8. Recive a personalized portrait of yourself as your very own original superhero!
  9. Have yourself immortalized as a character in an issue during our first year/season of issues.
  10. A night out with the with the artist and writer (dinner and festivities).

***With any perk/donation that is for an unspecified series (Lineage or Spectrum) we will contact you to complete your order so that you receive the proper reward!

PD Comics is more than excited to see this project become a reality. Whether we receive $50, or $50,000, Lineage and our other projects WILL BE COMPLETED! It is for this reason that we've opted to go with the "FLEXIBLE FUNDING" option. Every dollar and every cent donated to our cause will go directly towards the list of expenses that will see this passion project fulfilled!

 

THE IMPACT

So why should you donate to our cause? And why do we KNOW that people will want to hear our stories, out of so many others in this industry? What sets us apart in an industry with no shortages in original content?

Well, there are a few BIG reasons! Firstly, this is a series “for the fans” & “by the fans”.
By that, we mean that we as the series creators are, of course, fans of comic books and graphic
novels. But beyond that, we’re hoping that this will also become an interactive project in which our fans will be able to influence and help decide where and how the story develops.

Next, Lineage sets itself apart from other comic book titles in the way that we’ll be using it to highlight many of the lesser known parts of the country. Featuring real towns, real people, and real events. No made up metropolitan cities, and no fake regions.
We’ll be starting this by having the series begin in North Carolina, and then progressing up and
down the east coast over the first “season”. Where we go from there, and what lesser-known regions we show off, our fans will help decide!

And finally, one of the biggest things that will set Lineage apart from the competition, is the story itself! This isn’t a story of aliens, mutants, or science. But a story that will combine local and Scottish folklore into a new and refreshing origin story! Using flashbacks and branch-offs from the main storyline, we’ll get to discover just what happened to the Duncan family… and whether these abilities getting passed down are a gift, or something far more sinister.

 

OTHER/FUTURE PROJECTS

Lineage isn’t the only series that we at PD Comics have in the works! That’s right, in fact, we already have a total of 5 projects in our line-up!

SPECTRUM!
After Lineage, comes what could possibly be an even bigger series!!
Having worked with children with special needs, autism in particular, for most of his adult life; Tim Davis has developed the story about a boy with autism who becomes the hero we all wish we could be! Captain Hero is Andrew "Andy" Templeton's favorite afternoon television show. He loves superheroes and had always wanted to be one. When Andy gets the chance to meet his idol, circumstances cause Andy to be the hero he has always wanted to be. It's a story of acceptance. It's a story of understanding... And it's just plain fun! Through this set of comics we are calling "Spectrum: The Adventures of Andy Templeton", we hope to bring awareness to the autism community. In fact, after we print and begin to sell Spectrum, we plan to give a portion of the money earned from those copies to The Autism Society. This is a subject that is near and dear to Tim Davis' heart and is a personal calling to bring awareness to Autism Spectrum Disorder that affects 1 in 68 people in America.


THE TALES OF JACK EASTER
Our final project that’s still in its early conceptual stage, is “The Tales of Jack Easter”. This series will follow Jack, a bounty hunter set in a dark fantasy world that is a twisted version of the North Eastern territories and Canada, in the late 1700’s. These tales are being written as a new, and more “grim” origin story for some of the present-day traditions and fables that surround our culture and holidays. Such as the first novel, which will follow Jack as he hunts and attempts to slay a large beast, that the local villagers have claimed is a giant/monstrous rabbit.

CLOCK BOY
A quirky adventure that takes notes from some of the greats like Tim Burton’s animated films, and those shows with a more innocent look… such as “Over the Garden Wall” and “Gravity Falls”. It will follow our young protagonist as he ventures through the many stages of life, which will each present themselves as varied “wonderlands” with magnificent settings and differing challenges. The world of this series stands to be one, unlike anything you’ve ever seen!

LINEAGE: WITCH HUNTERS
Our fourth series that is still in early development, is a spin-off of our premiere series,
Lineage! "Witch Hunters” will tell the origin story of how the Duncans first received their abilities and the challenges that followed, during the Jacobite Rebellions of the early 1700’s in
Eastern Scotland.
 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Both Tim Davis and Micah Peterson currently work full-time jobs apart from the efforts to become career comic creators. This added to their growing families and the long list of pre-existing responsibilities takes away from their time to fully commit to the creation and development of these great stories. This said, they are committed to seeing this project through to its end and will do so at the most efficient and speedy pace that they can manage.

These challenges are one of the many reasons as to why we are here launching this campaign. The success of reaching our campaign goal would mean that both of us would have the chance to take time off from work and devote ourselves more fully to finishing Lineage #1 in a timely manner and by the intended date.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

We know that not all of our friends, family, and fans can donate financially. But if our project has caught your attention, if our story has piqued your interest, then please share our page on social media! Like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter, Instagram, and even LinkedIn!

And whether you're able to donate today, or simply like us on social media, THANK YOU for stopping by!

story:
Intro to this new comic series:  Ku-Mighty

Hello Fans!  This new series is a highly-anticipated project from a collaboration of world-renowned talent that will bring to life a comprehensive story universe that was in the making over the past 9 years by the acclaimed team at Starlight Runner Entertainment and Thunder Reign Studios. Ku-Mighty started as a game idea that was co-developed with the living legend of Magic: The Gathering, Richard Garfield. The game launch was put on hold, wanting first to introduce the immense story of Ku-Mighty to fans. This led us to our first INDIEGOGO campaign that will bring forth this exciting property, which will take you back to the mystical origins of Earth’s mythology and then into a sci-fi fantasy adventure that will first take place on a distant planet called Esharra. The Ku-Mighty epic is deep and wide and this first issue, Rise of the Righteous, will kick things off with the introduction of the key characters on Esharra embarking on a quest to solve the mystery behind the sudden vanishing of the planet’s enigmatic ancient race and secret society - The Ku. This Issue begins at a mid-point within the overall Esharrian Era timeline of the anthology in what is known as the 6th Period of the Reign of Chaos Epoch. 

In this Period, the main protagonist,  Pan-Ku, has just finished assembling a select team of experts in their respective domain of both intellectual and combat.  This band of "Anthros", in which they are referred to as, is comprised of scientists, linguists, astronomers, alchemists, archeologists, geographers, engineers and of course warriors in addition to others, who offer some unsavory, but useful skill sets. Pan-Ku has commissioned this team as the "Collectors" - Whose mission is to hunt for clues, artifacts & relics of the Ku and to protect them from falling into the hands of those who would use that knowledge and power in order to dominate and rule. This Expeditionary hunt across a menacing and battle-scarred planet, starts at an excavation site in the Northern most region of Esharra at a long-lost Ku temple. The voyage continues south with danger erupting around every corner and seemingly insurmountable challenges threatening the mission at every turn. New alliances are forged to strengthen the team and to advance Pan-Ku's campaign.

However, the story runs much deeper, as Pan-Ku and his Collectors are not only being pursued by competing powers and frequently confronted by monstrous dangers, there is also whispers of a prophecy of a forthcoming apocalyptic threat. There are times of fierce combat and heroics, the rise of one's spirit for overcoming the enduring struggle in the fight to survive, as well as the relentless quest for the truth of what happened to the Ku. There will be themes of love, loss and sacrifice, and the trope of finding friendship and the building of uncompromising loyalty to new alliances as well as to those who stand, and fight, beside you. The collective journey of the story's characters will present "distant mountains" to climb, which will reveal yet another chapter of the Ku-Mighty saga.

Fans will experience the odyssey and adventure of the Collectors and learn of the interwoven legends and mythology that will reveal the linkages to Earth. Fans will also learn how Earth's true history has been disguised by mythology. Each voyage, discovery, battle, victory, and tragedy will paint the story for the fans to track, explore and dive deeper into the mysteries that veil the story's conclusion. Learn more about the story and characters at: Ku-Mighty.com and join the mailing list for news and exclusive fan story details, distant mountain clues and dialog. 

Offering to the Fans

The primary intent of this campaign is to generate the required funding to produce the comic book. The value add to the fans are the array of awesome and unique pledge rewards that will include everything from participating in the conceptual design of Esharrian pirate ships, to claiming a geography discovery on Esharra, to receiving a secret clue pertaining to the story written in cuneiform on a clay tablet - Plus, many more extraordinary perks and rewards!

Our team's bottom line is to work diligently and with integrity to produce and deliver all perks and a high-quality collectible comic book and reward products and to keep the story moving forward as comic books or a graphic novel. We will be presenting the opportunity for fans as we reach new levels of funding through the Stretch Goal strategy. We promise to keep our fans continually involved and aware of the status, progress, milestones and any new and exciting information and offerings regarding the Ku-Mighty property and the campaign.

What We Hope to Achieve & What You Get as a Fan

This campaign's first objective is to raise enough funds to develop and publish this first issue and to share this amazing storyworld through both digital and print versions. Our team's initial goal is the raise $24,900 to fund full production of both digital and print versions and to cover the set Indiegogo fees and required reserve funds. We are offering Stretch Goals to offer and deliver some awesome production options and perks that will bring the fans' experience to the next level. Stretch Goals are described below.

Your pledges and fan participation with socializing and promoting this property will propel this first comic to production release and will open the floodgates to the future issues and follow-on series.  The second objective is the most important - We want to share this experience and to build a long-term relationship with our new fans, which will not only sustain this property but will help our team shape Ku-Mighty into a story that people will enjoy generation after generation. 

The Impact

Your contribution will not only bring this story universe to life but it will also support the amazing artists, writers and production talent who have provided their skills and passion to deliver the highest-quality comic, exclusive merchandise and fan experience. The number one goal is to make this property a fan-favorite in the form of an amazing story, awesome art and some extraordinary extras that will mature this property into what our Fans want and expect.  Our team is committed to producing excellence, but we depend on your funding, promotional support and enthusiasm to make this a success. This team will strive to create a special joint venture, and an enduring relationship, with our fans and to bring you series after series of a reader's adventure, continual exciting story arcs and provide the opportunity for you the fans to help build this property further through ideas, concepts and participation.

Risks & Challenges

It is our team's commitment to provide full transparency of plans and intent throughout and after the campaign to make fans aware of any risks and challenges of delays, shortfalls or any other issues. We will provide insight into any risks or obstacles and out plan to mitigate and overcome to achieve our goal with getting the highest quality story and art products and merchandise to the most important priority of this campaign - Our fans!

Other Ways That Fans Can Help

We understand that during these challenging times, not all fans can financially contribute to this campaign but we ask all fans to get the word out and make some noise about this new story property and this Indiegogo campaign. To support this important effort, please use the Indiegogo share tools! Fans can also join our mailing list on kumighty.com to stay up to speed on everything new and additional offerings as the property matures.

Further, we will be offering a referral contest to allow our fans and pledgers to refer their friends, family and people within their network to support this new project. The top two fans that win the referral contest will each receive 1 printed variant copy of the exclusive and very limited edition of the Dichotomy Cover Title - RISE OF THE WRETCHED.  The two winners will be those that either bring in the most number of fans that pledge to the campaign and the one that brings in the most pledge dollars total. 

Once this Stretch Goal is hit, fans will have the opportunity to take part in launching the first four characters in the form of high-quality resin 30mm-80mm figures with an option to get the figures painted by the exceptional art team at White Weasel Studio (https://miniaturepaintingservice.us/). This set will look awesome along with the comic, metal print and can be used for wargaming. Plus, we will have the fans decide which characters our 3D artist will create!

​​Join The Fight as a Ku-Mighty Ally with Launching this Comic Series!

No story, product, or property is worth anything without the fan's              involvement, love and Support! We thank you for your pledge!

 

Meet the Team

  • Jeff Gomez // CEO of Starlight Runner // Jeff is a leading expert in the fields of brand narrative, story world development, creative franchise design, and transmedia storytelling. As a producer accredited by the Producers Guild of America, Jeff also develops the story worlds of films, TV shows, video games, toys, books, and comics. Jeff’s work has contributed to such blockbuster properties as Disney’s Pirates of the Caribbean, Sony Pictures' Men in Black and Spider-Man, 20th Century Fox 's James Cameron’s Avatar, Hasbro’s Transformers, among many others. Jeff and his Starlight Runner team developed the official Story World Mythology for the existing ULTRAMAN series running on Netflix.    https://starlightrunner.com/
  • Steele Filipek // Starlight Runner Entertainment's Writer, Executive Editor & Lead Transmedia Producer // Steele worked on projects for Microsoft's Halo, Ubisoft's Splinter Cell, and Nickelodeon's Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.
  • Fabian Nicieza // Starlight Runner Entertainment's Chief Innovation Officer & Lead Writer // Fabian is one of the most prolific and successful comic book writers of all time, having sold over 200 million comics from Marvel, DC, Dark Horse and Acclaim. Fabian co-created Deadpool with Rob Liefeld, and many aspects of his origin and persona have found their way to the global blockbuster Deadpool feature (and sequels, Deadpool 2 and X-Force) from 20th Century Fox/Marvel, as well as the upcoming Deadpool animated series for FXX network.
  • Chris Rallis //Artist // Chris has created some unbelievable art for Applibot, Fantasy Flight Games, Penguin Books USA, Valve, and currently works almost exclusively for Wizards of the Coast. https://www.rallisart.com/
  • Simone Ragazzoni // Comics Artist & Illustrator // Simone will be performing Pencil, Inks and Colors and he has worked as artist and colorist on Sergio Bonelli Editore's sci-fi monthly series "Odessa" and most recently for BOOM! Studios as interior artist for the miniseries "Power Rangers: Drakkon New Dawn".   https://www.artstation.com/simoneragazzoni 
  • Jonboy Meyers // Comic and Cover Artist // Jonboy has been telling stories through art for as long as he can remember and has racked up notable credits such as Spawn, Superman, The Inhumans, Teen Titans, Spider-Man, The Walking Dead, Red Sonja, League of Legends, G.I. Joe, Black Dynamite, Thor, Generator Rex (animation), Supergirl, Huntress, She Hulk, Hulk, Arana, Gen 13, Ninja Scroll, Danger Girl, Justice League of America, X-Men (comic books), Motor Storm Apocalypse (video games), World of Warcraft TCG (illustration), Marvel Heroes MMO (Gazillion Entertainment). https://jonboymeyers.com/ 
  • DC Hopkins // Letterer/designer // DC has worked for BOOM!, Dark Horse, DC, Disney, Dynamite, Heavy Metal, Humanoids, IDW, Image, Oni, Scout, and more. hopkinsletters.com
  • Bryan Syme // Illustrator & Concept Artist // Bryan specializes in fantasy, science fiction, horror properties and has created for Wizards of the Coast, Paizo, Onyx path, and many others. https://bryansyme.artstation.com/

  • Joshua Cairós // illustrator and concept artist // Worked for the film industry and game industry with clients including Walt Disney studios, Legendary picture, Fantasy Flight Games ( Star Wars, Game of Thrones and Lord of the Rings ...) Cryptozoick, and others. http://www.joshuacairos.com/ 

  • Tiffany “Ti” Munro // Fantasy cartographer & Concept artist // Tiffany is a top fantasy world builder and has created art for trading card games, board and video games, and many RPG assets for Dungeons and Dragons, Pathfinder, FATE Core, and Troika.  http://feedthemultiverse.com/

  • Mindy Lopkin // Letterer, Editor, Designer & Pre-Print Production // Mindy has worked with Horizon Line Publishing, Pronto Comics, Running Press Books, Super Mystery Comics and Ellipsium Entertainment and has recently supported Billy Tucci's awesome graphic novel, Return of the Warrior: Shi . https://mindy490.wixsite.com/mindylopkin/about 

  • Alan Silva // 3D Artist & Digital Sculpter// Alan will be re-creating the Cover art of Chris Rallis to develop a very cool set of exclusive collectible miniatures for this campaign.  https://alansilvasp.artstation.com/

  • Carl "Meff" Mefferd // Comic, Concept and Storyboard Artist // co-creator and artist of the steampunk high seas adventure "Doctor Atlantis," the artist/writer of "Falling Awake" and Carl currently writes and draws the webcomic "JoyRiders."    https://www.meffillustrations.com/ 

  • S.A. and T.M. Housel // Founders of UGH! Entertainment’s Thunder Reign Studios // These brothers are story-world architects, game creators, scholars of mythology, ancient history and science-fiction conceptualization. Writing and Editing team.
  • Willie Jimenez // Character & Concept Artist// Art Student with awesome talent and showing his stuff here for the first time. Keep an eye on Willie! https://www.instagram.com/williejimenezart/ 
  • Imaginary Friends Studios // Concept Art Team // IFS has worked with many premium clients on major entertainment and game projects such as DC Comics, Marvel Comics, Image Comics, Top Cow, Hasbro, Sideshow Collectibles, Capcom, SquareEnix, Ubisoft, Sony Online Entertainment, Valve & Riot Games. Some of the projects and properties that has IFS’s name on it includes Batman Dark Knight, DOTA 2, League of Legends, Star Wars Galaxies, Street Fighter 3 Online, Darkstalkers Resurrection, Front Mission Evolved, Planetside 2 and more. IFS is renowned internationally with a huge fan following, with a collective page-views on our online art galleries for more than 100 million times. https://imaginaryfs.sg/

 

Page 1:   

 

Pan-Ku:

​
story_txt:
Intro to this new comic series:  Ku-Mighty
Hello Fans!  This new series is a highly-anticipated project from a collaboration of world-renowned talent that will bring to life a comprehensive story universe that was in the making over the past 9 years by the acclaimed team at Starlight Runner Entertainment and Thunder Reign Studios. Ku-Mighty started as a game idea that was co-developed with the living legend of Magic: The Gathering, Richard Garfield. The game launch was put on hold, wanting first to introduce the immense story of Ku-Mighty to fans. This led us to our first INDIEGOGO campaign that will bring forth this exciting property, which will take you back to the mystical origins of Earth’s mythology and then into a sci-fi fantasy adventure that will first take place on a distant planet called Esharra. The Ku-Mighty epic is deep and wide and this first issue, Rise of the Righteous, will kick things off with the introduction of the key characters on Esharra embarking on a quest to solve the mystery behind the sudden vanishing of the planet’s enigmatic ancient race and secret society - The Ku. This Issue begins at a mid-point within the overall Esharrian Era timeline of the anthology in what is known as the 6th Period of the Reign of Chaos Epoch. 

In this Period, the main protagonist,  Pan-Ku, has just finished assembling a select team of experts in their respective domain of both intellectual and combat.  This band of "Anthros", in which they are referred to as, is comprised of scientists, linguists, astronomers, alchemists, archeologists, geographers, engineers and of course warriors in addition to others, who offer some unsavory, but useful skill sets. Pan-Ku has commissioned this team as the "Collectors" - Whose mission is to hunt for clues, artifacts & relics of the Ku and to protect them from falling into the hands of those who would use that knowledge and power in order to dominate and rule. This Expeditionary hunt across a menacing and battle-scarred planet, starts at an excavation site in the Northern most region of Esharra at a long-lost Ku temple. The voyage continues south with danger erupting around every corner and seemingly insurmountable challenges threatening the mission at every turn. New alliances are forged to strengthen the team and to advance Pan-Ku's campaign.


However, the story runs much deeper, as Pan-Ku and his Collectors are not only being pursued by competing powers and frequently confronted by monstrous dangers, there is also whispers of a prophecy of a forthcoming apocalyptic threat. There are times of fierce combat and heroics, the rise of one's spirit for overcoming the enduring struggle in the fight to survive, as well as the relentless quest for the truth of what happened to the Ku. There will be themes of love, loss and sacrifice, and the trope of finding friendship and the building of uncompromising loyalty to new alliances as well as to those who stand, and fight, beside you. The collective journey of the story's characters will present "distant mountains" to climb, which will reveal yet another chapter of the Ku-Mighty saga.
Fans will experience the odyssey and adventure of the Collectors and learn of the interwoven legends and mythology that will reveal the linkages to Earth. Fans will also learn how Earth's true history has been disguised by mythology. Each voyage, discovery, battle, victory, and tragedy will paint the story for the fans to track, explore and dive deeper into the mysteries that veil the story's conclusion. Learn more about the story and characters at: Ku-Mighty.com and join the mailing list for news and exclusive fan story details, distant mountain clues and dialog. 
Offering to the Fans
The primary intent of this campaign is to generate the required funding to produce the comic book. The value add to the fans are the array of awesome and unique pledge rewards that will include everything from participating in the conceptual design of Esharrian pirate ships, to claiming a geography discovery on Esharra, to receiving a secret clue pertaining to the story written in cuneiform on a clay tablet - Plus, many more extraordinary perks and rewards!
Our team's bottom line is to work diligently and with integrity to produce and deliver all perks and a high-quality collectible comic book and reward products and to keep the story moving forward as comic books or a graphic novel. We will be presenting the opportunity for fans as we reach new levels of funding through the Stretch Goal strategy. We promise to keep our fans continually involved and aware of the status, progress, milestones and any new and exciting information and offerings regarding the Ku-Mighty property and the campaign.
What We Hope to Achieve & What You Get as a Fan

This campaign's first objective is to raise enough funds to develop and publish this first issue and to share this amazing storyworld through both digital and print versions. Our team's initial goal is the raise $24,900 to fund full production of both digital and print versions and to cover the set Indiegogo fees and required reserve funds. We are offering Stretch Goals to offer and deliver some awesome production options and perks that will bring the fans' experience to the next level. Stretch Goals are described below.
Your pledges and fan participation with socializing and promoting this property will propel this first comic to production release and will open the floodgates to the future issues and follow-on series.  The second objective is the most important - We want to share this experience and to build a long-term relationship with our new fans, which will not only sustain this property but will help our team shape Ku-Mighty into a story that people will enjoy generation after generation. 
The Impact

Your contribution will not only bring this story universe to life but it will also support the amazing artists, writers and production talent who have provided their skills and passion to deliver the highest-quality comic, exclusive merchandise and fan experience. The number one goal is to make this property a fan-favorite in the form of an amazing story, awesome art and some extraordinary extras that will mature this property into what our Fans want and expect.  Our team is committed to producing excellence, but we depend on your funding, promotional support and enthusiasm to make this a success. This team will strive to create a special joint venture, and an enduring relationship, with our fans and to bring you series after series of a reader's adventure, continual exciting story arcs and provide the opportunity for you the fans to help build this property further through ideas, concepts and participation.
Risks & Challenges

It is our team's commitment to provide full transparency of plans and intent throughout and after the campaign to make fans aware of any risks and challenges of delays, shortfalls or any other issues. We will provide insight into any risks or obstacles and out plan to mitigate and overcome to achieve our goal with getting the highest quality story and art products and merchandise to the most important priority of this campaign - Our fans!
Other Ways That Fans Can Help

We understand that during these challenging times, not all fans can financially contribute to this campaign but we ask all fans to get the word out and make some noise about this new story property and this Indiegogo campaign. To support this important effort, please use the Indiegogo share tools! Fans can also join our mailing list on kumighty.com to stay up to speed on everything new and additional offerings as the property matures.
Further, we will be offering a referral contest to allow our fans and pledgers to refer their friends, family and people within their network to support this new project. The top two fans that win the referral contest will each receive 1 printed variant copy of the exclusive and very limited edition of the Dichotomy Cover Title - RISE OF THE WRETCHED.  The two winners will be those that either bring in the most number of fans that pledge to the campaign and the one that brings in the most pledge dollars total. 




Once this Stretch Goal is hit, fans will have the opportunity to take part in launching the first four characters in the form of high-quality resin 30mm-80mm figures with an option to get the figures painted by the exceptional art team at White Weasel Studio (https://miniaturepaintingservice.us/). This set will look awesome along with the comic, metal print and can be used for wargaming. Plus, we will have the fans decide which characters our 3D artist will create!
​​Join The Fight as a Ku-Mighty Ally with Launching this Comic Series!

No story, product, or property is worth anything without the fan's              involvement, love and Support! We thank you for your pledge!
 
Meet the Team


Jeff Gomez // CEO of Starlight Runner // Jeff is a leading expert in the fields of brand narrative, story world development, creative franchise design, and transmedia storytelling. As a producer accredited by the Producers Guild of America, Jeff also develops the story worlds of films, TV shows, video games, toys, books, and comics. Jeff’s work has contributed to such blockbuster properties as Disney’s Pirates of the Caribbean, Sony Pictures' Men in Black and Spider-Man, 20th Century Fox 's James Cameron’s Avatar, Hasbro’s Transformers, among many others. Jeff and his Starlight Runner team developed the official Story World Mythology for the existing ULTRAMAN series running on Netflix.    https://starlightrunner.com/


Steele Filipek // Starlight Runner Entertainment's Writer, Executive Editor & Lead Transmedia Producer // Steele worked on projects for Microsoft's Halo, Ubisoft's Splinter Cell, and Nickelodeon's Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.

Fabian Nicieza // Starlight Runner Entertainment's Chief Innovation Officer & Lead Writer // Fabian is one of the most prolific and successful comic book writers of all time, having sold over 200 million comics from Marvel, DC, Dark Horse and Acclaim. Fabian co-created Deadpool with Rob Liefeld, and many aspects of his origin and persona have found their way to the global blockbuster Deadpool feature (and sequels, Deadpool 2 and X-Force) from 20th Century Fox/Marvel, as well as the upcoming Deadpool animated series for FXX network.

Chris Rallis //Artist // Chris has created some unbelievable art for Applibot, Fantasy Flight Games, Penguin Books USA, Valve, and currently works almost exclusively for Wizards of the Coast. https://www.rallisart.com/


Simone Ragazzoni // Comics Artist & Illustrator // Simone will be performing Pencil, Inks and Colors and he has worked as artist and colorist on Sergio Bonelli Editore's sci-fi monthly series "Odessa" and most recently for BOOM! Studios as interior artist for the miniseries "Power Rangers: Drakkon New Dawn".   https://www.artstation.com/simoneragazzoni 


Jonboy Meyers // Comic and Cover Artist // Jonboy has been telling stories through art for as long as he can remember and has racked up notable credits such as Spawn, Superman, The Inhumans, Teen Titans, Spider-Man, The Walking Dead, Red Sonja, League of Legends, G.I. Joe, Black Dynamite, Thor, Generator Rex (animation), Supergirl, Huntress, She Hulk, Hulk, Arana, Gen 13, Ninja Scroll, Danger Girl, Justice League of America, X-Men (comic books), Motor Storm Apocalypse (video games), World of Warcraft TCG (illustration), Marvel Heroes MMO (Gazillion Entertainment). https://jonboymeyers.com/ 

DC Hopkins // Letterer/designer // DC has worked for BOOM!, Dark Horse, DC, Disney, Dynamite, Heavy Metal, Humanoids, IDW, Image, Oni, Scout, and more. hopkinsletters.com


Bryan Syme // Illustrator & Concept Artist // Bryan specializes in fantasy, science fiction, horror properties and has created for Wizards of the Coast, Paizo, Onyx path, and many others. https://bryansyme.artstation.com/
Joshua Cairós // illustrator and concept artist // Worked for the film industry and game industry with clients including Walt Disney studios, Legendary picture, Fantasy Flight Games ( Star Wars, Game of Thrones and Lord of the Rings ...) Cryptozoick, and others. http://www.joshuacairos.com/ 
Tiffany “Ti” Munro // Fantasy cartographer & Concept artist // Tiffany is a top fantasy world builder and has created art for trading card games, board and video games, and many RPG assets for Dungeons and Dragons, Pathfinder, FATE Core, and Troika.  http://feedthemultiverse.com/
Mindy Lopkin // Letterer, Editor, Designer & Pre-Print Production // Mindy has worked with Horizon Line Publishing, Pronto Comics, Running Press Books, Super Mystery Comics and Ellipsium Entertainment and has recently supported Billy Tucci's awesome graphic novel, Return of the Warrior: Shi . https://mindy490.wixsite.com/mindylopkin/about 
Alan Silva // 3D Artist & Digital Sculpter// Alan will be re-creating the Cover art of Chris Rallis to develop a very cool set of exclusive collectible miniatures for this campaign.  https://alansilvasp.artstation.com/

story:
An Odyssey Beyond The Stars! Orion's Bridge!

When two “highly advanced,” aliens crash land in Roswell New Mexico aboard a spaceship, the United States Government brings in expert code breaker Ray O'Ryan to translate the controls!

Ray accidentally activates the ship and triggers a jump through space and time to a universe far away. Stranded light years from Earth, and armed only with a universal translator implanted during transport, he must do all he can to get home! Writing and art by John Rawson! (Letters here by Lucas Gattoni.)

What We Need & What You Get

With your help, lettering, printing and shipping all become easy! Your funding goes directly the fulfilment of this dream! Not just finished pages, but fully printed graphic novels sent out to people all over the place! Please help support independent storytelling and science fiction!

With perks at every price level, the impact of your contribution is huge to the success of this graphic novel!!!

 

Risks & Challenges

The only risk is not picking up this graphic novel!!! Since I am keeping a flexible goal, I am minimizing risk to only print the ones I sell here!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pick up you copy of Orion's Bridge! With a digital copy only costing $10, and printed at $20 you are able to get your hands on this comic, and still keep in your budget!

If you can't afford one right now, please feel free to share on social media! The more eyes we get on this the more copies we can deliver to people's hands! Thank you so much and thank you to all the people who helped me launch this campaign!!!

EXTRA PREIVEW PAGES!!!

 

AND SO MANY MORE!!! 

This weeks updated previews!!!

story:
Short Summary

I'm Josh. Alex and I are working hard to create The Barks because we love comics, and music, and dogs. We put them all together and we're having a ton of fun doing it.
But, we could use some money to help us get the books printed and then get to cons, shows, and stores to get the books in to the grubby little hands of our readers.

Also, Alex has been working his butt off and deserves more than I can afford to pay him right now.

Your contribution will not only be a public declaration of your love for comics/dogs/punk, but also your hate for bullies. NO BULLIES!

You can help carve out a space in the world where bullies are not allowed.

What We Need & What You Get

We're hoping for $1000 to pay for the artwork that's already been done on issue 1 and to get started on the next issue.

Regardless of what we end up with, this is the breakdown...

50% goes straight to Alex to pay for the art.

30% will go to printing.

10% will go to me (josh).

5% for stuff we didn't think of.

5% platform fee.

You will get the 3 page Indie Go Go exclusive just for our backers here (and maybe a few teaser slips here and there). You'll also be able to get digital copies of the finished The Barks #1.

If things go really well, we'll add ways for you to get paper copies as well... but we'll cross that bridge when we get to it.

Risks & Challenges

The comics are almost completely created.

We're not offering paper copies to start with specifically because we don't want to get over extended.

Honestly, we risk offending some people with the content. And, I am just a little worried that we are biting off more than we can chew. Or, that I am over estimating the bully situation and flying off half-cocked.

If that's the case, I hope we can talk about it in a nice and rational way. Our parody of bullies might be a little mean... but I'm ok with that.

Update: If we come at #comicsgate too hard, we run the risk of getting more counter-bullying than we can handle. On the other side, if we come off as too even-handed with our treatment of them, I worry about enflaming the wrath of the ANTI side.

Again. MOST LIKELY this is based on my own anxiety and second guessing. It could be that no one cares at all.

Other Ways You Can Help

I'll be super happy if this just helps get the word out about our comic.

I'll also be super happy to let bullies know that they stink and I don't like them. I'm happy to do that alone, but I'd be even happier if you stood with me.

Money is a great way to demonstrate that... but sharing sharing sharing can be even more powerful. Let the world know what you think of The Barks Hate Hate.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, My name is Luke Stone.  I am the creator, writer, and artist behind Hybrids.  I am a full time pastor and lover of comics.  Several years ago I started making my own comics.  That eventually brought me to begin writing this story of Hybrids.

I have always been interested in the parts of scripture that create more questions than they answer.  Genesis 6 and the Nephilim is by far one of my favorites.  So, for 10 years I spent my spare time researching these Nephilim and reading all of the information I could find.  The culmination of that research became the basis for the story behind Hybrids: The Sons of Gods.

What We Need & What You Get

Issues 1-3 are already completed.  We are simply using this as a platform to distribute to new fans. Once we are funded, we will be shipping out rewards

What we raise will pay for print and distribution and go to help us produce the next two issues of Hybrids in this story arc.
