story:
Hello, my name is Daniel, I am 12 years old and live in England, 

My Comic “The Final” is dedicated to my Grandfather Ismail  who was affected by a rare type of cancer called Thyroid. He got this type of cancer from exposure to radiation. When he was in the military, he was sent to build the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan to help launch the spacecraft that led Yuri Gagarin to go to space! 

And a great achievement came with a price and back then they had no protective gear to shelter from the radiation from the rocket's fuel. This was the reason my grandpa had Thyroid cancer which resulted in his death 3 years before I was born. I never got to see him. Let’s just say there is an uncanny similarity to the story beyond volume 1 of The Final. It is why I want to raise money for charities that are beating cancer to help children, like me, to be able to know their grandparents and other relatives who have been affected with cancer of any type.

 

STORY & COMIC ILLUSTRATIONS
by DANIEL AKHMED

 

Follow Steve Mile, a teenager with a dangerously short temper and his best
friend John, as they join a summer camp called “Jack’s Wood”. But after just
a few hours there, it becomes clear that Jack’s Wood is understaffed and is
really only running from the Enthusiasm from its founder and camp Leader;
Mr. Chang! And the more time they spend there, the more it is clear that Jack’s  Wood isn’t just filled with the strangest people on earth, but also Jack’s Wood isn’t everything it seems.


Volume 1 is a big introduction to the larger story that establishes most of the
characters’ personalities and the different tones the story dwells into from a
a jokey fun ride through the activities, as well as the darker tone inside the forest.
Also, I think the ending is a perfect way to set up the real action of this bigger
narrative.

_____________________________________________________________________________

Всем привет! Меня зовут Даниель, мне 12 лет и я живу в Англии. Я хочу представить свой первый комикс  “The Final” созданный чтобы поддержать борьбу с раком.

 

 

Мой комикс «The Final» посвящен моему дедушке Исмаилу Ахмеджанову, который заболел редкой формой рака щитовидной железы. Причиной этой болезни стало радиационное излучение. Когда он был в армии, его отправили строить космодром Байконур в Казахстане, чтобы помочь запустить космический корабль, доставивший Юрия Гагарина в космос!

Великие достижения всегда даются большой ценой... В те времена не существовало средств, которые бы защитили его от радиации ракетного топлива, из-за чего у моего дедушки и появился рак щитовидной железы, от которого он умер за 3 года до моего рождения. Мне так и не удалось его увидеть. 

Можно сказать, есть некоторое сходство между историей моего комикса и современными реалиями. Именно поэтому с помощью своего проекта я хочу собрать средства для благотворительных организаций, которые борются с раком, чтобы дать возможность ребятам вроде меня пообщаться как можно дольше со своими родными, которых поразил этот недуг. 

 

 

Идея комикса «The Final» появилась у меня в голове уже очень давно. Конечно, за последний год сюжет немного изменился, но сама история была придумана в  2016 году.  

Главный герой - Стив Майл, тинейджер со взрывным характером, вместе с лучшим другом Джоном приезжает в летний лагерь “Джексвуд”. Но уже через пару часов становится понятно, что работников там маловато, и на самом деле лагерь держится только на энтузиазме основателя и старшего вожатого Мистера Чанга. Друзья быстро выясняют, что их окружают самые странные люди на планете Земля. А сам “Джексвуд”... совсем не то, чем кажется.

И все-таки, о чем же первый выпуск комикса?

Первый выпуск - это только начало по-настоящему большой истории. В нем вы познакомитесь поближе с обитателями лагеря “Джексвуд” и сможете проникнуться духом истории - от веселых конных прогулок и других развлечений до пугающей тьмы лесной чащи.

 

Я верю в Вашу поддержку!

Если по каким-то причинам у Вас не получается сделать пожертвование через эту платформу, свяжитесь с моим издательством по e-mail publisher@ocamagazine.com или WhatApp​ +447411978955 и мы расскажем об альтернативных методах
story_txt: Hello, my name is Daniel, I am 12 years old and live in England, My Comic “The Final” is dedicated to my Grandfather Ismail  who was affected by a rare type of cancer called Thyroid. He got this type of cancer from exposure to radiation. When he was in the military, he was sent to build the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan to help launch the spacecraft that led Yuri Gagarin to go to space! And a great achievement came with a price and back then they had no protective gear to shelter from the radiation from the rocket's fuel. This was the reason my grandpa had Thyroid cancer which resulted in his death 3 years before I was born. I never got to see him. Let’s just say there is an uncanny similarity to the story beyond volume 1 of The Final. It is why I want to raise money for charities that are beating cancer to help children, like me, to be able to know their grandparents and other relatives who have been affected with cancer of any type. STORY & COMIC ILLUSTRATIONSby DANIEL AKHMED Follow Steve Mile, a teenager with a dangerously short temper and his bestfriend John, as they join a summer camp called “Jack’s Wood”. But after justa few hours there, it becomes clear that Jack’s Wood is understaffed and isreally only running from the Enthusiasm from its founder and camp Leader;Mr. Chang! And the more time they spend there, the more it is clear that Jack’s  Wood isn’t just filled with the strangest people on earth, but also Jack’s Wood isn’t everything it seems.Volume 1 is a big introduction to the larger story that establishes most of thecharacters’ personalities and the different tones the story dwells into from aa jokey fun ride through the activities, as well as the darker tone inside the forest.Also, I think the ending is a perfect way to set up the real action of this biggernarrative._____________________________________________________________________________Всем привет! Меня зовут Даниель, мне 12 лет и я живу в Англии. Я хочу представить свой первый комикс  “The Final” созданный чтобы поддержать борьбу с раком.  Мой комикс «The Final» посвящен моему дедушке Исмаилу Ахмеджанову, который заболел редкой формой рака щитовидной железы. Причиной этой болезни стало радиационное излучение. Когда он был в армии, его отправили строить космодром Байконур в Казахстане, чтобы помочь запустить космический корабль, доставивший Юрия Гагарина в космос!Великие достижения всегда даются большой ценой... В те времена не существовало средств, которые бы защитили его от радиации ракетного топлива, из-за чего у моего дедушки и появился рак щитовидной железы, от которого он умер за 3 года до моего рождения. Мне так и не удалось его увидеть. Можно сказать, есть некоторое сходство между историей моего комикса и современными реалиями. Именно поэтому с помощью своего проекта я хочу собрать средства для благотворительных организаций, которые борются с раком, чтобы дать возможность ребятам вроде меня пообщаться как можно дольше со своими родными, которых поразил этот недуг.   Идея комикса «The Final» появилась у меня в голове уже очень давно. Конечно, за последний год сюжет немного изменился, но сама история была придумана в  2016 году.  Главный герой - Стив Майл, тинейджер со взрывным характером, вместе с лучшим другом Джоном приезжает в летний лагерь “Джексвуд”. Но уже через пару часов становится понятно, что работников там маловато, и на самом деле лагерь держится только на энтузиазме основателя и старшего вожатого Мистера Чанга. Друзья быстро выясняют, что их окружают самые странные люди на планете Земля. А сам “Джексвуд”... совсем не то, чем кажется.И все-таки, о чем же первый выпуск комикса?Первый выпуск - это только начало по-настоящему большой истории. В нем вы познакомитесь поближе с обитателями лагеря “Джексвуд” и сможете проникнуться духом истории - от веселых конных прогулок и других развлечений до пугающей тьмы лесной чащи. Я верю в Вашу поддержку!Если по каким-то причинам у Вас не получается сделать пожертвование через эту платформу, свяжитесь с моим издательством по e-mail publisher@ocamagazine.com или WhatApp​ +447411978955 и мы расскажем об альтернативных методах

story:
Welcome to the campaign to fund....

ARTIFICE RE-ANIMATE - TIME WILL TELL!


 

THE STORY....


After a chaotic incident at sea, Dany washes ashore the dystopian hellscape of Velrona...

The larger story begins unfolding as Dany confronts the surface of the worlds deeper mysteries, ancient secrets, and the insanity of unknown hyper-technologically advanced civilisations, as forces beyond his comprehension propel him on a collision course towards the ever-blurring grey areas between past and future....


Awaken to a world... Where personal identity shadows... In comparison to digital reflections...



Art by Vic King
Colors by Barbusco
Written by SMiRKtheALiEN & RaginMantis
Letters by SMiRKtheALiEN
 

​​60 pages of Action-Packed Sci-Fi Fantasy, Dark Futurism, Large-Scale World Building, Character-Driven Mystery, Nightmarish Dystopian Dread, Ancient Civilizations, Philosophy, Quantum Blockchain Artificial Intelligence....



ABOUT US....


Artifice Re-Animate - Time Will Tell - is the first graphic novel installment by Core Comics, One of three fully realized universes with overlapping and intertwining character stories to tell...

The first book Artifice Re-Animate - Time Will Tell, Brought to life with Artwork by the one and only VIC KING, written by SMiRKtheALiEN & RaginMantis, with colors by Barbusco Studios and contributions from members Warlock & T3, is the first initial phase of our greater overarching plans at Core Comics.

0UR 4 STEEL CARD  COLLECTABLE NFT's AVAILABLE HERE: https://Rarible.com/CoreComics



FROM ALL OF US A CORE COMICS,  THANK YOU FOR CONSIDERING BACKING ARTIFICE RE-ANIMATE - TIME WILL TELL!

story:
THE GREATEST JOURNEY BEGINS WITH THE FIRST STEP:

EXHAUSTIVE, DEFINITIVE. Collecting every page of sci-fi bounty hunter Mercy St. Clair's first set of adventures into one, oversized full-color hardcover TREKKER: THE COMPLETE JOURNEY Vol I.  

  • Over 520 pages! 
  • 200 pages in color for the first time ever!
  • Printed oversized (7.5" x 11") to truly convey the epic scale of the journey. 
  •  Every page of Mercy's journey before the three most recent books Chapeltown, Darkstar Zephyr, and Battlefields in one glorious, full-color hardcover!
  • Attached cloth Ribbon Bookmark!
  • Embossed and spot-gloss cover!
  • Large extra content section: sketches, designs, pin-ups and more!

  • "Artist's Edition" section: high-res scans of the original art of Mercy's entire 24-pg debut adventure!

GOING BACK TO RECLAIM THE FUTURE.

I had a wildly successful campaign to fund TREKKER: THE COMPLETE JOURNEY Vol I, which collects of all of the classic Trekker stories that I had originally published through Dark Horse Comics. All of those tales had gone out of print. Now, we've rescued them! 

But ever since the book was successfully funded, those who missed the campaign have been asking, "Can I still get a copy of TREKKER: THE COMPLETE JOURNEY Vol I?" Now, thanks to Indiegogo InDemand the answer is YES! 

TREKKER: THE COMPLETE JOURNEY Vol I was originally scheduled to ship in August 2020, though between Covid and Tariff complications, it's now looking like September --and, since I ordered  extra copies, now would be a great time to snag yourself a copy of this 520+ page graphic novel. 

A BRIEF HISTORY OF THE 23rd CENTURY:

When TREKKER first came out in the 1980s it was a ground-breaking series: A badass bounty hunter who lives by her own rules and takes orders from no one as she makes her way through the violent and complicated world of the 23rd century.

As Gail Simone wrote in her introduction to an earlier collection, "It's of stuff like Trekker that revolutions are begun. A female character that is sexy but not sexualized, that is tough but not without flaws and doubts, and that is dangerous but not without compassion."

All of those original tales are collected in this hefty, deluxe volume. Whether you are new to the world of Trekker or a long-time reader, this book is designed to thrill and to satisfy you... and to leave you wanting still more.

NEW TO TREKKER? 

       

                        Mercy's first appearance: the cover of DHP #4, 1987

Want to know what you'd be getting into? Click this link to a FREE PDF of Mercy's very first adventure! This complete introductory 24-page story will give you the chance to see if TREKKER is right for you. I'm betting it is. (Colors on this story are by the always-brilliant Jeremy Colwell.)

TREKKER AS YOU'VE ALWAYS KNOWN HER. 

TREKKER AS YOU'VE NEVER SEEN HER BEFORE.

SAMPLE PAGES:  

For those already familiar with Mercy's original, black & white world, here are a few examples of pages that I've newly converted to full-color for the first time ever exclusively for this deluxe, hardcover volume! The results add a new subtlety, richness, and vivid life to the pages and make them feel finished in a whole new way at last. I'm thrilled at the chance to get these familiar-yet-new stories into your hands.

THE PERKS:

For this campaign I've kept the rewards as simple and straight-forward as possible:

  • Digital reward levels
  • Physical levels
  • Limited-edition, signed and numbered, tipped-in print:

SO, WHAT'S A TIPPED-IN PRINT?

For those who, like me, might not have been familiar with the phrase "tipped-in print," it's a page that is printed separately from the main body of the book and is then bound into the book by the printer. This lets us use a different paper (in this case, something with a bit of distinctive texture, since the print will be of the above watercolor I've done especially for this volume) to yield the best possible effect for this special image. Each copy will come individually signed and numbered by me. Only 200 will be printed, and many of those were claimed in the original campaign. Just saying...

Risks & Challenges

Well, with a book that is already done and at the printer, most of the challenges and risks are behind us. And, with three previous campaigns all successfully fulfilled right on schedule, I feel that I have a pretty good handle on how to get this done, and that I have the support system in place to help me deal quickly and efficiently with any complications that might arise.

Other Ways You Can Help

Trekker is my absolute passion as a comics storyteller-- even after all these years, I am as excited as ever to be telling these tales and sharing them with new readers. That's why I'm happy to be using Indiegogo to help me reach even more readers. But, Indiegogo is a new realm for me, and I could use some help in spreading the word. So, if something you see here has you interested, please feel free to make some noise about it! Indiegogo has some great sharing tools, don't be afraid to use 'em!

story:
A Time Bending Tale of Dinosaurs and Cowboys

The Good, The Bad, and The Prehistoric is an exciting story about the old west ... but not as you know it. In our story the horses and beasts of burden have been replaced with dinosaurs and the indigenous people are now mysterious cavemen. This reimagining of the classic western genre follows Joel, a young man who has been put on a journey with the dying wish of his caveman friend. He will be joined by his mother and the morally ambiguous Cormack. Joel’s journey is made even more dangerous as the evil Baaker and his gang are after an item entrusted to the boy. It’s a fun, fast paced story for readers of any age.

The Good, The Bad and The Prehistoric is a 3-issue mini-series created by Martin Pierro & Zach Bassett! This first issue is an exciting all-ages 24 page full-color comic (6 & 5/8 inch by 10 & 1/4 inch)! After being successfully funded through another platform, the books have been printed and are ready to be shipped. 

The Covers

To match the excitement of this story several covers have been created that capture the feel of this first issue! 

Cover A - MJ ERICKSON

Cover B - JOSE GARCIA

Cover C - RYAN MILLER - Limited to 500 Units

Cover D - FOIL STAMP - ZACH BASSETT - Limited to 200 Units

Only Available in the Collectors Box

The Box 

The Good, The Bad, and The Prehistoric Collectors Box is perfect for holding your variant covers and the next two issues in the series as well. The boxes are made of sturdy material to keep your books safe forever.

We have TWO different rewards featuring this box ...

The Basic Box - featuring this box plus Cover A & Cover B

The Collector’s Box - featuring the box with ALL four covers, this is the ONLY way to get the limited foil stamped Cover D at this time.

Why should you support this project?

Books like The Good, The Bad, and The Prehistoric are rare gems in the current comic book marketplace, it’s truly a book for everyone. It was written in such a way that anyone from age 6 to age 106 can enjoy it. We employed something we like to call the “Pixar Effect” where there are elements in the story that will appeal to adults, kids and everyone in-between. We feel that the world can use more positive and fun stories like this and with your help we can cover our production costs, reach a wider market and of course, reward YOU with a quality product that you will enjoy.

Interior Art

story:
Update: Colton Crux is now INDEMAND which means you can still pre-order it if you want to get a copy when it's out. Just chose from the options on the right.

If you want to be notified when it becomes available for direct purchase subscribe to my NEWSLETTER

 

The goal of this campaign is to fund the production and fulfillment of Colton Crux, an occult noir graphic novel inspired by the work of H. P. Lovecraft, the movie Inception, and old Noir films (particularly the ones starring the great Humphrey Bogart like The Maltese Falcon, All Through the Night and The Big Sleep).

Synopsis: After centuries of political infighting, the Church that was meant to stand guard against the forces of darkness, not only forgot its purpose but became an obstacle to it. This is a story about a paranormal PI manipulated by both sides, that must investigate a series of supernatural cases to discover a secret history of the world, and find a way to stop an incoming invasion.

I'm also commissioning other high-quality artists to draw some of the stories in the book. As an example check out this 1 page Colton Crux short story called "The Key Hole" by a very talented Kayden Rowk:

IndieGoGo makes art blurry so if you want to see the previews in better quality click >HERE<

 

Colton Crux EXTRA NOIR

Besides the main fully colored version of the book, you can also pre-order a B&W version that will include extras like concept art accompanied by world-building details for those who want to learn more about the world the story is set in and the developing process behind it.

 

 

Team

The book is fully created by Nashotobi (twitter/instagram) a writer/artist from Ukraine. Matt Crotts serves as a project manager and will handle its printing and fulfillment locally in the US. Matt already has a successful experience with producing and fulfilling his own graphic novel series KYRIE.


KYRIE is inspired by the Indiana Jones series. The story is set in Ancient Rome and follows a team of treasure hunters and outcasts, who race across North Africa to uncover the secrets of Alexander the Great and stop an Ancient Roman death cult. There are currently 2 books in the series already produced, with a total of over 250 pages of content. Please check them out here: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/kyrie-exiles... and consider ordering yourself a copy.

story:
The book is done, all the supplies are here, and I'm shipping orders as soon as they come in. The Build a Pack tier is the only one available, but there are add ons available. The Build a pack tier comes with the book (signed), a 4 pack of trading cards, a bookmark, and a button pin.  You can add on the Print 4 pack, and/or a piece of original concept art. Also, after a vote among the backers, it was decided that both issues are combined into one Deluxe Edition book rather than 2 floppies. The vote was won with a 72% majority.

In a galaxy at risk, a young samurai will prove their greatest hope.

Star Wars meets Skyrim and Seven Samurai with a bit of Rocketeer mixed in. The angel, Azrekal, served the Seven Legions for 2000 years, until he uncovered a plot to destroy them from within, but before he could warn the others, he vanished, leaving only his memories behind in the mind of Hiko, an orphan born in feudal Japan's chaotic Sengoku era. As Hiko finds himself caught in the middle of the mystery of Azrekal's disappearance he must choose between fighting the war that threatens the clan that took him in, or the war that threatens the galaxy itself.

Issue 1 is 20 pages, issue 2 is 30 pages.

Set in a universe where the races of fantasy exist on other worlds in an alliance protected by the Seven Legions. Where several human empires betrayed the alliance and the descendants of those humans live on Earth, where they have long forgotten the other races, beyond stories that have become myth and legend. There are three histories in this universe: History as we know it, history as it is known in the galaxy, and the history long forgotten. A fantasy universe grounded in science where Earth history is identical to our own but part of a much larger story.

All backer tiers include a physical copy of issue 1 and 2, guaranteed.  All copies will be signed and all backers will be listed by name (default is indiegogo user name, but if it's the same as your real name, you'll be mentioned by first name and last initial, unless you wish to be listed by full name).  The book comes with a 4 pack of trading cards, a bookmark, and a button pin.  The print add on comes with 4 11x17 prints by talented artists.

This is a series 13 years in the making, a carefully woven story in a vast universe, and I aim to create a story where not one issue goes by without action, carefully placed humor, and heart.  It's a story about belonging and the value of the individual.  

Art Team

Each issue is split in two parts with different styles to separate the memories of Azrekal from the continued adventures of Hiko.

Issue 1:
Maksis Zabers: Line art on Azrekal's memory. Unfortunately, he was not able to continue his work but he provided an interesting art style and many of the gun designs in this series before handing off to...

Henry Ponciano: Best known for his work on Tinsel Town, published through Alterna, Henry took over Maksis' side of the story and put out pages at a rapid pace with a clean style he continues to improve on as he goes.

Federico Guillen: Federico provided the entirety of the artwork on the last four pages of issue 1 in a stunning realistic style. Unfortunately things did not work out.

Issue 2:
Henry Ponciano: Henry's speed and skill continues to impress as he continues to work on issue 2, and hopefully, on through the series as a whole as he draws the memories of Azrekal in a western comic style.


Pablo Romero: the moment I saw Pablo's anime style I knew it had to be done. Contrasting the western style provided by Henry and separating the two halves of the story, Pablo draws his pages with speed matching Henry's and accuracy to the setting.  On occasion, he has provided reference for things that I haven't found in my research.

Issue 2 art

This story has been carefully built over years, with every thread connected in ways that will amaze readers as they discover the secrets of this universe. It's a universe with the potential to be expanded into other stories. To learn more about the lore, go to https://sevenlegions.com

The races of the Seven Legions Universe

The Humans: Like you and me, on Earth, humans have no knowledge of the other races outside of what we remember through myth and legend. The other races are cloaked by a mysterious force from human eyes.  Beyond the Earth, some humans live among the other empires of the alliance and beyond.

The Angels: Large feathery wings, a glowing aura halo that changes color and shape with emotion. The angels have a telekinetic blast ability and pyrokinesis. The angels don't age past maturity and have accelerated healing. There are 3 variations of the angels: The Cherubim, the average angel. The Thrones, 4-winged angels genetically altered with enhanced physical and psionic abilities. The Seraphim, 6-winged angels with one of seven powers, chosen as leaders of the Seven legions.

The Eldrian/elves: Long, pointed ears. A small, diamond-shaped bump on their foreheads. The Eldrian have telepathy, with varients in this ability. The High eldrian have telepathic communication only and human range of skin tones, the wood eldrian have illusion telepathy and golden skin, the blood eldrian can control others and have red skin, the polar eldrian can use the magnetic poles to amplify their telepathy and have pale skin, and the dark eldrian have a telepathic EMP ability and have blue skin. The Eldrian have plant-based technology, adapting the plant life of their world to serve them.

The Darvosi/dwarves: Short, stout, and strong. The Darvosi are proud warriors from the world of Asgard, where they live in underground cities to escape their violent wildlife. They settle wars in the virtual world of Valhalla and hunt in mech suits and jet packs.

The Undine: An aquatic race with long, finned tails and nostrils on their foreheads. Essentially, they look like dolphin people. Their tech is adapted from the rapidly-evolving fauna of their homeworld. Most prominent among them is their starships, gigantic space krackens.

The Faer: Tall and lanky with chitinous wings and pointed ears. The Faer come from the same world as the Undine but live primarily on the islands.

The Cobrin/Goblins: short and slender with long, pointed ears and long canine teeth. Their skin is green from a symbiotic moss that grows on their skin. 

The Orac/Orcs: The tall and bulky cousins of the Cobrin. They're similar to the Cobrin in every way but their size and lack of intelligence. 

The Daemons: Large, leathery wings, long horns, pointed ears and red skin. The daemons are brutal and hate the other races. They have access to technology far ahead of any other race, but they have fortunately kept to themselves aside from supply raids, as they wait for the return of their creators to lead them on a crusade across the galaxy. 

The Seven Legions need you!

We can fund for $3,000, which will provide the funds needed to: 

  • finish the art for issue 2.
  •  print issue 1 and 2.
  •  print copies of Pablo Romero's pinup print, Henry Ponciano's action print, and Karl O'Rowe's villains print.
  • Print bookmarks by Simon SIM Pothier.
  • Print 4 packs of trading Cards.
  •  provide heavy-duty mailers.
  • provide bags and boards
  • pay for shipping.

We can fund with anywhere from 27 to 64 backers.

We're printing the books through Mixam, a high quality printing company, as a limited edition print run. 

We're recruiting the help of talented artists to provide additional posters, each 11x17, and the more stretch goals we hit, the more posters you get.

Risks

This is my first campaign, and I am aware that there are hurdles.  Sometimes there are issues that lead to artists having to leave a project. I have experienced that. If that happens, I will inform the backers and we'll continue forward. Over the last two years I have found an amazing community of comic creators all working on our own projects.  We're all working together to create our dream projects, and I have a great group to turn to for help. Given the most likely printing option, there's a chance we may be delayed in printing if we do not have the issues completed before the deadline.  If the delay is too great, I will work to find another option.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word on social media! If you have a youtube channel, I'd be glad to talk to you about the project. Reach out to me on twitter @7legionsbeacon by email at michalbeacon@gmail.com find the facebook page at www.facebook.com/7legions.
story_txt:
The book is done, all the supplies are here, and I'm shipping orders as soon as they come in. The Build a Pack tier is the only one available, but there are add ons available. The Build a pack tier comes with the book (signed), a 4 pack of trading cards, a bookmark, and a button pin.  You can add on the Print 4 pack, and/or a piece of original concept art. Also, after a vote among the backers, it was decided that both issues are combined into one Deluxe Edition book rather than 2 floppies. The vote was won with a 72% majority.
In a galaxy at risk, a young samurai will prove their greatest hope.
Star Wars meets Skyrim and Seven Samurai with a bit of Rocketeer mixed in. The angel, Azrekal, served the Seven Legions for 2000 years, until he uncovered a plot to destroy them from within, but before he could warn the others, he vanished, leaving only his memories behind in the mind of Hiko, an orphan born in feudal Japan's chaotic Sengoku era. As Hiko finds himself caught in the middle of the mystery of Azrekal's disappearance he must choose between fighting the war that threatens the clan that took him in, or the war that threatens the galaxy itself.

story:
Short Summary

Little Jassen lost his head. There a few theories and practical reasons for why this occurred. Some of them are due to his bad decisions but at other times happened out of his control. He sometimes gets his head back but it does not last for long. Even without a head, LJ is creative and does what he can to illustrate. However, when his head is lost he does not have the ability to identify what it looks like. This is his creative problem to solve.

This documented scene is the first instance that LJ lost his head due to a series of bad actions in Poland. He noticed his head was being transported back to the US.


More than 2 years passed without hearing a word about his head until now.  Trying to illustrate heads that could be potential replacements, LJ posted a number of them on social media in hopes of a solution.  A friend noticed and swears he saw it in Mexico City. 

Action is in order to find it. LJ has a plan.

He needs your help.  LJ’s plan will be to go to Mexico City and find it. He outlined a grid of 32 spots in and around the city to find his head.  Illustrations will aid in the visualization process and may help to point him in the right direction.  Not easy getting around in a big city without a head.

In return for helping him find his head, 32 of these illustrations will be documented with photographs showing his search.  With your help he can have a better chance of getting his head back.

story: This is my first proper Edinburgh Fringe Trip on a two week run to Edinburgh from the 15th August to 29th August 2015 , chasing my child hood dream.  I offer something unique and different to the comedy industry, The Presidential Invasion Comedy tour is a personal project of mine which requires funding. I have been gigging across the country showcasing my talent , its time to bring my talent to Edinburgh.   President Obama had to raise Campaign funds to run for office , I would like to raise funds just like Obama to run a successful comedy tour in the Edinburgh.

story:
Short Summary

4 Pages | 16 Bars: A Visual Mixtape began in 2013 as an art installation that ran for four months at Chicago institution The Silver Room. The event celebrated the cultural diversity of the independent comic book scene… And, was a stone groove, baby.

The 4 Pages | 16 Bars: A Visual Mixtape trade paperback series is a celebration of where true diversity exists in this industry, a sampler for potential fans to enjoy our intellectual properties, a showcase for existing and upcoming talent as well as a source guide for those fans to purchase our books.

What We Need & What You Get

So, let me break it down to the elements concerning what we need and where it's going to:

  • We need $3000.00 to finish production of the second volume and to get the printed version of our books to our supporters. We are using the Indiegogo platform as another storefront and marketing campaign as well as raising funds to continue production.
  • Our perks are unique in that you don't have to wait longer than two - four weeks to receive them after the campaign is over. Our perks up to $50.00 have already been created, so those bad smokers will be in your hands on on your digital device post-haste.  
  • If we don't make our entire goal, that's cool. Everyone who supports the campaign will receive their perks. And, you can be the coolest kid on the block when people see the book in your hands and wonder aloud why they weren't cool enough to get on the ground floor... You'll be a tastemaker!

The Impact

In 2015, diversity has become the buzzword in the comic book industry with companies like DC and Marvel claiming to lead the charge, but merely scratching the surface of the complexity and intersection of race, culture and gender. 

Our voices are important, now more than ever. Creators of color have been are coming on strong, taking no shorts, providing true representation, and giving voice to the voiceless. We’re saying it loud and we’re saying it proud.

4 Pages 16 Bars: A Visual Mixtape is the shot fired across the starboard bow. It is the dream realized and the face of the true diversity that exists in the entertainment landscape today. It is where you will find us, the creators, the Hard Riders, theVisual MCs, Literary DJs and Crowd Controllers who have been holding this scene down, changing the color of the industry one innovative concept at a time.

Risks & Challenges

Let's face it: we live in interesting times.

Fact is, there are those of us in the indie game that go toe to toe with what the Corporate Two puts out. The only thing we don’t have are the funds for big marketing campaigns. What we do have is passion, drive and chutzpah. What we need are the fans who do dig us riding hard to bring awareness to those who still sip the Kool-Aid.

That’s why I came up with the 4Pages16Bars concept. It’s the best of the best in a “Heavy Metal” format where fans can sample the great work out there. Not to toot a horn, but if I could get half the cats who complain about representation promoting and buying a project like this, things will change.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support financially, no worries... You can still help:

  • Get the word out. Share this on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, Carrier Pigeon, whatever floats your boat when it comes to social media. Word-of-Mouth advertising goes a very long way.
  • And, please, please, please use the Indiegogo share tools. Let people know that there are many shades in the Complexion of Comics... We ain't going nowhere!

Help us rock the spot and put the world on notice. 4 Pages 16 Bars is that next ish on the horizon... Protect ya neck!

story: After Mallory Thorn receives a mysterious phone call from her father who resides in Cloverdale asylum, she unsuccessfully rushes to his aid.Shortly after his suicide an orderly from the hospital who had become close friends with her father reveals that her dad was a former "demon chaser" A modern age demon hunter with a gift that has now passed down to Mallory at the time of her father's death.I would like to use the money for lettering, and towards filling rewards. I just want to bring my story to comic fans all over the world. My team and I love this story! We feel more like fans of Cloverdale than the creators, so it's just a matter of time before it really takes the world by storm.

story:
The first saga is upon us! Vile Tribe was started in 2014 by a group of friends from the Lower East Side. It takes place in a future past present version of New York where people live and die by the sword. . A small neighborhood of farmers welcomes all who seek spliff sanctum, as long as the stanzas are followed those who work get piff and malt lix till tomorrow. But beyond the sanctum are nefarious forces which they must work with and against to maintain their hood and way of life.

This book we are gathering funding for will contain the first 5 issues of the comic totaling 55 pages along with each of the covers and several pages of drawings by Miles Angerson and friends. There are a few different tiers of support available on the right, with the book itself included in the $20 and up tiers. Thank you so much for your support.

Also, please check out Miles' page, as well as the other artists, over on thepaplin.org.

story:
The Book : Three minus One

“While the mother bird is absent from the nest, three little birds are born. One of them is kicked out of the nest by his brothers. Then the mother bird comes, she notices that there is one missing and desperately looks for him. Thinking that she has lost him forever she returns to the nest really sad. After several days, the little one reunites with his mother. And his brothers learn a big lesson.”

This is a story of a bird family, which teaches us that being evil doesn’t compensate, and that perseverance overcomes all obstacles and allows us to reach our goals.
It’s an educational book, with a morality, written in two languages - English and Portuguese (one of the most difficult languages ​​in the world).


The goal: Budget, deadlines and rewards

I need at least € 500 for printing of 150 books. This will be the second edition of the book.
The rewards will be given to supporters up to 40 days after the project financing.


  • Thank you for your support, be it money or a simple sharing of the project.

story:
John Orlando's impressive resume stretches back to the early nineties and his proven record in comics clearly shows that he is a man of many talents.
Originally, John Orlando began as a penciling assistant to Rich Buckler in 1994 for Buckler’s Visage Studios, assisting on Syphons the Sygate Strategem for Now Comics, Zaanan for Mainstream Comics and Gene Roddenberry’s The Lost Universe for Tekno Comics. He became Production Manager for Buckler at Visage in 1995 and a penciler, inker, colorist, painter and letterer producing covers, page work and portfolio sets for various publishers. 

John produced several creator-owned books in 1996-98 including the off-beat, “classic-style” titles Cybergen, Journey into Madness, and The Intruder. We have launched this Indiegogo to bring these three stories back to print and to bring color to Cybergen for the first time. We are very happy to have John join us in the never-ending quest to create breathtaking, pulse-pounding and unforgettable comics covering a plethora of genres for YOUR reading entertainment. John is widely respected in the field and we at Outpouring are very happy to have him aboard!


FIRST THINGS FIRST, A BIG THANKS TO ANYONE THAT SUPPORTS OUR PROJECT IN ANY WAY! YOU WILL BE RECEIVING A CREDIT ON OUR WEBSITE AND HAVE OUR UNDYING GRATITUDE!



The comics and prints are set and ready to go, all they need is the funding for printing. If need be we will print smaller print runs to fulfill the prize list for our contributors. We have several amazing printers we work with including one that offers reasonable prices on smaller print runs.

Once the crowdfunder has come to a close we plan on reaching out to each of our partners to confirm their order. This way there is no confusion as to what was actually ordered. We will be ready to ship within three weeks of the end of the Indiegogo which is well within the two month shipping period we allotted for ourselves. We have a full team dedicated to success that has been working hard since we first announced the John Orlando collection coming to Outpouring Comics. We are excited for this opportunity to share these works with you and prepared to deliver a great experience to all who partner with us.


Simon Kilgore has kidnapped Karen James, Doctor Warlock's former fiance!  Doctor Warlock, Slither, and Cyberagent join forces as the dysfunctional group Cybergen to battle the mutated Kilgore and his monstrous synthorg Mutoids in order to save Karen.  Are their greater evils afoot, who are The Offspring, and what are the intentions of the mysterious Dr. Poole?  Find out in Cybergen.


An aging crook runs afoul of a shape-changing alien who is on the lam from an intergalactic cop. The Intruder’s plan is to seize power, acquire wealth, and ultimately sow the seeds of destruction on the Earth’s population. His reason is only to revel in his success then head off to another planet to repeat the process. Now it is the task of the two cops from two worlds to stop the evil of the Intruder.

Each issue of Journey into Madness is a collection of short horror stories created and written by John Orlando.  The horror story collection in these books pays tribute to the Atlas pre-code horror comics of the early 1950's.


$3: Cybergen Digital Download

$5: Digital Downloads for all for all three titles

$8: Physical copy of one of John Orlando's comics

$10: Physical and Digital copies of one of John Orlando's comics

$12: Joe Martino Doc Behemoth print


$15: Signed and Digital copies of one of John Orlando's comics

$18: Orlando/Martino Combo!

$20: Limited Edition Print in addition to $15 reward

$20: Signed and Digital copies for two of John Orlando's comics

$25: Rusty Gilligan Sketch Card

$25: Limited Edition Gilligan/Orlando Print in addition to $15 reward

$28: Signed and Digital copies of all three of John Orlando's comics

$30: Gilligan/Orlando Limited Edition print in addition to Signed and Digital copies of two of John Orlando's comics

$35: Gilligan/Orlando Limited Edition Print in addition to Signed and Digital copies of all three of John Orlando's comics

$50: Rusty Gilligan sketch card in edition to the $35 reward


More great prizes to be added every time we reach a thousand dollar tier.
Sneak peak at the next prize to be added:

Once we reach $1000 we will be adding a few perks which will include buttons of John Orlando's iconic characters!


Partner with us today! Spread the word to your friends, share the link on your social media, and check out all that Outpouring Comics has to offer:

www.outpouringcomics.com

http://outpouringcomics.storenvy.com/

https://gumroad.com/OutpouringComics#

https://www.facebook.com/OutpouringComics/

https://twitter.com/OutpouringComic

https://www.instagram.com/outpouringcomics/

Outpouring Comics started as a couple of friends Role Playing together and creating stories while in college. These stories evolved and two of the Role Players eventually went on to start their own universes, characters, and stories. Both creators brought in a small group to assist in creation and expansion of their universes before bringing any comic to readers eyes.
In June 2012, the two universes merged together to bring about the creation of Outpouring Comics. Outpouring Comics made their first public appearance at the April 2014 Asbury Park Comic Con with the debut of VODA #1.
story_txt:
John Orlando's impressive resume stretches back to the early nineties 
and his proven record in comics clearly shows that he is a man of many 
talents.       Originally, John Orlando began as a penciling assistant to Rich Buckler in 1994 for Buckler’s Visage Studios, assisting
 on Syphons the Sygate Strategem for Now Comics, Zaanan for Mainstream 
Comics and Gene Roddenberry’s The Lost Universe for Tekno Comics.  He 
became Production Manager for Buckler at Visage in 1995 and a penciler, 
inker, colorist, painter and letterer producing covers, page work and 
portfolio sets for various publishers. 
 John produced several 
creator-owned books in 1996-98 including the off-beat, “classic-style” 
titles Cybergen, Journey into Madness, and The Intruder. We have launched this Indiegogo to bring these three stories back to print and to bring color to Cybergen for the first time. We 
are very happy to have John join us in the never-ending quest to create 
breathtaking, pulse-pounding and unforgettable comics covering a

respected in the field and we at Outpouring are very happy to have him 
aboard!

story:
The Story

In the Valley of Pünd, there are no allies, even among the closest blood. Emperor Gunther II, known as The Curse to later historians, is crowned at the height of the Imperial Renaissance. He also comes to power at the most politically divided point in the Valley’s history. The High Houses of Davoy, Briedenburg, and Hillhorn, battle for control over development lands, as an unforeseen evil lurks in the distance. Only the Imperial Mother, Hella of Hammerheld, holds the Valley from the dark abuse of Civil War. This is The Twelve Beavers, The Blood Oath.

 

 

The Twelve Beavers continues the line of historically inspired Graphic Novels such as Maus, with the psychological elements of Dune, told in civilization scale narrative similar to that of The Foundation.

Welcome to the Valley of Pünd.


 

 

The Team

Writer: R.E.J. Fitzpatrick (@rejfitz)

Storyboard Artist: Ardashes Najarian (@Artdashes)

 

The Struggle

Story telling is a symphony, and like a symphony, you know when a note is off. The greatest struggle bringing The Blood Oath to market was making sure all the notes in the symphony struck the perfect cord. We have succeeded thus far. Now we need your help to bring the symphony to life.

 


 

The Fund

I have already personally funded the creation of the storyboard ($6000), working with the talented Ardashes Najarian. This campaign is to fund the final product artwork for the graphic novel. The work load is significant, with The Blood Oath totaling 150 storyboarded pages. At the professional industry rate of $150 dollars per illustrated page, that comes to $22,500, with Indiegogo platform fees making up for the rest of the cost.

 

Telluride, Colorado, The Inspiration for the Valley of Pünd

story:
Fund the remaining artwork for Vapor, the Graphic Novel, Book 1

 

Note: Each contributor gets a bound, hard copy of the Vapor Book 1.

 

We have already completed the first chapter of Vapor, which is available as a standalone 41-page flipbook comic here: Vapor First Colonists.

  • A successful funding campaign would allow us to finish the remaining ~100 pages of artwork for Book 1, in total Book 1 will be about 145 pages long.

  • I'm Eric, a novelist, screenwriter and now a graphic novelist and I live in Florida, USA. This story has a history...

 

 

  • Vapor's amazing Illustrator for Vapor is Dmitriy Turchinsky, and he lives Kiev, Ukraine. Dmitriy's message to you...

 

 

 

  • And, there is also a free Vapor Primer available as a flipbook

We need you to help us colonize this planet... or at least bring you that story.

If contributing to our funding isn't right for you perhaps, on Facebook, you can Like and Follow our page @vaporgn (it's the list ... menu to the right of Like) and our Twitter handle is the same to help us attract more contributors and help with marketing when Vapor is finished.

Word of mouth makes a huge difference, too.

If you're a vlogger/blogger, Eric is happy to do an interview with you.

More Videos...

story:
I have always wanted create and share something that I was passionate about. More importantly, I wanted to instill my passion in others. Being a graphic designer I love creating works of art and sharing emotions through my art. A picture is worth 1000 words, but a picture only lasts so long. I wanted to create something that lasts longer. Something that was important to me, but would also serve the purpose of making a difference. 

After losing a good friend of mine to suicide and having my own experience I wanted to tell a story that gave people hope in times of tragedy. I wanted to share both of our stories with the world through the lives of the main characters and raise the importance of suicide awareness. 

 

The Other Side tells the story of how we decide to overcome the challenges we are dealt in life that make us who we are in the end. 

Michael can be described as the perfect example of the word, "normal". Michael is a recent college graduate with a steady job, a one bedroom apartment, and average day to day responsibilities. Michael pays his bills on time, does laundry on Sundays, and even keeps his desktop organized. After what seemed to be another repetitious day folds over, "fate" leads Michael on the path of a beautiful girl. She's edgy, won't take no for an answer, and looks like heavy metal wrapped in a girls body. Michael thought he could try to impress her if he could even speak, but she wouldn't take much impressing because she was already in love with Michael as if she had known him for years. This all feels so strange to him, but he feels this is what his life has been missing. Michael's relationship with this mysterious girl takes him on a journey of passion and pain where his true identity is discovered.  Michael's discovery reveals that he is the aire to both thrones of heaven and hell. He must choose to become the ruler of either kingdom or will he chose his own path?

 

Indiegogo makes it possible for people like us to be able to share our creations with the world. My name is Damon Odom and I am the writer of The Other Side. Unfortunately, I am not a great free hand artist, but luckily I found Luís Figueiredo who is helping me bring my project to life. If funded the first volume of The Other Side will be able to be completed and is expected to be completed by  April 2017. Since a volume is much more than a chapter, funders won't be left waiting for the next continuation of The Other Side. Also since this is the beginning of our project, all funders will be given a digital copy of The Other Side Volume 1 if our goal is met. It would be my pleasure to share the story with you all because if it were not for you none of this would have been possible. 

Special thanks to Luís Figueiredo. Please review his work @luisgfigueiredoart

 

Below are the levels of Perks for our supporters. Not only will you receive the perk of your level, but if our project is 100% funded every supporter will receive a digital copy of The Other Side Volume 1. Our goal would not have been met if it were not for you, therefore I feel that it is only right to share with you something we all made happen.

 

Not everyone has to make a donation to help. If you would like to help but do not have the funds to make a donation, remember, you can always help by sharing our project. Feel free to share our project where ever you feel it deserves to be seen. Thank you again for taking the time to check out The Other Side. I hope we will be able to bring to you Volume 1 and much more.

story:
El Saloncito del Cómic

Somos un pequeño equipo de Burgos dedicado al mundo del cómic desde hace décadas. El proyecto Unrated S.L es una empresa con recorrido que sale de la mente de nuestro amo y señor, Iván Sarnago. Dibujante ganador de la edición XII de Expocomic y otros premios, con una dilatada carrera en el humor gráfico.  

We are a small team from Burgos (Spain) dedicated to the world of comics for decades. The Unrated S.L project is a company with a long way that comes from the mind of our master and lord, Ivan Sarnago. Artist winner of the XII edition of Expocomic and other awards, with a long career in graphic humor.

El objetivo de esta campaña es la de elevar Unrated Comics S.L. al siguiente nivel, porque ya llevamos un camino andado en los dos años pasados. Con tu ayuda, sin duda, alcanzaremos nuestro objetivo de crear ese espacio singular y único.

The objective of this campaign is to elevate Unrated Comics S.L. To the next level, because we have already taken this path in the past two years. With your help, we will undoubtedly achieve our goal of creating that unique and unique space.

Pero no solo eso, conseguiremos darle una faceta social y de comunicación como nunca se ha conseguido antes a través de nuestro portal online de cómics, que pretende ser un puente de unión entre artistas del mundo del cómic, aquí y al otro lado del charco - de cualquier charco - y de nuestro nuevo local.

But not only that, we will be able to give it a social and communication facet like never before has been achieved through our online comic book portal, which pretends to be a bridge between artists from the world of comics, here and across the puddle- Of any puddle - and of our new place.

ACCIÓN SOCIAL EL SALONCITO DEL CÓMIC 2.0
No somos ajenos a la realidad de la ciudad en la que vivimos y, por ello, pensamos que una parte de nuestras instalaciones deben estar orientadas a ofrecer una alternativa de ocio para jóvenes. Como parte de nuestra programación social, incluimos talleres urbanos en periodo vacacional, talleres gratuitos y jornadas de puertas abiertas; así como eventos de proyección de clásicos. En esta misma línea aspiramos a convertirnos en Escuela Municipal de Dibujo y Cómics, y ofrecer una alternativa laboral a nuevos talentos.
Pensamos que la difusión de la cultura es importante y, por ello, organizamos exposiciones, charlas-coloquios, foros y nuestro podcast "EL CAFECOMIC" en nuestras instalaciones. Queremos enriquecer el ecosistema cultural de nuestra ciudad. 

SOCIAL ACTION EL SALONCITO DEL COMIC 2.0

We are not estrange to the reality of the city in which we live and, therefore, we think that a part of our facilities should be oriented to offer a entertainment alternative for young people. As part of our social programming, we include urban workshops during vacation periods, free workshops and open days; As well as classic projection events. In this same line we aspire to become a Municipal School of Drawing and Comics, and offer a work alternative to new talents.

We think that the dissemination of culture is important and, therefore, we organize exhibitions, talks, forums and our podcast "EL CAFECOMIC" in our facilities. We want to enrich the cultural ecosystem of our city.

Así que, hemos generado una evolución del anterior Saloncito del Cómic. El primer paso fue buscar un local accesible a toda la ciudad, por ello escogimos Avenida del Arlanzón 41. Un local en pleno centro geográfico de la ciudad, que no nos aleja demasiado de nuestra anterior clientela y nos abre una nueva masa de clientes del centro de la ciudad. 

So, we have generated an evolution of the previous Saloncito del Comic. The first step was to find a place accessible to the whole city, so we chose Avenida del Arlanzón 41. A place in the center of the city, which does not take us too far from our previous clientele and opens a new mass of customers of the center from the city.

Actualmente el Saloncito 2.0 tiene operativas varias áreas:
 

ESPACIO DE LECTURA Y OCIO
Nuestros clientes pueden acceder a la más amplia colección de cómics de la ciudad, juegos de mesa y otras opciones alternativas de ocio, donde los jóvenes - y no tan jóvenes - pueden socializar en un ambiente sano, divertido y para todas las edades. Pero queremos que estén muy cómodos, así que queremos ampliar añadiendo servicios de cafetería.

At the moment the Saloncito 2.0 has several operative areas:

 

SPACE FOR READING AND ENTERTAINMENT

Our clients can access the city's largest collection of comics, board games and other alternative entertainment options, where young - and not so young - can socialize in a healthy, fun and for all ages. But we want them to be very comfortable, so we want to expand by adding cafe services.

LA ACADEMIA
Nuestros alumnos ya están aprendiendo las técnicas de cómic, videojuegos y otras disciplinas artísticas, pero queremos llegar a más alumnos y darles una enseñanza mas avanzada y especializada.

THE ACADEMY

Our students are already learning the techniques of comics, video games and other artistic disciplines, but we want to reach more students and give them a more advanced and specialized teaching.

UNRATED STORES
Con el fin de explotar las posibilidades comerciales de nuestra nueva ubicación, tenemos la intención de abrir una tienda con diverso producto orientado al ocio, mundo artístico y el cómic.
Estos productos son accesorios y regalos relacionados con el mundo del Ocio y el videojuego, juegos de mesa, tazas y camisetas de producción propia con diseño de Unrated, cómics y, por supuesto, material de dibujo y arte para nuestros alumnos. Para esto necesitamos una inversión destinada a adquirir equipos para la fabricación del producto propio, mobiliario para la tienda y el stock inicial de la misma. 

UNRATED STORES

In order to exploit the commercial possibilities of our new location, we intend to open a store with diverse product oriented to the entertainment, artistic world and the comic.

These products are accessories and gifts related to the world of entertainment and video games, board games, mugs and T-shirts produced with Unrated design, comics and, of course, drawing material and art for our students. For this we need an investment to purchase equipment for the manufacture of own product, furniture for the store and the initial stock of it.


LOCAL
Queremos que la imagen de nuestro local sea atractiva y un imán para nuestro tipo de cliente. Para ello necesitamos adaptar este nuevo espacio con diversas mejoras estructurales, entre las que podemos contar el nuevo mobiliario, suelos de madera, decoración de escaparates y paredes. Queremos crear un diseño polivalente para un negocio tan variado y disponer de una instalación informática y eléctrica adecuada. Por supuesto, necesitamos adaptabilidad para personas con movilidad reducida. Porque todo el mundo merece disfrutar del nuevo Saloncito del Cómic.

LOCAL

We want the image of our premises to be attractive and a magnet for our type of client. For this we need to adapt this new space with various structural improvements, among which we can count the new furniture, wooden floors, decoration of windows and walls. We want to create a versatile design for such a varied business and have a suitable computer and electrical installation. Of course, we need adaptability for people with reduced mobility. Because everyone deserves to enjoy the new Saloncito.

 

Estamos seguros de que con vuestra ayuda, conseguiremos lo que nos proponemos y daremos mucho que hablar. Gracias de Antemano.

We are sure that with your help, we will get what we propose and we will give much to talk about. Thanks in advance.

The Unrated S.L project is a company with a long way that comes from the mind of our master and lord, Ivan Sarnago. Artist winner of the XII edition of Expocomic and other awards, with a long career in graphic humor.
El objetivo de esta campaña es la de elevar Unrated Comics S.L. al siguiente nivel, porque ya llevamos un camino andado en los dos años pasados. Con tu ayuda, sin duda, alcanzaremos nuestro objetivo de crear ese espacio singular y único.
The objective of this campaign is to elevate Unrated Comics S.L. To the next level, because we have already taken this path in the past two years. With your help, we will undoubtedly achieve our goal of creating that unique and unique space.
Pero no solo eso, conseguiremos darle una faceta social y de comunicación como nunca se ha conseguido antes a través de nuestro portal online de cómics, que pretende ser un puente de unión entre artistas del mundo del cómic, aquí y al otro lado del charco - de cualquier charco - y de nuestro nuevo local.
But not only that, we will be able to give it a social and communication facet like never before has been achieved through our online comic book portal, which pretends to be a bridge between artists from the world of comics, here and across the puddle- Of any puddle - and of our new place.
ACCIÓN SOCIAL EL SALONCITO DEL CÓMIC 2.0No somos ajenos a la realidad de la ciudad en la que vivimos y, por ello, pensamos que una parte de nuestras instalaciones deben estar orientadas a ofrecer una alternativa de ocio para jóvenes. Como parte de nuestra programación social, incluimos talleres urbanos en periodo vacacional, talleres gratuitos y jornadas de puertas abiertas; así como eventos de proyección de clásicos. En esta misma línea aspiramos a convertirnos en Escuela Municipal de Dibujo y Cómics, y ofrecer una alternativa laboral a nuevos talentos.Pensamos que la difusión de la cultura es importante y, por ello, organizamos exposiciones, charlas-coloquios, foros y nuestro podcast "EL CAFECOMIC" en nuestras instalaciones. Queremos enriquecer el ecosistema cultural de nuestra ciudad. 
SOCIAL ACTION EL SALONCITO DEL COMIC 2.0
We are not estrange to the reality of the city in which we live and, therefore, we think that a part of our facilities should be oriented to offer a entertainment alternative for young people. As part of our social programming, we include urban workshops during vacation periods, free workshops and open days; As well as classic projection events. In this same line we aspire to become a Municipal School of Drawing and Comics, and offer a work alternative to new talents.
We think that the dissemination of culture is important and, therefore, we organize exhibitions, talks, forums and our podcast "EL CAFECOMIC" in our facilities. We want to enrich the cultural ecosystem of our city.
Así que, hemos generado una evolución del anterior Saloncito del Cómic. El primer paso fue buscar un local accesible a toda la ciudad, por ello escogimos Avenida del Arlanzón 41. Un local en pleno centro geográfico de la ciudad, que no nos aleja demasiado de nuestra anterior clientela y nos abre una nueva masa de clientes del centro de la ciudad. 
So, we have generated an evolution of the previous Saloncito del Comic. The first step was to find a place accessible to the whole city, so we chose Avenida del Arlanzón 41. A place in the center of the city, which does not take us too far from our previous clientele and opens a new mass of customers of the center from the city.
Actualmente el Saloncito 2.0 tiene operativas varias áreas: 
ESPACIO DE LECTURA Y OCIONuestros clientes pueden acceder a la más amplia colección de cómics de la ciudad, juegos de mesa y otras opciones alternativas de ocio, donde los jóvenes - y no tan jóvenes - pueden socializar en un ambiente sano, divertido y para todas las edades. Pero queremos que estén muy cómodos, así que queremos ampliar añadiendo servicios de cafetería.
At the moment the Saloncito 2.0 has several operative areas:
 
SPACE FOR READING AND ENTERTAINMENT
Our clients can access the city's largest collection of comics, board games and other alternative entertainment options, where young - and not so young - can socialize in a healthy, fun and for all ages. But we want them to be very comfortable, so we want to expand by adding cafe services.
LA ACADEMIANuestros alumnos ya están aprendiendo las técnicas de cómic, videojuegos y otras disciplinas artísticas, pero queremos llegar a más alumnos y darles una enseñanza mas avanzada y especializada.
THE ACADEMY
Our students are already learning the techniques of comics, video games and other artistic disciplines, but we want to reach more students and give them a more advanced and specialized teaching.
UNRATED STORESCon el fin de explotar las posibilidades comerciales de nuestra nueva ubicación, tenemos la intención de abrir una tienda con diverso producto orientado al ocio, mundo artístico y el cómic.Estos productos son accesorios y regalos relacionados con el mundo del Ocio y el videojuego, juegos de mesa, tazas y camisetas de producción propia con diseño de Unrated, cómics y, por supuesto, material de dibujo y arte para nuestros alumnos. Para esto necesitamos una inversión destinada a adquirir equipos para la fabricación del producto propio, mobiliario para la tienda y el stock inicial de la misma. 
UNRATED STORES
In order to exploit the commercial possibilities of our new location, we intend to open a store with diverse product oriented to the entertainment, artistic world and the comic.
These products are accessories and gifts related to the world of entertainment and video games, board games, mugs and T-shirts produced with Unrated design, comics and, of course, drawing material and art for our students. For this we need an investment to purchase equipment for the manufacture of own product, furniture for the store and the initial stock of it.
LOCALQueremos que la imagen de nuestro local sea atractiva y un imán para nuestro tipo de cliente. Para ello necesitamos adaptar este nuevo espacio con diversas mejoras estructurales, entre las que podemos contar el nuevo mobiliario, suelos de madera, decoración de escaparates y paredes. Queremos crear un diseño polivalente para un negocio tan variado y disponer de una instalación informática y eléctrica adecuada. Por supuesto, necesitamos adaptabilidad para personas con movilidad reducida. Porque todo el mundo merece disfrutar del nuevo Saloncito del Cómic.
LOCAL
We want the image of our premises to be attractive and a magnet for our type of client. For this we need to adapt this new space with various structural improvements, among which we can count the new furniture, wooden floors, decoration of windows and walls. We want to create a versatile design for such a varied business and have a suitable computer and electrical installation. Of course, we need adaptability for people with reduced mobility. Because everyone deserves to enjoy the new Saloncito.
 
Estamos seguros de que con vuestra ayuda, conseguiremos lo que nos proponemos y daremos mucho que hablar. Gracias de Antemano.
We are sure that with your help, we will get what we propose and we will give much to talk about. Thanks in advance.

story:
Short Summary

We are a new comic book company that has a growing universe with a big future in mind. This will involve other indie comic creator's content as well, to be promoted.

This all started when the creator of The Seer Chronicles (co-founder, Greg Moquin) became inspired one night to write a story—that sprouted into a trilogy. This would become one of the first projects of SeerNova Comics LLC with plans of being turned into a graphic novel. This comic will include an entire unique universe of characters as well.

We have a dream to create our own Comic Book Company and universe. Another dream is to help other indie comic creators help them reach their own dreams. Finally to create a unique online community where even our supporters (that's you!) can have their say.  All those who contribute will help build more projects like the interactive city maps.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

These funds will first and foremost go to our artists and writers because they are the heartbeat of our organization. Without them, all this would not be possible. Next it will go to our moonshot projects like the interactive virtual world of the cities.

Some of the perks you'll be able to get when you contribute range from social media shout outs to t shirts, a full year's subscription to our online comics and even becoming a character in our universe!

The Impact

This project is more than just about us. Do we want to have a highly successful business? Absolutely. But, our primarily our goal is to help reduce the number of starving artists by giving them a platform from which to shoot their dreams from.

Our artists are all over the country and soon we hope to expand further. We want to help them bring their dreams into a reality as much as our own. By doing so we can help them provide for their families by doing the thing they love most, creating art.

Risks & Challenges

Although we are new to the game, we are highly optimistic about the outcome. We have built a highly skilled team and a powerful network to help us mount each hurdle that comes our way. As long as we have the support of patrons like you, this dream will surely succeed.

Regardless of funding, we will push forward. As the saying goes "Never give up! Never surrender!" or "You killed my father... Prepare to die!" Okay maybe that last one doesn't quite fit, but you get the point. We'll be fighting tooth and nail to see this dream come into a reality, and we hope we will have your support in doing so.

Other Ways You Can Help

Now we understand, not everyone is capable of contributing financially—believe us, we can appreciate that. However, if you'd like to show your support here's a few thing you can do:

  • Tell your friends and family about us! (word of mouth is a powerful tool)
  • Share our campaign page on your social media accounts! (Use the Indiegogo share tools!)
  • Additionally, signup for our newsletter by going to our website.

story:
Hi I'm Derec Donovan I'm a Professional comic book Artist and I've Made comics for Marvel/DC/Image comics for 20 years, and Now I'm here to ask your help bringing TRIGGER MORTIS to Life. This campaign will help raise funds for Printing and Distribution as well as Marketing and Convention appearances. I'm a huge fan of Horror and Genre Movies and this Graphic Novel represents a love letter to them. I hope you'll join me on this Wild, Action filled Ride!

 

TRIGGER MORTIS tells the Story of Rancher Sarah Mc,Clintock who has hired a pair of Pinkertons to protect her family's ranch from the ever present threat of Cattle Rustlers.

She soon finds herself caught in a love triangle between her old flame, Deputy Dylan Hawkes, and  mysterious Gunhand Seamus O'Donnell.

Until a Zombie plague comes crashing to Earth, spreading like wildfire and threatening the unsuspecting citizens. 

Can the living band together to defend the town of Devil's Lantern from an army of the walking dead?!

*TRIGGER MORTIS is intended for Mature Audiences- Violence/Strong Language.

Thank You for your support!

story:
**NOTE** I will be printing this book whether I make the goal or not.  At this point I would love to see people enjoy what this great team did. 

Welcome to the 22nd century, with anti-gravity packs, flying cars, intergalactic soda shops and much more. Follow the crazy antics of teenager Jetta Raye, and her friends Hilaria, Arky, Gizmo and Biff, as they star in all new stories that will have them being chased by dinosaurs, intergalactic aliens, and anything else that's out of this world.

I'm Jimmy T, writer, Inker, editor and publisher at Totally Galactic Comics. I have worked many years in comics and Jetta has always been a favorite character of mine. So when contributing artist Rich Maurizio mentioned bringing back her adventures, I thought it would be great fun. So let's go!

Jetta is based on the character published by Standard Comics in 1952. She was designed by the great Dan Decarlo. Dan was the creator of Josie and the Pussycats and co-creator of Sabrina the Teenage Witch. He was also an artist for Millie the Model, and the definitive artist for the Archie gang.

Jetta's original three issues, published by Standard, has fueled our excitement to do this book. We love the imagination of the original artists and hope we do them justice with all new stories.
Our writers had a ball coming up with new antics for the gang, and it shows with their vivid imaginations, while the artists, with varying styles, did an absolutely incredible job!

Talent list:  Writers include Chris Yambar, Craig Boldman, Angelo DeCesare, Matt Manning, Paul Kupperburg, Rich Maurizio and Jeff Shultz and Jim Tournas
Artists: Al Milgrom, Jeff Shultz, Pat & Tim Kennedy, Ken Wheaton, Bill Walko and George Broderick.
Inkers: Rich Maurizio, Bill Walko, Tim Estiloz, Ken Wheaton.
Letters: Eddy Chapman, Mattia Gentili, Ken Wheaton.
Colors by Mike Woods.  A wonderful group!

REMEMBER, every Perk has a book with it!

All new stories, with over 100 pages of exciting fun for all ages, Jetta Raye Adventures was a labor of love.  The main cover "Space Fishing" by Jeff Shultz is a fun way to show the antics of Biff and Jetta.


It is fun to see how each artist interprets the different stories.  For example, I had tons of fun inking Pat and Tim Kennedy's pencils on a "Star Trek Parody" and "Space Truckers".

Actually, I had a ball inking Jeff Shultz as well.  Jeff is an amazing artist with a gift for wonderful cover ideas.

As a contributor, you will have a book that your whole family will enjoy (be sure to get two so they don't wrinkle yours) You will also have a chance to purchase some wonderful perks.  Act fast so you will not miss out on the limited ones. We will have sketch cards, sketches and posters from the artists, and exclusive signed limited editions.

As a perk, we will be putting up original art from Bill Walko, Jeff Shultz, Pat and Tim Kennedy, and one cover from Joe Sinnott.

Joe is a longtime pal and has inked this cover over Jeff Shultz.

We have a special signed cover edition by Archie artist Jeff Shultz, inked by Joe Sinnott.  This is the last published cover Joe Sinnott has inked.  They will be limited, so do not miss out on this one.

We also will give 10 people a chance to be in the book.  This is a fun way to have yourself, a friend, spouse or children as characters in a comic book.  For this perk you would get one page of original art and a copy of both covers of this edition for each person in the book.

 

What fun to appear in a story with Jetta and friends.  A fun gift or momento to share with friends and family. 

HERE ARE A FEW SAMPLE STORY PAGES:

From "Star Truckers"  Angelo Decesare / Pat & Tim Kennedy / Jim Tournas

A Great story about cookies and shoes by Craig Boldman / Jeff Shultz and Tim Estilez.

"The Binge" A funny Simpson's Parody by Craig Boldman / Jeff Shultz and Ken Wheaton.

"Shake your Bot-ty" by Angelo DeCesare / Bill Walko.  Another fun story.

"The Elite" By Craig B oldman /Jeff Shultz  and Rich Maurizio


We do have a stretch goal of obtaining $25,000. If we meet the goal we will upgrade all books to hardcovers.

Other perks are original art from the book as well as a beautiful "I Dream of Jeannie" donated by Captain Nuclearfor his "I Dream of Jeannie" book.  We Have 75 Beautiful 16X20 heavy weight painted posters, featuring the wonderful Barbara Eden, and signed by the artist Joe Jusko.  These are the last ones of the limited edition posters held back by Airwave comics and donated to help us get Jetta Raye Adventures of the ground.   Poster we be shipped seperately in a tube.  

Funding for this campaign is to pay for the hard work of the creators and printing of this book, so we very much appreciate the contributors who help out.

If you are unable to make a contribution, we would appreciate it if you would share this campaign on social media to let people know Jetta Raye Adventures is here.  So please tell your friends, relatives, pets, or anyone else in your neighborhood.

Thank you for reading this.  The talent had a blast with this book and would love to continue to start on book two as soon as possible.

Thanks for tuning in!

Jimmy T

story:
ghcomics presents Este Vato "A Hitman Story"

Hello all I'm Gabriel Hernandez with ghcomics excited to bring you the 2nd story follow up to the Chingona series Border on Fire. Este Vato (aka The Dude) we will introduce you to the uprising of a young boy who moves up in the ranks of the Cartel world. We will also introduce you to other villains as well but the first nemesis and archrival of Chingona is the infamous Este Vato. 

Here is what you can do to support the cause:

We are looking for backers to support the printing cost, mugs, t-shirts, and posters. The comic will come in digital format and paper copies. I will have multiple support options so thank you again for all that you can support.

Risks & Challenges

I have no risks or challenges I can think of at this time other then time. I do not have enough time in one day but that's on me so no worries please support and I will keep cranking out comics.

Other Ways You Can Help

Donate what you can as everyone is a member and will get special gifts no matter on the size of your contribution. Stay safe and sound out there. Peace out.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mack Duncan. After spending my life as an performing artist and educator, I have decided to pursue a new creative venture. AMONG US is my first, and hopefully not my last, comic book.

What We Need & What You Get

My skill is in writing the story and creating the ideas for the world. I do, however, require help with the visual aspects of the project. I hired some great artists to help bring the books to life, and I have been paying them fair compensation. This campaign is intended to recover some of those costs and help continue the series in the future. 

By contributing, you will be among the first to experience this new title. I am also offering some exclusive merchandise, and an opportunity to attend the special Book Release event at The Torch Theatre in Phoenix, AZ.

The Impact

So far, two issues are ready to go, and I have at least 7 more issues in the script phase. If this campaign and subsequent sales are successful, I will be able to move quicker on realizing future issues. My plan is to retire from teaching in a few years, and allow this to be my next career.  I don't expect to be Stan Lee or Neil Gaiman, but I would like see this reach its full potential. 

Risks & Challenges

As I said, this is my first comic book. It's a pretty crowded field, so it will take a lot to find its audience. The original idea started out as a play I wrote in 2007. It was too complicated to stage, so it became a screenplay. Again, beyond my means and ability to produce. This world belongs in the sequential art story telling format, so I'm eager to see it flourish in its new home.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know someone who is looking for a new comic to get into, send them my way.

Also, if you know of a comic book retailer who sells indie books, I'm ready to talk to them.
