story:
Summary (Русский ниже)

We bring to life the great cultural and spiritual heritage of the Slavic people. We produce an animated fantasy comic book series about the customs and beliefs of the Slavic tribes in the early Middle Ages.

Three things are very unique about our animated comic book:

  • All the creators are passionate about Slavic mythology and history. We have turned this passion into an exciting story for you
  • This is a digital comic optimised for smartphone viewing
  • We created completely new user experience with breathtaking illustrations, animation, original music and sound effects

The initial piece of the first chapter “BOAR” is already finished and posted online for viewing – now we need your help to raise funds for the completion of the full first chapter.

Please FOLLOW THE LINK AND SEE WHAT IS READY  (use your smartphone for viewing):

***********************************

https://slovene.online/animation/1.0/msl/index.html  (MEDŽUSLOVJANSKY)

https://slovene.online/animation/1.0/eng/index.html  (ENGLISH)

https://slovene.online/animation/1.0/ru/index.html  (РУССКИЙ)

***********************************

Русская версия (English below)

Увлечение историей и обычаями древних славян может принимать разные формы. В жизни и верованиях наших предков многие находят глубокие корни, созидательное и объединяющее начало славянского наследия. Вот из этих мыслей автора данного проекта и родилась идея создания фэнтези-комикса с использованием современных возможностей. Но это не просто комикс, это анимированная история.

Над проектом работает целая команда, куда входят художники, программисты, аниматоры и даже композиторы. Именно поэтому в проекте вы найдете не только замечательные анимированные иллюстрации, но и оригинальную музыку, написанную специально для него. По сути, это электронное онлайн издание в новом формате, которое специально оптимизировано для чтения со смартфона.

«ВЕПРЬ» является первой историей о жизни, обычаях и верованиях славян раннего средневековья. Вот что говорят о ней сами авторы: «Молодой охотник из славянского племени Лендзян отправляется в лес по следам вепря, не подозревая, что это станет началом длинного пути, полного неведомых испытаний и приключений...». С этого читатели и начинают своё путешествие-знакомство с удивительным мифологическим миром славян.

Но, как и любой стартап, этот проект нуждается в поддержке. Поэтому создатели запустили кампанию краудфандинга, цель которого собрать средства на завершение первой части.

Краудфандинг, в чём-то похож на онлайн-магазин и подразумевает получение вознаграждения за поддержку проекта. Часть средств используется на создание и отправку этих вознаграждений, а другая часть будет использоваться по назначению для завершения работы над комиксом. Авторы создали большой ассортимент для выбора: рингтоны, обои для телефона, постеры, саундтреки, PDF-версия комикса и т.д.

Изначально проект задумывался как панславянский, состоящий из цикла историй, охватывающих ареал древнего расселения славян от Балтики до Греции и Малой Азии. Большая часть этих территорий по-прежнему заселена славянами, поэтому помимо русской версии создатели комикса делают также и английскую, так как английский в последние годы становится языком межславянского общения. Поэтому и платформа краудфандинга была выбрана англоязычная.

Вы также сильно поможете, если расскажете об этом проекте другим и сделаете на него ссылку!

The Story

“BOAR” is our pilot episode of what we hope will become, a series of fantasy motion comics inspired by Slavic mythology:

“Young hunter from the Lendians tribe goes after a boar into the forest, not expecting that this will be the beginning of a much longer journey full of unknown trials and adventures…”

Sounds intriguing, right? Our ancestors lived in a world where gods and spirits were real. As a reader, you will be immersed into that world, learn about ancient customs, visit old shrines, and witness medieval fantasy adventures.

In fact, for our stories we conduct research in the fields of material culture, history, mythology, ethnography and geography. Even though our stories are created in a fantasy genre, we make every effort to consult on various topics with reliable scientific sources. But who proclaimed that these subjects should be boring? Did you know that the popular book “The Wonderful Adventures of Nils” by Selma Lagerlöf was actually written as a geography reader for schools in Sweden? Although our comic is for adults, it does offer new and interesting things to learn. We hope it will inspire you to set off on your own historical exploration journey.

And now, meet the characters of the “BOAR” story:

The Format

We live in 2020, so yes – this is a digital animated comic optimised for viewing on your smartphones! We have created an absolutely amazing and unique reading experience with music, sounds and animation. In addition, we would like to point out that no application or special software installation is required to view our comics – this is an app-free experience with a standard mobile Internet browser on your smartphone.

Go and check it out for yourselves – we put a first part of the story online for you to get the feel of it (use your smartphone for viewing):

**********************************************

 

https://slovene.online/animation/1.0/msl/index.html  (MEDŽUSLOVJANSKY)

https://slovene.online/animation/1.0/eng/index.html  (ENGLISH)

https://slovene.online/animation/1.0/ru/index.html  (РУССКИЙ)

**********************************************

We hope you enjoyed watching the initial piece of the comic, and now understand what we mean by “absolutely amazing and unique”! We might consider publishing a printed version in the future, but right now our approach is about digital media and digital user experience, which comes with new technological possibilities. Still, it is a comic book. In fact, you will be doing quite some reading, as it has even more text than traditional comics.

This is how the panels of a motion comic are outlined before the animation process starts:

The Team

The story was written by Slavomir and Miro Lysak, in addition, there is a highly skilled crew working on creation of the comic:

  • Illustrations: Anastasia Barlett, experienced cartoon and book illustrator, digital art and water colouring enthusiast
  • Music and Sound Effects: Denis Tarasov, globally acclaimed song writer, sound editor and game developer
  • Animation: Vitalina Prokhorenko, graduate in book illustration and animation, who works with various publishing houses
  • Technical Project Management and Programming: Andrey Zheludkov, seasoned code writing, animation and application development guru
  • Web Development: Andrey Struzh, internationally commended web design, CMS and software development expert

The Budget

Currently, we have only produced the initial piece of the first chapter “BOAR” (about 25% of the whole story) and placed it online for viewing and beta testing. The story script and all of the illustrations are finished, but we need to complete the animation, sound editing and programming for the remaining part, which is roughly 75%. The funding will be targeted for that purpose.

Of all the funds raised, around a half of the amount will be invested for development. Platform and processing fees must be paid, as well as the cost of producing and shipping the perks.

We are putting together a $5,000 initial funding target. In reality, we would like to surpass this amount, so that we will be able to move beyond the first pilot episode. Here are future plans if through your support we raise more money than our initial target:

$10,000 – the first episode will be produced, and we will start working on the second and third episodes’ storyboard
$25,000 – we will create a new web experience for you and start production of the next two episodes
$50,000 – we will expand production into a whole First Season!
$100,000 – we will launch a Second Season production, and with possibly a printed adaptation of the comic, depending on demand
$200,000 – we will invest to enhance your digital experience and start a mobile app development

We are planning publication of the full “BOAR” episode by end of May 2020. In the interim we will also be releasing the first half of the episode, once it is completed.

Please remember that EVERY DOLLAR HELPS! 

And that we THANK YOU SINCERELY for your support and contribution!

The Perks

Most of our perks are digital – just the way this motion comic is created for the readers of the 21st century. We will offer a wide range of downloads, from the original music soundtracks and ringtones to the phone wallpaper and print-it-yourself posters. We will consider your suggestions in case you want something special to be added to the list.

Most of the perks are expected to be shipped out by May 2020.
Shipping for digital perks is FREE.


ORIGINAL SOUNDTRACKS (click to open in a new tab)

"The Chase" sampler: https://soundcloud.com/slovene_online/the-chase

"Volk theme" sampler: https://soundcloud.com/slovene_online/volk-theme

"Musician from Wolin" sampler: https://soundcloud.com/slovene_online/musician-from-wolin

"The Hunt" sampler: https://soundcloud.com/slovene_online/the-hunt


ePOSTERS / eWALLPAPER

Wallpapers include two files with portrait and landscape orientation. In case of print-it-yourself posters, we will send you a file optimised for printing a medium-sized poster (A2 or 18 x 24 inches). You will need to place an order directly with a regional printing house of your choice using the file from us.

Leshy

Forest

Mirko

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are currently unable to contribute the money, you still CAN HELP!

Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign amongst your friends and in social media! There are cool Indiegogo share tools on the website.

THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
MORTAL WORLDS is a science fantasy graphic novel in which a supersoldier discovers that man's first ancestor is our final descendant - a being of ultimate evil! 

The book will be a full-color 48-page one-shot in US standard format with a cardstock cover.  

THE STORY

Striking from the shadows, an evil force preys on the hearts of the innocent. Its goal: to lure a man who can at last prove a challenge to its own invincible champion.

The quarry it seeks is Cade Cyger, a renowned swordsman who can himself barely be described as innocent. Under the command of the mysterious Guild, he serves to maintain a threadbare but hardline order in a newborn age of wonder weapons.  

 

But... the mysterious unearthed power that now impels man to blazing feats emanates from deeper in the cellars of the earth than anyone  ever realised. 

The Dark Vortex whom the ancients called Zor has awoken, and sent forth its deadly emissary Nargun Drayve to eliminate Cyger.

When the swordsman dies, Zor will prove to not only have been the secret ancestor of all mankind, but existence’s lone and undefeated survivor atop the throne of skulls that is Battle Mountain.

The Hunt concluded, Zor will submerge once more; the devastation serving to reignite the world from scratch… that it may yield a worthier champion.

However, though Cyger is  heavily outmatched, he is not one to shirk from a challenge. Let battle commence!

 

 

The ART OF MORTAL WORLDS is a supplemental magazine available separately or as a bundle with the comic. Featuring a plethora of concept art accompanying a variety of revealing articles about the extensive creative world building and visual dictionary behind the comic book.

This will be a stapled full-color 32-page book in US standard format with a cardstock cover. 

 

CADE CYGER - Stoic swordsman

 

 

THE SKULLBALE - The Abomination of Devastation

 

 

 

$5,000 LOCKED - Bookmark for all backers!

$10,000 LOCKED - First trading card for all backers (Cade Cyger)!

$15,000 LOCKED - 2nd trading card for all backers (The Skullbale)!

$20,000 LOCKED - MORTAL WORLDS patch for all backers!

$25,000 LOCKED - TBA! 

 

THE CREATIVE TEAM

Michael and Caroline Anden are first time comic creators, inspired by old-school comic ideals of escapism, heroism and nerve-wracking tension!

Probably much like you, we continue to marvel at the pulp heroics of BUCK ROGERS, FLASH GORDON and THE SHADOW, the space-bound optimism and psychedelia of Silver Age LEE, KIRBY and DITKO, and the seismic culture-warp of legacy STAR WARS.  Throw in a hefty dose of LOVECRAFT and CONAN while you're at it!

That could all be because we’re also fascinated by tales of the paranormal, cryptids, UFO encounters and weird science (the disciplines, not the movie. Then again...) 

We also believe in the adage that if the customer asks for a hot dog, the only reply the vendor's being asked for is “ketchup or mustard".

story:
LET'S GET KRAKEN!!!

MONSTER HUNT 2: LET'S GET KRAKEN!

Bringing together one of the industry's most renowned and legendary scribes, Inkpot and Two-time Eisner award-winning Mike Baron of Nexus, Badger, Punisher, Action Comics, the Flash, and too many others to name...

Alongside newcomer and fan-favorite phenom Matthew Weldon, artist of Punchline for Antarctic Press,

directed by Mike S. Miller. Monster Hunt: Let's Get Kraken brings together Lonestar and his Unknown Soldiers together with Doug TenNapel's Bigfoot Bill and a few of his cryptid friends as they join forces with Mike Baron and Steve Rude's intergalactic executioner, and one of the most popular independent comic characters of all time: NEXUS!  Bound together by fate to save the world from the galactic devourer: GOURMANDO!!!

Join us for this epic, galaxy-spanning, dimension-hopping, mind-bending adventure that's guaranteed to grab you by the throat and never let you go!

Four epic covers brought to you by the creative team and other fan-favorite artists of the independent comics world!

FULL COLOR 48pp

Cover A: Matthew Weldon 

Cover B: Mike S. Miller 

Cover C: Elliot Fernandez Secret Wars Homage

Cover D: Kelsey Shannon

Back cover by Kevin Sharpe and Mike S Miller:

 

We're keeping the perks simple, and the prices as low as feasible, please check out the perks down the side of the campaign page!

Yes, this is technically a sequel to Monster Hunt 1, which featured Lonestar and the Unknown Soldiers, Jon Malin's Graveyard Shift, and Richard C. Meyer's Jawbreakers. A few copies of the first volume will be made available through this campaign if you want to fill out your collection, but you won't need the first book to understand the second!  MONSTER HUNT is going to be the Lonestar cross-over book, much like Marvel Team-Up was the Spider-man cross-over book. They'll all be a lot of fun, and we've already got something in mind for Monster Hunt 3! But let's not get ahead of ourselves!

Please check the perks out for more specific details!

STRETCH GOALS will be announced as we near them, including new trading cards, postcards, stickers, and more!

Preview pages below!

IN ADDITION to Monster Hunt 2: Let's Get Kraken, thanks to the generous spirit of Richard C. Meyer, we are now pleased to announce that NEXUS: TRIPLETS #1 is also available on this campaign!

"When Richard Meyer asked me to write a three-issue Nexus series, he said he wanted something like the Mandalorian. I have never seen the Mandalorian, but I'd heard enough references to Spaghetti Westerns that I had an idea. This is Nexus as Western.

The Squib Triplets (Squiblets) are adorable prodigies. At age five, they share an ESP link. They can communicate instantly with each other--even through black holes. When they are kidnapped, their parents appeal to Nexus. The CYNdicate took them to communicate across space and time, manipulating currencies and commodities.

Bob Squibb is on Xofluza. Lucy Squibb is on Skyrizi, a thousand parsecs away. And Shiloh is on Ozempic, an artificial world equidistant from the others. Nexus tracks them down one by one. But all is not as it seems. The CYNdicate anticipates Nexus' involvement and has laid a trap for him.

Nexus is the Man With No Name as he travels from one remote settlement to the next." -Mike Baron

With art by the illustrious KELSEY SHANNON, this is a 22-page adventure not to be missed! Available as part of a discounted package in the 3-pack with Monster Hunt 1 & 2!

Cover and pages from NEXUS: TRIPLETS art by Kelsey Shannon

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

SHI, Kamen America, Daym Drops, Cyberfrog, Earthworm Jim, Titan, Black Flag, Black Tide, Expendables, Cash Grab, Jawbreakers, Graveyard Shift, Starlight Cats,  Plot Holes, Thomas River, Dreamkeepers, Impossible Stars, Chenoo, Replicator, Gold Digger, Starblades, Reignbow the brute, Alterna, Inglorious Rex
story_txt: LET'S GET KRAKEN!!!MONSTER HUNT 2: LET'S GET KRAKEN!Bringing together one of the industry's most renowned and legendary scribes, Inkpot and Two-time Eisner award-winning Mike Baron of Nexus, Badger, Punisher, Action Comics, the Flash, and too many others to name...Alongside newcomer and fan-favorite phenom Matthew Weldon, artist of Punchline for Antarctic Press,directed by Mike S. Miller. Monster Hunt: Let's Get Kraken brings together Lonestar and his Unknown Soldiers together with Doug TenNapel's Bigfoot Bill and a few of his cryptid friends as they join forces with Mike Baron and Steve Rude's intergalactic executioner, and one of the most popular independent comic characters of all time: NEXUS!  Bound together by fate to save the world from the galactic devourer: GOURMANDO!!!Join us for this epic, galaxy-spanning, dimension-hopping, mind-bending adventure that's guaranteed to grab you by the throat and never let you go!Four epic covers brought to you by the creative team and other fan-favorite artists of the independent comics world!FULL COLOR 48ppCover A: Matthew Weldon Cover B: Mike S. Miller Cover C: Elliot Fernandez Secret Wars HomageCover D: Kelsey ShannonBack cover by Kevin Sharpe and Mike S Miller: We're keeping the perks simple, and the prices as low as feasible, please check out the perks down the side of the campaign page!Yes, this is technically a sequel to Monster Hunt 1, which featured Lonestar and the Unknown Soldiers, Jon Malin's Graveyard Shift, and Richard C. Meyer's Jawbreakers. A few copies of the first volume will be made available through this campaign if you want to fill out your collection, but you won't need the first book to understand the second!  MONSTER HUNT is going to be the Lonestar cross-over book, much like Marvel Team-Up was the Spider-man cross-over book. They'll all be a lot of fun, and we've already got something in mind for Monster Hunt 3! But let's not get ahead of ourselves!Please check the perks out for more specific details!STRETCH GOALS will be announced as we near them, including new trading cards, postcards, stickers, and more!Preview pages below!IN ADDITION to Monster Hunt 2: Let's Get Kraken, thanks to the generous spirit of Richard C. story:
Click here to get a free 40+ page preview!

And get a 50+ page preview of volume 1 by clicking here

 *** NO ADDITIONAL DOMESTIC SHIPPING CHARGES!*** 

Do you love Lovecraft? 

Did you enjoy our first volume of Cthulhu is Hard to Spell? 

Are you itching to return to the world of Lovecraft's gods and monsters with us?

If so we're back again for the second volume of Cthulhu is Hard to Spell, featuring everything you loved about the first volume, with even more Lovecrafty goodness. 

These books are our love letter to Lovecraft fans of all kinds, from those that obsess about Cthulhu, to the ones that never want to leave Arkham, to the ones that keep a copy of the Necronomicon under their pillow, and everyone in between. Whether you are a casual fan or a rabid one, we've got you covered.

The second volume features stories by Paul Jenkins (Spider-Man) and Tony Donley (Grimm's Fairy Tales), Ray-Anthony Height (Wakandaverse), Christian Gossett in his FIRST comic book art duties since The Red Star years ago, and a fantastic cover by Aaron Alexovich (Invader Zim). 

In total, over 70+ creators contributed 38 incredible stories to this 160-page hardcover collection, and the results are pretty mindblowing. 

Plus, the first anthology is a 176-page hardcover collection featuring 35 amazing stories from 70 more creators, featuring stories by Lea Hernandez (Teen Titans Go) and Megan Hutchinson (Will o' the Wisp).

This series was made for people who know nothing about Lovecraft as much as somebody who loves Lovecraft deep in their bones.

There are many stories that discuss the deep, rich history of the universe, and give some psychological shocks in the old Lovecraft style, but there are also some simpler stories to ease people into the universe, like mine about the Yith accidentally transferring their minds into that of a cat, which is accurate to the universe and features tons of inside jokes for existing fans, but a much lower part of entry story for somebody that wants to get their loved ones into the mythos.

The great thing about Lovecraft is that he's been manipulated and remixed by so many people that there is something in Lovecraft for everybody, and that is what I really wanted to share in this book.

I believe Lovecraft permeates every inch of our culture, and Cthulhu is Hard to Spell: The Terrible Twos is the manifestation of that belief, and carries on the torch lit by Cthulhu is Hard to Spell.

Cthulhu is Hard to Spell: The Terrible Twos is a book steeped in the mythology and gods of Lovecraft. The stories inside its pages follow the spirit of Lovecraft, but often strays from the tone of Lovecraftian horror to delve into the lives of the gods and monsters themselves.

Lots of the stories in this book are Lovecraftian in nature down to their very core, but there are also funny stories, cute stories, fantasy stories, sci-fi stories, and much, much more which build on the Lovecraftian mythos.

If you love the gods and monsters of Lovecraft, then Cthulhu is Hard to Spell: The Terrible Twos is going to blow you away.

And if you haven't picked up volume one yet, you can do so in the rewards, either by itself or in a bundle with volume 2. 

Best of all, this anthology series is ALL AGES APPROPRIATE. These aren't stories made for children necessarily, at least not all of them, but we toned down the cursing (there is none), the violence (there is no blood), and there was never any sex, to make sure you could show it to your child, even if they won't understand it all. 

I've had so many people thank me for making this book appropriate for their little ones while still creepy enough for them to enjoy. I really think there is something for everybody, from the hardcore fans to the ones you want to indoctrinate into the madness.

Backers really loved the first anthology

The only reason I came back to do this second version of Cthulhu is Hard to Spell is because the fans loved the first volume so much. I've been doing this a long time and I've never seen such dogged enthusiasm for a book. 

If it wasn't for you, this second volume wouldn't exist. And if you haven't picked up the first volume yet, you can do so in the rewards.

For this second volume of Cthulhu is Hard to Spell, I made it even better than ever before. I brought in Kris Simon to edit the book, who worked for Image editing books for just about everybody. 

We filled the book with some of your old favorites, but also stories by renowned creators like Christian Gossett (The Red Star), Paul Jenkins (Spider-Man), Ray-Anthony Height (Wakandaverse), and many, many more of your favorite creators jamming out about the Lovecraft universe. 

 Who am I?

My name is Russell Nohelty, publisher of Wannabe Press, a small press that creates weird books for weird people, creator of Katrina Hates Dead S%&t, Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter, and Pixie Dust, along with the editor of both the Monsters and other Scary S^&t, and first Cthulhu is Hard to Spell anthology.

I have raised over $200,000 from 13 different crowdfunding projects, and have gotten exceedingly good at crafting amazing books that audiences love. 

Did Aaron come back to draw that dope cover?

He did and I'm so excited! Aaron drew the first cover for the anthology series and I couldn't imagine doing the book without him on cover duty. 

This time, I told him I wanted it to feel like an old B-movie throwback, which is something I KNOW he LOOOVES, and he delivered brilliantly. 

If you don't know Aaron, then you probably recognize the style, as he is a character designer on Invader Zim. 

Aaron is a powerhouse in the world of indie books, and Zim is one of my favorite animated shows of all time. He also drew the cover for the Monsters and Other Scary S^&t anthology. I really wanted him to come back for this anthology too, and I was so stoked when he said yes to the second volume!

I am so stoked for this rad cover, and to show you what's inside. Let's look at some more stories. 

What are the stories in this book?

Deliver Me from Evil (art and words by Matthew Childers) -- A woman is chased by a tentacled monster and must take refuge in an old house, and the comfort of a strange cat.

Good Kitty (art by Erik Lervold, words by Russell Nohelty, colors by Claire Donaghue) -- A Yithian returns from being transferred into the mind of a cat, and relays his experience to his friends once it is over. 

Hideous Name (art by Tony Donley, Words by Paul Jenkins) -- A man, adrift in space, comes into contact with the idiot god Azathoth. 

Hellhound (art and words by Kelsi Jo) -- Medusa and her Father, Yig order away for a hellhound and get more than they bargained for. 

Bokrug's Proxy (art and words by Nathaniel Osollo) -- A girl is chased to the edge of a river and must call upon the old gods for help. 

The Old Gods Ain't What They Used to Be (art by Henry Ponciano, words by David Lucarelli, letters by HDE) -- A man hides from the rain in an old cabin and meets an ax-wielding, yet quite polite, Cthulhu child. 

Advanced Placement (art by Nathan Lueth, words by William Schar) -- A student tries to figure out what happened to his disappearing friends in a creepy school.

The Job (art and words by Mary Bellamy) -- Cthulhu tries to find a job in Lucifer's new world order. 

Unseen (art and words by Claire Leslie) --Nyarlathotep has a chat with an old friend.

Home Hunting: Apocalypse Edition (art by Abby Butler, words by Leanne Daniele) -- People still have to find houses, even after the Apocalypse, and this show follows lucky couples as they search for their dream home.

Food for Thought (art by Evan Scale and words by Jack Holder) -- At the end of the world, a man travels to take comfort in the great black tree god, Rhogog. 

How the Dark Lord Hastur Conquered the World (art by Cara Stemo, words by Johnny C, letters by Justin Birch, logo design by Nathan Burns ) -- Hastur is summoned to Earth against his will, and must learn how to build an army of worshipers. 

Behold the Almighty (art by Roman Gubskii, words by Joel Rodriguez) --  Two teenagers tangle with the great Cthulhu as he lies dreaming. 

Cthulhu's Good Day (art by Hailey Suits, words by Joe Ranoia) -- Cthulhu invades a fairground and finds that a carnival can be a good time. 

Someday (art and words by Katrina Kunstman) -- Old gods will need friends, too...someday.

To Be Young and Dark in Hollywood (art and words by Ray-Anthony Height) -- A young actress goes in for a meeting with a sleazy movie studio executive.

Never too Elder to Love (art and words by Willow Payne and Allison Bannister) -- Shub Niggurath searches for love on a date through the cosmos. 

Father Figure (art by Brandon Perlow, words by Paul Mendoza, letters by Micah Myers) -- At the end of the world, a man finds and nurtures a young Deep One, showing it the beauty of humanity, and family. 

That's My Cthulhu (art by Greg Woronchak, words by Rob Stanley, Colors by Rebecca McConnell, letters by Toben Racicot) -- Cthulhu wakes up in a sitcom. 

Contract of a Lifetime (art by  Aaron Allen, words by Chuck Suffel) -- A band shows up to a creepy town for a gig. 

She Returns (art by Jonathan Howard, words by Dillon Fields) -- Two cops search through a horrible crime scene trying to find a cultist. 

Camp Sarnath (art by Carolyn Carter, words by Brandie June) -- A child at Camp Sarnath finds a new friend. 

Waiting for Whateley (art by Don Nguyen, words by Mike Korpi) -- A man shows up in a sleepy seaside town looking for Wilbur Whateley, and a magical artifact. 

The Lonely and the Tired (art by Brianna Gilmartin, words by Heather Keneally) -- Yba 'Sokug tries to reinvigorate his sagging follower count. 

Under the Bridge (art by Mark Mactal, words by Jessica Maison) -- An old god visits detainees at an internment camp. 

Slinky and the Burnouts (art by Finnula Willman, words by Becky Nason) -- Two teenagers have a vision of Yig as they eat pizza in the woods. 

The Apology (art and words by Angela Oddling) -- The end of the world deserves an apology. 

Mother of the Apocalypse (art by Gowdi, words by Nicholas Doan) -- The old gods need children.

Respect Your Elders (art by Lloyd Ladera, words by Sarah Anderson) -- Hastur accidentally tramples an old man's garden on his way to destruction. 

Nightmares of the Nightgaunts (art by Wilson Gandolpho, words by Matthew Kund) -- A new security guard must traverse the creepiness of an asylum haunted by unnatural forces. 

Yig Gotta See This (art by Zac Skellington, words by Leo Baxter Kiker, letters by Stan Yan, created by Zac Skellington and Elijiah Conley) -- A reality TV show goes bonkers at the sight of Yig. 

The Old Laws of Ulthar (art by Steven Preston, words by Travis Gibb) -- A trailer park learns not to cross the Cats of Ulthar. 

Woe is Beans (art and words by Shannon Kirkwood) -- Life can get stale, even for the old gods, especially when they get complacent. 

Unboxing (art by Christian Gossett, words by Marcus Perry, letters by Maryann White) -- A social media influencer has a surprise gift for all of her fans.

Howard Dies in the End (art by Silvio DB, words by Terrance Grace) -- At the end of his life, Lovecraft travels into the great beyond.

story:
Hi! We’re the team at the Camosun Comic Arts Festival, a celebration of the artistic, literary, and cultural impact of comics and graphic novels. This is the third year of the event, which is the grand finale of the year-long Comics and Graphic Novels program at Camosun College.

CCAF will be held this year on April 11th at Camosun College in Victoria, BC - and we need your help to make it happen!

CCAF is open to the public, free of charge, and like Toronto’s TCAF and Vancouver’s VanCAF, the focus is on the creators of comics. There are panels, workshops, comics jams, a superhero life-drawing class, and much more. Students and alumni will present and sell their published work, original art, and sketches alongside the pros in our artists alley.

Past pro guests have included Scott Chantler, Paul Chadwick, Janine Johnston, Nelson Dewey, Sam Logan, Ann Marie Fleming, Simon Roy, Katherine Collins, Michael Nicoll Yahgulanaas, Renée Nault, Gareth Gaudin, and many others. (For updates on this year's guests, check our Facebook page) The majority of our funding goes towards bringing the finest in contemporary Canadian comics creators to the festival - costs include travel, accommodation, and honoraria, facilities and equipment rental, printing promotional material, etc. totalling $5,000, which is our goal.

We have lots of cool perks for you to choose from at all donation levels, from PDFs of all the student's comics, to published original artwork donated by our professional guests, so please check out the list. Your generous support is enormously appreciated by the students, who are the next generation of author/illustrators of the graphic novels that are bringing folks into libraries and bookstores in droves!

The Comics & Graphic Novels Program at Camosun College in beautiful Victoria, BC, is unique in the Canadian post-secondary public school system. Co-created by Ken and Joan Steacy, the program offers career-focused, skills-based training in the language of visual storytelling, which includes creation of Comic Books, Graphic Novels, Comic Strips, Web Comics, Storyboards, and Edutainment Comics.

This comprehensive one-year certificate program includes a diverse range of practical skills, including fiction and non-fiction writing, life drawing, pencilling, inking, lettering, and colouring in both analog and digital modes, as well as experience in production, promotion and publishing. Students graduate with a 24 page full-colour comic they create, and then present at the Camosun Comic Arts Festival.

CCAF also allows students the opportunity to connect with professional visual storytellers, who generously share their experience, skills, and stories in a mentoring environment which includes portfolio reviews, one-on-one critiques, and slide presentations. 

We hope you will join us on April 11th, 2015, to meet the students, teachers, and mentors at CCAF!

Keep up with the latest news on our facebook page!
________________________________________________

Perks! Perks! Perks! 

Here are images of the lovely perks you get for supporting us — many of them are one of a kind, so if one of them grabs you, grab it before someone else does! We have a limit of 20 perks that we can display, so as these one-of-a-kind goodies are snapped up, we'll keep posting more as long as our supplies last.

This year's poster features characters by the students of this year's Comics and Graphic Novels Program at Camosun, composed into a harmonious whole (with a scene of Camosun's Young Building as the backdrop), and inked, lettered, and coloured by none other than program leader and comic artist extraordinaire, Ken Steacy. It's available as Poster Pixels at the $10 level, and as a signed giclée print at the $100 level — comes with our digital goodies package!

The digital goodies package consists of: E-Gratitude, A Moment of Glory, Poster Pixels, and A Taste of Comics.

Scroll down to see some of the great one-of-a-kind artwork perks we have on offer from students, alumni, and our pro guests (some are also available as prints). All the physical artwork perks include our digital goodies package as well. See the perks at the right for what is included in each package.

________________________________________________

Here are the awesome prizes being donated by our Pro Guests and Program Alumni!

Signed print by alumna Karen Gillmore! Quadra Cats series. 8.5x11 digital print. 

A whole pack of Renee Nault's delightful mermaids! Two 11x14 prints, one 8x10 print, one 2015 mermaid calendar, two mermaid postcard packs of 12 cards each (so 24 different cards in total).

Original Comic Page by alumna Mariesa de la Rosa! Keki Sama. 8.5 x 11, ink. Prints offered at the $50 level. Original offered at the $150.

Limited edition digital print by Ash Vickers!  20" by 23" signed and numbered by artist. number 7 of 12. This  print is not available commercially (Ash only offers them as donations), so this is a rare opportunity to get your mitts on one!

Original Comic Page by Nelson Dewey! Back to the Future, Issue 0000001 Page 23 November 1991, 11x17 Pen & Ink

Page 15 of Scott Chantler’s best-selling work: the first Three Thieves book, TOWER OF TREASURE, which won the Shuster for Best Comic for Kids in 2011. 11x17, ink on Bristol.

The original inked artwork for this year's poster featuring characters by the students of this year's Comics and Graphic Novels Program at Camosun, composed into a harmonious whole (with a scene of Camosun's Young Building as the backdrop), and inked, lettered, and coloured by none other than program leader and comic artist extraordinaire, Ken Steacy. 17.5 x 19.5

Original Comic Cover by Gareth Gaudin! Magic Teeth issue #61, August 2013 11x17" marker and crayon

Original Double Comic Page by alumna Karen Gillmore! From Spam and the Sasquatch (pub. 2014), pages 30-31, 14x17, pen & ink with watercolour.

Original Full-colour Painting by Program Co-creator Ken Steacy - plus Working Drawing! 11x17" Mixed Media

________________________________________________

Student work — original comic pages produced by the artist during the Comics and Graphic Novels program:

Every year each of the students of the Comics and Graphic Novels program produce a comic book of up to 24 pages of their own. Pictured above are covers from the past two years. Get all of the comics produced by this year's student in our Comics Galore perk at the $250 level — as with the one-of-a-kind perks, this comes with the digital goodies pack.

Original Comic Page by Georgia Hewitt! Created in the Camosun Comics & Graphic Novels program, 11x17" Mixed media

Original Comic Page by Katherine Crane! Created in the Camosun Comics & Graphic Novels program, 11x17" Mixed media

Original Comic Page by Georgia Hewitt! Created in the Camosun Comics & Graphic Novels program, 11x17" Mixed media.

Original Comic Page by Rich Quay! Created in the Camosun Comics & Graphic Novels program, 11x17" Mixed media
story_txt:
Hi! We’re the team at the Camosun Comic Arts Festival, a celebration of the artistic, literary, and cultural impact of comics and graphic novels. This is the third year of the event, which is the grand finale of the year-long Comics and Graphic Novels program at Camosun College.



CCAF will be held this year on April 11th at Camosun College in Victoria, BC - and we need your help to make it happen!


CCAF is open to the public, free of charge, and like Toronto’s TCAF and Vancouver’s VanCAF, the focus is on the creators of comics. There are panels, workshops, comics jams, a superhero life-drawing class, and much more. Students and alumni will present and sell their published work, original art, and sketches alongside the pros in our artists alley.


Past pro guests have included Scott Chantler, Paul Chadwick, Janine Johnston, Nelson Dewey, Sam Logan, Ann Marie Fleming, Simon Roy, Katherine Collins, Michael Nicoll Yahgulanaas, Renée Nault, Gareth Gaudin, and many others. (For updates on this year's guests, check our Facebook page) The majority of our funding goes towards bringing the finest in contemporary Canadian comics creators to the festival - costs include travel, accommodation, and honoraria, facilities and equipment rental, printing promotional material, etc. totalling $5,000, which is our goal.




We have lots of cool perks for you to choose from at all donation levels, from PDFs of all the student's comics, to published original artwork donated by our professional guests, so please check out the list. Your generous support is enormously appreciated by the students, who are the next generation of author/illustrators of the graphic novels that are bringing folks into libraries and bookstores in droves!



The Comics & Graphic Novels Program at Camosun College in beautiful Victoria, BC, is unique in the Canadian post-secondary public school system. Co-created by Ken and Joan Steacy, the program offers career-focused, skills-based training in the language of visual storytelling, which includes creation of Comic Books, Graphic Novels, Comic Strips, Web Comics, Storyboards, and Edutainment Comics.


This comprehensive one-year certificate program includes a diverse range of practical skills, including fiction and non-fiction writing, life drawing, pencilling, inking, lettering, and colouring in both analog and digital modes, as well as experience in production, promotion and publishing. Students graduate with a 24 page full-colour comic they create, and then present at the Camosun Comic Arts Festival.


CCAF also allows students the opportunity to connect with professional visual storytellers, who generously share their experience, skills, and stories in a mentoring environment which includes portfolio reviews, one-on-one critiques, and slide presentations. 
We hope you will join us on April 11th, 2015, to meet the students, teachers, and mentors at CCAF!
Keep up with the latest news on our facebook page!________________________________________________

story:
Short Summary

I'm John Lepper. Horror is my life. Ever since my dad showed me Halloween when I was a teenager, I have been obsessed with horror and, in particular, slashers. While I was in high school, I came up with an idea for a story about a government agency that fights slashers.

That was almost a decade ago. Now I own and write for theblood-shed.com, a horror news site. I produce, act, and do special effects for horror films. Horror is my life. And I am now, with the help of artist Bryan Revell and letterer Alex Giles, ready to make my story a reality. 


We Kill The Dead is a horror/action comic that is a love letter to the slasher genre.  It is about a secret government agency whose mission is to combat thano-sapiens, undead killers such as Jason or Freddy. This first story of a planned trilogy entails Joanna, a survivor of a thano-sapien attack at her college, who enlists in the SSTB (Supernatural Special Tactics Bureau). Shortly after she joins, Jack the Ripper returns as a demonic being, last seen when SSTB leader, Nathan Scrimm, blew his head off with a grenade in the 80's. Now Jo, Nate, and the more-than-slightly-disturbed Agent Cooper race to discover the secret to stopping the legendary serial killer while battling an army of thano-sapiens under Jack's control. 

We are also featuring cameos from 15 actual slashers from actual horror movies, having been granted this right by their copyright holders. For instance, we have access to Stitches the clown from Stitches:

BBK from Gutterballs:

And Jack-O from the film of the same name:

What We Need & What You Get

To make this comic a reality, we needs funds. I have been in contact with a publishing company up in Canada and have received a quote where I can print 5000 units of a 32 page comic book for about $2000. We Kill The Dead is a four issue mini series, for a total of $8000 for 5000 units of the full run. We hit that, and the first issue will be out as soon as January 1st of 2016!

We have some great perks. We have issues, signed items, Indiegogo exclusive tee shirts and prints, mp3's, opportunities to be drawn into the book, the list goes on! And it all leads up to an amazing horror comic written by a horror fan for horror fans!

The Impact

This is a horror comic written by a horror fan for other horror fans. If you like slasher films, action movies, or horror comics, this is going to be a story you don't want to miss! This is a love letter to the slasher genre! 

We are also, with our 15 cameos from different independently owned characters, breaking a world record for most separately owned characters appearing in a comic book crossover and as such we plan to get this record certified by Guinness upon publication! So, not only is this comic a slice of awesome, it's a slice of awesome that makes history!

Risks & Challenges

This is an independently published comic. We don't have the backing of a huge company like Marvel or DC. That limits our audience. I will overcome this by drawing on my contacts in the horror genre. Many of the owners of the cameo characters will be pushing the book, we will be putting up articles on theblood-shed.com and contacting our friends at other horror sites for coverage as well, and we will use social media to our advantage to build an audience across dozens of horror and comic book fan groups. 

Other Ways You Can Help

And of course there is you! It starts with the individual! If you can't afford to contribute, you can still help us by spreading the word! Share this campaign to your social media accounts! Your support is so appreciated! We can't do this without you!


Note: please add $10 to any perk requiring physical shipping if you are outside of the US to cover postage. Thanks!

story:
A graphic novel project coming in 2016!!!

Fear, loneliness, confusion, anger... these are big emotions that we all deal with sometimes.  The Silent Witch is first and foremost a concept and story meant to entertain and spark the imagination.  But it is also a way to present a realistic portrayal  of  how young people deal with the very real pain that comes with loss and with the guilt and regret that growing up forces on us all.

The Story

“The Silent Witch” is the dreamlike journey of Benjamin Frost and Chinah Presence.  To solve a dark mystery and to free their hearts, they will visit amazing places and meet strange and wonderful characters. In their quest we will meet people made of tears who live on an island of mist, a lonely inventor in a clockwork city, and an underwater Eden populated with nightmares.  

Benjamin Frost is a loser. Not to mean he's a bad person or someone incapable of success. He is a person who loses things. He lost his parents, his sister, his dreams and his ability to love. 
Chinah Presence is broken. Something about her doesn't quite work. She is clever, full of light, and yet shadowed; a crystal vase... cracked.  Her tragedy is a secret. In each other they find salve for their wounds; a bond of pity, laughter and companionship.
Standing in the background of all the dark  events of their lives, hovering like a shadow of judgement and pain, is the Silent Witch.

 Once again the Witch appears,  Chinah is taken and now Benjamin must find her. But would China be found?  

About the Creator


Mark Lowery is weird. He loves stories. He loves comics. He loves films...and music...and books...and games...and making things; his background is a varied one indeed. A technical degree in Music combined with studies in writing and art have put him in a number of interesting places. He has published poetry, developed and written for short films, apps and even an opera. The Silent Witch is his dream project, since he thinks graphic novels might be the best of all possible mediums for stories.

The Illustrator/Artist

Damali Young is from Brooklyn, NY,  but has spent the last 10 years in Sweden painting and making music. In his youth he studied at the School for Art and Design in NYC as well as becoming an in-demand drummer for many local bands. Over the years, music would become a dominate force in his life, taking him all over the world, but eventually to Sweden where he would move from behind the kit to become a first rate performer on his own. In tandem with his music, his art has evolved, incorporating collage and pop art into an expressionist, sci-fi fantasy of vibrant colors and rich imagery. 

What the Witch?

Some quick info for the uninitiated! What is a graphic novel?!?

"A novel whose narrative is related through a combination of text and art, often in comic-strip form."

http://www.thefreedictionary.com/graphic+novel

 

The Silent Witch will be two different formats, i.e. two ways to transport yourself into our fantasy world. 
Firstly, we will make a traditional graphic novel as that is the core format of the project. We truly believe that the artistic and story telling potential of comics and graphic novels has barely scratched the surface and we are excited to experiment in this still avant garde medium.
 The most interactive way to follow the story will be the tablet and smart phone app. It will  be a new kind of interactive e-book with music, 3d sound effects, and animation . "Sure..." you might say..." We've seen comics with sound and such before." Well not like this! This app will allow the user to exist in the world of the Silent Witch in an immersive way only available with true binaural 3d audio.  Binaural ain't surround sound! It is true 3d which allows us to bring the shiver of a crying whisper in the darkness straight to your spines! The music will be an intricate part of the reading experience in the way of opera, every character and environment having their own theme.

What We Need and What You Get

We are so grateful for any and all support we can get - this project won't happen without wonderful people like you who take the time to pledge, share, and talk about this story. If you feel like helping us out, here are some things you can do.

  • Pledging to our Indiegogo today - check out our list of perks and see what appeals to you.(there are some images at the bottom of this page)  No matter how much you can give, you will be rewarded with something cool and we will be so grateful for your support. Also, it's good karma. 
  • Yell it from the rooftops - or at least the virtual versions of rooftops. Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, Instagram, heck, even good old fashioned e-mailing is a great way to tell your friends, family, minions about this story. Indiegogo has some great sharing tools, so please check them out. The more people who know and care about it, the more likely it is that we will reach our goal - and that you will get to finally experience The Silent Witch.
  • Do you have a favourite comic book store? Perhaps you know a person who blogs about comics, or other genre related stuff? Or maybe a favourite graphic novel forum online? Whatever that is, tell them about the project and see if they'd be willing to publicise it. 
  • And of course, if you've got a suggestion for something that you think we should be doing send a message to Mark at info@thesilentwitch.com - he loves getting mail!
Risks and Challenges
We have budgeted the goal so that if we reach it, we will be able to deliver our rewards to our backers. The money is all going into making this story come to life as a real, physical graphic novel and one of the coolest apps ever! We already have our team working, they just need the necessary funds to finish this work of art.

In practical terms, we have set the estimated delivery dates so that we will have (hopefully) plenty of time to complete everything and also ship it out, however, there is always a chance of delays when it comes to printing and shipping and such. But we are as excited for you to get the stuff as you (hopefully) are to receive it. We will of course keep everyone informed and up to date with the fulfilment process once we get to that stage. 

If you guys have any questions on where the money you pledge is going, just send Mark a mail and he'll give you a complete run down. But right now we can say that more than half the money is going to the app programmer/developer, with the rest mostly paying for the rewards, printing, prints, etc....All our cost are just estimates since we don't know how funding will go. We are asking only what we think we need to make a quality product that we can be proud of.  And you should also be proud for supporting this project, because crowd funding means this will be be your project too!

Images for Perks:

Poster(A4)





 Sticker


Prints(Choose one of the two...Signed by the artist!)


(thanks Jonas for the photo!)

By the way, we want to take this space to thank the ones who have already given support to The Silent Witch through advice, time and money. A Big shout out to:

Boost HBG

Tambourine Studios

Mathias Ransheim

Chip Boles

And of course, thank you to everyone else who has already facebooked, tweeted, instagrammed, tumbled, emailed, smoke signaled, morsed, or otherwise excreted info into the ether about the Silent Witch...you rock!

We are asking only what we think we need to make a quality product that we can be proud of.  And you should also be proud for supporting this project, because crowd funding means this will be be your project too!
Images for Perks:
Poster(A4)






 Sticker


Prints(Choose one of the two...Signed by the artist!)









(thanks Jonas for the photo!)
By the way, we want to take this space to thank the ones who have already given support to The Silent Witch through advice, time and money. A Big shout out to:
Boost HBG
Tambourine Studios
Mathias RansheimChip BolesAnd of course, thank you to everyone else who has already facebooked, tweeted, instagrammed, tumbled, emailed, smoke signaled, morsed, or otherwise excreted info into the ether about the Silent Witch...you rock!

story:
MY KIND of LOVE 

    

                                                              

Hi! I'm Dan Green

  • I'm a gay artist from Idaho, who now lives in Portland, Oregon. I'm also an ex-mormon who is still trying to help my family. My family and I love each other, but it can be tricky finding common ground sometimes. 
  • I'm trying to introduce a gay comic I've been working on. MY KIND of LOVE is different from the other comics that are out there. It isn't geared toward children, but is something you don't have to hide when they come to visit. In fact, that's why I created it. 
  • I wanted something MY family, and MY friends could enjoy, a book that could be left out on the coffee table (or Postum table ;-) ) without worrying what Grandma or the kids might be exposed to ... (That seems to be a novel concept, for some reason.)  It's something they will be able to see and enjoy, without having it be some big deal. 
  • The comic panels are funny, but not crude or graphic.
  • You can see several of the characters in the Gallery here, (gallery tab at top) along with some basic descriptions of the characters. Be sure to give it a look, and who knows... maybe you'll see yourself, or someone you know in some of the characters!       



My Goal

  • I am trying to raise money to print a book of my comics. This is my first experience with crowd-sourcing, and I need to raise enough money so that I can print a large quantity ...so that the individual book price will be affordable.  
  • I'd love it if my book of gay comics was able to make its way to coffee tables in all kinds of homes. It's not geared towards little kids specifically, but it's the kind of book you can have around children, and not have to worry about things that are completely inappropriate ... It's the kind of book I wouldn't mind having around, even if my nieces and nephews were flipping through it. It's something my family could have on their coffee tables, and not have to worry about having their kids see it...
  • MY KIND of LOVE is a much kinder, gentler, "normal-er" comic. 
  • Hopefully this will be  just the beginning for this project! After this book is completed, I have several more ideas for the project... and your support really will help make it happen!



What I Need to Succeed

  •  I need $2000 to print at least 250 copies of the book first, to keep the per copy cost reasonable. (The more I can print, the less each book costs.) The book will be a high quality paperback with a full color cover, in a large 8 x 10 format, with at least 72 pages. I can do a lot with a little!

--------------

Fun Perks for You 

(see sidebar for more details)


1. Get a book!

  • All contributors of $20 or more get a copy of the book fresh off the press!     Be the first of your friends to experience MY KIND of LOVE! 

2. Get comic prints!

  • And you can get a cool high quality comic print starting at only $5!


3. Get prints and a book!

  • For a bit more ($45+) you can get a book plus more comic prints!


4. Get cool comic mugs!

plus the book and prints!

Starting at only $65



My commitment

  • I'm going to have this book printed no matter the outcome of this campaign, but your support will make a huge difference. Even if I don't receive the full funding, any amount will go to good use and enable me to print as many copies as possible to keep the unit cost affordable.  
  • And... the book will be printed quickly! You won't have to wait long to see real world results.


The real world impact...

  • By helping me get this out into the world, you'll be helping send the "Love is Love" message, and you'll be helping to get that message into other homes, and onto other coffee tables. The message that, gay or straight,  we're all just the same, and that it's no big deal, seems very boring at first... but it's actually very powerful... and real.
  • I plan to make this book widely available, at a very affordable price to gay and queer friendly bookstores, LGBTQ diversity community centers, gay youth support groups and any organizations that exist to strengthen our families and friends. I believe humor can be healing, powerful, ... and even bring people together. 
  • MY KIND of LOVE is the type of book that can help reassure friends and loved ones that although being gay in our society can have some real challenges, there is definitely a lighter, funnier, and sweeter side to gay culture that we can all enjoy.
  • This is actually my first crowdsourcing campaign. I'm hoping it will help me take this idea, and others, to the next level.  After this book is published, I have many other ideas and directions I want to go. This is just the first step...  and a good step in a positive direction.   :-) 



Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please, help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Also, tell me if you know of any groups or organizations that might be interested in learning more about this book.
  • And Hey! use the IndieGoGo share tools!  (the buttons below my video)  By all means, PLEASE SHARE this IndieGoGo project with your friends!  And ask them to share as well! Facebook can be amazing!                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 ---Thank you!   :-)

MY KIND of LOVE 







    


                                                              
Hi! I'm Dan Green


I'm a gay artist from Idaho, who now lives in Portland, Oregon. I'm also an ex-mormon who is still trying to help my family. My family and I love each other, but it can be tricky finding common ground sometimes. 


I'm trying to introduce a gay comic I've been working on. MY KIND of LOVE is different from the other comics that are out there. It isn't geared toward children, but is something you don't have to hide when they come to visit. In fact, that's why I created it. 

I wanted something MY family, and MY friends could enjoy, a book that could be left out on the coffee table (or Postum table ;-) ) without worrying what Grandma or the kids might be exposed to ... (That seems to be a novel concept, for some reason.)  It's something they will be able to see and enjoy, without having it be some big deal. 

The comic panels are funny, but not crude or graphic.

You can see several of the characters in the Gallery here, (gallery tab at top) along with some basic descriptions of the characters. Be sure to give it a look, and who knows... maybe you'll see yourself, or someone you know in some of the characters!       





My Goal

 I am trying to raise money to print a book of my comics. This is my first experience with crowd-sourcing, and I need to raise enough money so that I can print a large quantity ...so that the individual book price will be affordable.  
 I'd love it if my book of gay comics was able to make its way to coffee tables in all kinds of homes. It's not geared towards little kids specifically, but it's the kind of book you can have around children, and not have to worry about things that are completely inappropriate ... It's the kind of book I wouldn't mind having around, even if my nieces and nephews were flipping through it. It's something my family could have on their coffee tables, and not have to worry about having their kids see it...

MY KIND of LOVE is a much kinder, gentler, "normal-er" comic. 
Hopefully this will be  just the beginning for this project! After this book is completed, I have several more ideas for the project... and your support really will help make it happen!







What I Need to Succeed

   I need $2000 to print at least 250 copies of the book first, to keep the per copy cost reasonable. (The more I can print, the less each book costs.) The book will be a high quality paperback with a full color cover, in a large 8 x 10 format, with at least 72 pages. I can do a lot with a little!

--------------
Fun Perks for You 

(see sidebar for more details)


1. Get a book!


All contributors of $20 or more get a copy of the book fresh off the press!     Be the first of your friends to experience MY KIND of LOVE! 




2. Get comic prints!


And you can get a cool high quality comic print starting at only $5!








3. Get prints and a book!


For a bit more ($45+) you can get a book plus more comic prints!






4. Get cool comic mugs!

plus the book and prints!
Starting at only $65










My commitment
 
I'm going to have this book printed no matter the outcome of this campaign, but your support will make a huge difference. Even if I don't receive the full funding, any amount will go to good use and enable me to print as many copies as possible to keep the unit cost affordable.  


And... the book will be printed quickly! You won't have to wait long to see real world results.






The real world impact...  By helping me get this out into the world, you'll be helping send the "Love is Love" message, and you'll be helping to get that message into other homes, and onto other coffee tables. The message that, gay or straight,  we're all just the same, and that it's no big deal, seems very boring at first... but it's actually very powerful... and real.

I plan to make this book widely available, at a very affordable price to gay and queer friendly bookstores, LGBTQ diversity community centers, gay youth support groups and any organizations that exist to strengthen our families and friends. I believe humor can be healing, powerful, ... and even bring people together. 
 
MY KIND of LOVE is the type of book that can help reassure friends and loved ones that although being gay in our society can have some real challenges, there is definitely a lighter, funnier, and sweeter side to gay culture that we can all enjoy.

This is actually my first crowdsourcing campaign. I'm hoping it will help me take this idea, and others, to the next level.  After this book is published, I have many other ideas and directions I want to go. This is just the first step...  and a good step in a positive direction.   :-) 







Other Ways You Can Help

 Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  Please, help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

Also, tell me if you know of any groups or organizations that might be interested in learning more about this book. And Hey! use the IndieGoGo share tools!  (the buttons below my video)  By all means, PLEASE SHARE this IndieGoGo project with your friends!  And ask them to share as well! Facebook can be amazing!                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 ---Thank you!   :-)

story:
My name is Drew Ford, and I am the author behind the new comic book anthology SPECULATE.  With each issue of SPECULATE, I will delve into a different region of genre fiction, be it science fiction, fantasy, horror, crime or just plain good ol' weirdness.  With your help, SPECULATE can become a regular part of the comic book landscape.  The plan is to release new issues four times per year.  If the book is successful beyond my wildest expectations, I am open to releasing it more regularly.  In case you didn't notice, the entire book (inlcuding the cover) will be presented in beautiful black and white!

This first issue focuses on the genre of science fiction, and contains six stories.



1. THE COVER UP (illustrated by Tony Lorenz & Larry Blake)

Aliens are real...and you won't believe just how deep THE COVER UP goes!



2. AND EVEN THE PEOPLE ARE FORGOTTEN (illustrated by Russ Miller)

In the far flung future, one zookeeper tries to save some very familiar animals!



3. THE PARABLE OF TWO MARTIANS (illustrated by G.M. Danzey)

Life lessons can be rather tough...especially on the surface of Mars!



4. ONE (illustrated by Chris Eisert)

An extraterrestrial struggles with the fate of ONE human child.



5. THE COST OF FREEDOM (illustrated by Helmut Eppich)

People love to fight...and hate.  Both now, and in the future.



6. UNIQUE (illustrated by Yul Tolbert)

What if the artificial life we create doesn't want to live?

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If successful, the $3000 will be used to design, print and distribute the first issue of what will hopefully become a regularly recurring title.  If we are able to raise more than $3000, the extra money will go directly towards SPECULATE #2!

As for rewards, I have tried to keep it simple.  For $10 flat, you get a digital copy of SPECULATE sent to your e-mail box.  For $15 ($10 plus $5 s&h), you get a physical copy of this science fiction issue of SPECULATE mailed to your front door.  For $20 you get one of each!  For $30 you get one of each, plus one copy each of my 90s science fiction and fantasy anthology COSMIC WAVES #1-3.  For $50, retailers can get 10 copies of the book at 50% off the cover price!  For $100 you can pick up two print copies of the book and a phone call with me to talk comics and such.  For $250 you get two print copies, a phone call and my personal editorial notes on any ONE comic book script you are working on (not to exceed 32 pages).  I am an editor in my 9-5 job, and am lucky enough to be working with incredible folks like Sam Glanzman, Chuck Dixon, J.M. DeMatteis, Alex Simmons, David Michelinie, Bret Blevins, Stephen Murphy, Michael Zulli, Harlan Ellison, Carl Potts, Jim Lawson, Jeff Nicholson, and many more on a variety of comic book and graphic novel related projects.  I will be more than happy to pass along any editorial knowledge I might have picked up along the way, to you and your script.

And that about does it!  The stories (writing AND art) are completed.  We simply need to raise the money to design the book, print the book and distribute (which includes those NASTY shipping costs!) the book.  In the above stories, I hope you will see something that piques your interest, and will consider throwing us a few dollars towards making this FIRST EVER science fiction issue of SPECULATE a reality!  Thanks for taking a look!

-DF

story:
Hello everyone from the Mythoverse team!  We have exciting news for you!

We've followed the beginnings of Adobe Kroger's action packed adventures, been there with young Maeve Mckenzie as she came to terms with her true identity, and accompanied Elthia Fletcher as she worked out mystical conundrums.

Now however, the world of the Mythoverse is set to expand in a huge way, and it couldn't have happened at a better time of year!

To that end, it is our pleasure and our privilege to be able to announce that we are prepared to offer onto you an entirely new and original set of stories set in our creator owned, independent shared comic universe.  

Yes!  Halloween!  All Hallow's eve!  Samhain!  All Saint's eve!  Whatever you choose to call it, this time of year has always seen a rise in the feelings of magic, mystery, and wonder for the young and the young at heart.  This suits us at the Mythoverse as well as can be imagined.

Ever since our successful first joint campaign last year, the creative community surrounding our shared comic universe has swelled with an enthusiasm and energy that is more than gratifying, it is humbling.  Artists and writers of all tastes, talents and persuasions have demonstrated a tireless drive to help the Mythoverse to grow into the rich and varied modern tribute to ancient myth and legend we envisioned when we conceived it originally.  At the Mythoverse, Myths are paramount; it's in our name!

And so, we are proud to present Hallowed Harvest.  The first entirely original Mythoverse Anthology!

Six creative teams will be working to bring their brand new creative visions to life, with six brand new stories.  Each story is set in the Mythoverse, and will center around the theme of the spookiest holiday of the year!

 

Hallowed Harvest will be made up of SIX stories, all with a distinct genre and style, all brought to you by artists and writers in the Mythoverse community.  So what are we waiting for? Let's have a look at them!

 

1. October, 1987

Writer/Artist:  Dylan R. Fagan

Tom and Michael are two Paladins in the Order of The Carolingian Cross, the ancient order of Holy Knights that has defended humanity from eldritch horrors since the time of Charlemagne. Set in a time long before Adobe Kroger set out on her first mission, Tom and Michael must hunt down a vampire in an old sewer system.

October 1987 expands upon the world introduced in Adobe Kroger: Dame Commander and Adobe Kroger: Knight Errant, while providing entirely new pieces of world building that will have far reaching ramifications.

 

2. Maze of Dolls

 Writer/Aritst:Peter Niederbrach

A young woman sneaks into a Halloween Maze early, after discovering that there was no mention of it anywhere online. Once there, she finds that one of the decorations is far more real than she ever wanted to imagine.

Inspired by real life stories in which bodies were mistaken for Halloween decorations, Maze of Dolls promises a deceptively cute aesthetic with a darker tone under the surface.

 

3. Port of Call

Artist/Writer: Forester

In Port of Call,  a Naval aviator stumbles upon a back alley speakeasy, which turns out to be a bar for dead sailors who come to port once a year, on Halloween.  He sees a friend who was shot down over North Africa, beckoning him to a table where Pirates sing sea shanties alongside Kriegsmariners, buying ale with Confederate money.  Can he escape, or is he condemned to join their fleet of doom?

 

Featuring a brilliantly stylized pulp newsprint limited color palette aesthetic, Port of Call hearkens back to the golden age of comics, and promises to deliver a story worthy of the Twilight Zone.

 

4. My Best Worst Halloween

Artist/Writer: GingerFoxy (Changeling: An Urban Fairytale)

Brought to us entirely by GingerFoxy, whose colors brought Changeling: An Urban Fairytale to vivid and extraordinary life, My Best Worst Halloween tells a story of a night in the life of young Maeve McKenzie, shortly after she discovered the truth of her fae heritage.

Preoccupied with her new double life, Maeve has completely forgotten about Halloween.  That is, until she is sent to trick or treat with her younger, and very rambunctious cousin!

It promises to be anything but an ordinary Halloween for this far from ordinary young Banshee.

Halloween Traditions

Writer: James Stern     Artist/Lettering: Jacob K. Graczyk

One of the charms of any holiday is the set of local traditions that come with it. In Mayagin County, a young girl who spends all of Halloween night in the local graveyard discovers that the supernatural have traditions of their own.

Halloween Traditions is a charmingly spooky tale about a group of neighborhood children who spend Halloween night in a cemetery.   This is a story that's appropriate for readers of all ages, which should come as no surprise; it was inspired by the writer's own childhood experiences during the Halloween/harvest season and memories of Halloween kid's specials.

Exquisite artwork from Jacob K. Graczyk creates a perfect balance between the wholesome and the spooky.

 

5. The Blackfire Covenant

Author: Salem LeBlanc    Illustrations: Omenomicon

The Blackfire Covenant is unique among the offerings in Hallowed Harvest, in that it is an illustrated short story rather than a comic.

In this story, our protagonist Theo is searching for his friend Amy, who has recently gone missing.  Amy was last heard to have joined a cult that had been gaining popularity in Europe, and some members were last seen within the forests of western Ireland.  Theo is searching for his friend, but is about to encounter what the Blackfire Covenant has planned within the forest for the Feast of Samhain.

The Blackfire Covenant is a revised and abridged short story of a story the author was working on.  He had written several stories involving cryptids, monsters, supernatural beings and such, but had yet to create his own spin on witches.  Instead of giving them a modern touch, he decided to dive deep into pagan and more specifically Gaelic aesthetics and intertwine them with the more menacing elements of nature.  To put it simply, this was made mostly as a challenge to the author to make something original but try to present it in a way that would seem to be something people of ancient Ireland and France would have in their folklore.  He added some characteristics to the witches that are not accurate to witches themselves from folklore, but they are characteristics that are pulled from pagan folklore nonetheless.  Music is the author's main inspiration, and much of the imagery was inspired by listening to Omnia.  The feeling of the overall story though was inspired from artwork by the author's friend, Omenomicon.

 

What are our goals for Hallowed Harvest?  Simple.  We want as many fans of independent comics and the Halloween spirit to have a fresh and enjoyable read this season!  To that end, we have planned the production of Hallowed Harvest to reach completion before the conclusion of this campaign.  There will be no waiting between disbursement of funds and digital fulfillment.  This will also allow for minimum turnaround time for the physical rewards, as the art will already be complete.

As for the above mentioned funds, all will go directly to the creators and creative teams. We've budgeted to permit maximum return to the creators, less shipping and handling for physical rewards.  It is the purpose of this campaign to provide a quality product to new and old Mythoverse readers while rewarding the creators as much as possible for their energy and time.  It's not cheap, but we at the Mythoverse believe nothing worth having is!

Hallowed harvest will be 52 full color story pages of original Mythoverse content!  You're getting a lot of value for your pledge.

On top of that, the best part about backing the Mythoverse now is that you can get all of the books and short comics we've produced so far in one place, both in digital and in print!   Check out the Digital and Print catch up pack tiers!

If you go all the way, you can also get these three prints featuring artwork from the Hallowed Harvest teams!

 

In conclusion, we're a group that is both dedicated to and passionate about storytelling, with rich settings and compelling characters.  We believe that legends and myths are crucial to preserve and to pass on.  Let us share ours with you!

 

Risks and Challenges

We at the Mythoverse have a successfully fulfilled crowdfunding campaign under our belts, and a second campaign that was recently funded and is well on track to fulfill very shortly.  We have had a great amount of practice managing on demand printing and fulfillment through our Patreon, and we've learned a great deal about the process all the while.

Still, we recognize that past success means nothing if you can't deliver in the present.  To that end, we are committed to maintaining the trust and loyalty we've cultivated from our backers and readers over the last year, and will be transparent about delays and difficulties as they arise (just look at how many updates were on our first Kickstarter!)

We don't just want customers, we want enthusiastically returning readers, and will do all in our power to earn them.

 

Other ways you can help

 

If you are unable to offer support through a pledge, you can help by making some noise about our campaign! Share and retweet, spread the word! That's all there is to it.
