Once there, she finds that one of the decorations is far more real than she ever wanted to imagine.Inspired by real life stories in which bodies were mistaken for Halloween decorations, Maze of Dolls promises a deceptively cute aesthetic with a darker tone under the surface. 3. Port of CallArtist/Writer: ForesterIn Port of Call,  a Naval aviator stumbles upon a back alley speakeasy, which turns out to be a bar for dead sailors who come to port once a year, on Halloween.  He sees a friend who was shot down over North Africa, beckoning him to a table where Pirates sing sea shanties alongside Kriegsmariners, buying ale with Confederate money.  Can he escape, or is he condemned to join their fleet of doom? Featuring a brilliantly stylized pulp newsprint limited color palette aesthetic, Port of Call hearkens back to the golden age of comics, and promises to deliver a story worthy of the Twilight Zone. 4. My Best Worst HalloweenArtist/Writer: GingerFoxy (Changeling: An Urban Fairytale)Brought to us entirely by GingerFoxy, whose colors brought Changeling: An Urban Fairytale to vivid and extraordinary life, My Best Worst Halloween tells a story of a night in the life of young Maeve McKenzie, shortly after she discovered the truth of her fae heritage.Preoccupied with her new double life, Maeve has completely forgotten about Halloween.  That is, until she is sent to trick or treat with her younger, and very rambunctious cousin!It promises to be anything but an ordinary Halloween for this far from ordinary young Banshee.Halloween TraditionsWriter: James Stern     Artist/Lettering: Jacob K. GraczykOne of the charms of any holiday is the set of local traditions that come with it. In Mayagin County, a young girl who spends all of Halloween night in the local graveyard discovers that the supernatural have traditions of their own.Halloween Traditions is a charmingly spooky tale about a group of neighborhood children who spend Halloween night in a cemetery.   This is a story that's appropriate for readers of all ages, which should come as no surprise; it was inspired by the writer's own childhood experiences during the Halloween/harvest season and memories of Halloween kid's specials.Exquisite artwork from Jacob K. Graczyk creates a perfect balance between the wholesome and the spooky. 5. The Blackfire CovenantAuthor: Salem LeBlanc    Illustrations: OmenomiconThe Blackfire Covenant is unique among the offerings in Hallowed Harvest, in that it is an illustrated short story rather than a comic.In this story, our protagonist Theo is searching for his friend Amy, who has recently gone missing.  Amy was last heard to have joined a cult that had been gaining popularity in Europe, and some members were last seen within the forests of western Ireland.  Theo is searching for his friend, but is about to encounter what the Blackfire Covenant has planned within the forest for the Feast of Samhain.The Blackfire Covenant is a revised and abridged short story of a story the author was working on.  He had written several stories involving cryptids, monsters, supernatural beings and such, but had yet to create his own spin on witches.  Instead of giving them a modern touch, he decided to dive deep into pagan and more specifically Gaelic aesthetics and intertwine them with the more menacing elements of nature.  To put it simply, this was made mostly as a challenge to the author to make something original but try to present it in a way that would seem to be something people of ancient Ireland and France would have in their folklore.  He added some characteristics to the witches that are not accurate to witches themselves from folklore, but they are characteristics that are pulled from pagan folklore nonetheless.  Music is the author's main inspiration, and much of the imagery was inspired by listening to Omnia.  The feeling of the overall story though was inspired from artwork by the author's friend, Omenomicon. What are our goals for Hallowed Harvest?  Simple.  We want as many fans of independent comics and the Halloween spirit to have a fresh and enjoyable read this season!  To that end, we have planned the production of Hallowed Harvest to reach completion before the conclusion of this campaign.  There will be no waiting between disbursement of funds and digital fulfillment.  This will also allow for minimum turnaround time for the physical rewards, as the art will already be complete.As for the above mentioned funds, all will go directly to the creators and creative teams. We've budgeted to permit maximum return to the creators, less shipping and handling for physical rewards.  It is the purpose of this campaign to provide a quality product to new and old Mythoverse readers while rewarding the creators as much as possible for their energy and time.  It's not cheap, but we at the Mythoverse believe nothing worth having is!Hallowed harvest will be 52 full color story pages of original Mythoverse content!  You're getting a lot of value for your pledge.On top of that, the best part about backing the Mythoverse now is that you can get all of the books and short comics we've produced so far in one place, both in digital and in print!   Check out the Digital and Print catch up pack tiers!If you go all the way, you can also get these three prints featuring artwork from the Hallowed Harvest teams! In conclusion, we're a group that is both dedicated to and passionate about storytelling, with rich settings and compelling characters.  We believe that legends and myths are crucial to preserve and to pass on.  Let us share ours with you! Risks and ChallengesWe at the Mythoverse have a successfully fulfilled crowdfunding campaign under our belts, and a second campaign that was recently funded and is well on track to fulfill very shortly.  We have had a great amount of practice managing on demand printing and fulfillment through our Patreon, and we've learned a great deal about the process all the while.Still, we recognize that past success means nothing if you can't deliver in the present.  To that end, we are committed to maintaining the trust and loyalty we've cultivated from our backers and readers over the last year, and will be transparent about delays and difficulties as they arise (just look at how many updates were on our first Kickstarter!)We don't just want customers, we want enthusiastically returning readers, and will do all in our power to earn them. Other ways you can help If you are unable to offer support through a pledge, you can help by making some noise about our campaign! Share and retweet, spread the word! That's all there is to it.

story:
Launched in the end of summer 2015, PONYO PORCO is a brand that focuses on the theme of hand-painted prints. 

Co-founded by the designer duo, Lupa and Larry. PONYO PORCO is named after the two axolotls of the designers. On the logo, the two magical creatures are conjoined in a pair with asymmetric features in details, which not only suggests the harmonies and differences between individuals, but also symbolizes the brands philosophy.

The designer duo is specialized in using vivid visual language to create mythical imageries where harmony and contrast co-exist. The blend of magical, realistic printing patterns and simple, straight-forward cuts produces a unique fashion deconstruction. The visual concept hopes to inspire viewers to explore the intriguing narratives behind the designs by their imaginations. Moreover, PONYO PORCO uses its intuitive spirit and aesthetics with a soul to illustrate rhythmic and musical creations.


At the launch of the brand, we expected to surpass clothing categories and focus on hand-drawn patterns. The brand combines different media, applies unique visual concepts, and integrates their ingenuity to express a delicate sense of amusement. These are then extended into different products such as paper products, homeware, socks, hats, scarves, bags and clothes.

From the products to the overall imagery, we hope to deliver an impression that is magical, equipped with a sense of sleekness, and enriched with the literary metaphors in adult fairy tales. 

Since we operate on small productions, we pay a lot of attention to the quality of our products. We hope to convey our diligence and sincerity to every customer, while making our high quality, unique products available to them at reasonable prices. We aim to deliver the feeling of collectibles and sustainability, rather than the pursuit of popular trends or fast fashion.

Although our company is currently at the start of its establishment, it has already expended a large amount of cost in preparatory operations, design, packaging, photography, human resource, and manufacturing.
 As we hope to have more printing enthusiasts from abroad to support our vitality, we have released various combinations of promotions on this platform for sponsors around the world to obtain the most dedicated and high quality products.    

[ The Floaters ]

In bedtime story, 
The sun and the witch with magic and crows
Crocodiles, snakes, and mermaids swim in the Bermuda pool 
Girl in a split, color-changing tail, 
Skull and the amputated body 
Appears all in five chapters 
With images of innocence and chaos 
Branded in layers on the fabric 
As night approaches
Choose a duvet for your body and mind tonight.

About the print



The collection of “Floaters” from season one comprised of 5 printing designs that were hand-painted by artist Lupa. They are respectively illustrated in: POOL, MERMAIDLAND, CHAOS IN PURITY, WITCH &CROWS , DARKCROWS.

Floaters literally refer to floating objects. As a result of the obsession for different floating organic forms, the complex and distorted conditions of all the characters are hidden under the seemingly fairytale-like decorations. In fact, this poses a question about the nil existence of people or objects in the world. 

Lupa often creates characters with self-invented logics about the world, and loves to express a glimpse of cold, dark charm in her naïve style. She is especially attracted to seemingly inanimate organic forms, and also likes to demonstrate an event or scene narratively.

On the other hand, the brand’s image and graphic designer Larry, likes classic and coherent colors. He works on the main graphic visual designs and packaging designs. Colors are an especially important part of emphasis, and the colors of this season are a match of tender milk tea and calm, neutral sapphire.

Moreover, photographer Sydney Sie, is specially invited this season to express the visual effects of a constructed reality through authentic, forced-perspective, and non-composite photography, along with a mysterious and interesting story plot.

Now, after all these challenges and efforts, this collection can finally be displayed to everyone in the world here. It will introduce Ponyo Porco’s  magic, charm, and colors to more people’s lives.

July 13th - August 27th : PONYO PORCO Indiegogo will be live. 

August 27th - September 5th : Indiegogo  will send us funds to pay for the products and incentives if project is fully funded. 

September 5th - September 12th : Payment will be sent to our manufacturing company to make the products. 

September - November : Products will be made and shipped. 

November - December : Products will be received and packaged with appropriate incentives and sent off to backers!

If delays happen along the way we will keep everyone fully updated. Please note that we have already included a bit of time padding to help avoid delays.


Our primary concern was whether the design’s expression could faithfully convey  the brand spirit. Hence, we not only selected different backing fabric based on  the different styles of each printing pattern before production, but also repeatedly proofed and corrected their colors. We also supervised the production process to ensure every sewing detail is well-done, as well as specially ordered custom-made clothing materials and accessories. 

These troublesome and critical measures further refined the illustration of our clothing samples. We received successive invitations from foreign and local stylists, brans, bands, and independent magazine to work on photography and collaborative projects even before the full information was released to the general public! While we deeply appreciate the support from these great friends, we also become more determined in our beliefs.

Our original plan was to launch high quality and price-friendly products even if our profits would be reduced. We hope that everyone can wear our design with reasonable price in daily life. However, our expectation for high quality products and way of small productions drastically increased our cost. The only way to launch the products at the original prices is to have a sufficient number of orders. This is why we need to adopt the “Preorder & Crowdfunding” approach in order to  successfully launch the branding project and production!

Please join the preorder if you like our works. Let’s activate PONYO PORCO’s branding project for the present and the future!


Website： www.ponyoporco.com
IG： www.instagram.com/ponyoporco
FB： www.facebook.com/ponyoporco/

The most recent progress on other crowdfunding projects will continue to be updated on this page, and email notifications will also be delivered to consumers/sponsors.

PONYO PORCO BOX No.1/2 

BOX No.1--------24 x 13 x 3cm [ For : Socks,Scarf,Bag.etc.. ] 

BOX No.2-------36 x 30 x 7cm [ For : Outer, Hat, Dress..etc..]

CRYSTAL LUPA

  Lupa is a fashion designer as well as an artist. She was born in Los Angeles, 1989. Graduated from Fashion Design Womenswear at Central Saint Martins, London in 2012. Subsequently began to focus on painting and print design. Has worked as a intern in London’s designer studios such as Alexander Maqueen, Belle Sauvage, and Christopher Kane. 

Lupa uses a very diverse array of creative media, and she likes to challenge new things to discover more possibilities. She works in areas including painting, illustration, sculpture, fashion design, and music composition. Her style is always comprised of a dark, unusual, allegorical, narrative, and magical sense of literality. Lupa is currently based in Taipei working on her print label PONYO PORCO.

Website : www.crystalupa.com


LARRY CHEN

Larry is a graphic designer born in Taipei, 1990. Expressed artistic acuity at a young age. Enrolled in art classes from elementary school to senior high school, and won premium prize in the comic category of National Student Art Competition in senior high school. Studied fine arts in university, and graduated from Chinese Culture University’s Department of Fine Arts in 2012, when he also won the top prize in the category of Western painting. Furthermore, Larry attended the design program offered by another department during university enrollment. He discovered his passion for graphic design, hence he turned to work in the design industry after graduation. In addition to working as designer at a design company, he established design studios like O4O and Plan b with some friends. Finally, he decided to pursue his personal dream of working in brand design. 

Website : www.behance.net/idra79911


Sydney Sie 

  “Iridescent like the collective unconsciousness of an eternally sun-lit, tropical city of neon.” 

Sydney Sie is a photographer as well as a graphic designer and Animator. She uses gradients of color, surreal imagery, the female body, and other graphical elements of composition, color, and layout to construct ambiguous, two dimensional worlds in her photographs. 

Sydney Sie’s creative approach to photography is to create a strong impression of the external form with an implied narrative buried within. She deliberately uses the inertia of the viewer’s attention to move beyond the bright colors and into the narrative story. 

Nominated: 2012 Melbourne International- Animation Festival (MIAF) Kinofest Festival Animex Festival Monstra Festival Golden Kuker -Sofia Festival Lucania Festival 

Website : www.sydneysie.com

The only way to launch the products at the original prices is to have a sufficient number of orders. This is why we need to adopt the “Preorder & Crowdfunding” approach in order to  successfully launch the branding project and production!

Please join the preorder if you like our works. Let’s activate PONYO PORCO’s branding project for the present and the future!

Website： www.ponyoporco.comIG： www.instagram.com/ponyoporcoFB： www.facebook.com/ponyoporco/

  During this project, we need to accumulate preorders that worth at least $9,000 in order to launch the final stage of the production process, and deliver our products to your home.  
The most recent progress on other crowdfunding projects will continue to be updated on this page, and email notifications will also be delivered to consumers/sponsors.




PONYO PORCO BOX No.1/2 
BOX No.1--------24 x 13 x 3cm [ For : Socks,Scarf,Bag.etc.. ] 
BOX No.2-------36 x 30 x 7cm [ For : Outer, Hat, Dress..etc..]


 

 






CRYSTAL LUPA

  Lupa is a fashion designer as well as an artist. She was born in Los Angeles, 1989. Graduated from Fashion Design Womenswear at Central Saint Martins, London in 2012. Subsequently began to focus on painting and print design. Has worked as a intern in London’s designer studios such as Alexander Maqueen, Belle Sauvage, and Christopher Kane. 
Lupa uses a very diverse array of creative media, and she likes to challenge new things to discover more possibilities. She works in areas including painting, illustration, sculpture, fashion design, and music composition. Her style is always comprised of a dark, unusual, allegorical, narrative, and magical sense of literality. Lupa is currently based in Taipei working on her print label PONYO PORCO.
Website : www.crystalupa.com

LARRY CHEN
Larry is a graphic designer born in Taipei, 1990. Expressed artistic acuity at a young age. Enrolled in art classes from elementary school to senior high school, and won premium prize in the comic category of National Student Art Competition in senior high school. Studied fine arts in university, and graduated from Chinese Culture University’s Department of Fine Arts in 2012, when he also won the top prize in the category of Western painting. Furthermore, Larry attended the design program offered by another department during university enrollment. He discovered his passion for graphic design, hence he turned to work in the design industry after graduation. In addition to working as designer at a design company, he established design studios like O4O and Plan b with some friends. Finally, he decided to pursue his personal dream of working in brand design. 
Website : www.behance.net/idra79911



Sydney Sie 

  “Iridescent like the collective unconsciousness of an eternally sun-lit, tropical city of neon.” 
Sydney Sie is a photographer as well as a graphic designer and Animator. She uses gradients of color, surreal imagery, the female body, and other graphical elements of composition, color, and layout to construct ambiguous, two dimensional worlds in her photographs. 
Sydney Sie’s creative approach to photography is to create a strong impression of the external form with an implied narrative buried within. She deliberately uses the inertia of the viewer’s attention to move beyond the bright colors and into the narrative story. 
Nominated: 2012 Melbourne International- Animation Festival (MIAF) Kinofest Festival Animex Festival Monstra Festival Golden Kuker -Sofia Festival Lucania Festival 
Website : www.sydneysie.com

story:
(You can find the english version after the italian introduction)

 

Presentazione (ITA)

Salve a tutti! Mi chiamo Carla, ma tutti mi conoscono come Kumi, nome che ho scelto per rappresentarmi anni fa, dato il mio amore per il Giappone.

Sono qui per presentarvi il mio progetto: Kitsune to Neko, ovvero La Volpe e il Gatto.  

KtN è un progetto nato per caso, creato per una maratona a fumetti, ma che è esploso in maniera incredibile, grazie anche al sostegno dei lettori. Lo stile si ispira agli antichi dipinti giapponesi, con colori molto spesso delicati o quasi assenti, per dare la giusta atmosfera ad ogni singola scena. Uno stile che ho studiato e ricercato per parecchio tempo e adesso sta finalmente diventando familiare.

 

Storia

È un'epoca in cui i demoni e gli spiriti camminano e intervengono nelle vite umane, cercando di aiutarli o creare un contatto in caso di spiriti benevoli, oppure predandoli, beffandosi di loro o uccidendoli per puro diletto. Un guerriero umano molto potente sta però contrastando quest'ultimi.

L'Onorevole Shinju, demone volpe molto potente capace di trasformarsi in una bellissima donna, viene scelta per uccidere definitivamente questo forte nemico. Ma quello che per Shinju sembrava un banalissimo modo per spezzare la secolare routine, si rivela essere più duro del previsto e sconvolge completamente i suoi piani… quando scopre che il "Gatto" non è altro che una donna!

 

 

KtN è ancora un fumetto incompleto. Questo che è in procinto di essere stampato grazie a questa campagna è il volume 0. Conterrà i capitoli già pubblicati sul web, ma corretti e con nuove tavole, più un capitolo totalmente inedito che chiuderà il primo arco della storia! 

I fondi raccolti mi aiuteranno finalmente a stampare le copie cartacee che in molti mi stanno chiedendo e a sostentarmi un pochino con le spese!  

Se riuscirò a raggiungere la somma pattuita, riuscirò a stampare dalle 100 alle 150 copie. Coloro che prenderanno una copia ovviamente la riceveranno a casa, mentre il prossimo anno chi non è riuscito a prenderlo mi troverà a qualche fiera! Se il goal non sarà raggiunto, mi limiterò a stampare le copie prenotate e a mandarle ai rispettivi proprietari e… niente, il resto lo terrò da parte per stampare altre copie in seguito ^_^

 

 

 

Quando potrò avere KtN fra le mani?

Il fumetto di KtN è verrà mandato in stampa a Febbraio del 2017; ovviamente chi ordina la versione digitale lo avrà appena conclusa la realizzazione!  :)

Sperando che le poste facciano il loro lavoro decentemente, avrete tutti la vostra copia entro gli inizi di Marzo!

 

Introduction (ENG)

Hello everybody!

My name is Carla, but I am known as Kumi, the name I chose to represent me years ago because I love Japan.

I'd like to present you my project: Kitsune to Neko, The Fox and the Cat.

KtN is a project born completely by chance: it was created for a comics marathon, but has exploded beyond every expectation, with the support of you readers.  Inspired by ancient Japanese paintings, the style is often delicate or with nearly absent colors, in order to give the right atmosphere for each scene. It's a style that I have studied and researched for a long time and now it's finally becoming familiar.

The Plot

 

It's an age when demons and spirits are walking and interact with human lives: trying to help or create a contact in case of benevolent spirits, or killing them for fun. A very powerful human warrior, however, is fighting the latters.

The Honorable Shinju, very powerful demon fox that can transform herself into a beautiful woman, is chosen to kill this strong human enemy. But what for Shinju seemed a trivial task, for breaking her century-old routine, turns out to be harder than expected and completely disrupts her plans... when she discovers that the "Cat" is but a woman!

KtN is still an incomplete comic. What is going to be printed, the goal of this campain, is the Volume 0. It will contain the chapters already published on the web, corrected and with new tables, plus a totally new chapter that will close the first arc of the story!

The raised funds will help me print the hard copies that many are asking for and help me a little with the life's expenses!

If I can reach the agreed goal, I will be able to print around 100 to 150 copies. If the goal is not reached, I'll just print the booked copies and send them to their respective owners and... I'll keep the rest aside to print additional copies later! ^_^

When will I have KtN?

Sadly, for now I am not planning to print an english version. BUT! In the future, I will for sure. In the meantime, in this Indiegogo campaign, you can get the digital version of Volume 0: you will receive the files just after I will finish to complete it, so around february 2017! :)

story:
---------------------------------------------

An Unprecedented Journey

BLUE BASTION is an action-packed Science Fantasy series that explores a Utopia run by 6 Elders + 1 King and the conflicts they face maintaining peace in a volatile world. A central theme of Blue Bastion is the use of Gauntlets much like modern-day smart phones. With all citizens wearing "Grain Gauntlets", every one has a bit of magic at their fingertips!

---------------------------------------------

Check Us Out On:

Twitter: https://twitter.com/BBComicSeries

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BlueBastionStudios

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/bluebastionstudios

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/travis-e-marshall

---------------------------------------------

ISSUE #1 COVER

SAMPLE PAGES

---------------------------------------------

EXCLUSIVE METALLIC STAMPS!

All copies of BLUE BASTION sold through this campaign come with limited edition Metallic Stamps signifying the rarity of your issue.

---------------------------------------------

A Race Unlike Any Other

In BLUE BASTION, you'll be introduced to the scenery through the eyes of renegade citizen Master Euclid Syfer, as he competes in The Path To Kingship, a 3-year long series of chariot races. With the ultimate prize being the crown, will Euclid win and become the next King?

A Blend Of Sci-Fi & Fantasy

As you turn the pages of BLUE BASTION, you'll watch a world grow in front of your eyes. 

But before you enter, you should know a few things:

  1. Blue Bastion is a planet.
  2. There are 3 States on Blue Bastion - The Capitol, The Slums, & The Impact Site.
  3. There are no cars on Blue Bastion. Instead, citizens use their Grain Gauntlets to generate creatures called Constructs that they use as companions and vehicles. 
  4. Grain Gauntlets are powered by batteries called "Grain Cores".  Grain Cores are obtained through the unethical use of slaves called Harvesters. One motivation for our heroes is to invent a new core. But will the Traders in the Slums like this?
  5. All Citizens of the Capitol  must attend the Blue Bastion Academy from 8 years of age until they graduate at 28 during a ceremony in the Elder Temple.
  6. After graduating, Citizens choose to become a Builder, Councilor, or Master.
  7. Life expectancy is much longer in Blue Bastion while injury rates are much higher. This is due to citizens utilizing The Earth Sigil to heal one another with their gauntlets.

Climb The Social Ladder

Each donation perk is themed after a social class in Blue Bastion. With your donation, you will symbolically enter the world of Blue Bastion in the class of your choosing. And for higher donations, we'll draw you as a character!

All Physical Copies of Issue 1 will come with exclusive Metallic Stamps themed to your class, so with your donation you'll be getting not just a book but also a collector's item!

Help Bring A Dream To Life

Whether you can spare $5 or $500, all donations are welcomed.  Thanks in advance for your support bringing this dream to fruition.

I hope this can be the beginning of a long journey together. Only through your support can we make BLUE BASTION into a series that will go down in history as one of the greats. So donate now, and get ready for some fun!

-TE Marshall, Creator/Writer - BLUE BASTION

Want a poster? Buy one on Displate! 

---------------------------------------------

THE TEAM

Blue Bastion Studios (@BlueBastionStudios)

T.E. Marshall - Writer / Creator (@TE_Marshall)

Rod Luper - Lead Artist (@Rod.Luper)

Carlos Eduardo - Inker (@InkArts)

Artecida - Colorist (@Artecida_Studio)

Priscila Souza - Letterer (@Pri.Pritz)

Chastity Irizarry - Publicist (@ChastityInc)

Kumie Asai - Costume Designer (@KumieAsaiCostumeDesign)

 

Additional Works by:

Andrew Garza (@Art_ificial_Suicide)

Kyle Petchock (@KPetchock_Art)

Minea Juntura (@Minskujuu)

Rob Bowyer (@MassiveFace)

Tommy Nguyen (@Tommy_Nguyen)

 

Special Thanks To:

@NumOneFan

 

For any and all media inquiries, please contact Chastity Irizarry at:

chastity@chastityinc.com

 

 

Book mockups designed by Aleksandr_Samochernyi / Freepik and ZippyPixels.​​

story:
KNIGHT ERRANT

Hello, my name is Joshua Sloniker and I am a graduate of the Kubert School of Cartooning and Graphic art. My previous work includes illustrations for PS Magazine, Full Mag Magazine, Dynamite, and many other small indie comic books.

About 10 years ago before I was even accepted into the Kubert School, I began working on the story of The Knight Errant. In the years since I graduated from the Kubert School and worked as a professional illustrator and grown as an artist. I believe I now have the skills to bring my dream to life and tell a story that’s been a decade in the making.

If you're a fan of stories like Final Fantasy, Battle Chasers, and Game of Thrones this book is for you!

 

What We Need

$500 goes to printing and shipping.

$1500 goes to my team of inkers and colorists.

 

What You Get

 

All tiers will get a digital copy of Knight Errant Issue #1. Additional perks include:

• Personally hand drawn sketches

• Have your name printed in the back of the comic on a special thank you page.

• Hand-drawn postcards from Japan, Philippines, Indonesia, New Zealand, Hawaii or Australia. (Subject to availability and my travel schedule)

 

Risks & Challenges

If I die in the next few months I can't finish the book other than that there is no risk.
Even If I don't hit my goal you will get a book and its perks.
If I don't hit $1000 the book won't be in color.
The main purpose of this campaign is to fund the comic's first print run, rather than trying to make back its production costs through sales.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Here's a preview of the 1st issue cover and the first TEN pages of the COMPLETED 1st issue. 

 

2nd issue cover by Comic Artist Karl Altsaetter! (X men, Q Unit, BloodStrike, KnightStrike, Deity, Emerald City Blues and much more.)  Colors by Gil Rivera.

WIP of Issue 2 double page spread of the credits page/page 1 and page 2.

Nite Stalker Print by Comic Artist Mike Bowden! (World of Warcraft, Flash, Bubble Gun and much more.)  Colors by Gil Rivera.

 

Grindhouse Style Nite Stalker Print

 

Side by side comparisons of the Remastered pages!      

 

Thank you for taking the time to check out my campaign, my family and I really appreciate it. I'm Gil Rivera, a graphic designer by trade, comic book artist by heart. In March 2018 we debuted Nite Stalker #1 at Wizard World in Cleveland, OH, and SOLD OUT.  Cleveland is a kick@$$ city that adopted me as an artist, a brother, a cousin, an uncle and a son-in-law, the support was out of this world!  I'm a Christian & a military spouse who wholeheartedly supports my beautiful, amazing wife who serves in our United States Air Force. We are blessed with two beautiful daughters to raise and I couldn't be prouder. 

With Nite Stalker, I'm bringing back the excitement of classic 80's and 90's comics and action movies with the over the top violence of Quentin Tarantino & Robert Rodriquez!  I experienced the Image Revolution when I was in middle school. The Image guys inspired me to pick up a pencil and start taking my art serious if I wanted to create my stories.

Nite Stalker is a journey with complex and interesting characters, pulse-pounding action scenes and drama! It has dynamic visual storytelling & a gripping story featuring handsome heroes, beautiful women, and evil villains. Most importantly, this story is for everybody regardless of your political views! As Legendary Filmmaker Roger Corman once said "No preaching just storytelling." I believe that comics are for everyone and shouldn't pander to one ideology or another. To be honest, I don't care what your politics are, I just want to put these entertaining comics in your hand and take you on this amazing journey with Javier Rey and the intriguing cast of characters you will soon meet.​

 

Comic books are my passion and we really want to make an impression with the quality of our books. Readers deserve it. YOU deserve it. I pride myself on professionalism, so you can rest assured that you'll love what you pay for.

 

My initial funding request is just enough to cover the printing, distribution, and fees of the comic, plus money for the writer and I decided to hire a colorist and letterer this go around. So help us go above and beyond the funding request to unlock our Amazing Stretch Goals!!!

 

$12k STRETCH GOAL: Remastering and Recoloring Nite Stalker #1 so both comics match in quality!

$15k STRETCH GOAL: Combine the 2 comics into a square bound 50 page graphic novel for your comic long box or bookshelf!  

$18k STRETCH GOAL: Exclusive set of 2 Nite Stalker trading cards featuring Nite Stalker & Winchester!!!

$20k STRETCH GOAL: To be announced when *unlocked*!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your help and support, not only financially, so this project can live, thrive and grow, we needs your voice!  You can help by getting out there on social media and tell the WORLD about Nite Stalker and this campaign!  On Instagram, use #NiteStalkerComic2019. On Facebook, "like" the posts. On Twitter, retweet posts. And if you can't afford to help right now, it costs nothing to spread the word.

Come join us in making Nite Stalker an epic, action packed adventure! 

We're keeping the perks simple, and the prices as low as possible. THANK YOU for looking, I hope we have your support for NITE STALKER #1 and #2!!!
story_txt: Here's a preview of the 1st issue cover and the first TEN pages of the COMPLETED 1st issue.  2nd issue cover by Comic Artist Karl Altsaetter! (X men, Q Unit, BloodStrike, KnightStrike, Deity, Emerald City Blues and much more.)  Colors by Gil Rivera.WIP of Issue 2 double page spread of the credits page/page 1 and page 2.Nite Stalker Print by Comic Artist Mike Bowden! (World of Warcraft, Flash, Bubble Gun and much more.)  Colors by Gil Rivera. Grindhouse Style Nite Stalker Print Side by side comparisons of the Remastered pages!       Thank you for taking the time to check out my campaign, my family and I really appreciate it. I'm Gil Rivera, a graphic designer by trade, comic book artist by heart. In March 2018 we debuted Nite Stalker #1 at Wizard World in Cleveland, OH, and SOLD OUT.  Cleveland is a kick@$$ city that adopted me as an artist, a brother, a cousin, an uncle and a son-in-law, the support was out of this world!  I'm a Christian & a military spouse who wholeheartedly supports my beautiful, amazing wife who serves in our United States Air Force. We are blessed with two beautiful daughters to raise and I couldn't be prouder. With Nite Stalker, I'm bringing back the excitement of classic 80's and 90's comics and action movies with the over the top violence of Quentin Tarantino & Robert Rodriquez!  I experienced the Image Revolution when I was in middle school. The Image guys inspired me to pick up a pencil and start taking my art serious if I wanted to create my stories.Nite Stalker is a journey with complex and interesting characters, pulse-pounding action scenes and drama! It has dynamic visual storytelling & a gripping story featuring handsome heroes, beautiful women, and evil villains. Most importantly, this story is for everybody regardless of your political views! As Legendary Filmmaker Roger Corman once said "No preaching just storytelling." I believe that comics are for everyone and shouldn't pander to one ideology or another. To be honest, I don't care what your politics are, I just want to put these entertaining comics in your hand and take you on this amazing journey with Javier Rey and the intriguing cast of characters you will soon meet.​ Comic books are my passion and we really want to make an impression with the quality of our books. Readers deserve it. YOU deserve it. I pride myself on professionalism, so you can rest assured that you'll love what you pay for. My initial funding request is just enough to cover the printing, distribution, and fees of the comic, plus money for the writer and I decided to hire a colorist and letterer this go around. So help us go above and beyond the funding request to unlock our Amazing Stretch Goals!!! $12k STRETCH GOAL: Remastering and Recoloring Nite Stalker #1 so both comics match in quality!$15k STRETCH GOAL: Combine the 2 comics into a square bound 50 page graphic novel for your comic long box or bookshelf!  $18k STRETCH GOAL: Exclusive set of 2 Nite Stalker trading cards featuring Nite Stalker & Winchester!!!$20k STRETCH GOAL: To be announced when *unlocked*! Other Ways You Can HelpWe need your help and support, not only financially, so this project can live, thrive and grow, we needs your voice!  You can help by getting out there on social media and tell the WORLD about Nite Stalker and this campaign!  On Instagram, use #NiteStalkerComic2019. On Facebook, "like" the posts. On Twitter, retweet posts. And if you can't afford to help right now, it costs nothing to spread the word.Come join us in making Nite Stalker an epic, action packed adventure! We're keeping the perks simple, and the prices as low as possible. THANK YOU for looking, I hope we have your support for NITE STALKER #1 and #2!!!

story:
Overview

While serving as a guide to the U.S. Special Forces on a mission to Egypt, Professor Samuel Kocian finds himself mysteriously transformed into the Crimson Scorpion -- a mythical warrior with powers he neither understands nor fully controls.   Ambushed by terrorists, targeted by super assassins, and pitted against costumed crusaders, volume one of Crimson Scorpion takes our hero on a journey of non-stop action and adventure, all told and drawn in a classic comic book style. 

The Crimson Scorpion first appeared in issues #1 through 6 of Exciting Comics volume 2 published by Antarctic Press.  Now, for the first time, these adventures are compiled into a single, 72 page trade containing seven chapters covering three story arcs.  The graphic novel features art by Joseph Olesco and Salvatore Cuffari with colors by Shannon and Gerilou Smith, and script by David Furr.

The Scorpion's Sting

In “The Scorpion’s Sting” Professor Kocian leads a group of Special Forces operatives to ancient ruins that ISIS is using to hide chemical weapons. It is a reprint of Crimson's chapters from issue one and two of Exciting Comics.    

Betrayal

In “Betrayal”, while trying to return home the Crimson Scorpion and Corporal Liz Taylor are entangled in an international conspiracy and become the targets of the super assassin known as Agent Chambers.  This is a reprint from Exciting Comics #3 and #4.

The Cat and the Bug

The third story, “The Cat and the Bug” pits the Crimson Scorpion against a re-imagined public domain hero; the Catman.  These are reprinted from issues five and six of Exciting Comics.

Original Sketch by Salvatore Cuffari

Current Project Status

Everything is actually done; colors, letters, everything.  All we have to do is raise enough to handle printing and shipping for the trade.  For those who are backing tiers with copies of Exciting Comics, we are also waiting on issues five and six to ship to Diamond before we can fulfill those tiers.

Lettered pages from Chapter One of the Scorpion's Sting:

Lettered pages from Chapter Two of the Scorpion's Sting:

A lettered page from Chapter Three of Betrayal:

story:
In the continuing saga of The Oswald Chronicles, Oswald finds himself trapped in a war between Kobolds and Orks, while discovering he is able to manipulate magical gems. An ability that only the Queen of the Orks has ever been able to do.

Each book will be limited to 500 copies and will be signed and numbered.

For the first time we will be offering virgin covers to this series. What that means is that the covers will be printed without any logos of text on them, so the art will not be obscured.

Original covers by Jade Gonzalez

Alternative cover by: Donny Hadiwidjaja with colors by Carlos Alberto Moreno

Original Virgin covers by Jade Gonzalez

Alternative Virgin covers by: Donny Hadiwidjaja with colors by Carlos Alberto Moreno

story:
Get ready for the next installment of Richard Boom's instant crowdsourcing success, "SISTERHOOD"!

Love, betrayal, Mummies and Monsters and epic battles - all in ONE PACKAGED intense issues. No nudity, No gore... just loads of fun, amazing art and a story spanning the centuries!

32-page Full Color ONESHOTS, folks!

INTENTION: SISTERHOOD is a series of one-shot, stand-alone stories. Each  comic book will feature different artists, to ensure not only a high quality but also creating a platform for outstanding artists. 

ISSUE ONE: the origin issue in which we see the rising of the Sisterhood, the introduction of the Khepri god/computer and a new adventure in which the Sisterhood's leader Rand is discovering he is not the only one residing in his own head!

ISSUE TWO: 28 story-pages in a 32-page book, 90 (or 115) grams paper stock! TWO stories, FOUR writers, TWO artists and ONE madman trying to make it into ONE comic!

Synopsis Main Story: Upon returning to his mansion, high-priest Dymonos makes a heart-wrenching discovery that not only lets him question his loyalty towards his master, the mighty god Khepri, but also sets him on a path of righteous revenge and destruction. Then again - sometimes, not all is at it seems. Brace yourselves for love, heartbreak, daddy-issues and all-out mayhem as we dive deeply into the Sisterhood's ancient past and learn how Dymonos became the man/spirit he is today in a yarn we like to call "The Fall of Dymonos: Whom Gods Destroy"!

Synopsis Backup Story: Talah is hunting a human trafficker and taking a stance, like only Talah can. 

#1 Regular by Paulo Yonami Teles and the wraparound variant by Eric Basaldua and the cosplay variant by Lucid Belle.

#2 Regular by Markus von Renthe-Fink and the variant by Greg Capullo and the variant PENCIL version by Greg Capullo.

All these comics can be purchased in both PDF and Physical format, via Add-ons if you want even.

Aside from above covers to #1 and #2, you can also  get sets of prints and sets of trading cards added. If you want only ONE print or tradingcard, just add 10 for a print and 1 for a tradingcard and PM me!

PRINTS: from L to R > Cosplay, Eric Basaldua, Rich Ard, Kevin Enhart, Vinz el Tabanas, Greg Capullo, Marlon Teunissen.

TRADING CARDS: from L to R > Cosplay, Eric Basaldua, Greg Capullo, Budd Root, Juan Jose Ryp, Yonami Teles, Vinz el Tabanas, and the back cover Cosplay.

RICHARD BOOM: Project Leader/Creator

Richard Boom  started out in the comic industry as your regular fanboy, just reading  comics and enjoying it even more due to the internet and making contact  with creators. As his contact list grew, so did his interest in the  complete field of comic. Starting up a Bad Grrl Comics Fan club in 2001  was the first step to go further then his own living room. Soon  thereafter he began setting up websites for Arthur Suydam, Eric  Basaldua, Broadsword Comics and focussing on titles like Vampirella,  Cavewoman, Hack/Slash and more... He even started working with the FACTS comicon organization where he also met the founder of Broken Frontier and  shortly thereafter began doing headlines for this news site. Later he  founded the website COMICSFORSINNERS which more resembles his prior BadGrrl fanclub. Nowadays Richard  dabbles in Art Agency, sending out comic Press Releases and since 2019 publishing various comic books.

Markus von Renthe-Fink: Story Editor / Interior artist #2 penciller

Markus has loved comics and creating art since childhood. His road to creating comic books, though, took several detours. After graduation he had to admit to himself that it would be next to impossible to make a living by drawing comics in Germany, and relocating to the US wasn't really an option, even though at this point his drawing abilities were quite good. So he spent the next 20 years in the dreary profession of a graphics deisgner. It took a pep talk from fan-favorite artist Greg Capullo during a book signing in Frankfurt to get Markus back on track; after being told that in the meantime, the "bullpens" at the publishers had ceased to exist: all you needed nowadays to break into comics were talent, a scanner and an internet connection. With newfound enthusiasm, determined to take the comic book world by storm (or, failing that, a gentle breeze), Markus set out to find a partner-in-crime - enter Richard Boom, who was happy to take Markus aboard. Initially (and rather inadvertently) he took on the role of story editor, trying to bring some sort of order and continuity to she sprawling wealth of material that represented the "Sisterhood" universe. Hungry to get his teeth into the actual creation of art, he took the script for a 10-page story apart at the seams (with the blessing of original author Viktor Kruithof) and hammered it into a full-length comic book story. These pages will see print as Sisterhood #2 sometime in the spring of 2020, and, as life sometimes comes full-circle, will feature a variant cover by none other than Greg Capullo.

Renee Rienties: Interior artist #2 penciller

Renee Rienties is an independent comic artist from the Netherlands.                She made her start in the world of comics in 2016 with her smallpress book “My Daily Life Comics” which was received well by her readers online and at comic conventions.                In 2017 her art took a dark turn, from funny cute gag comics to creepy bloody horror. Here she worked on a story in “Oyasumi” A manga collaboration she started with two fellow artists. Where she drew her comic “Distortia”  Her creepy art will leave a chilling impression for you to remember.                In 2018 she worked on a chilling short story in the “Hollandsch Manga” anthology series made by various Dutch artists.                If mystery, thriller and horror are your thing, then you have something to look forward to. Right now Renee is working on a new chilling book that will come out end of 2019.               

Diego Magno Loiola: Interior artist #1 penciller

Diego loved comics and drew since childhood. He grew up, became a collector, continued drawing, graduated in fine arts, did fanzines, illustrations, fanarts and countless stories; some that never came to light and others that became RPG among friends. Then came Sisterhood, not only the first real job opportunity, but how to give life to someone else's ideas, a bulky, imaginative and rewarding job. Diego continues to draw and collect comics!

story:
Welcome to
Chateau Obsidian #3! 

 

I am proud to announce the third campaign in the epic science fiction comic series Chateau Obsidian.  Since January 2019, I have crowdfunded over £2,300 ($3,155 USD), successfully creating and fulfilling issues 1 and 2. Now that I’m 2 issues in and all backers have received copies of issues 1 & 2, work on issue 3 is now in full swing. With fans eager for the continuation, it’s that time of year again that Chateau Obsidian is fully open for business to backers old and new!

Character print ‘The Green Goddesses’ of new characters from Chateau Obsidian #3

Chateau Obsidian #2 cover A:


Chateau Obsidian #3 Cover B variant:



Page 1 of Chateau Obsidian #3:

The Story:

The following is a selection of finished pages from Chateau Obsidian #2 (mild spoilers ahead).


In the far future, aboard the Cruise Starship Mayflower, ship holographer Jack’s search for missing data takes an unexpected turn when he finds himself under arrest - as his girlfriend Sarah looks on from her job in ship security.

In the ship’s vineyard, a strange experiment is going on, and tourist Barry notices something odd about the grapes:




In some of the last pages from Chateau Obsidian #2, where on the same ship, centuries later, Captain Featherstone and first mate Bot:re19 come across numerous obstacles and hit upon a major discovery in their search for the mythical Green Man, who is their last hope in stopping the ship’s collision course with Earth.

The first completed artwork for Chateau Obsidian #3, before a chase to find Jack at the centre of the spherical city inside the Mayflower:

An image of Jack and Sarah meeting in Chateau Obsidian #3 (previously included as an exclusive print to backers of Chateau Obsidian #2 who signed up early):


 

Funding:

My target is £1,500 (approximately $2,052 USD) - more than enough to print and ship and to allow myself the time and space to write, pencil, ink, colour and letter Chateau Obsidian #3 and (circumstances permitting) attend a couple of local conventions later in the year. This time I am also keen to involve other cover artists if funding allows.

Perks:

For those of you who missed out on Chateau Obsidian #1 & 2, you can choose the awesome Catcher-Upper perk and get physical copies of all issues so far for just £13 ($17.85 USD). If there are any gaps in your collection, back issue add-ons are available on all perks for £4 ($5.49 USD) each. A digital bundle including the first two issues is included with each perk so there’s no reason to miss out on the story so far.

As with all issues so far, you can have your likeness included into the story in issue #3 either as a one-off appearance, for which there is no limit, or you could be introduced as a recurring character to also appear in later issues - including assisting main characters Jack and Sarah in the finale as they fall foul of the conspiracy aboard the starship Mayflower! Be quick as this is strictly limited to one only!

You could have a role to play in this scene from Chateau Obsidian #6!

A double splash page from the series finale in Chateau Obsidian #6 - recurring characters likenesses featured in this scene were snapped up in the issue #1 campaign:

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out if you like what you see.

Smash those Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What's This?

Digital Lizards of Doom is a love letter to pop-culture featuring wild new characters like Commander E.K.O, Dizzy Doom, and Dana Deathly! Follow along on an adventure pulling from action movies, Japanese story telling, video games and more. Oh, and there's a cyborg pirate cat!

This campaign is for a complete 140-page graphic novel created and written by Gabriel Valentin featuring art by Ernie Najera.

Welcome to The Digital Lizards Of Doom!

“In a world where science and sorcery have brought peace to the galaxy, a young warrior’s belief system is shattered when an evil robot and an ancient witch attack his kingdom, forcing him into a quest for justice. As revelations about his world are exposed, Dizzy’s faith is shaken, and he must now make an unlikely alliance with a mysterious ninja and a cyborg cat pirate. Together they'll search for a fabled weapon that could destroy evil forever and bring the universe into an unending era of peace!"

 

Why are we here?

We want to launch Digital Lizards Of Doom with style! Whether you've been a fan for years or you're just finding out about the book now, this campaign is the place to come to to get excited and to ask your questions!

 

Digital Lizards of Doom represents a brand new way of story-telling within the graphic novel medium, as the story is told with a combination of full-page artwork and a new dialogue system that pushes the boundaries of the format.  

 

 

Stay tuned for updates, stretch goals, and maybe even some live streams!

Have something you want to see? Let us know in the comments section. 

 

SEE WHO ELSE LOVES DLOD!

 

San Diego Comic Con co-founder Mike Towry has agreed to write the introduction for Digital Lizards Of Doom and artist Mark Irwin (Batman, X-Men, Green Lantern) has illustrated a special INDIEGOGO exclusive cover just for this campaign!

"This book is a great pop-culture meld, a fun mix of comics, video games, tabletop games, adventure cartoons, and more, that all combine to make something very new yet also familiar. Gabriel’s approach to visual storytelling is quirky, and idiosyncratic and unique: at least it’s new and fresh to me, and incredibly well done." - Mike Towry

INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE COVER BY MARK IRWIN (BATMAN, X-MEN, GREEN LANTERN)

 

What comes next?

We've got stretch goals, livestreams, and a whole month worth of surprises planned! Keep checking in and make sure to spread the word!

If you're telling friends about DLOD, make sure to tag @clover_press and @DLODWorld

 

Meet The Team

GABE VALENTIN

Gabriel Valentin, the writer of Digital Lizards of Doom, possesses long standing passions for composition and storytelling. When it comes to pop culture, he describes himself as a “hopeless romantic”, a rose petals on the bed, champagne in the ice bucket, and a little mood lighting before stocking up on potions and heading into the next dungeon kind of guy.

ERNIE NAJERA

Influenced by the graphic novel styling of the 90's and classic animation, Earnie Najera has had his artwork in comic book anthologies like Action Hospital, Kaiju and tribute comics like Jack Kirby Birthday Tribute #96. He serves as the primary artist for the gang's adventure.

MARGO PRODAN

Margo Prodan is a master of color and texture, and applies these skills to articulate the emotes for each of our unique characters. She is a lover of everything Mermaids, Final Fantasy, Legend of Zelda and Cyberpunk.

CHANCE

To make sure this adventure comes to life in a way no-one has ever experienced in a graphic novel before, Chance Boren draws on his experiences from working on Transformers: Infiltration, 30 Days of Night and Metal Gear Solid: The Comic Series and lends his skills as a producer to Digital Lizards of Doom. 

CHRISTINA-MARIE MCBREARTY

Real-life Disney Princess and fearless pop-culture fandom warrior, Christina-Marie McBrearty, serves as the Executive Producer of Digital Lizards of Doom. She has worked in both the music and fashion industry and has been involved with major events for Star Wars, Marvel Studios, Seventeen Magazine,  Vans Warped Tour and the Grammy’s. 

SPECIAL GUEST ARTIST 

MARK IRWIN

Mark is an accomplished artist who has worked on Batman, X-men, Green Lantern, Spider-Man, and more.

Clover Press is a progressive, eclectic, boutique publisher made up of four industry veterans. Our goal is to work on projects we have a strong passion for.

 

Risks and challenges

Clover Press is made up by a team of publishing professionals. While delays are always possible and sometimes impossible to control, the members of Clover are committed to delivering the best quality products in as timely a manner as possible.
story_txt: What's This?Digital Lizards of Doom is a love letter to pop-culture featuring wild new characters like Commander E.K.O, Dizzy Doom, and Dana Deathly! Follow along on an adventure pulling from action movies, Japanese story telling, video games and more. Oh, and there's a cyborg pirate cat!This campaign is for a complete 140-page graphic novel created and written by Gabriel Valentin featuring art by Ernie Najera.Welcome to The Digital Lizards Of Doom!“In a world where science and sorcery have brought peace to the galaxy, a young warrior’s belief system is shattered when an evil robot and an ancient witch attack his kingdom, forcing him into a quest for justice. As revelations about his world are exposed, Dizzy’s faith is shaken, and he must now make an unlikely alliance with a mysterious ninja and a cyborg cat pirate. Together they'll search for a fabled weapon that could destroy evil forever and bring the universe into an unending era of peace!" Why are we here?We want to launch Digital Lizards Of Doom with style! Whether you've been a fan for years or you're just finding out about the book now, this campaign is the place to come to to get excited and to ask your questions! Digital Lizards of Doom represents a brand new way of story-telling within the graphic novel medium, as the story is told with a combination of full-page artwork and a new dialogue system that pushes the boundaries of the format.    Stay tuned for updates, stretch goals, and maybe even some live streams!Have something you want to see? Let us know in the comments section.  SEE WHO ELSE LOVES DLOD! San Diego Comic Con co-founder Mike Towry has agreed to write the introduction for Digital Lizards Of Doom and artist Mark Irwin (Batman, X-Men, Green Lantern) has illustrated a special INDIEGOGO exclusive cover just for this campaign!"This book is a great pop-culture meld, a fun mix of comics, video games, tabletop games, adventure cartoons, and more, that all combine to make something very new yet also familiar. Gabriel’s approach to visual storytelling is quirky, and idiosyncratic and unique: at least it’s new and fresh to me, and incredibly well done." - Mike TowryINDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE COVER BY MARK IRWIN (BATMAN, X-MEN, GREEN LANTERN) What comes next?We've got stretch goals, livestreams, and a whole month worth of surprises planned! story:
Reserve your exclusive print copy now!

 

 

 


 “Sister” Issue #0 is a teaser comic that introduces our hero Kim Tran: a devoted Catholic sister by day, ass kicking vigilante at night.

Sister Kim prowls the crime ridden streets of NYC circa 1990s, on a personal vendetta: to hunt down the serial killer known as The Seducer, who brutally murdered her older sister.

"Sister" will be a 4-issue limited series.
Issue #1 is currently in the writing / pre-production phase. 

 

 

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

None! We hit our funding goal already and the comic book will be printed as planned. We expect to ship everything out in February!
 

Thank you so much for your support!
We’ll see you in the world of Sister.

Rise up!
Ryze Comics

story:
After burying her only daughter, a deadly intergalactic bounty hunter discovers her next job will jeopardize the only thing She has left... her secrets. 

SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known is a brutal, action-packed sci-fi graphic novella from award-winning writer Ryan K Lindsay (Eternal, Chum) and illustrator Chris Panda.

SHE is Available Now! The Most Beautiful Hardcover Ever!

 

Who Will Love SHE?

  • Fans of action packed, high-concept sci-fi like EAST OF WEST, BLACK SCIENCE and SAGA.
  • Collectors of glorious, original, and sexy-as-hell hardcover graphic novels.
  • Process junkies who will love taking a deep dive into the creative process with Lindsay & Panda's delicious back-matter.

What Exactly Do You Get When You Travel to the Tower of All That is Known in This Campaign?

SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known is a 64-page OVER-SIZED FORMAT hardcover graphic novella, featuring a special DIE-CUT translucent helmet cover, sure to be unlike anything you've seen in the galaxy.

All backers will receive bonus content, including an original SHE theme song by George O'Connor, digital deluxe process pieces taking you deep into the SHE universe.

 

  • Higher pledge levels will have access to campaign exclusive collectibles and merchandise, included enamel pins, custom toys and much more!
  • And for serious fans of the standard single-issue comic format, we'll be making a special limited edition variant of SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known available. This will be a 48-page, staple-bound comic with a metallic foil cover by Chris Panda, with a special homage to the classic THE UNCANNY X-MEN #141 "Days of Future Past" cover by John Byrne.

 

Want a Peek? Take a Look at These Stunning Pages Inside the Book... 

Want to See More Before You Ascend the Tower?

If you'd like to read even more of SHE: At the Tower of All That is Known before you back this campaign, we invite you to download this extended ashcan preview.

 ? CLICK HERE TO ACCESS THE EXTENDED ASHCAN PREVIEW ?

Here's What the Industry is Saying About SHE...

 

Ryan K Lindsay writes comics.

He has partnered with artist Eric Zawadzki to produce: ETERNAL through Black Mask Studios, and HEADSPACE, with Sebastian Piriz, through Monkeybrain Comics/IDW.

He has partnered with artist Sami Kivela to produce: BEAUTIFUL CANVAS through Black Mask Studios, DEER EDITOR through his own ‘Four Colour Ray Gun’ imprint and a handful of self-published successes,  and CHUM through ComixTribe.

He was selected as a participant in the DC Writing Workshop group of 2016.

His other comics include: Aurealis and Ledger Award winning NEGATIVE SPACE with Owen Gieni through Dark Horse Comics,  GLOVES with Tommy Lee Edwards in the Vertigo CMYK anthology, as well as EIR with Alfie Gallagher, INK ISLAND with Craig Bruyn, and STAIN THE SEAS SCARLET with Alex Cormack for ‘Four Colour Ray Gun.’

He’s written/edited analytical texts, including THE DEVIL IS IN THE DETAILS: EXAMINING MATT MURDOCK AND DAREDEVIL through Sequart, and has had essays published in Criminal, Godzilla, Sheltered, Strange Nation, and Crime Factory.

He is Australian and when not being a family man he hones his writing skills by sacrificing blood wombats to the outback spider fight clubs.

Chris Panda is a French illustrator and comic artist living in Berlin.

He's been working as an illustrator since 6 years and decided to move to the comic book world 4 years ago.

He mainly have worked as an interior and cover artist with american publisher IDW on title like MICRONAUTS, ROM, STAR TREK vs. TRANSFORMERS and TRANSFORMERS/GHOSTBUSTERS. And also self-published his own comic book WONDERLAND RESISTANCE.

If you’ve been following Ryan K Lindsay’s career over the past decade, you know that he likes to dig into the emotional core of big genre stories and is passionate about making creator owned comics.

You also probably know Ryan has a keen eye for talent, and in Chris Panda has found the perfect partner to bring this action packed sci-fi, intergalactic espionage tale that doesn’t shy away from big ideas & emotions to life.

You also probably know Ryan has a keen eye for talent, and in Chris Panda has found the perfect partner to bring this action packed sci-fi, intergalactic espionage tale that doesn’t shy away from big ideas & emotions to life.

Here at ComixTribe, we’ve built a reputation for producing some of the slickest hardcovers in the world of comics… but we’re not content to rest on our laurels.

And that’s why we decided to partner with Sam Amborn at Printlore to do something truly special with this cover.

First, we decided Chris' big visuals needed more room, which is why this book is large format (7.75” x 11.25”) which is 30% bigger than your standard comic book!

Watch This to See How That Awesome Die-Cut Translucent Cover Works:

 

We wanted to replicate the appeal of the visually stunning mask SHE wears by creating a special Die-Cut, transparent, layered image that will turn heads all across the galaxy.

Our goal was to create a stunning, original graphic novella package that’s beautiful inside and out... and we did it! 

Here's How Some of the First 300+ Comic Fans Who Received Their Copies of the SHE: At the Tower of All That Is Known Hardcover Reacted:

 

Ready to Get YOUR COPY? 

 

HERE ARE THE THE AVAILABLE PERKS...

 

HOW YOU CAN MAKE AN IMPACT BY SUPPORTING THIS LAUNCH!

Creator owned comics live and die on the support of readers like you.

With the direct market disrupted and most major conventions worldwide canceled, we remain undaunted in our mission to get copies of the glorious SHE: At the Tower of All That Is Known hardcover into as many hungry comic fans hands as possible. 

And that's why we're expanding our reach to the thousands of comic fans here on Indiegogo! 

This Indiegogo launch will let us reach sci-fi comic fans around the globe and help us continue to create beautiful comics and graphic novels unlike anything you’ve seen before.

 

Here's How We've Squashed the Risks For Backing! 

While this is our first project released on Indiegogo, over the past eight years, ComixTribe has successfully crowdfunded 20 projects and fulfilled over 6,000 pledges to backers like you! 

This project is 100% complete, the product is in stock,  and books are ready to ship immediately... there's no waiting for years or even months... your books will get to you as fast as the post office can deliver them! 

Here's How We Protect Your Rewards in Transit So Books Arrive in Great Condition for Collectors:

It's so not cool when you back an awesome campaign only to have your books damaged upon arrival, right?

To prevent that, we package our books with collectors in mind, and use Gemini Comic Mailers to protect and secure your books during transit. 

And our Collector's Boxes will be BUBBLE WRAPPED before being inserted into a second shipping box, so that it arrives in great condition.

There is nothing we love more than getting a superior comic book product into the hands of incredible fans of creator owned comics. 

We appreciate this opportunity to reach hundreds of more fans here on Indiegogo. Please know that the entire creative team has been working on this for over a year, and we’re dedicated to ensuring all backers receive more than just a story, but an experience with SHE.

And if you love her as much as we do, there will be more SHE stories in the future.

So if you’re a fan of action packed sci-fi, intergalactic espionage, and big ideas & emotions in your comics,  then scroll back up our Indiegogo page, find the pledge level perfect for you and join us for the wild ride.

And after you back, please take the time to share the link somewhere you use your voice for good.

Tell the people you know that #SheIsHereOnIGG and they need to get on board!

story:
I believe this moment we're living in is the greatest time in the history of storytelling.

Vampire Mob is an idea I tripped over while working as a private investigator in 2009 and it changed my life. 

My name is Joe Wilson and being able to tell a story directly to you, the audience, all over the world, is a dream come true. Thank YOU!

Thanks to the audience, Vampire Mob was made into a live-action series and, after the loss of cast member, Marcia Wallace in 2013, VMob returned as a graphic novel with Issue 1 in 2014.  Again, thanks to the audience. 

                           >> DOWNLOAD VAMPIRE MOB ISSUE 1, FREE, HERE. <<

           Marcia Wallace and me on the set of Vampire Mob, season two!

With your help, this story can continue with an even longer graphic novel in Issue 2!

And it's a story you can be in.

No, really.

Characters in Vampire Mob will be drawn from your pictures and those characters return in future issues with your face! 

I wrote a giant script for season 3 of the live-action series, which is longer than a feature film and, with your help, I will adapt that script into Issue 2 as part of a long series of graphic novels (like, 9 issues). 

Also included in Issue 2 is Vampire Mob - ORIGIN, a ten-page mini-comic that tells the story of Don becoming a vampire! 

       

                                                                 Cool Mug! 

    PLEASE NOTE: VAMPIRE MOB is littered with F-Bombs meant for adults. 

                  Above is the trailer for Vampire Mob Issue 1, Art by JM Ringuet.

Issue 2 picks up the story from Issue 1 and will be 46 black and white pages, possibly 50-58 pages, if we can hit the stretch goals. 

If you believe the future of storytelling is here, no gatekeepers, no publishers, no agents, just people telling people a story, join the Supporting Mob and help this story become something you can hold in your hands. 

Choose a perk to the right, make a contribution and you will get to see a graphic novel happen, spoiler-free!  And maybe you will also be DRAWN IN ISSUE 2!

Artist, June Grigioni-Kileen, will be drawing mom's and mother-in-laws toasting blood with Virginia in the guest artist section of the book! 

                

             Pencil sketch by June Grigioni-Kileen of the mom's blood toasting!


The Vampire Mob Issue 1 Cover Art Poster (art by JM Ringuet) comes wrapped in CRIME SCENE TAPE! 

            

Vampire Mob EARRINGS made by VMobber Donna Joyce! I only have a couple pairs! 


The budget raised will help cover:

  • Creation of the artwork, lettering & graphic designs for Issue 2.
  • Print your copies of Issue 1.
  • Print your copies of Issue 2.
  • Print your cool T-shirts. 
  • Worldwide shipping of Issue 1 and Issue 2, posters, T-shirts.
  • IndieGoGo, PayPal and credit card fees. 

     

  • Kim Goodman contributed to be drawn by June Kileen Grigioni, this was her reaction to recieving the drawing...

                                 Maybe we can make an *even* longer story!

                       

                   Supporting Mobsters, Tara Lee (above) and Gilbert Gilvas(below)                                               wearing their 'We are all famous to a few people" shirts!

                Vampire Mob Issue 2 

                 will be created by...

VAMPIRE MOB ISSUE 2 ARTIST TO BE ANNOUNCED, SOON! 




Deron Bennett - Letterer & Graphic Designer

Deron is the creator of "Quixote" and was nominated for an Eisner Award for his work on Billy Fog, Jim Henson’s Dark Crystal, Jim Henson’s Tale of Sand, Mr. Murder Is Dead (Archaia); Helldorado, Puss N Boots, and Richie Rich (APE Entertainment). See Deron's work http://andworlddesign.com.

Corey Blake - Creative Consultant 

Corey Blake guided Vampire Mob Issue 1 as the creative consultant and returns to help Issue 2 by giving notes on the script and the creation of the book itself. Corey writes about the comic book industry and art form for Robot 6 @ Comic Book Resources - http://robot6.comicbookresources.com/author/coreyblake/. He is also an improviser, actor and writer. 

Joe Wilson - Storyteller (writer, director, photographer)

Joe Wilson tell stories, usually with swearing. He created the original series "Vampire Mob," which continues as a graphic novel (http://www.VampireMob.com), and "PlayShorts," an ongoing anthology series (http://www.PlayShorts.com).  He posts way too many pictures of his cat, Mike, on the internet. 

See?

Choose a perk to the right, make a contribution and you will get to see a graphic novel happen, spoiler-free!  And maybe you will also be DRAWN IN ISSUE 2!

Artist, June Grigioni-Kileen, will be drawing mom's and mother-in-laws toasting blood with Virginia in the guest artist section of the book! 

                
             Pencil sketch by June Grigioni-Kileen of the mom's blood toasting!




The Vampire Mob Issue 1 Cover Art Poster (art by JM Ringuet) comes wrapped in CRIME SCENE TAPE! 


            


Vampire Mob EARRINGS made by VMobber Donna Joyce! I only have a couple pairs! 




The budget raised will help cover:

Creation of the artwork, lettering & graphic designs for Issue 2.
Print your copies of Issue 1.
Print your copies of Issue 2.
Print your cool T-shirts. 
Worldwide shipping of Issue 1 and Issue 2, posters, T-shirts.
IndieGoGo, PayPal and credit card fees.  

Kim Goodman contributed to be drawn by June Kileen Grigioni, this was her reaction to recieving the drawing...






                                 Maybe we can make an *even* longer story!

                       
                   Supporting Mobsters, Tara Lee (above) and Gilbert Gilvas(below)                                               wearing their 'We are all famous to a few people" shirts!





                Vampire Mob Issue 2 
                 will be created by...


VAMPIRE MOB ISSUE 2 ARTIST TO BE ANNOUNCED, SOON! 





Deron Bennett - Letterer & Graphic Designer

Deron is the creator of "Quixote" and was nominated for an Eisner Award for his work on Billy Fog, Jim Henson’s Dark Crystal, Jim Henson’s Tale of Sand, Mr. Murder Is Dead (Archaia); Helldorado, Puss N Boots, and Richie Rich (APE Entertainment). See Deron's work http://andworlddesign.com.

Corey Blake - Creative Consultant 
Corey Blake guided Vampire Mob Issue 1 as the creative consultant and returns to help Issue 2 by giving notes on the script and the creation of the book itself. Corey writes about the comic book industry and art form for Robot 6 @ Comic Book Resources - http://robot6.comicbookresources.com/author/coreyblake/. He is also an improviser, actor and writer. 


Joe Wilson - Storyteller (writer, director, photographer)
Joe Wilson tell stories, usually with swearing. He created the original series "Vampire Mob," which continues as a graphic novel (http://www.VampireMob.com), and "PlayShorts," an ongoing anthology series (http://www.PlayShorts.com).  He posts way too many pictures of his cat, Mike, on the internet. 


See?

story:
The Basics:

 

  • My name is Nick Spender and I am a freelance Illustrator who has been working in the Publishing and Advertising Industries for over 30 years. I have worked on Book covers, Ad Campaigns, Posters, Magazine articles, Children's books and numerous non-fiction Historical Graphic Novels. Three years ago I published an Ebook (for Amazon Kindle) about Operation Chastise, from the first unique concepts by Barnes Wallis to the subsequent raids on the dams in 1943. This Ebook has garnered very good reviews and now I want to expand the story to create a viable 'property' that will have a real chance of being printed as a physical book, something many people have asked for. 
  • This campaign is to help me raise enough funds to allow me to work full-time on researching, writing and creating more pages of comic strip and other information pages. Also, if I achieve my funding goal it will allow me to secure the services (paid) of the Official Historian of 617 Squadron Association, Dr. Robert Owen,  and commission Graham Bleathman, a very accomplished 'cutaway' Illustrator, to provide other complementary artwork.
  • Your contributions (no matter how modest!) will help me create a book , using classic comic strip 1950s/60s techniques and painstaking research,  making a true and accurate portrayal of one of the most famous 'special' Squadrons of World War Two, which  should appeal to all generations.

 

What I'm aiming for and what you get for your money:

 

  • I'm trying to get at least £4000 to allow me to work full-time on the project, which I calculate will take 3/4 months to complete. That doesn't sound a lot for that amount of time, but luckily my overheads are relatively small, and I certainly expect to contribute more personally.
  • The funding idea I have may well be as unique (at least for Indiegogo) as the Bouncing Bomb -  first of all I'm looking for 'Page Sponsors' - people who will sponsor a new page of strip artwork, and in return will become the owner/s of the original art, along with a colour print of the completed, coloured and lettered page, mounted and framed. I've done this before for a Dan Dare strip for 'Spaceship Away' (a UK-based fan magazine) and it proved quite successful. I've priced these new pieces of work at  £180 per page, intending to create at least 22 new pages of strip art and adding more design-based pages myself. I also have for sale the original 17 pages of art, which I've posted details of on a FaceBook page -https://www.facebook.com/NickSpenderDamBusters/... you have a few minutes please take a look - I will be post in updates on this page - also you will find details of how I created my pages of art so far.
  • If I don't reach my funding goal, I will, hopefully, depending on Indiegogo's terms and conditions, be able to return the money! If not, I will be sending out prints of existing arts and copies of the existing ebook - and also donating the money to the RAF Association.

The (hoped for) Impact:

 

  • I think that this, and many other stories of scientific breakthroughs and personal courage and heroism, are important to pass on to subsequent generations. When I grew up (with a father who served in the RAF during the War)  these events weren't so far away, but as decade follows decade, for new generations they might as well be in The Dark Ages. By using the medium of Comic Strip I hope to be able to remind them of the incredible sacrifices (and cost to all sides) that this war meant. Also, I'm after telling a damn good yarn to the best of my abilities!
  • If you're in any doubt as to my abilities/track record, please check me out on Amazon Books (Nick Spender), or do a simple picture search on Google (or similar)
  • This is a project that I believe can really contribute, physically as a printed book, to our understanding of what was, for many generations, a pivotal moment in 20th Century History.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • No matter if you can't afford to contribute ( I've been in the same position myself!) please just share and spread the word. There's just so much I can do using Social Media ( I'm old  - I'm sure I've missed out another platform of communication...)
  • If you're already somebody who visits Indiegogo please use their share tools (whatever that means - did I mention I was old? Well - at least in my mid-50s...)

And that's all there is to it.

Also, I'm after telling a damn good yarn to the best of my abilities!
If you're in any doubt as to my abilities/track record, please check me out on Amazon Books (Nick Spender), or do a simple picture search on Google (or similar)
This is a project that I believe can really contribute, physically as a printed book, to our understanding of what was, for many generations, a pivotal moment in 20th Century History.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
 

No matter if you can't afford to contribute ( I've been in the same position myself!) please just share and spread the word. There's just so much I can do using Social Media ( I'm old  - I'm sure I've missed out another platform of communication...)
