And that's all there is to it.

story:
NEW ISSUE FUNDING HERE - https://igg.me/at/SOS3/x/416911

NEW ISSUE FUNDING HERE - https://igg.me/at/SOS3/x/416911

NEW ISSUE FUNDING HERE - https://igg.me/at/SOS3/x/416911

 

Save Our Souls is a stunning new magazine featuring written articles by brilliant writers and journalists alongside some of the best short comics and illustration you can find.

So if you want to see gobsmacking visuals and thought-provoking belly laughs then we'd love you to help us launch this groundbreaking publication.

  • We hand-pick and invite our writers and creators to make sure this will be like nothing produced in the UK before.
  • Includes articles on wide ranging topics and experiences by some of the best writers currently being published in major newspapers, magazines and websites.

 

 
  • We want to change the way people see the relationship between comics and writing. So even if you aren't much of a comic reader, this mag is the best way to give it a go!
  • A magazine in the truest sense: a range of interesting, informative and addictive content which looks stunning. See just some of the comic contributors so far...

 

 

 
  • We want Save Our Souls for be something you are proud to own.
  • The mag will be in 16cm x 24cm format, full colour, perfect bound with high quality printing.
  • Save Our Souls is edited by David Ziggy Greene. Best known for his years of illustrated journalism, he has also created work for BBC, Time Out London and numerous publications and created multiple graphic novels. His work can be found at samu.co.uk

 

  • We need to raise £3000 to pay for great printing and more importantly it helps to pay the contributors for their amazing time and work.
  • We want to buck the trend of expecting creatives to work for free. This is important to us. Please help us do this.
  • We've kept perks simple but brilliant to make it as easy as possible to get your mitts on our thrilling magazine and every contribution is hugely appreciated. Thank you.

 

 

 

 

  • It's also a great help to spread the word for us. Please stick this link wherever you go - http://igg.me/at/sosmag

story:
Hey Everyone!

Welcome to my Indiegogo page! It's time for me to get our pal Super Geek on real paper in a real comic book!
I'm Jim Sprandel and I've been working on this character and his adventures for a reallllllly long time now.  We are going to launch this thing the right way and get him into as many hands as possible! That's where you come in!
I am asking for your help to make this lifelong dream of mine possible.  What's more exciting than that?


What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for what seems like a large amount of money for a comic book! Well, this just isn't any comic!  When I started drawing this years ago, there was a fad called "widescreen comics."  These were published sideways so the artists could convey a more "movie like" image.  I loved the idea. Didn't really think through what would happen when it actually came to publish it.   It's doable but it is more expensive...so there's that.
Going forward though, after this story is done, I'll do it the right way. Promise.
Printing the book will cost $1000 - $2000 depending on how much clean up they have to do at pre-press.  I will update the page as soon as I have an answer.
The rest of the money?  Well, any self publisher of comics will tell you that though the internet and social media are important, there's nothing like actually putting yourself out there at conventions and fan expos and pressing the flesh.  A big chunk will be used for travel and promotional things. I again will update the page as we go with updates from the convention floors! 
These shows, with travel and other expenses are not cheap. Setting up at a single convention can cost up to $300 just for an artist's table.
What if we don't make our goal? Then what?
Well, then we will get the book published,if possible, and fulfil our promises as far as rewards go.  Whatever is left will be used for small conventions or more local avenues of getting the book out there.


Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD! Even if you can't contribute! Social media is our friend. Share links, posts, pictures, whatever you can do to help! We appreciate any seemingly little thing.  It all matters and we are grateful for any help you can give.

story:
STARRING:

Brooke Ashley Anderson, Sarah Chaney, Toni Christopher, Jen Drohan, Kira (Cook) Hesser, Alissa Jessup, Ally Marks, Heather Olt, Beth Robbins, Darcy Shean, Caitlin Thompson & Pisha Warden


“I’d love to see four girls who actually get along in a movie that’s not about chasing some guy or marrying somebody." - Michelle Rodriquez, Interview Magazine

"Oh my god! Me too!" - Alissa Jessup, on her couch

Alissa got off her couch, wrote, directed and stars in "chickadee", a comedic short made entirely by ladies. Determined to produce her project independently, Alissa reached out to 6 With Heels, an LA-based production company that is committed to championing female-driven content.

Alissa says, "It was important to me to make something with an all female cast and crew. What can I say, I'm a sucker for a room full of kick-ass ladies.”  

Alissa Jessup is turning to IndieGogo to raise finishing funds for her comedic short film, chickadee. 

chickadee follows a pathologically unfiltered woman who throws a surprise baby shower for her very pregnant sister, but it seems like all anyone wants to talk about is her recent hysterectomy. 

It’s no secret that women are vastly underrepresented in the film industry. Only 7% of directors on the top grossing movies are women. 

Thank you for supporting women in film. 


ABOUT ALISSA JESSUP

Alissa Jessup is a west coast based writer, director and actor. She was born and raised in Seattle but became a woman in NYC. As an actor, she has performed/developed new plays with Sundance Theatre Lab, 13P, Soho Rep, P.S. 122 and N.T.U.S.A. TV/ film Credits include Casual (hulu), True Blood (HBO), The Mindy Project (FOX), The Mentalist (CBS) and American Sniper. The last few years Alissa has been writing and performing her own work through stand up, sketch and storytelling. She has performed improv comedy at Upright Citizens Brigade NYC & L.A., and The Groundlings. Alissa loves living in Portland with her husband, their dog and two cats.

ABOUT 6 WITH HEELS PRODUCTIONS

Sarah Chaney and Heather Olt started 6 With Heels Productions in 2015 to promote the long overdue expansion of women in media. “Half of our planet's population is comprised of women and it's time the entertainment industry followed suit. At 6WH, our mission is simple: Women will make up at least half of the cast, crew and content of our multimedia productions.” Sarah and Heather each have over twenty years experience as actresses on stage, tv and film and are also award-winning producers and writers. 


What We Need & What You Get


We need an additional $2000 to finish post production costs, enter festivals, and achieve our marketing strategy. Your contribution will help to get this short film seen!  

Each contribution will go to a specific need.  For example, you can cover individual festival submission costs, help to pay for our remaining sound and editing costs, recoup out of pocket expenses, purchase postcards and posters for marketing purposes, and even come on board as a producer.

The Impact


We strongly believe that this all female cast and crew short film will make a huge impact on its viewing audiences.  Every dollar helps to champion the voice of the underrepresented female filmmaker.

Other Ways You Can Help


If you are unable to donate financially, please share this link on your social media pages!

*6 With Heels Productions is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of 6 With Heels Productions] must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
The story so far...

Two years ago I created a graphic novelisation of 617 Squadron's operation to destroy the  German Dams in World War 2, filling in parts of the  incredible story left out of the famous 1950s film and correcting some long-held mis-conceptions that have gone down in history as fact!

Now I would like to be able to expand the story to other Operations, including their involvement in D Day and the sinking of the Pocket Battleship Tirpitz in Norway, also subsequent famous operations. With more pages of comic strip (and extra 'graphic' pages) the whole project becomes much more viable as a 'real' printed book,  something many readers of the ebook have been asking for. Now, with the planned revival of this famous Squadron due in 2017, I am also hoping to bring the story up to date (including the Post-War/Cold War days of the 50s and 60s) to make my book as complete as I can, for all ages to enjoy.

 

The Proposal...

I'm now looking for 'Sponsors' for the new pages to be produced - in essence, that means anybody who pledges a certain amount of money will, firstly, receive the ORIGINAL line art, along with a colour print of the finished, lettered art, framed and signed. Also, the art  that has already been drawn is available, in the same format, to other sponsors who pledge slightly less. With enough financial backing I will be able to do research (including engaging the services of 617 Squadron's Official Historian, Robert Owen) and create new pages. This will also be a group effort - I plan on having a classic cut-away illustration of the new Lightning 2 aircraft that 617 Squadron will be using - and am happy to say that Graham Bleathman, who has done various illustrations for Dan Dare, Gerry Anderson and Haynes Manuals, has agreed to provide art.

 

The Goal...

...is to be able to produce enough pages that can then be either A: sold as a completed project to an established Publisher or B: to independently publish a finished book.

story:
Stop Smat!

Your nightmare incarnate, the first ever hour-long show from Smat (Seattle sketch comedians Sarah McKinley and Matt Olson) will be November 5th and 18th at The Pocket Theater... unless we stop them!

  • We cannot allow such a self-indulgent, crass mockery of comedy to exist.
  • They claim to be "artists", but like anybody they can be bought.
  • You will be on the ground floor of a grass-roots revolution to preserve comedy.

 

Goals

The following checkpoints have been negotiated with Smat.

  • $50 - Smat will provide radishes for you to spitefully throw at them during both shows.
  • $100 - Smat will concede 15 minutes of stage time during each show to respectable performers.
  • $500 - Smat will soak their jeans in water onstage and perform the show in wet jeans.
  • $1,000 - Smat will concede 30 minutes of stage time during each show to respectable performers.
  • $1,500 - ????
  • $2,000 - Smat will concede 45 minutes of stage time during each show to respectable performers.
  • $2,500 - Smat will perform the entirety of each show on their knees.
  • $2,750 - Smat will perform each show 24 hours sleep deprived.
  • $3,000 - Smat will cancel both shows and throw a party in the theater each night instead. Smat will not be allowed to attend either party, only bartend.

Stretch Goals!

 

  • $10,000 - Sarah and Matt do not believe in marriage. They will marry each other on stage, and begin the divorce process immediately.
  • $20,000 - Matt will fly in his parents from San Jose for the wedding. They will not be amused.
  • $35,000 - Sarah and Matt will meet with a priest prior to the ceremony to confirm their love before God.
  • $50,000 - Sarah and Matt will tattoo each other's names on themselves, then tattoo them crossed out.
story_txt:
Stop Smat!
Your nightmare incarnate, the first ever hour-long show from Smat (Seattle sketch comedians Sarah McKinley and Matt Olson) will be November 5th and 18th at The Pocket Theater... unless we stop them!

We cannot allow such a self-indulgent, crass mockery of comedy to exist.
They claim to be "artists", but like anybody they can be bought.
You will be on the ground floor of a grass-roots revolution to preserve comedy.


 
Goals
The following checkpoints have been negotiated with Smat.

$50 - Smat will provide radishes for you to spitefully throw at them during both shows.
$100 - Smat will concede 15 minutes of stage time during each show to respectable performers.
$500 - Smat will soak their jeans in water onstage and perform the show in wet jeans.
$1,000 - Smat will concede 30 minutes of stage time during each show to respectable performers.
$1,500 - ????
$2,000 - Smat will concede 45 minutes of stage time during each show to respectable performers.
$2,500 - Smat will perform the entirety of each show on their knees.
$2,750 - Smat will perform each show 24 hours sleep deprived.
$3,000 - Smat will cancel both shows and throw a party in the theater each night instead. Smat will not be allowed to attend either party, only bartend.


Stretch Goals!
 

$10,000 - Sarah and Matt do not believe in marriage. They will marry each other on stage, and begin the divorce process immediately.
$20,000 - Matt will fly in his parents from San Jose for the wedding. They will not be amused.
$35,000 - Sarah and Matt will meet with a priest prior to the ceremony to confirm their love before God.
$50,000 - Sarah and Matt will tattoo each other's names on themselves, then tattoo them crossed out.

story:
A struggling musician questioning his choices in life is involved in a freak accident that sends him on a path to discover a supernatural existence parallel to his own.

This is Septembryo.

Some might recognize the name Septembryo as the Calgary based electro-rock act who write songs about ghosts, UFOs and other supernatural themes. Being one of the first musical acts to perform at the Calgary Comic & Entertainment Expo in 2012, the inspiration to expand on those themes lead musician Michael 8 to the (super)natural decision to create a Septembryo comic book with artist Roberto Duque. 

Readers will notice the comic differs from others in a few ways. First, the blurring of the lines between both visual and sonic mediums will put the reader in a direct relationship to the music itself. 

 "The inspiration for the stories and the songs both come from the same place" says Michael 8 "so it makes sense that the 2 would be so interconnected." 

"And with so many songs tying themselves directly to events in the story" continues Roberto "It is our plan to make them an actual part of the story by strategically placing QR codes that readers can scan, so they can hear the song that goes with that scene!" 

The combination of sounds and visuals does not end with just music within the comic either, elements of the comic can also currently be seen within the music as well, including album artwork by Roberto Duque and music videos featuring characters from the books which can be seen here: https://www.youtube.com/Septembryo

Even though countless books have been written about the supernatural, in a fashion similar to The X-Files, Septembryo will be drawing much of it's influence from actual case files, eye witness accounts and even personal experience.

"Although ultimately, the comic is a work of fiction" says Michael 8 "I think people would be very surprised to find out just how much of it came from real experiences"

 In an attempt to build a cohesive universe, many hours were spent researching paranormal topics like astral projection, near death experiences, UFO's and more in order to "get the rules right". Rather than borrowing from real life mysteries and reworking them to fit the story, Septembryo actually builds it's core mythology around the mysteries themselves. In this regard, many readers who are already well versed in various paranormal topics will delight in how the comics stay true to the real life theories and histories of it's subjects.

Another way the pair hope their graphic novel stands out is the format in which the continuing story will be told through. 

"I'm a longtime devoted reader of comic books" says Roberto "but at the same time I realize that I am part of a rare breed. We want to make our story accessible to readers and non readers alike."

"It can be pretty intimidating to jump into 50+ years of continuity in comics" continues Michael "Even with all the reboots and relaunches the issues add up fast. Which is why I still stick to graphic novels to this day."

In an attempt to appeal to both comic fans as well as casual readers, Septembryo will be formatted into graphic novels with the basic story complete unto itself. With the first book being an origin story and future books already in the works, it is the duo's plan to have the new reader able to jump in at any point, without reading previous books, and know exactly whats going on. At the same time, devoted readers will be rewarded with an overarching story that will span across multiple volumes. A story that, according to the pair, has an eventual ending in store.

"This isn't something that's meant to go on forever like Superman or Spider-Man." says Roberto "Even with all the volumes of novels and one shots and various ideas we have in mind, there is plan and that plan has an ending."

"But right now we're just at the beginning" says Michael "There's a lot of ideas and potential places for this story to go, but they all depend on this first book. And if we can just get a little bit of help putting it out there and people like what they see, the rest will take care of itself."

Risks & Challenges

It is not a question of if this book will exist but merely when. We have a desired deadline of Mid to Late March to get the book completed and ready for the printer. We want physical copies ready and at our artist alley table in time to debut the book to the general public the week of the Calgary Comic & Entertainment Expo (April 28 - May 1). As we're still working on pages we're either going to print up to a point that makes sense to end off at story-wise, or postpone the print date until its all done. Regardless we want a solid debut for that Expo weekend. Of course with additional responsibilities between the 2 of us including: 2 kids, 4 day jobs, a solo music career and artist commissions (not including working on this book) things can get pretty tricky.

If we get the whole book done by our deadline, we are at the mercy of our printers. A month window is a good amount of time to get everything done but, In the words of John Lennon "life is what happens when you are making other plans". We thank you for your support in this project. Wish us luck!

A month window is a good amount of time to get everything done but, In the words of John Lennon "life is what happens when you are making other plans". We thank you for your support in this project. Wish us luck!

story:
Short Summary

 I am a 27 year old art school graduate, and I along with an amazing team are currently working on an upcoming Manga called "The Boy And The Island". Before I decided to be a fool and pursue my dream of creating a Manga, I worked as the lead 3D animator for 2 years at a mid-level oil company, and before that I worked in their warehouse department for 6-7 years. The oil industry was never my dream career choice, the thing I loved doing the most ever since my high school years to present was creating stories....inside my head. I have had fears and doubts stop me from actually placing my stories onto sheets of paper for years and years, but this time around it's different. Today I have a team of very enthusiastic local artists, cosplayers, bloggers, and family on my side, not to mention the support of my  6 obnoxiously annoying little nephews and one niece.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign is to promote and gather funds for "The Boy And The Island", and the funds will be to pay for the artists, editor, marketers, and of course...lots and lots of paper and art supplies.

The current team working on the story consist of me (the writer ) , a lead artist, two conceptual artists, background artist, and a marketer.. all of us local and willingly working pro bono at the moment.  We have completed the script of episode 1 and our goal after this campaign is to have it drawn and available online for free so the fans can read, as well as starting a Patreon that will offer more bonus features which includes fans interacting with the team.

We have plenty of perks for all donation amounts, so please check the list out and see which one you find more appealing

 

The Impact

The Boy And The Island has a life of it's own, it is no longer quietly waiting in my imagination, it is demanding to be told to the world. Kai (the protagonist) wants to share his tale to all of you and he wants to show you how beautiful and mysterious life can be, no matter what age you are.   

As the Guardian of the Land, Sea and Creatures, Kai  is one with nature. When in full control of his power, nature will respond to his every emotion, but due to his youth and inexperience the power within him has a mind of its own, and the land protects him until he’s ready to take on his role. 

The story will follow 12 year old Kai and his companions as they explore the mysterious island of Circadia.

Risks & Challenges

The team we have is strong and talented, the only real challenge we got is gathering up the funds to pay for the work. 

There is always a risk of failure and a chance that people will find it unoriginal or unappealing, but to not try at all is a failure in itself and the support from many has been so overwhelming that it seems unfair to them to not take the chance.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are short on money...like me, there are plenty of ways to help us out

Simply by sharing this campaign to others, as well as our Facebook Page will be more than enough help

story:
It seems as though it's a very good possibility we will not meet our goal, and while that is unfortunate, please rest assured that this book will go forward no matter what!
All people who have donated and all Patreons will receive a book, 100%. 

The only thing that will change if we do not meet our goal is that we are going to have to find a different printer with lower minimum orders, which isn't great because it means the cost per book will likely be higher than what we have been charging for pre-orders.  If we can reach a minimum of $2500 we will be able to keep our current printer and order the minimum which is 250 books. So please continue to donate and help us get at least to our minimum goal!

Thank you so much to all our current backers and patreons who have made everything we do possible! 

 

10 years ago armed with a new notebook, a backpack and a mobi-cool cooler stocked with bottles of coke Jepi, Gwu and Daddy set off on a trip that would be the start of an adventure of Dino proportions! 

I'm Jayleen, Aka Gwu, or Marker guru. Jepi is my Twin sister and together we call ourselves Gurukitty! That's where GuruKitty studio's has come from. We always do our own projects but we like to promote ourselves together. We are 2 parts of a whole, we tend to fill in the blanks for each other and we act as editors and sounding boards for our projects. We also argue a lot! What a perfect recipe to create a couple of Crazy Cat Ladies!

I went to Vancouver Film school for Classical Animation in 2005 and worked for a few years in the animation industry however my passion was always to tell my own stories and make comics and my interest did not include 3d animation or flash animation and I decided to pursue comics. for the past 11 years we have been selling our comics at various conventions in Canada and this is where we found our community. Lovely fellow artists who also had a passion for telling their stories and being kinda weird.

Hello, Albertosaurus was ambitious from the get go. Doing a full colour comic I knew it would be expensive to print. It received so much  support as a web comic I hope it wont be an issue to meet this goal.

What We Need & What You Get

the goal of $4200 is  to print with all the bells and whistles that I'd like to have.

  • Perfect bound, soft cover
  • 6"x6"
  • roughly 108 pages (more bonus pages if we pass our goal)
  • 14pt cover - matte with Spot gloss
  • French flaps (fold over flaps on the ends of the covers)
  • 105lbs matte internal pages, full colour
  • 500 copies.
  • Our quote for that is $3700.00
  • Indiegogo takes 5% + $25 for canadian as fees (Roughly $200 of $4000 that we need) so I've had to calculate that in.
  • The remaining $300 we would like to use to get extra comics, cover any incidental additional costs (change of exchange rate from now to printing being a bit of a concern) and a bit of an advertising budget. Another unknown fee is the cost to ship the books from the shipping docks to our studio.
  • This will also cover sending some books to some of the locations in the comic like the Royal Tyrell Museum and other locations seen in the comic to try to get some whole sale purchases and get this comic into stores! 
  • *New* All supporters will be added as a thank you in the book! all of you helped and I appreciate you ALL

Special Note: As part of this campaign i'm hoping for your input on the perks! The stickers and Dino cards I would love to be dinosaurs that you, our supporters, like the best! in this way I hope that this helps to really make these perks special for Indiegogo.

The campaign ends this year, however there is a long process of printing and shipping to contend with. My goal is to have this print copy available at Vancaf the following year (May 2019) which is why I've said the end date if February. Everything should be ready by then to keep my anxious brain from self destructing!

We've chosen flexible funding because even if we don't get full funding, I need to print the copies I've promised to supporters through the creation journey, family and of course our beloved Patrons over on Patreon. One way or another this thing is getting printed. 

We've previously funded 3 other books on Indiegogo so this is a trusted platform for us.

I'll be happy as a pig in slop if we just meet our goal, but if we exceed our goal there a a few things

  • If we exceed by $200 we will add in an embroidered patch of an Albertosaurus into every donation at all reward tier levels
  • $5200.00 A hardcover book - So far we've only really considered paperback, but it would look super sharp as a hard cover. If we exceeded our goal by $1000 we could upgrade all copies to hardcover

Plan & Supporter interaction!

We have a plan! while the campaign is going on I'll be working on a number of things. Here is my "to do" list of sorts, and some ways you can have some fun with it too!

  • Redoing some pages from the comic. (These will be print exclusive, I will not be updating the online comics)
  • Making the chapter title pages (again, print only)
  • Designing the stickers, enamel pins, etc for the Indiegogo campaign. 
    • Ideally I'd like you, our supporters to offer feedback in the comments to help me make these perks be what YOU want. Please tell me your favourite dinosaurs for the stickers and card packs! even if they don't make it into the perk, I'll post the art here!
  • I'll be getting help from my sister to format the book for print, she will be working on the interior pages for me while I work on all this art (I better let her know this...) 
  • I'll be creating bonus pages in case we get some additional funding to add content to the print
  • Creating the digital library and digital comics
  • Re-lettering the whole comic to a consistent look

I have a LOT to do however I am confident I can manage it! I wont let a Decade of work stop now!

Oh boy, I've promised copies to a lot of people. The risk of not funding is having to find an alternative source to fund printing the comics I've at least promised (Patrons, previous contributors, family). It would be upsetting to not have my final copy come together however I am determined. I'm confident that if I don't reach my goal I will at least get enough to meet the minimum order at our printer.

If we are less than $1000 from our goal I can still print without the spot gloss, french flaps and maybe a lighter paper weight.

If we don't I'll have to look into alternative printers and get a smaller run done. It wouldn't be ideal but I didn't work on this for a decade to give up now! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? You can do more than you think! Please share this campaign far and wide! Instagram, twitter, Tumblr, Snapchat, facebook! I can't be everywhere but with your help I can make an impact. 

This comic has been my passion for a decade! I'm often just sad that the story is done but to make the thought of having a completed book in my hand to see all my hard work in a final project would mean the world to me!

Here is the short link to copy and paste: https://igg.me/at/helloalberto

story:
I am Daniel de Sosa, cartoonist and founder of OMEOW COMICS. I have spent the past 2 and a half years putting together the self contained ALL-AGES 136 page fantasy comic book A SONG OF MICE AND FUR, I want to bring it to YOU and indiegogo. The book is 100% complete and ready to send to print. You can read A SONG OF MICE AND FUR online for free HERE and decide if you want to own a signed copy yourself!

 

A SONG OF MICE AND FUR is an epic comedy fantasy set in Nyania, a magical land shaped like a pooping cat where kitty lords and ladies vie for control of the rodent peasants.  The dogs of the Wooflands, lead by Lord Mayor Sad Fatters the Pug are preparing to invade Nyania's capital of Purrusalem and turn it back in to Dogstantinople. Meanwhile, the birds and rodents also have plots of their own. The realm teeters on the brink of chaos-WHO WILL COME OUT ON TOP?

A SONG OF MICE AND FUR is a series of short stories and comics that all connect to tell the full story and is ENTIRELY SELF CONTAINED.

 

I wrote, illustrated, lettered and designed the entire book and poured my heart and the past 2 and a half years of my life in to bringing this book to life. If you like what you see and wish to own a signed version of the book, I hope you will come along and support me on this exciting journey!

 

 

PERKS

KITTY DREAMERS COLORING BOOK- Signed copy. Features 36 pages of cool cats to color. If you want an unsigned copy, you can order it on Amazon HERE.

 

PURRVANA- My 56 page hardcover sci fi comedy graphic novel telling the story of Kitty Jenkins popping to people's lives and sending them on crazy cosmic journeys through time and meowter space that they don't want to go on. In the end, they learn nothing. Each copy of Purrvana comes hand signed with a  sketch.

 


A SONG OF MICE AND FUR-  136 page fantasy graphic novel printed in prestige format. Each book comes hand  signed with a sketch.

 

CATFISH SHIRT-Direct to print on 100% cotton

WATER COLOR PET PORTRAIT-a water color painting of your pet.


ACRYLIC PAINTED PET PORTRAIT-7"x7" acrylic painting on canvas of your pet.

story:
Deepstalker crow is a 22 page FULL-COLOR comic.

Mercy awakens on the doorstep of the infamous Crow Manor scared and confused. Crow Manor is home to the most skilled and brutal monster hunters in all the land. When Mercy finds herself drawn into the Crow clan, she is forced to push far beyond her limits and risk her life, values, and sanity all in the name of family duty.

Will Mercy be able to push beyond her physical impairments to stay alive, save the citizens, and find a place in her new family? Read and find out!!

 

Testimonal
"The overall graphic feel is unique and worth looking at. This isn’t always the case, but with Deepstalker Crow, the quality of the story is amplified by creative page layout and gorgeous splash pages.

Bottom Line: I wish I had 220 pages of this and not just 22."

-The Pullbox Review-

Sample Pages

Perks!!!

Comic Versions

 

Concept Art Print 

 

Special Art Print

Lolo Crow "Old King Crow" - Artist : Chevron Lowery

Valonna Crow - Artist : Alex Meder

 

Name in Credits + Mythos Character Creation

 

1 of a kind print

You tell us what character you have fallen in love with and we will create them in a one of a kind print that will be printed and shipped to you! (Nude or NSFW character will not be done.)

ADD-ON

Make your order extra special with a LIMITED TIME print of Pablo or Lolo Crow! (Must have a physical comic print to qualify)

Pablo the Lich Concept Print

Lolo the King Crow

 

Why Do We Need Funding?

This project along with many others in the works, are completely funded by myself. The money we gather will help recoup the investment into Deepstalker Crow Vol 1. After our goal is met, money will go toward funding Deepstalker Crow Vol 2, and making it possible for our artists to bring you the next installment MUCH FASTER and possibly bring them on full time. Anything beyond that will go toward expanding our reach, production rates, and other projects within Dark Sand Oasis Productions.

Risks & Challenges

Want to know a secret? There are no risks! Deepstalker Crow Vol 1 has been ALREADY CREATED! So that means no matter what you WILL BE receiving what you order! As far as challenges, the only thing is dealing with the ever shifting nature of a post-COVID world, and we could only ask for your patience in case something does come up with our printers. We will make sure that we communicate any issues that arise.

Who Are We?

Howdy Howdy!! Antonio here, owner and lead writer at Dark Sand Oasis Productions, a studio that focuses on bringing you the most thrilling and compelling dark fantasy stories out there. This is our first crowdfunding project that has been in the making for over a year, by our highly talented artist! Any support you could offer from financially contributing and securing your copy of this top notch story, or simply sharing this campaign is GREATLY APPRECIATED and we thank you for your help.

 

    The Team!

    • Writer, Co-Editor(content), Project Manager
      • Antonio Cooper
    • ​Script Editor
      • Mike Schneider
    • Lead Editor(content), Letterer
      • ​Bill Simpson
    • Interior Pencils/Inks Artist, Alt. Cover Designer
      • ​JTravis Smith
    • Interior Colorist, Cover Colorist, Concept Print Colorist
      • ​Edgar Tavitas
    • Cover Artist 
      • Yarkin Sakaya
    • Lead Cast Concept Artist
      • Roger Bonet Martinez
    • Title Logo Designer
      • Andre Gutierrez
    • Race Concept Artist
      • Albert Chauw Wijaya
    • Special Print Artists
      • Alex Meder (+ Promo Art Team)
      • Chevron Lowery
    • Promotional Art Team
      • Phoebe Griffin
      • Kushiki
      • Drid Dasig
      • Harold Alim
      • Oe Kunn
      • Albert Chauw Wijaya
      • Yuda Antoro

    STRETCH GOALS

    ??? - 10,000

    ??? - 20,000

    ??? - 40,000

    ??? - 80,000

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Go out and make some noise about what we are doing here. I guarantee that by simply sharing this page on your status and tagging people, posting in comic related groups, or sharing your excitement with Comic Reviewers on platforms like Youtube DOES make a big difference.
    • Follow us on Instagram, Facebook, and to stay up to date on not only what we got going on with Deepstalker Crow, but other projects we got in the works. By following us on Facebook and Instagram you get to see work from our EXTREMELY talented promo artist.

    Thank you for your time and support in what ever capacity you can provide.

story:
THE STORY

PREY FOR THE SINNER is a story of Dr. Synthia "SYN" Kemp a resident prison psychologist at prison asteroid Devil's Den Maximum Security Facility. The "Den" houses the most heinous criminals in the universe...if you're a prisoner at Devil's Den then you're the worst of the worst. During a prison riot Synthia gets violently assaulted and left for dead by the most ruthless prisoners in the "Den". Somehow she survives (a mystery that will unfold). She comes out of her coma and discovers some new found abilities. These new capabilities help her facilitate the only thing on her mind vengeance...bloody... violent... vengeance! What ensues is an intergalactic game of cat and mouse with mind bending twists and turns that you'll never see coming....SYN chasing her assailants while being chased by the authorities as her mysterious origin unfolds. A new creation from the mind of Marat Mychaels, an intricate story that will leave you wanting the next issue ASAP! Beautifully illustrated by Dietrich Smith whose credits include such high profile books as Incredible Hulk, Outsiders, Battlestar Galactica and many more! Vividly colored by Anthony George. This REMASTERED edition includes 9 additional pages illustrated by Marat Mychaels and Adelso Corona.

THE CREATIVE TEAM

MARAT MYCHAELS (Writer, Penciler Letterer, Publisher, ): Is a 28 year veteran of the comic book industry. Marat has worked for most major publishers including Marvel, DC, Image, Coffin Comics, Dynamite, Zenescope and many more. In 2013 he founded Counterpoint Comics and quickly found success with such books as Notti & Nyce, Do You Pooh and  Hardlee Thinn.

DIETRICH SMITH  (Illustrator):  An industry veteran whos work includes Incredible Hulk, Outsiders, Battlestar Galactica and many more provides the work of his career on Prey for the SInner.

ADELSO CORONA (Inker) Maybe the hottest inker in comics! Inking superstar Brett Booth on Blood Shot for Valiant Comics ! Currently inking industry legend Rob Liefeld on Snake Eyes:Dead Game. #2. Lends his amazing inks on the bonus pages.

ANTHONY GEORGE (Colorist): Anthony has graced many books with his amazing hues including  Blood Strike, Graveyard Shift, Notti & Nyce and Battle Fairy and the Yeti #1 and #2.

THE COVER GALLERY

THe best of the best provide a variety of brand new covers for Prey for thre Sinner #1 Remastered edition:

  • MARAT MYCHAELS
  • ALEX KOTKIN
  • ANDREW HIBNER
  • MIKE DeBALFO
  • NATE SZERDY

WHAT WE NEED

The book is 100% finished as we launch this Indiegogo campaign! We need your support to get this book printed and shipped to you!

 

THANK YOU HOMAGE EDITION

Not available for purchase!  We will randomly insert the GOLD Prey for the Sinner - Spiderman 300 homage edition in reward packages as a thank you for your support!

*not guarnteed to recieve one.

Risks & Challenges

All projects have risk. BUT...this book is 100% finished and ready to be printed! We try to do everything we can to keep ours at a minimum. We have a great track record of delivering our books not only on time as promised but on many occasiosn early.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love for you to take a shot on this book. But, if you don't want to invest your hard earned money but still want to show your support please share this campaign on all forms of social media.

story:
SAVAGE SASQUANAUT #1 (of 6) is a rocket fueled sci-fi action adventure comic about the  legendary bigfoot carving a path of chaos across the galaxy.  Join him as he high jacks a starship from the largest intergalactic super power, the Aurellian Empire, and that's after he organized a prison break with the outlandish new friends to escape the clutches of a maniacal Empress all in the hope to find a way back to Earth.

The entire series can be described as a mashup of STAR TREK and BUCK ROGERS starring Jack Burton from BIG TROUBLE IN LITTLE CHINA as bigfoot.  That's Sasquanaut in a very  broad nutshell.  

The first issue is 100% completed and ready to go to print, and to further prove how invested I am in Sasquanaut, the scripts were written and Gab has already completed penciling and inking issues 2-6. 

This is campaign is to raise funds for the production of the 24 page first issue of the series and help launch a new aspect of my career that will allow me to focus more on creating my own work and less on freelance work-for-hire gigs that place other people's dreams and endeavors before my own. As mentioned above the Kickstarter was successful and I hope to have Indiegogo unlock and expand the issue for the enjoyment and benefit of all backers here and on KS.

I'm Wes Hartman, an award winning comic book colorist, and a small press comic book creator and editor and creator of the Sasquanaut comic. I have spent the last 15+ years working with the biggest and best talent at Marvel, DC, Dark Horse, Aspen, Dynamite, etc. and have had my work featured in TV, film, and video games.  Some of my previous creations and credits include Moon Streak, Sky Sharks, Gears & Bones, Pirates vs. Ninjas, and more.

Gab Santos is an illustrator and concept artist who was born and raised in Manila, Philippines. When digital art was introduced to him in college he realized he wanted to pursue a career in art.  He is fond of making robot designs and mechanical/sci-fi/fantasy/apocalyptic themed illustrations because he enjoys imagining what the future may look like.

  • SS#1 contains 24 story pages (20% more than Marvel and DC)
  • All printed copies are in standard American comic size and printed on high-quality glossy paper.
  • All backers will also receive the Savage Sasquanaut #1 Digital PDF copy
  • SS#1 has 3 limited Variant Covers available.

  • SS#1 also includes an Indiegogo Exclusive Variant Cover

  • There is also an extremely limited ARTIST EDITION where the entire issue will be printed in the original black and white line art (no coloring) for the true art aficionados. 
  • 4"x 6" mini-prints/postcards
  • Higher pledge levels include collectible hard enamel pins
  • Cover A is the first of a 6 part collectible cover mega poster image

The above is a look at the INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE VARIANT COVER by the phenomenally skilled Alessandro Michelli and myself on colors.

Check out the awesome HARD ENAMEL PIN based from a cover by KELSEY SHANNON.

This is the the set of 5 mini print postcards that are available with art from Gab Santos, Tyler Kirkham, Paolo Pantalena, Ace Continuado, and Austin Rogers!

This is the UNLOCKED stretch goal BONUS postcard that every backer who purchases any tier with that includes a book(s) will get this card absolutely free!

This is a locked stretch goal for another BONUS PRINT, with your help we can unlock it!

A locked stretch goal that adds 4 more pages to the issue, including the origin story with art by superstar artist Tyler Kirkham. With your help we can unlock and add these pages into the book.

Wes says:

"I stumbled across an EP of a band I had never heard of, with a picture of a gorilla in a space suit on the cover and the title of the record read Sasquanaut I did two things: I laughed my butt off and then started a search. I scoured the internet for month for a story, a comic, a novel, cartoon, game, ANYTHING about bigfoot in space because that idea excited me in a way like Star Wars and X-Men did for me as a kid. I needed to read, no to EXPERIENCE this story. But I couldn't find it anywhere and I was bummed about it. That is until I FINALLY realized (slower than I'd like to admit) that this was the comic I've been born to create! Somebody needs to tell the story of bigfoot in space. The ultimate outcast, hunted his whole life in the forests of Earth now finds himself lost in space, that's too rich of an idea to pass up. 

I've spent most of my youth growing up living in the worlds others have created because as a kid who often felt out of place, comics like the X-Men really resonated, Elric of Melnibone was transformative, Star Trek was this utopia where everyone belonged, and Star Wars was just cool.  Even with all the powers, costumes, strange worlds and settings the characters and emotions always struck a chord with me in ways non genre fiction never has and when I felt alone these stories helped me connect and understand that there were others out there like me. 

Now I think this zany tale of bigfoot lost in space can provide for others, as well as myself, an immense universe full of limitless potential for joy and exciting and fun stories like all those that I have always have and still enjoy."

This project has been nearly 10 years in the making for me. There have been numerous ups and downs, stops and starts, and most every problem you can imagine has been encountered over the years. Most recently I have successfully been funded via Kickstarter and all my basic costs have been met, and I am now reaching out to Indiegogo to reach an audience as far and wide as possible for the "best comic you've never read" and providing a little extra awesome for the dedicated Indiegogo audience!

Indiegogo and Kickstarter have both proven to be amazing venues for getting new creative ideas into as many hands as possible, and after the successful Kickstarter campaign and has allowed me to cover basic costs, the  extra funding that is raised on Indiegogo will help go directly into investing into the completion of coloring and lettering issues 2-6 of SAVAGE SASQUANAUT.

I want make clear that issue 1 is 100% completed and ready to print, and issues 2-6 of Sasquanaut have been scripted, pencilled, and inked and are awaiting coloring and lettering to be wrapped up.  

"This is a great new unique idea and it’s executed extremely well. I like the writing with the story & plot development, pacing and characterisation alongside this really killer comic style interiors. I would check out their kickstarter and then pledge if you can because I know I’d like to see this come to life." READING WITH A FLIGHTRING  full review here

REVIEWS OF PREVIOUS COMICS BY WES HARTMAN

 

Risks & Challenges

SAVAGE SASQUANAUT #1 (Wes Hartman - My First Indiegogo Campaign)

Before launching this campaign I have made every effort to minimize any risk to the backer as I know, as a crowd funding supporter myself, what it means to ask you to support a new project with your hard earned money.

Part of this effort was to make sure that the first issue is 100% completed, and to emphasize how serious this is, all line art for the remaining 5 issues has also been completed by Gab Santos.

Basic funding has been secured with a successful Kickstarter already, so there is a GUARANTEE that the book will be printed. This is my first campaign(s) that I am running and I have made every effort to learn and prepare myself for this endeavor from discussing and surrounding myself with peers who have been successful in running campaigns as well as attending The ComixLaunch Course for creating successful crowdfunding campaigns.

I love this book and I want everyone who takes part of this campaign to love this book as much as I do, and to have a completely satisfied experience with me and Gab all the way through the campaign through fulfillment, so as soon as issue 2 is completed we can offer it to you as well.

If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to message me and I will do my absolute best to make this project as rewarding as possible.

Thank you for your time and your support!

Other Ways You Can Help

So please PLEDGE, SHARE, and help me continue to bring this dream project into reality.

A locked stretch goal that adds 4 more pages to the issue, including the origin story with art by superstar artist Tyler Kirkham. With your help we can unlock and add these pages into the book.

Wes says:
"I stumbled across an EP of a band I had never heard of, with a picture of a gorilla in a space suit on the cover and the title of the record read Sasquanaut I did two things: I laughed my butt off and then started a search. I scoured the internet for month for a story, a comic, a novel, cartoon, game, ANYTHING about bigfoot in space because that idea excited me in a way like Star Wars and X-Men did for me as a kid. I needed to read, no to EXPERIENCE this story. But I couldn't find it anywhere and I was bummed about it. That is until I FINALLY realized (slower than I'd like to admit) that this was the comic I've been born to create! Somebody needs to tell the story of bigfoot in space. The ultimate outcast, hunted his whole life in the forests of Earth now finds himself lost in space, that's too rich of an idea to pass up. 
I've spent most of my youth growing up living in the worlds others have created because as a kid who often felt out of place, comics like the X-Men really resonated, Elric of Melnibone was transformative, Star Trek was this utopia where everyone belonged, and Star Wars was just cool.  Even with all the powers, costumes, strange worlds and settings the characters and emotions always struck a chord with me in ways non genre fiction never has and when I felt alone these stories helped me connect and understand that there were others out there like me. 
Now I think this zany tale of bigfoot lost in space can provide for others, as well as myself, an immense universe full of limitless potential for joy and exciting and fun stories like all those that I have always have and still enjoy."

This project has been nearly 10 years in the making for me. There have been numerous ups and downs, stops and starts, and most every problem you can imagine has been encountered over the years. Most recently I have successfully been funded via Kickstarter and all my basic costs have been met, and I am now reaching out to Indiegogo to reach an audience as far and wide as possible for the "best comic you've never read" and providing a little extra awesome for the dedicated Indiegogo audience!
Indiegogo and Kickstarter have both proven to be amazing venues for getting new creative ideas into as many hands as possible, and after the successful Kickstarter campaign and has allowed me to cover basic costs, the  extra funding that is raised on Indiegogo will help go directly into investing into the completion of coloring and lettering issues 2-6 of SAVAGE SASQUANAUT.
I want make clear that issue 1 is 100% completed and ready to print, and issues 2-6 of Sasquanaut have been scripted, pencilled, and inked and are awaiting coloring and lettering to be wrapped up.  



"This is a great new unique idea and it’s executed extremely well. I like the writing with the story & plot development, pacing and characterisation alongside this really killer comic style interiors. I would check out their kickstarter and then pledge if you can because I know I’d like to see this come to life." READING WITH A FLIGHTRING  full review here
REVIEWS OF PREVIOUS COMICS BY WES HARTMAN

 
Risks & Challenges
SAVAGE SASQUANAUT #1 (Wes Hartman - My First Indiegogo Campaign)
Before launching this campaign I have made every effort to minimize any risk to the backer as I know, as a crowd funding supporter myself, what it means to ask you to support a new project with your hard earned money.
Part of this effort was to make sure that the first issue is 100% completed, and to emphasize how serious this is, all line art for the remaining 5 issues has also been completed by Gab Santos.
Basic funding has been secured with a successful Kickstarter already, so there is a GUARANTEE that the book will be printed. This is my first campaign(s) that I am running and I have made every effort to learn and prepare myself for this endeavor from discussing and surrounding myself with peers who have been successful in running campaigns as well as attending The ComixLaunch Course for creating successful crowdfunding campaigns.
I love this book and I want everyone who takes part of this campaign to love this book as much as I do, and to have a completely satisfied experience with me and Gab all the way through the campaign through fulfillment, so as soon as issue 2 is completed we can offer it to you as well.
If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to message me and I will do my absolute best to make this project as rewarding as possible.
Thank you for your time and your support!

Other Ways You Can Help
So please PLEDGE, SHARE, and help me continue to bring this dream project into reality.

story:
Here's Dave Sim on the origins of this unique project—

"An annual CEREBUS Birthday Card is an idea I had been toying with for years and stopped thinking about after my wrist went wonky in 2015. Then Dean R. sent me a copy of a CEREBUS drawing he had commissioned from Neal Adams and I thought, 'Wait a minute, it doesn't HAVE to be a Dave Sim drawing.' Neal was kind enough to grant us blanket permission for use of the image, for which I really can never thank him enough! He's been a personal hero of mine since he blew my 12-year-old mind with his work on DEADMAN in 1968. Now I just have to figure out who I'm going to ask to draw the 2020 card!" 

All of the pledge levels will include this basic item—a Cerebus birthday card, penciled and inked by Mr.  Adams as a commission for Cerebus (and Neal!) fan Dean Reeves, and toned and lettered by Dave Sim. In addition, Dave Sim will sign each printed card and personalize them to you, to be delivered by your birthday (or any other 2019 date of your choosing).

For the multi-birthdayed among us, you may also purchase cards in value-packs of five or ten cards each.

Secondly, we're offering an opportunity to catch up with the CEREBUS ARCHIVE PORTFOLIOS for those of you who might have missed the previous campaigns. These offerings represent the entirety of the remaining inventory of Cerebus Archive portfolios, printed and signed for the original campaigns, and still bearing their numbered designations.

Here's Dave Sim again:

"In order to preserve what's left of my right wrist for work on THE STRANGE DEATH OF ALEX RAYMOND, I've had to make the hard decision with the Artists' Editions Portfolios to only sign the front label on the Portfolio from now on, instead of all of the interior plates. So these are the last of the Kickstarter CEREBUS ARCHIVE Portfolios signed throughout that will ever be made available for sale to the public: First come, first served!" 

As with previous Aardvark-Vanaheim Kickstarter campaigns, returning backers will be able to retain their special partner pledge number in this campaign. 

Thanks for reading, thanks for sharing, and most importantly, HAPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU!

Risks and challenges

We're trying to reduce the logistical complexity AND delivery time of the prints. However, we do not compromise on quality, either in print or in execution of accurate fulfillment. We offer a 100% no-hassle, replacement or money-back guarantee if there is anything damaged, missing or if the quality is simply not up to your expectation! Each and every Pledge Partner can bank on that guarantee!

story:
Where it all began ...

This adventure started many years ago, while growing up in the small town of Utopia, Texas. In second grade I discovered my love of drawing when my teacher gave me an old, 1940s book about drawing cartoons. That book set the course for years of drawing at home and doodling in the margins of my assignments at school. My world turned green forever when I found the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. Growing up with the cartoon, my mind began to race with characters and stories of my own. I dreamed of someday putting pencil to paper to share my  imagination with others.  It feels like I’ve stepped into a time machine. It might be 30 years later, but this is only the beginning! 

 T I R

The Intergalactic Riptoadz belong to an amphibious race from a planet in a distant galaxy ... far, far away … well, you get the idea. Refugees from a war-stricken planet, the riptoadz hope to find a new home where they can start a new life. They aren't looking for trouble but they won't run away from it either. They pack quite an intergalactic PUNCH when their backs are to the wall. As you’ll soon discover, there’s more than meets the eye when it comes to these tadpolez.

Meanwhile, species throughout the universe are noticing an alarming number of their citizens disappearing mysteriously. As the Riptoadz journey through space, they’ll tangle with the galaxy's most sinister space pirates, Red Beard and his pack of menacing robo hounds. Will they be able to stop his heinous, intergalactic reign of terror? Will they find a new home? Will they survive at all? Back our campaign to help the intergalactic revolution and learn their fate!



 The Intergalactic Creators 

My name is Matthew Holland. I’m the father of two wonderful kids, who I work full-time to support. In my few moments of down time, I love to draw, ink and sculpt my life away. I have teamed up Manu' Silva to bring new life to The Intergalactic Riptoadz.

Emanuel Silva, known in the art world as Manu Silva, is a Brazilian artist rising in popularity among TMNT, Predator and Venom fans for his detailed style inspired by legendary artists like Todd McFarlane, Alex Ross, Greg Capullo and J. Scott Campbell. Other inspirations include Mike Deodato Jr, Gabrielle Dell’Otto, Adi Granov and classic greats such as Jack Kirby, Walter Simonson and George Pérez.

With our powers combined, T I R and the galaxy will never be the same!

 

Our Intergalactic mission

The mission of this project is to increase awareness of human trafficking, shedding light on a dark scourge that has plagued the human race for centuries. Too many lives have been stolen, too many atrocities perpetrated … all for the sake of human greed and depravity. As we raise awareness, we push toward a future where the darkness of human trafficking fades away.



 

For the campaign...

We have 32 action packed pages of awesomeness planned depending on size of the final budget. Plus we‘re offering special variant covers, as well as signature options. We have also called on comic book artist, Frank Fosco (TMNT UL) and Jason Flowers (Bounty Bullfrog) to help our quest by offering variant covers that will be out of this world! There are original art sketch cards available. There are awesome pin-ups, stickers, posters by some awesome artists and bonus material that will be unlocked as goals are met.  We want to put as much intergalactic swag in your hands as possible. We just need your support to make it happen!

Be the one and join the intergalactic revolution!

 

 Our intergalactic budget  

The funds will be allocated appropriately to cover the many costs of publishing a comic book of intergalactic proportion. Artist commissions and materials, publishing costs and massive amounts of time don’t just happen by magic. I know, I already asked; apparently, it’s a lot of hard work. Also the amount of funds we raise will determine the length of this intergalactic first shot. And don’t forget the Intergalactic Federation will want their taxes and fees. With your support we will pay their bounty and help the Riptoadz bring balance to the universe! 

 

Join us for Intergalactic dominance over all tyrants and bullies!

 

 

STAY TUNED FOR MORE AWESOME INTERGALACTIC UPDATES!!!

We have some really awesome villains, heroes and spin-off stories that will be ahead in future doses!!

A special intergalactic thank you to Chris Gage, Emanuel Silva and Wes Roberts. Thanks to each of you for your suggestions and support. Without you guys this would not be possible!! Together we can make a difference in our own galaxy!

BE THE ONE!

Risks and challenges

Together, Manu and myself believe that you will be so happy you helped bring this project to life.   We will need your support in sharing our project and telling others about it!  Your support is vital in helping us create this awesome comic book of wonders!

This will be a super detailed work of comic book art!

Oh, and YOU risk the chance of having your mind blown!

story:
Ominous Press is proud to announce the Jim Starlin’s Dreadstar Omnibus Collection. Featuring more than 1,500 pages of classic Dreadstar action over three volumes, each page has been meticulously remastered by Jim Starlin himself, making this the definitive Dreadstar collection. The three-volume hardcover Omnibus Collection will gather the complete Dreadstar stories by cosmic master Jim Starlin. Volume 1 is a 512-page collection of Dreadstar’s journey, from the original Metamorphosis Odyssey presented in Epic Illustrated magazine, to the Dreadstar Graphic Novel, The Price graphic novel, the Epic Illustrated short story, and the first eight issues of the original standalone Dreadstar comic series. As an exclusive bonus, Jim Starlin’s Dreadstar Omnibus Volume 1 also features the original painted Metamorphosis Odyssey Portfolio, as well as a four-page bonus story, The Prayer. Whether you’re a longtime Dreadstar fan, or this is your first introduction to the acclaimed series, this volume is a massive, must-own masterpiece. 

Dreadstar is the comos-spanning tale of Vanth Dreadstar, a powerful warrior and the lone survivor of the Milky Way Galaxy. Joined by his crewmates Oedi, Syzygy Darklock, Willow, and Skeevo, the team finds themselves in the middle of an ancient stalemate war between two forces of evil: The Church of Instrumentality, led by the all-powerful and misguided Lord Papal, and The Monarchy. 

Near frozen and left for dead after the brutal slaying of his parents, Vanth Dreadstar is saved by the Sword of Power, giving him newfound might and abilities. With sword in hand, he travels the galaxy on a quest for revenge, but what he finds is much, much more.

Derived from an experimental race of cat people at the hands of The Church of Instrumentality, Oedi joins Vanth on his journey after an epic war destroys his people.

A blind telepath, Willow can not only influence sentient minds, but has the power to affect the minds of cybernetics and computers as well. Joined by her seeing-eye monkey Rainbow, Willow uses the power of her inner light, but is fueled by a dark past.

 Ravaged by his own mystical powers, Syzygy Darklock is kept alive only by cybernetic parts and a will to abolish evil. His faith makes him a ready companion and powerful ally in Dreadstar’s quest, but his heart remains focused on his own ambitions.

 Freebooter Skeevo uses his friendship with Oedi to join the crew, and the fight. He serves as the ship’s lowbrow pilot.

 

 

 

 

 

 

A truly legendary writer and artist, Jim Starlin has blazed his own trail in comics for five decades. His expansive work spans every major publisher, and includes the creation of beloved characters including Thanos, Gamora, Drax the Destroyer, Mongul, and more. His work helped form the bedrock of the Marvel Cinematic Universe, and has been celebrated on screens large and small the world over.

story:
CLICK HERE TO READ THE FIRST ISSUE OF ICHABOD JONES MONSTER HUNTER

***NO ADDITIONAL DOMESTIC SHIPPING CHARGES!***

Do you love crazy stories filled with monsters, magic, gore, and humor?

Have you ever read about H.P. Lovecraft's Dreamlands and thought..."I wish this was funnier and gorier"?

Are you excited by stories that keep you on your toes and make you question the very fabric of reality?

Then you are going to love Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter. 

Ichabod comes from a deep, almost primordial, place in my soul. It's the part that devours movies like In the Mouth of Madness, Event Horizon, and Jacob's Ladder, while still binging on Gravity Falls, Frankenweenie, and Army of Darkness. It's the part that read Johnny the Homicidal Maniac and laughed hysterically at every gruesome scene.

All of that went into Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter, which is what has made it my most beloved property, and for the first time since it released in 2014...there is another full arc written and drawn by the original creative team!

That's right. 

Renzo Podesta is back on art for the second arc. Renzo brings so much to the look of the book, and turns Ichabod from a creepy person into a lovable character...who is also a bit creepy.

We're now ready to release the second volume of Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter, a 96-page hardcover. 

That's right. HARDCOVER. 

What is the story about, really?

Ichabod isn't about some mental patient who's ruthlessly killing people. It's about a broken man, who was cast off by society, and whether that person, a person who nobody wants, can be a hero.

Can he find his place in the world? Can he come to terms with everything that he's done? Can he become a hero?

I'm very interested in that idea, as a person who is severely broken myself. I've had depression and anxiety for as long as I can remember, and it's getting worse with every passing year.

I never felt like I fit in for the first 30 years of my life. It wasn't until I went out into the world and became the hero of my own story that I started to think that maybe I wasn't the worst human being on the planet.

Ichabod, though, came from a place where I was very much alone, broken, and wondering if it would ever get better.

I think what makes Ichabod really special is that is was started by a person who never knew if he could be fixed, one who felt like he was cast off from society, and now it's being written by a person who understands that the broken bits are what make him special.

See, Ichabod, at its core, is about hope. It's about taking what's special about you and using it to bring light into the world; of shining hope in a bleak universe. Ichabod's world is harrowing and awful, but Ichabod can bring light into it, not despite of being broken, but because of it.

A psychological mind screw

Ichabod Jones is about a psychopath that escapes from a mental asylum and becomes a monster hunter during the Apocalypse, but he doesn't know if he's killing monsters, humans, or it's all in his head the whole time.

Ichabod has been imprisoned in a mental asylum for crimes he definitely committed. When he was arrested, the police found him wrist-deep in the guts of his latest victim.

While he's never claimed he was innocent, he says he only committed atrocious acts because an authoritative, and unwelcome, voice in his head told him he was doing God's work.

He tried to say no to the voice, but it was very insistent and persuasive. It told Ichabod that the people he was killing were monsters and he was saving the world by murdering them.

He was wrong...or so he thought.

At the beginning of the story, Ichabod wakes up in the Apocalypse, being chased by a monster trying to devour his soul. He has no choice but to use his training as a monster hunter to fight off the beast, and accept his fate as the savior of the world.

He meets a band of other inmates, helps them escape the asylum, and they begin their long journey across the desert to freedom, trying to carve out a bit of humanity as they go.

Something strange happens to Ichabod throughout the story, and I say strange in a tale that is already at 11 on the strange meter.

Every now and then...he snaps back to another place, where he's sitting with his doctor, talking out what just happened to him, or on the run from the law, and definitely NOT in the Apocalypse.

Is he really there, is it a memory, or is he having a psychological break?

It's that juxtaposition between reality and perception that makes Ichabod special. It's not just an Apocalypse story, or a dark fantasy tale, or a chosen one book. It also messing with your very perception of the universe, and whether Ichabod is truly a hero, or a psychopath killing the innocent.

After all, he was wrong about being a savior once, and that's what got him locked away in the first place. What's to say he's not wrong again, only now he's having a much more vivid hallucination?

Or perhaps he's only fantasizing about being a hero, while being locked in his cell, unable to smell freedom ever again.

The second arc breaks the story open into a fantastical world full of even more magic and monsters, including his meeting the first wizard of the Apocalypse, Necromonica, huge sand scorpions, nightmare elves, inferini, and much more. 

The first arc hinted at the huge world of Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter, and the second arc smacks you full force into it. 

What other people are saying about Ichabod

We've gotten some great reviews over the years. 

If you’ve got a taste for unconventional and offbeat horror, then don’t miss Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter!" – Bryant Dillon, President: Fanbase Press

https://fanbasepress.com/index.php/blogs/bryant-dillon/item/1072-ichabod-jones-monster-hunter-review

"Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter – is a glimpse into the abyss. Renzo Podesta’s art fits perfectly. If you love your horror gritty, gory, and psychological, pick up a copy." – Chuck Suffel, whatchareasing.com

https://whatchareading.com/ichabod-jones-monster-hunter/

"Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter" gets a 5 out of 5 for me. A nicely done little indie horror comic that could. Nice atmospheric artwork, good characters." – popgoesthedarkeraven.com

https://popgoesthedarkeraven.wordpress.com/2020/08/13/wannabe-ichabod-jones-monster-hunter-4-review/

I am so appreciative of all the amazingly supportive press reviewers we've met over the years. However, the most important reviews to me are from fans just like you. 

Check out what other fans are saying about Ichabod

Who am I?

My name is Russell Nohelty, USA Today bestselling author and publisher of Wannabe Press, a small press that creates weird books for weird people, creator of Katrina Hates Dead Shit, Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter, and Pixie Dust, along with the editor of both the Monsters and Other Scary Shit, and Cthulhu is Hard to Spell anthologies.

I have raised over $200,000 from 13 different crowdfunding projects, and have gotten exceedingly good at crafting amazing books that audiences love. One of my previous projects, Cthulhu is Hard to Spell, raised over $39,000 on Kickstarter from over 1,000 backers, and its sequel, Cthulhu is Hard to Spell: The Terrible Twos, raised another $30,000. The two before that, Monsters and Other Scary Shit and Pixie Dust, both raised north of $25,000 from over 600 backers each.

Who drew that dope art?

Renzo Podesta is a bit of a kingmaker in indie comics. I didn't know it when I first started working together, but Renzo has helped some of the coolest comic creators on the planet build their careers.

He's worked with Charles Soule on a book called 27 from Image Comics. From that book, Charles started working with Marvel, and has written Death of Wolverine, X-Men, Poe Dameron, Han Solo, and a bunch of books for them.

He's also worked with Jeremy Holt, who has several books out with Insight Editions, including After Houdini and Skinned, and Skip to the End for Heavy Metal.

He was also the original artist on Howard Lovecraft and the Frozen Kingdom before it was picked up as an animated movie.

I met Renzo all the way back in 2010, well before I was a known artist in the indie scene. In fact, he was producing the first issue arc for me while he was producing the second arc of 27 for Charles, and well before Charles was even at Marvel, which seems like two lifetimes ago.

He's one of my favorite artists, and he's the reason Ichabod became such a beloved character. He took a psychopath who could have easily come across as evil and creepy, and turned him into an enduring, lovable person.

Why did I write this book?

I still remember the moment I came up with the idea for Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter.

I had just returned from San Diego Comic-Con 2010, after pitching my book, The Wannabes, a YA superhero story about fake superheroes who get real superpowers. Everybody, and I mean everybody, rejected it.

They said it was too cute, or not cute enough, but most often they just flat out told me no without any explanation. So, I came home, disillusioned, and I told myself "If they're going to tell me no, I'll give them a good reason to say no."

I set out to make the most unlikely hero imaginable. Something unpublishable by the standards of any conventional publisher.

I didn't know the story yet. I just knew I wanted it to be my big screw you to publishing, and everybody who told me no.

Then, it happened.

I was cresting over the hill to the valley on the 405 in late 2010, looking out on the city below me, and that's when it hit me like a ton of bricks.

What if the hero was a psychopath, somebody that society had written off for being objectively evil? What if he didn't even know if he was in his own head or the Apocalypse was really happening?

Could a person like that...could they be a hero?

Icbabod Jones is the exploration of that question.
story_txt: CLICK HERE TO READ THE FIRST ISSUE OF ICHABOD JONES MONSTER HUNTER***NO ADDITIONAL DOMESTIC SHIPPING CHARGES!***Do you love crazy stories filled with monsters, magic, gore, and humor?Have you ever read about H.P. Lovecraft's Dreamlands and thought..."I wish this was funnier and gorier"?Are you excited by stories that keep you on your toes and make you question the very fabric of reality?Then you are going to love Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter. Ichabod comes from a deep, almost primordial, place in my soul. It's the part that devours movies like In the Mouth of Madness, Event Horizon, and Jacob's Ladder, while still binging on Gravity Falls, Frankenweenie, and Army of Darkness. It's the part that read Johnny the Homicidal Maniac and laughed hysterically at every gruesome scene.All of that went into Ichabod Jones Monster Hunter, which is what has made it my most beloved property, and for the first time since it released in 2014...there is another full arc written and drawn by the original creative team!That's right. Renzo Podesta is back on art for the second arc. Renzo brings so much to the look of the book, and turns Ichabod from a creepy person into a lovable character...who is also a bit creepy.We're now ready to release the second volume of Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter, a 96-page hardcover. That's right. HARDCOVER. What is the story about, really?Ichabod isn't about some mental patient who's ruthlessly killing people. It's about a broken man, who was cast off by society, and whether that person, a person who nobody wants, can be a hero.Can he find his place in the world? Can he come to terms with everything that he's done? Can he become a hero?I'm very interested in that idea, as a person who is severely broken myself. I've had depression and anxiety for as long as I can remember, and it's getting worse with every passing year.I never felt like I fit in for the first 30 years of my life. It wasn't until I went out into the world and became the hero of my own story that I started to think that maybe I wasn't the worst human being on the planet.Ichabod, though, came from a place where I was very much alone, broken, and wondering if it would ever get better.I think what makes Ichabod really special is that is was started by a person who never knew if he could be fixed, one who felt like he was cast off from society, and now it's being written by a person who understands that the broken bits are what make him special.See, Ichabod, at its core, is about hope. It's about taking what's special about you and using it to bring light into the world; of shining hope in a bleak universe. story:
Read With Me

I want to adapt comic books so blind children can read with sighted ones from the same book. It's a project that I've been working as a side note to a cafe. However, the interest in it has gotten so big that I've decided to make it one of my main focuses! So, I've been learning Braille on my own but an RNIB accredited certificate and the teaching they offer will help vastly and give potential publishers confidence in my translations.

Also, this means that I will then be able to advance to teaching braille in my spare time to anyone who wants it. Don't have to be blind to learn Braille and I think its something more people should learn to do. You never know who you will meet in this world!

More Info!

I have got more info in these places about Read With Me and the Cafe. If I can get this certificate I can gain more confidence in publishers and really get things moving with Read With Me.

Blog
Twitter
Kickstarter

    The Impact

    It is important to encourage children to see that being blind is not something that makes a person different. It means that their perception of the world is different. Adapting something like a comic book will encourage the same mentality, as well as encouraging blind children to read books. At the moment more and more schools are relying on computers and audio for blind children to read. Some have stopped teaching blind children how to read at all. I'm hoping this project will help bring a more positive light to reading and how it shouldn't matter if a child is blind or not - reading can be fun.

    Risks & Challenges

    This section has no real risks. All the other parts to the project are with the Pause Cafe Kickstarter. I've decided to make Read With Me a separate project to start with so that even if the Cafe doesn't work the Read With Me Project Can.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Spread the world. If you can't add a £1 to the campaign, that's fine. Spread the world, tell people about how awesome it would be to adapt comic books for the blind, and keep offering me words of support like you have!

story:
"Le mura del Continente racchiudono tutto ciò che resta del mondo civilizzato.

Oltre i suoi confini, oltre gli oceani, non restano altro che terre selvagge ed eremiti.

Un treno però porta ancora verso quei luoghi dimenticati e due ragazzi vi saliranno senza sapere che una volta superato il Confine, non puoi più tornare indietro.

Eric scappa dal Continente per trovare la cosa più importante che aveva e che gli è stata rubata, Milo per voltare le spalle al destino che altri hanno provato ad imporgli.

Il viaggio che intraprenderanno però li porterà molto più lontano di quanto avrebbero mai potuto immaginare, oltre  la realtà che era stata loro insegnata, in mezzo a conflitti che durano da secoli e a racconti andati dimenticati, che  cambieranno le sorti della loro vita."

Date uno sguardo alla gallery per vedere alcune pagine del fumetto e gli schizzi dei personaggi :)
