story:
About me and Herman Hedning

I've been drawing all my life - but the earliest evidence of any kind of specialisation is a short comic strip about two vehicles colliding – made at the age of seven.

In 1986 I start working as a professional cartoonist  on "91:an", at one of Swedens two major comic publishers and in 1988 I give birth to "Herman Hedning", published in every issue of the "Phantom", Swedens 2nd largest comic magazine at the time.

Herman Hedning quickly became very popular and since 1998 I've had my own magazine and we have published 145 issues so far. There is also and about 30 comic books published.

In 2016 I published a book by myself for the first time, with the glorious help from my readers and crowdfunding. I went really well, and the second book in this series will be coming this spring. Here's that campaign: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1158823709/herman-hedning-1988-1995-prekampbrium

But there is more to life than comics

Although I love writing and drawing comics, I also have an obsession with creating other products with Herman Hedning. There are T-shirts and posters of course, but also plastic figurines, a beer opener and last but not least – a beer brand (but you can only get those in Sweden)! You can take a peek here: http://hermanhedning.indiestry.se/en/

 

And now this painting ...

The original painting is probably the largest form of art I've ever done – in size that is. It's 100 x 80 cm, but since that monster won't fit on any wall (unless you live in a church) I decided to make the print smaller. 70 x 50 cm (including the white border) is still quite huge, but it fits in a standard poster frame. The painting will be printed on 200 g structured paper – a test print is already ordered.

Since I didn't have an actual deadline on this painting, it took over a year to finish it. I did some parts here and there, when I had some time over to relax between the "real" deadlines – finishing the magazine on time. 

The image includes all the main characters in the Herman Hedning universe. There are several others of course, but to fit them all in one picture would be a real challenge ...

From top left: Lillan, The Giant King, Death, The Fire Elemental Dragon, The Creator (God)

Middle row: An Archangel, Ragnar The Dino, Death, "Lilleman" (behind the beer), Herman, Gammelman, Hermine (behind Gammelman), The Devil, Garmor, Adam & Eve.

Front: Kain & Abel, Cochroach, An Alien, A Frog & The Beast

Risks & Challenges

I was really nervous about my first crowdfunding project last year – scared shitless is probably a better term – but it worked out well in the end. I hope this will too, because I have several ideas for humongous illustrations that can't be used in the magazine – but that's in the future to come. Now I want this baby sent to the printshop! It might be the only acrylic painting I'll ever do, due to the horrible amount of time put in, so get it while it's still there!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want this tasteful painting on your bathroom wall, but still want  to help keeping me happy, painting in my studio instead of disturbing the peace and order in society – please share this project with the Indiegogo share tools! Thanks!

best regards, Jonas Darnell

story:
Bref résumé

Depuis une dizaine d’année, nous sommes engagés avec notre agence Zhu Culture dans  la promotion et le développement du secteur culturel africain à travers différentes activités dans les disciplines de la musique, du Théâtre, de la mode, des Arts plastiques et aussi dans le domaine de la formation aux métiers du spectacle vivant.

En 2009 Zhu Culture a ajouté une corde à son arc avec l’édition de livres, en publiant un premier ouvrage sur la sonorisation de spectacle et dont le Tome 2 est récemment paru en Mars 2016.

Grâce à la créativité de Saintrick, l’auteur/scénariste des ''Aventures de Pygmoi & Pygtoi'' et le talent de l’illustrateur Rhys, nous avons trouvé l’occasion de nous lancer dans le secteur de la bande dessinée.

‘’Les aventures de Pygmoi & Pygtoi’’ représentent pour nous un projet très ambitieux car traitant de sujets cruciaux pour l’avenir de notre planète. Et la bande dessinée demeure un  formidable vecteur de partage d’idées. Nous espérons vivement, que ce projet s’inscrira dans  le long terme.

Tout en représentant clairement l’expression de nos valeurs vis à vis du développement de notre continent, de la préservation de la nature et de l’éducation, ‘’Les aventures de Pygmoi & Pygtoi’’ sont pour nous, un projet fiable et pertinent d’un point de vue artistique et économique.

Nous accompagner dans le lancement de cette bande dessinée, c’est nous permettre de proposer au monde entier une œuvre artistique de qualité, une œuvre pertinente dans ses thématiques, et enfin et tout simplement, une œuvre à fort impact culturel et économique.

 Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

  • Les 16 000$ demandés, serviront à couvrir deux besoins :
    1. L’imprimerie pour éditer les 5.000 premiers exemplaires de la BD
    2. Financer une partie du budget de communication pour le lancement de la BD à Dakar, Paris et Brazzaville. (photos et vidéos seront mises en ligne comme preuve)

Ces 5.000 premiers exemplaires seront mis en vente en ligne et dans les réseaux partenaires de librairies physiques, en Afrique, Europe et Amérique du Nord. L’argent de cette vente devrait permettre l’impression et la promotion d’autres exemplaires et assurer ainsi la pérennité des ventes du tome 1 et, on l’espère, son succès.

  • Les contreparties, qu’elles soient un fond d’écran HD, une BD ou un Poster sont le geste de remerciement le plus naturel que nous estimons devoir à nos contributeurs.
  • Quel que soit le montant récolté, en dessous de notre objectif fixé, cet argent ira intégralement à l’impression papier des BD.

Nous verrons à ce moment là, combien de BD nous pourrons imprimer et distribuer.

 L'impact

  • Les enjeux écologiques sont au coeur du développement humain et de la survie de toutes les espèces vivantes, animales et végétales sur terre. Mais la voix de l’Afrique est souvent inaudible dans le chœur des plaidoyers qui prônent un engagement de tout un chacun dans la préservation de notre planète. Or, il existe bel et bien des hommes, des femmes, des enfants qui oeuvrent chaque jour sur le continent pour sensibiliser leurs frères et sœurs. La BD « Les aventures de Pygmoi & Pygtoi » vient prêter un podium à ces énergies pour porter avec elles la parole de l’Afrique vers le reste du monde.
  • Lors du lancement de la BD, grâce aux 5.000 premiers exemplaires, des ateliers créatifs et d’information pour les 6 – 12 ans, seront organisés au sein des librairies partenaires à Dakar, Brazzaville et Paris. Durant une semaine, enfants et parents pourront assister et participer à des évènements autour de thématiques sur la nature et sa préservation. Selon les réactions, ces ateliers seront proposés dans d’autres pays désireux de participer à l’aventure de notre BD et à faire entendre la voix écologique de l’Afrique.

Le défi

Toute démarche commerciale de partager une œuvre ou une création avec le public revêt nécessairement une part de risque et d’inconnu.  Cela fait partie intégrante de l’aventure artistique et entrepreneuriale.

  • La BD « Les aventures de Pygmoi & Pygtoi» Tome 1, repose sur un concept réaliste et terriblement d’actualité : la protection de l’environnement et des patrimoines culturels ! Les engagements pris par les Etats lors de la COP 21 à Paris et de la COP 22 à Marrakech, sont aussi un bon indicateur pour croire que notre livre trouvera une attention aussi bien auprès du grand public que des institutions nationales et internationales en charge de l’environnement, ou qui y sont sensibles.
  • Nous travaillons actuellement à l’élaboration d’un plan de communication et d’approche des institutions nationales et internationales, des ONG et des fondations, en charge de l’environnement, afin qu’elles se saisissent de l’existence de la BD « Les aventures de Pygmoi & Pygtoi » Tome 1 (et des autres tomes à venir), pour nous aider à la relayer massivement auprès du grand public africain et dans le monde, souvent très peu informé sur l’environnement en Afrique et sa place dans l’équilibre mondial. Car à côté des dures maladies que sont le paludisme, la fièvre typhoïde, le sida ou encore le tristement célèbre Ebola, nous oublions bien souvent que ce continent renferme de très nombreux trésors de la nature et qui seront essentiels pour dessiner le monde de demain…

 Nous aider c’est aussi … :

Tout en remerciant d'avance tous ceux qui répondront à cet appel par leur contribution financière, nous remercions aussi

  • Ceux qui parleront de ce projet autour d'eux,
  • Ceux qui partageront autours d'eux les liens pour accéder  à cette plateforme Indiegogo.  

Et bien entendu,

  • Ceux qui partageront simplement avec nous, les valeurs et les objectifs de cette BD ''Les Aventures de Pygmoi & Pygtoi''.

Un grand MERCI d'avance pour votre soutien!

story:
Welcome to my Campaign!

Hello, My name is Kirk Lindo. I'm an Artist, Author and Independent Publisher, best known for my Vamperotica, Vampress Luxura and Super Fantasy Girls line of Comics, Graphic Novels and Art Books. 

The purpose of this campaign is to produce a 32 page Black &  White comic featuring a Full Color VAMPRESS LUXURA HOMAGE COVER, paying tribute to the awesome work of Dave Cockrum and Rudy Nebres from the original JOHN CARTER, WARLORD of MARS comic series published by Marvel Comics in the late 1970's.

When I was a kid I was a huge fan of the WARLORD of MARS Comic Series as well as Dave Cockrum's art. I was already collecting his X-Men series at the time and also fell in love with the work on that book.

A few years ago I noticed that HOMAGE COVERS were becoming popular with comic fans and decided to do one of my own featuring my Original Comic Character, The Vampress Luxura!

This art was blast to work on and I know you will love this collectible set of comics.

The interior of this book is a collection of previously published Luxura stories featuring her conflicts with the four armed martian vampires from my comic series.

 

There is also a GIANT 64 PAGE SPECIAL "MARTIAN CHRONICLES EDITION" Which collects ALL OF THE LUXURA VERSUS THE MARTIANS STORIES. If you are new to VAMPEROTICA and LUXURA, this edition is a perfect place to start. 

If you are a long time fan, then you will enjoy reading this collection of stories all in one book!

ABOUT LUXURA

I began publishing the adventures of THE VAMPRESS LUXURA in my original, erotic vampire anthology entitled VAMPEROTCA! The series was a smash hit from the very first issue and went on to become one of the best selling indy comics of the 1990's.

The book ran for 50 issues and spun off into several  one shots, mini-series and magazines. The main reason for the books success was huge fan response to THE VAMPRESS LUXURA!

Luxura belongs to a race of vampires known as the 'Kith'. Although her exact age has not yet been disclosed, she is at least several centuries old. She has made good use of this time, building her own shadow empire that spans the globe. The heart of this empire is a complex in Manhattan, New York. It is a vast network of tunnels, caverns, and trophy rooms.

Luxura is an avid collector. While much of her many collections have monetary value, most items are kept for sentimental value. Amongst the armor, jewelry, clothing, books and weapons, there is a crown jewel of her collections... the Blood Vault. This vault, believed by many to be the largest in the world, contains thousands of wine bottles filled with magically preserved blood. Each bottle is carefully labeled, and displays a portrait or photograph of the donor.

She is also a strong believer in the rule of law, and actively works to enforce the three main tenets of Kith society- sustaining mortals as a plentiful food source, regulating the Kith to prevent anarchy, and maintaining discretion so mortals are not alerted to the existence of Kith.

If you have any questions, please contact me and I will get back to you as quickly as possible with an answer. 

Thanks for taking the time to view this campaign and make your pledge today for the LUXURA VAMPRESS OF MARS HOMAGE COVER!

These items are completed and ready to ship. All we need are the funds to help cover the printing, restocking, delivery and marketing costs. Baring any outrageous occurrences these books will ship on or ahead of schedule.

I always keep in contact with my Backers and deliver quality items, carefully packed to arrive in excellent condition.

story:
It is important to note that you do not have to select one of the perks to be able to donate. By pressing the ‘Back It’ button, you are able to input any amount you choose without selecting one of the perks. If you are accessing this page via a mobile device then please scroll down to the bottom of the perks list instead and select ‘Make a Contribution’.

ASTROPHILE: NIRVANIC REPERANDO is a fantasy graphic novel inspired by cosmic horror and metaphysics. Think of a place where Stranger Things, Power Rangers, Hereditary, and Grant Morrison are thrown into one universal story of light against darkness. In ASTROPHILE's universe, bad vibes have robbed the world of all color, and negative thoughts can turn people into monsters. The story follows Rukiya, a biracial woman who is slowly succumbing to the darkness and joins a god who seeks to restore color to the universe by embracing one's truth and open-mindedness.

The IndieGoGo campaign is not "all-or-nothing," so there will be a guaranteed project foundation when it completes. You WILL get the complete story.  We’ll start with a digital release of 105 full-color pages, but stretch goals will include print versions and bonus artwork.

Aimed to help and inspire young adult audiences to take the reins of their lives, Astrophile serves you with social commentary in a psychedelic space with essences of horror.

ASTROPHILE was born out of the meeting of minds of Wu Allah-Fernandez and Jade Foss and is illustrated by twins Santiago and Martin Porro.

Now, we want nothing more than to be able to reach more people to inspire them to embrace their truths. All we need is a little help from others who share our ideas and thought processes to get this graphic novel off of the ground. Who doesn’t want to fight off cults, toxic societal norms, and kick some monster and alien ass?

 

Without giving away too much of our story we wanted to introduce you to the inclusive and incredible characters of our story and why we think this is such an important story to tell.

Aadhirai - A total queen who rocks a hijab and an asymmetrical jacket, Aadhirai is an Arabic transwoman who is a standup comedian. She is bold, colorful and very opinionated. Aadhirai prides herself on her ability to speak her truth and help others embrace themselves and their truths as well. She holds nothing back and will help you better yourself.

Rukiya - In a world of sameness, Rukiya struggles to find herself, what she is meant to do and who she is meant to be. Being a strong, mixed race, plus-size woman has always put her in the face of adversity, but with her family pushing for her to join them in being the same as everyone else, she takes great pride in finding her voice and learning to push back.

Talutha - A warm and bright electronic DJ, Talutha is an introvert who thrives and lives in their loneliness. Being Native American and nonbinary has brought them struggles, but nothing has ever felt more like home to them than being on their own making music to help people fight against a world forcing them to be the same. 

Vithara - A strong Cambodian man who finds himself stuck between a rock and a hard place. Growing up in the slums was never easy, but Vithara made it out and managed to find a good place for himself. This, however, brought thick walls that he struggles to break down in order to find friendships as he lives behind the mask of his hero complex.

Fli-Lo - What brings people together better than an alien who leads a cult? Nothing. And Fli-Lo knows this, which is why he is on Earth recruiting people. Uncanny and fluid in his self-identity, Fli-Lo is teaching people to accept their destiny and find their way to the cosmos. Self acceptance and open-mindedness flow through his words and body, but what happens when all of this is threatened, and who is he to fight to maintain it?

Wu Allah-Fernandez is no stranger to writing about the weird, psychedelic, and metaphysical as Xey believe that is where the purest form of truth resides. Wu has established Xyr craft with freelance experience rooted in writing queer cyberpunk erotica and mobile text adventure games. In the aftermath of these experiences, Wu has dedicated Xyr time to becoming a gateway for the world(s) and characters that scream for their story to be told, hoping that the content Xey writes will help those find a deeper understanding of self and be their true essence, without imagination limitations. Besides Astrophile, Wu will have two fiction pieces published in the indie zine Scarlett Leaf Review and soon release the psychedelic comic  AMERICHINO with Xyr brother. Wu looks forward to "transcribing" the stories of Xyr mind's eye to help those accept their own "weird."

Jade Foss is a 20-year-old writer, screenwriter, and comic book writer. When it comes to the strange and unusual, Jade loves it. Her specialization is in horror writing and she has been working hard to get her claws into writing horror novels, films, and comics. Outside of writing horror she has an extensive collection of cosplays and special effect makeup. Besides Astrophile, she's working on developing her own horror audio drama and a horror novel series with extensive lore.

Santiago and Martín Porro have been reading comics since they were five, and drawing them from before that, always doing it in tandem with one another. As they motivated and encouraged each other, their drive to create only grew, and it's never stopped twenty years later. Santiago is an art professor and an art major, while Martín is a colorist, but also a linguist with English studies, literary editor and copyeditor.

-Up to $5000: PRINT edition shipped to Tiers 2 and higher. 

-Up to $6000: Custom illustrations done for Tiers 3 and higher.

story:
Preview Pages (1 - 6) :

 

Art by Troy "Mistah Mahvel" Torres 

 

Additional Art, Lettering and Colors by Katherine Ellis

 

Charger is the story of Matt McCutchin, a teenage boy who suffered tragedy early on in his life. Since then, he has used that pain to challenge bullies and stand up to those who would treat others as beneath them! When a freak accident puts him into a coma for six months, Matt quickly develops incredible electric superpowers! With the help of some unlikely allies, and hearing the call to action, he takes to the streets and becomes the superhero known as Charger - named after his late father, Marcus "Charger" McCutchin! Charger becomes an instant star and Matt is suddenly sucked into the celebrity life he despises, but at what cost? Especially if it means losing sight of who he is!? Just who is pulling this costumed crusader's strings!? Find out in the first issue!

 

 

 

 

 

 

             Cost Breakdown

 

 

 

 

 

Trying to make a comic book is not easy, so supporting this project's debut will greatly help this series' kickoff! Stretch goals to come with your continued patronage!

story:
What's Broke Down and 4 Dead Bodies About?

After years of being on the bottom, Randy and Denver are finally on their way to being “Made Men”. Someone had other plans and now a simple drop has them broke down on the side of the road with four dead bodies.


Written By: Travis Gibb (Negative Burn, Government Bodies) 
Pencil and InkBy: Felix Novara (Kittarou Witch Hunter, Argo 5) 
Colors By: JW Sims (Omni)
Lettering By: Jérôme Gagnon (Tellos: the Mike Wieringo Tribute, Vol I & II)
Cover ColorsBy: Davi Comodo (Mirror’s Edge, Evil Dead)
Additional Cover Art & Color By Karl Moline (Buffy, Avengers Arena, Loners, Superboy)

What exactly do you get with BROKE DOWN AND FOUR DEAD BODIES #1?  

BROKE DOWN AND FOUR DEAD BODIES #1 is a 32-page comic in standard American comic size, on high-quality gloss paper. 

Backers get various cover options from Felix Novara and Karl Moline

Includes 30 pages of story. 

Plus loads of additional bonus content in the Deluxe Digital PDF!


Who will love BROKE DOWN AND 4 DEAD BODIES?

Fans of crime movies like Pulp Fiction, Usual Suspects, or Snatch 

Fans of crime comics like Sin City, Stray Bullets, 100 Bullets, and Criminal

Fans of crime television like Sopranos, Prison Break, and Sons of Anarchy

People who like crime noir/crime fiction

People who like long, swearing rants

Broke Down and 4 Dead Bodies is a story about violence, vengeance, and really bad decisions.

5 PAGE PREVIEW
 

Need More? Read the first 10 pages HERE

 

 

Travis Gibb - Comic Writer Origin: Rochester, New Hampshire (USA) Hobbies: Comic Books, Movies, Videos, Meatloaf, Motivational Speaking Status: I have been working in comics off and on for 15 years. I have been blessed to work on books such as Negative Burn (Yes, the book that launched Brian Bolland, Alan Moore, P. Craig Russell, Dave Johnson, Dave Gibbons, Mike Wieringo, Terry Moore, Brian Michael Bendis and Neil Gaiman), Government Bodies, and local imprint Space Coast Comixx. I am blessed to have a wonderful wife with two awesome daughters. I own a successful web design company that has been around for 10 years. But while I spend lots of time building other people's dreams every day, it's the time in my life to help create one of my own.  

Felix Novara: Pencils, Designer Origin: Magelang, Indonesia Hobbies: Drawing, Sports, Gaming Status: Happy, Married with three sons... okay, been in this comic industry for almost 15 years, have several books published by an Indonesian major label Gramedia, and also by a few U.S. based Indie publishers. Motorcycle enthusiast and right now training and encouraging myself to achieve taekwondo black belt… ^_^;  

JW Sims: Colorist Origin : born: Blairsville, Pa resides: York, Pa Birth (age) : October 1974 Hobby : Comics (obviously), movies, video games, cosplay, collecting my fandoms JW is the founder of HOOLIGAN ALLEY COMICS, artist and colorist. He has been working full-time in comics since 2014 and has been colorist on several indie titles: ASTRAEA: GODDESS OF JUSTICE [aka SINFUL JUSTICE], POLICE STATE, & DARK STORM (coming soon) as well as several titles from Hooligan Alley Comics. JW has also done some promotional work for major comic companies over the years. JW’s work on the upcoming title OMNI (from Hooligan Alley comics) has been a labor of love and perseverance this past 2 years as he has battled cancer.

Jérôme Gagnon - Letterer Origin: Montreal, Quebec Status: Like the Bat or the Devil of Hell's Kitchen, after his work day's done, like a vigilante in the night, Jérôme wears another costume: The one of letterer & colorist! Seeking new challenges in his work as a graphic designer, Jérôme started to learn more about these two art forms. The hours of practice and the constant lack of sleep finally paid off.

Davi Comodo - Color Covers Origin: Salvador, Bahia (Brazil)  Hobbies: Beer and Friends, playing guitar, Marvel Movies, comics/anime/movies/games from 90s and 80s Status: A professional colorist who has been drawing all his life. In 2012, after a few years in advertising as a designer, Davi left his job, a classical guitar college, and a rock band to work on his childhood dream: Comics and Illustration. His published works includes “Battle Star Gallactica: Starbuck” (Dynamite), “Evil Dead 2” (Spacegoat Publishing), “Starcaster” (Ctrl+Alt+Del), “Starcraft Battlegrounds” (Red Bull/Blizzard), “Mirror’s Edge: Exordium” (Dark Horse) and “Power Rangers” (BOOM!).

story:
Comic creator Ben Dunn has long wanted to see a resurgence of the classic superhero genre; a return to the kind of comics we saw in the silver and bronze ages. It was that desire that inspired him to launch the Superverse. 

This graphic novel will lay the foundation to the Superverse. However, it is not just another superhero book. In fact, it’s something entirely new and different. The story begins in the gritty streets of 1975 New York City. We meet Detectives Frank Barnes and Joe Reeds as they try to uncover why Cal Martin, a former actor famous for playing the character Rocket Man, was murdered in a cheap Uptown hotel. But what starts as a noir,  Starsky-and-Hutch-style murder/mystery, gradually morphs into a fantastic adventure that will open the doors to the Superverse.

What is the Superverse? 

The Superverse is a new line of super hero comics that began in the pages of Jungle Comics (recently featured here on IndieGoGo) and now continues in Public Domain.  It is our intent to create a shared universe that will merge public domain heroes from the 1940’s and 1950’s with a fresh wave of new, creator owned heroes from the 2010’s.  But we need your help to get there. Pledge today and bring the Superverse to life!

Check out these covers!

The softbound edition will feature a cover by artist Dell Barras.  The hardbound edition you have the option to upgrade to one (or more) slip covers including art by Fred Hembeck, Dell Barras, Ben Dunn and David Hutchinson.

 

Dell Barras (cover A)Actual cover

The Creative Team

Ben Dunn   Co-Creator 

David Furr   Co-creator, Writer and Letterer

Dell Barras   Pencils and Inks

Gerilou Smith   Colors

Shannon Smith   Finishes and Digitals, Crowd Funding Manager and Designer

 

Risks & Challenges

We are coming off a very successful campaign in Jungle comics #1 with Chuck Dixon and Kelsey Shannon(which you can still contribute to right now). The perks for Jungle Comics are outstanding!   We are looking to build off of that exciting campaign.  You can help to   make this campaign bigger and better,  in a way you are helping to build the Superverse.  The  Risks are minimal in this campaign.. We have Issues one and two ready and are halfway through issue three.   Dell Barras is a machine when it comes to pumping out quality pages. (The hard part is keeping up with him on the colors) So come along for the ride, this is the ground floor for the Ever-Growing Superverse!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give but want to help us (or even if you do give and want to help more) please spread the word.  Tell your friends about this project, and let people know on social media.  Word of mouth is the best endorsement.

story:
Short Summary

Hi All,

You're helping fund the production of BILLY BOY #3 By Frank Forte.

BILLY BOY is the story of a deranged delusional boy who lives in a fantastical world of monsters, creatures, demons, ghosts and goblins.  His only friend i his little teddy bear "teddy" who he carries around with him like a security blanket.  Billy is constantly teased by the other kids and is considered an outcast.  Billy goes off on his own adventures, but soon finds himself in precarious situations.

Billy Boy #1 and #2 were published by Asylum Press in the early 200s.  Billy Boy #3 is almost done!

Frank Forte is an artist, writer and storyboard artist. His credits include: Bob's Burgers, 3 Below (Trollhunters spin-off), Truth or Dare, Insidious:The Last Key, Despicable Me 2, The Emoji Movie, LEGO Guardians of the Galaxy, LEGO Star Wars:The Empire Strikes Out, The Super Hero Squad Show, Heavy Metal Magazine and more. His paintings have been exhibited at La Luz de Jesus Gallery, CASS Contemporary, Copro Gallery and Arch Enemy Arts among others. Frank is also the publisher at Asylum Press (www.asylumpress.com), an indy graphic novel and comic book publisher. Frank's website is: www.frankforte.com.

SAMPLE PAGES FROM BILLY BOY#1

SAMPLE PAGES FROM BILLY BOY#2

SAMPLE PAGES FROM BILLY BOY#3

Here are some of the interior pages almost completed

What We Need & What You Get

Billy Boy #1 & #2 were completed years ago and #3 was started and never completed. The sketches for Billy Boy #3 have been started. Kickstarter funding is needed for:

1. The time to complete 32 pages of comic book art. I can do roughly a page a day, drawing and adding graytones if I can work undisturbed. I will post the page progress as I do them.

2. I also need the raise the funding to print the comics. I'd like to do a run of a few hundred so I can match a Billy Boy #3 with the rest of the Billy Boy #1s and 2s soI can sell them as a set at conventions after the KS is complete. After that I have a new series called BILLY BOY COMIX AND STORIES #1 (which I'd also like to Kickstart).

3. Promotion. Billy Boy #3 will need some promotion though facebook and google ads.

4. Conventions and store signings. Some of the funds raised will be used for travel expenses to do a convention and comic book store signing tour.

5. Storage. Funds needed to store the books so my house isn't overrun by comic book boxes.

6. Web Comic. Funds needed to help fund the new Billy Boy web comic.

THE PERKS

The Impact

Funding Billy Boy #3 will help make an impact on Indy comics.  I will be able to distribute this comic to various comic stores and finally be able to sell Billy Boy 1,2 &3 as a set.  My next fundraiser will be for a Billy Boy Trade paperback collecting Billy Boy 1,2,3 and many other stories that haven't seen print.

  • Billy Boy (The Comic)  is valuable to the contributor and to the world because it shows an indy creator can be successful with the help of dedicated fans
  • I have been moderatELy successful in publishing comics in the 90s and early 2000-s. I had to take a break from comics because my storyboard work in animation and film was very time consuming--no time for comics!! I'm committed to getting back into comics, but I need your help..
  • If this funding is successful it will allow me to make even more comics.

Risks & Challenges

The art for the book is almost done.  I need about 2 more weeks to finish.  I need the funds for printing, shipping, conventions, marketing and promotion.  I'd like to have Billy Boy #3 for Wondercon and ComicCon 2020.

  • Printing
  • Comic Storage
  • Marketing & Promotion
  • Convention expenses
  • Advertising

Other Ways You Can Help

if you can't help financially, please just share this link on social media--sharing goes a long way--and remember--Sharing is caring!!!!

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about this Billy Boy campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, blogs, forums!!

Thanks for all your help

 

Frank

If this funding is successful it will allow me to make even more comics.

Other Ways You Can Help
if you can't help financially, please just share this link on social media--sharing goes a long way--and remember--Sharing is caring!!!!

Please get the word out and make some noise about this Billy Boy campaign.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
Share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, blogs, forums!!

Thanks for all your help Frank

story:
Aztec of the City issue # 5 ''Tales of Tenochtitlan''

 

The First Mexican-American superhero...which made its premier on Cinco de Mayo, 1993 at the Fairmont Hotel in San Jose, CA...Returns this summer with a 22 page story about life in Tenochtitlan, years before the Conquest of Mexico by the Spaniards

As a young teenager in junior high, I worked at Collector's Corner comic book shop, which further fueled my love and passion for the Marvel comic book universe of superheroes. In elementary school, I published a one sheet sports page that was distributed to three 6th grade classes. Something I wanted to do after working as a San Jose Mercury News paper boy.

As a sophomore in high school, I was in charge of the sports page and by my junior year, I was editor in chief of the bi-weekly 12 page San Jose High School Herald newspaper. 

We look forward to printing this historic and visually entertainng epic tale about Aztec life before the Conquest with our hopes and continued goal of giving Mexican-American, Latino comic book fans, a hero of their own. 

For the first time in our history,  we will include the names of everyone who helps our campaign, printed on a page in the comic book, specifically thanking them for their contribution. 

We expect to print 3,000 copies which has been what we have always done in the past with every issue dating back to 1993. All of whom, have all sold out, except for our volume III series, where we still have comic books available of #1, 2, 3 and # 4. 

 

Our Indiegogo crowdfunding goal is $3,000 USD

Aztec of the City is a 32 page black and white comic book with a cover price of $2.99

youtube Trailer videos of the Aztec of the City, and Super Chicano superheroes are also part of what we have been doing as we anticipate an Aztec of the City film being produced some day in the near future. 

 

  "You'd be hard-pressed to find someone as passionate about storytelling as Fernando Rodriguez. His love of history, mythology and comic book lore blend together in a way that not only entertains, but educates the reader. I've had the good fortune of having enjoyed the Golden, Silver and Bronze Ages of comic books. Now, with Fernando's Aztec of the City, I have the privilege to experience the beginnings of what I like to call, the 'Latino Age of Comics'."
 ~ Lee Villatoro
story_txt:
Aztec of the City issue # 5 ''Tales of Tenochtitlan''
 
The First Mexican-American superhero...which made its premier on Cinco de Mayo, 1993 at the Fairmont Hotel in San Jose, CA...Returns this summer with a 22 page story about life in Tenochtitlan, years before the Conquest of Mexico by the Spaniards
As a young teenager in junior high, I worked at Collector's Corner comic book shop, which further fueled my love and passion for the Marvel comic book universe of superheroes. In elementary school, I published a one sheet sports page that was distributed to three 6th grade classes. Something I wanted to do after working as a San Jose Mercury News paper boy.
As a sophomore in high school, I was in charge of the sports page and by my junior year, I was editor in chief of the bi-weekly 12 page San Jose High School Herald newspaper. 
We look forward to printing this historic and visually entertainng epic tale about Aztec life before the Conquest with our hopes and continued goal of giving Mexican-American, Latino comic book fans, a hero of their own. 
For the first time in our history,  we will include the names of everyone who helps our campaign, printed on a page in the comic book, specifically thanking them for their contribution. 
We expect to print 3,000 copies which has been what we have always done in the past with every issue dating back to 1993. All of whom, have all sold out, except for our volume III series, where we still have comic books available of #1, 2, 3 and # 4. 
 

Our Indiegogo crowdfunding goal is $3,000 USD
Aztec of the City is a 32 page black and white comic book with a cover price of $2.99
youtube Trailer videos of the Aztec of the City, and Super Chicano superheroes are also part of what we have been doing as we anticipate an Aztec of the City film being produced some day in the near future. 

 
  "You'd be hard-pressed to find someone as passionate about storytelling as Fernando Rodriguez. His love of history, mythology and comic book lore blend together in a way that not only entertains, but educates the reader. I've had the good fortune of having enjoyed the Golden, Silver and Bronze Ages of comic books. Now, with Fernando's Aztec of the City, I have the privilege to experience the beginnings of what I like to call, the 'Latino Age of Comics'." ~ Lee Villatoro

story:
Who We Are

  • My name is Audrey. I wrote Leaves. Our lead artist is the incredible Kate Carleton. But we also have Crystal Hutcheson, Joe Burke and Caleb WIlliams who have provided graphic design, poster design and concept art!

    What Is Leaves?
  • Leaves is a Whedon/Lost-inspired independent comic. The story follows a loner woman with severe emotional trauma who must fight the advances of a mysterious inter-dimensional being by taking a journey into his world to discover how he operates.

    We Need...
  •  $5000.00 to fully fund a first printed issue and sell it at a booth at Megacon Orlando 2017. But we have four budget options depending on how much money we raise. 
     

    Other Ways You Can Help

  • I've had the experience of wishing I could support a campaign in the past and just not being able to do so financially. If that's you, you can still help! 
     
  • Spread the word via social networking about our campaign, especially to your fellow friends and family who enjoy comics. We think we'd do well with the Buffy crowd, people who love Stranger Things, LOST and anyone who loves Neil Gamain, Clive Barker, Douglas Adams or string theory.

Who We Are


My name is Audrey. I wrote Leaves. Our lead artist is the incredible Kate Carleton. But we also have Crystal Hutcheson, Joe Burke and Caleb WIlliams who have provided graphic design, poster design and concept art!What Is Leaves?

Leaves is a Whedon/Lost-inspired independent comic. The story follows a loner woman with severe emotional trauma who must fight the advances of a mysterious inter-dimensional being by taking a journey into his world to discover how he operates.We Need...



 $5000.00 to fully fund a first printed issue and sell it at a booth at Megacon Orlando 2017. But we have four budget options depending on how much money we raise.  Other Ways You Can Help


I've had the experience of wishing I could support a campaign in the past and just not being able to do so financially. If that's you, you can still help!  
Spread the word via social networking about our campaign, especially to your fellow friends and family who enjoy comics. We think we'd do well with the Buffy crowd, people who love Stranger Things, LOST and anyone who loves Neil Gamain, Clive Barker, Douglas Adams or string theory.

story:
The Idea Behind “Power for Good”

A peek at some of the artwork featured in the calendar.

What do superheroes, charities, and calendars have in common?

They’re all things we love at A Place To Hang Your Cape!

AP2HYC is teaming up with the Anti-Bullying Alliance (ABA) to create a calendar to raise funds for this year’s Anti-Bullying Week. 

The theme of this year's calendar is "Power For Good", the same theme as Anti-Bullying Week. 

10% of all funds raised will be donated to the ABA. In addition, the calendar will be sold in fundraising events around the world to help raise even more funds and support for the ABA.

The artwork featured in this calendar will be created by some of the world’s smallest heroes – kids! Each page will feature a superheroic self-portrait with each young artist showing off their power for good as well as a reinterpretation by a professional artist.

It wouldn’t be an AP2HYC calendar if it didn’t include our trademark nerdy dates. This year, we’ll be adding in dates of important heroic acts (both real and fictional).

So if you love superheroes and hate bullying, this is the calendar for you!

Who are AP2HYC & the ABA?

A Place to Hang Your Cape is a superhero and comic book website dedicated to celebrating heroes big and small. We love mixing our love for superheroes with fundraising for charities, starting with our Spidertember event last year.

AP2HYC is teaming with the Anti-Bullying Alliance, to raise awareness for their Anti-Bullying Week event, November 14-18 2016. The ABA is “a unique coalition of organisations and individuals, who work together to stop bullying and create safer environments in which children and young people can live, grow, play and learn.” 

The Artwork

Our Young People's Choice winner Nik and a work-in-progress from artist Imran Javed's interpretation

We believe in celebrating heroes in all sizes. Each page of the calendar will feature a new hero, complete with superpowers, created and drawn by some of the world’s youngest artists.

We held a contest for kids (age 16 or under) around the world to submit drawings of themselves as superheroes. 12 winners have been selected and their drawings will be reinterpreted by 12 professional artists, with both images appearing together in the final calendar.

We Need Your Support

While originally a simple idea, it hasn't been easy to bring this calendar to life - and that's where you come in!

While the calendar is being made for charity, we do need to cover the production costs for printing and shipping the calendar.

We want to make sure the calendar looks great on your wall and that it arrives in time for the new year. Your funds will help us achieve this goal.

We've worked hard to keep the cost of the calendar down, and spent weeks finding the best printer.

This year's calendar is £10 plus shipping. That's less than £1 per month!

In addition, 10% of all funds will be donated directly to the Anti-Bullying Alliance to support their work to stop bullying and make the world safer for children. 

We’re confident that with your support we can make “Power for Good” a huge success and help children around the world.

Donate today and the calendar will be in your hands by Christmas 2016!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your help to get the word out about our project. In addition to donating, you can help us in other ways:

  • Go out and tell everyone you know about our campaign
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to shout about us on social media!

story:
My name is Sari Qudhaib and I am 29 years old, currently  living in the Netherlands.

I am born in Poland, with a Polish mother and a Irakee father, but when I turned 2 we moved to Sweden. I have a Swedish passport and consider myself Swedish and a citizen of the world.

When I was 20 years old I got a job in Spain, Mallorca, as an entertainer. I did that for about 4 years and then I moved back to the Netherlands with my Dutch girlfriend that I met in Spain.

I'm educated in the Performing Arts, theatre and musicals, but also had a minor in literature and modern art.
Since I moved to the Netherlands I have studied English and I am currently working at a school, teaching high school kids.

I am a big fan of graphic novels and comic books, as long if there is a story to be told.

My project " The Protector " is a story about a refugee father and his son and that is topic that is close to my heart. This is due the fact the  my father was a refugee in the early 1980's and his story is a key element to who I am today.

 I am writing a graphic novel/comic, called the Protector. The theme is a very modern day topic, the refugee crisis.

Its about a father and a son in a war zone and in order to make his son feel safe and make him think about other things than the war,  the father creates a story about a hero called the Protector.

We jump back and forth between the everyday struggle of the father and son and the story about the Protector. In the end they both come together in a very surprising and tragic way.

I have started on writing the novel and I am planning on getting around 110 - 120 pages done. I want it to either become a one single graphic novel or a mini comic series or perhaps both.

At the moment I need financial support to be able to get in touch and hire an illustrator with the same vision of the story as I have.

After that I need the get the copies out there, in other words, funding to get the book published.

This is not a conventional superhero story but first and for most a story of a struggling parent that wants to protect his child from the horrors in their everyday lifes. It is also an hommage to the imagination that lives in every child on the planet and the power of dreaming.

Help me get this story out there, a story of many struggling parents, not only in warzones but also in the first world.

The struggle or potential obstacles in this case is to get the book picked up by a company that believes in the story. There are tons of writers that want to get their work published and read. But I really think that the market needs a story like this at this moment in time and that this story needs to be told!

story:
Hi,

We are a film making collective from Portland, OR.

We consists of a core team of 3 (Christian Wright, A.T. Nguyen and Nikhel Chand) but partner with many other directors, producers, cinematographers, fight choreographers and actors in order to give you the best quality content.

We have always loved comic books and the rich stories they tell, but some of the best story arcs are considered too "risky" for traditional Hollywood. 

Our first fan film was "Agent Grayson", detailing Nightwing's adventures in this world of spies. Next, we want to tell the "Battle for the Cowl" story.

We don't want to do anything if we can't do it right!For that, we need a little bit of help with funding and if you can, we'd really appreciate it! Check out our trailer in the video above!
