story:
CARETAKERS

Do you believe there are other forces at play in the world...perhaps ghostly forces? Do you know anyone who has seen a ghost?  Can a teen outsmart an adult? Now imagine this: you settle down in your favorite chair, dim the lights, light a few candles, pour yourself a comforting beverage and open up our entertaining, funny, spooky graphic novel. A most wonderful time! 

Caretakers is an original story authored by Vancouver writers Harry Kalensky, Davy Longworth and Allan Stanleigh. San Francisco based artist Chloe Dalquist has brought their vision to  life with her imaginative rendering of the Caretakers story. This IndieGoGo campaign gives you the opportunity to bring this story to life!

The Story

Kendra, a sixteen year old aspiring dancer and Jesse, her 12 year old prankster brother are charged with looking after their baby sister Ginnie as their parents must dash away to help out grandma. When baby Ginnie goes missing, Kendra calls her rock and roll guitarist boyfriend Rino for help. His spiritual, vegetarian younger sister, Tact, tags along.

The police, represented by Officer Joanne Friday and her Russian exchange partner Officer Boris Pinsky scoff at their story and offer no immediate help. Tact suggests they search in the old abandoned Stewart mansion. That’s because on the way to Kendra’s house, she thought she heard the gurgle of a baby coming from beneath the overcoat of either Miles or Davis, two crafty yet rather inept criminals. Tact watched as they scampered towards the Stewart mansion. Living in this old mansion are three frustrated ghosts. Rosemary Stewart was an accomplished Hollywood actor, singer and dancer. Otto von Auspouf was her choreographer and Brian Germaine was an up-and-coming special effects wizard. All three died in the mansion under mysterious circumstances. They have been trapped in the ghostly state for a half a century. Caretakers is a delightful blend of ghostly spookiness, teenaged shenanigans, slapstick comedy, ballroom dancing and ninjas. It’s a tale where the teenagers, using their natural curiosity and openness to new experiences and ideas, discover that they understand the situation better than the adults.

This story is in the tradition of ‘Home Alone,’ and other stories where the kids succeed against the adults in their world.  

The Creative Team

The writers have, collectively, over a century of writing, film-making, acting and musical experience. Harry hails from an extensive background in playing music, acting in musical theatre, songwriting and script writing. Davy has acting credits in more than 90 feature films, television and stage appearances. And he’s one of Canada’s foremost cowboy poets. Allan has written or co-written 12 screenplays, developed scripts on contract and has also taught film-making and writing to children. Chloe Dalquist is an accomplished comic artist, graphic designer and creator, publishing her own graphic novel series and working in collaboration on Caretakers and  other projects.

The Reel Write Bros. 

(left to right) Davy Longworth, Allan Stanleigh, Harry Kalensky

The Artist ​   

Artist and Graphic Designer: Chloe Dalquist


Our Intent

As storytellers and artists, our goal is to provide you with quality entertainment through words and images: a graphic novel. It’s a chance for us to put a smile on your face and create some laugh-out-loud moments. If Caretakers can bring joy to your life and you feel that reading our graphic novel is time well spent, then this project will be a success. 

So What’s The Money For?

Through magic and sorcery and ghostly intervention, we have managed to put together enough funds to create the first two books of Caretakers.   

Now we need your help to complete this project. Here is an opportunity for you to enjoy an entertaining graphic novel while supporting an international team of creators. We are appealing to brilliant people like you who love the intrigue of other-worldly tales, to help us complete this series. 

With your generous assistance, we’re looking to raise $10,000. Here’s how the funds breakdown:

68% of the money will be going to the artist to create all of the original artwork in the third graphic novel plus the cover art. We feel very strongly that the artist should be fairly compensated for her hard work and exceptional talent. 

22% of the money will go towards printing Caretakers Book Three and the hardcover edition. 

5% of the money will pay for our costs in fulfilling the promises in this campaign. 

6% of the money goes to IndieGoGo to cover their well earned fees in helping us achieve our publishing goals.  

Here’s Where You Come In!

We’ve created a whole cauldron of exciting incentives that you’ll receive when you contribute to our Caretakers IndieGoGo campaign. And remember, it's the holiday season! Contributing to our campaign will make a delightful, surprising gift for someone special to you. 

Boo!

Pledge $10.00 or more: Receive a  personal ‘Thank You’  on a special page on our website and a ‘Thank-You’ printed on an acknowledgement page in Caretakers Book Three. It will also appear in the final book, which will be a combined copy of Books One, Two and Three. 

Delivery Date: On the website - within 21 days after the closing of this campaign                  

In Book Three - upon publishing - June 2018 

In the final paperback combined volume - September 2018            

In the final hardcover combined volume - December 2018

More Boo!

Pledge $15.00 and receive copies of 3 original artworks in 8" X 11" format AND a 'Thank-You' posted on a special page on the website AND a 'Thank-You' printed on a special page in Caretakers Book Three, the combined new paperback volume of Caretakers and the limited edition hardcover edition of Caretakers. Art to be sent within 15 days of the end of the campaign. 

Delivery Date: On the website - within 21 days after the closing of this campaign                  

In Book Three - upon publishing - June 2018 

In the final paperback combined volume - September 2018            

In the final hardcover combined volume - December 2018

Don’t Open That Door!

Pledge $20.00 or more:  A pdf copy of Caretakers Books One and Two to be delivered within 21 days of the closing of the campaign. And a pdf copy of Caretakers Book Three to be delivered in June 2018. 

Haunted!

Pledge $30. and receive a copy of Caretakers Book One and Caretakers Book Two AND Caretakers Book Three which will be published by June 2018. The first two books will be shipped within 21 days of the close of the campaign and Book Three once it's printed in June 2018. 

Ghostly Happenings!

Pledge $50.00 or more: A paperback copy of Caretakers Book One and a paperback copy of Caretakers Book Two PLUS a paperback copy of Caretakers Book Three AND a set of 5 original Caretakers bookmarks AND three 8” X 11’’ copies of original full color art by the artist and a digital PDF of all three books.

Delivery Date: The bookmarks and the art to be shipped 21 days after the end of the campaign. Caretakers Books One and Two to be shipped 21 days after the end of the campaign.  Caretakers Book Three to be shipped in June 2018. PDF copies of Caretakers Books One and Two to be shipped within 21 days of the end of the campaign and the PDF of Caretakers Book Three to be shipped June 2018.

The Original Bookmarks

 The Original Art

Much Too Scary!

Pledge $75.00 or more: A copy of the final paperback edition of Caretakers, which will be a combined volume of all three paperbacks, signed by the authors AND a paperback copy of all three Caretakers books AND a pdf of all three Caretakers books AND a set of 5 Caretakers original bookmarks AND the three 8” X 11’’ copies of original full color art by the artist. 

Delivery Date: The bookmarks and the art to be shipped 21 days after the end of the campaign. Caretakers Books One and Two to be shipped 21 days after the end of the campaign.  Caretakers Book Three to be shipped in June 2018. PDF copies of Caretakers Books One and Two to be delivered within 21 days of the end of the campaign and the PDF of Caretakers Book Three to be delivered June 2018.

The final paperback edition of Caretakers will be delivered by September 2018. 

Bones Are Rattling!

Pledge $100 or more: A limited, numbered and signed by the authors, hardcover edition of Caretakers. This book will consist of the combined Caretakers Books One, Two and Three AND  the set of three 8” X 11’’ copies of original full color art by the artist, Chloe Dalquist AND the five original bookmarks. 

Delivery Date: The bookmarks and the art to be shipped 21 days after the end of the campaign. The hardcover copy of Caretakers to be shipped in December 2018 or sooner. 

P..P..Please Don’t Turn Around……!

Pledge $150. or more: Choose any character from the Caretakers graphic novels and our artist will sketch an original 9 X 12 rendition of that character for you.

In addition to the character art, you will also receive the limited, numbered and signed by the authors, hardcover edition of Caretakers. This book will consist of the combined Caretakers Books One, Two and Three. AND a set of the 5 Caretakers bookmarks AND the three 8” X 11’’ copies of full color original art by the artist. 

Delivery Date: The bookmarks and the 8" X 11" art to be shipped 21 days after the end of the campaign.  The hardcover edition to be delivered in December 2018 or sooner.

The artwork of the Caretakers character chosen by you will be delivered in July 2018 or sooner.

Immortalized: The Light Edition

Pledge $150. and you can become  a character in Caretakers Book 3 and also in the combined paperback edition of Caretakers and the special edition hardcover. You will also receive a 9 X 12 portrait sketch of that character, signed by the artist, Chloe Dalquist. And you will receive the  five bookmarks AND three original 8 X 11 copies of original art AND paperback copies of the Caretakers Books AND a special 'thank you' on our website and the three books to be published in 2018. Delivery: Your character sketch Sept. 2018. Caretakers Book 3 - June 2018. Bookmarks, art, Caretakers 1 & 2 mailed 21 days after campaign ends.

Become Immortalized (but not by becoming a ghost)!

Pledge $200.00 or more:      

Our artist will create a character in your likeness that will appear in the graphic novel, Caretakers Book Three. You will also receive a 9 X 12 portrait sketch of that character, signed by the artist, Chloe Dalquist.  You will also receive the limited, numbered and signed by the authors, hardcover edition of Caretakers AND a  set of 5 Caretakers bookmarks AND the three 8” X 11’’ copies of full color original art by the artist.  

Delivery Date: The bookmarks and the 8" X 11" art will be shipped 21 days after the close of the campaign.  The original art with you as a character in the book will be delivered to you by September 2018 or sooner. The hardcover copy of Caretakers will be delivered in December 2018 or sooner.  

Every contributor in all categories will receive a ‘Thank You’ on the special Credits Page of our website and a page printed in Caretakers Book Three and all final, combined versions of the book.

 

Stretch Goals

We will put our full attention on marketing and promotion of Caretakers. Part of our marketing will be attending major Comic Expos in Canada and the US. 

Risks & Challenges

We are very confident that we will reach our IndieGoGo goal and will work very hard to succeed. But confidence does not guarantee success. 

If we don’t reach the goal, all rewards will be honored. If we do not reach our goal,  we will look to printing fewer books, thereby saving money. If we raise less than our goal, it will also mean we will have less expense in fulfilling our promises (fewer contributors to reward) and will have less in fees to pay to IndieGoGo.

Our Experience in Publishing

The writers have, for the past 7 years, published a graphic novel series entitled USNA: The United States of North America. This series consists of four books and all have been published. As the creative team behind USNA, we are confident we can take Caretakers to the next step.

For more information about USNA visit:  http://www.usna.ca

(Please note that the artists for the USNA series are different than Caretakers). 

The Promise:

Complete transparency: The creators of Caretakers will be ready to answer any questions and concerns you may have regarding this project during the entire campaign period and after. We'll be actively updating our Facebook Page and Twitter Feed with information regarding the artwork in Caretakers Book Three, the printing of the new books and the timing of shipping. We will  also send to you eMails with this information. Please feel free to message us at any time on Facebook/Twitter or by eMail.

Our publishing company, West Ghost Publishing Inc. is a federally incorporated company in Canada. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

The best thing you can do for us (besides making a pledge) is to share this campaign with your friends and family. Every dollar and every share helps! 

You can support us by:

    •    Liking our page on Facebook, and sharing it with friends who might be interested

    •    Following us on Twitter, and ReTweeting the posts you like

    •    Visiting and sharing our website, where you can learn more about Caretakers 

It's the holiday season! Contributing to our campaign will make a delightful, surprising gift for someone special to you. 

Thanks for taking the time to visit our IndieGoGo Campaign!

Independent publishing relies on the support of fans like you.
story_txt: CARETAKERSDo you believe there are other forces at play in the world...perhaps ghostly forces? Do you know anyone who has seen a ghost?  Can a teen outsmart an adult? Now imagine this: you settle down in your favorite chair, dim the lights, light a few candles, pour yourself a comforting beverage and open up our entertaining, funny, spooky graphic novel. A most wonderful time! Caretakers is an original story authored by Vancouver writers Harry Kalensky, Davy Longworth and Allan Stanleigh. San Francisco based artist Chloe Dalquist has brought their vision to  life with her imaginative rendering of the Caretakers story. This IndieGoGo campaign gives you the opportunity to bring this story to life!The StoryKendra, a sixteen year old aspiring dancer and Jesse, her 12 year old prankster brother are charged with looking after their baby sister Ginnie as their parents must dash away to help out grandma. When baby Ginnie goes missing, Kendra calls her rock and roll guitarist boyfriend Rino for help. His spiritual, vegetarian younger sister, Tact, tags along.The police, represented by Officer Joanne Friday and her Russian exchange partner Officer Boris Pinsky scoff at their story and offer no immediate help. Tact suggests they search in the old abandoned Stewart mansion. That’s because on the way to Kendra’s house, she thought she heard the gurgle of a baby coming from beneath the overcoat of either Miles or Davis, two crafty yet rather inept criminals. Tact watched as they scampered towards the Stewart mansion. Living in this old mansion are three frustrated ghosts. Rosemary Stewart was an accomplished Hollywood actor, singer and dancer. Otto von Auspouf was her choreographer and Brian Germaine was an up-and-coming special effects wizard. All three died in the mansion under mysterious circumstances. They have been trapped in the ghostly state for a half a century. Caretakers is a delightful blend of ghostly spookiness, teenaged shenanigans, slapstick comedy, ballroom dancing and ninjas. It’s a tale where the teenagers, using their natural curiosity and openness to new experiences and ideas, discover that they understand the situation better than the adults.This story is in the tradition of ‘Home Alone,’ and other stories where the kids succeed against the adults in their world.  The Creative TeamThe writers have, collectively, over a century of writing, film-making, acting and musical experience. Harry hails from an extensive background in playing music, acting in musical theatre, songwriting and script writing. Davy has acting credits in more than 90 feature films, television and stage appearances. And he’s one of Canada’s foremost cowboy poets. Allan has written or co-written 12 screenplays, developed scripts on contract and has also taught film-making and writing to children. Chloe Dalquist is an accomplished comic artist, graphic designer and creator, publishing her own graphic novel series and working in collaboration on Caretakers and  other projects.The Reel Write Bros. (left to right) Davy Longworth, Allan Stanleigh, Harry KalenskyThe Artist ​   Artist and Graphic Designer: Chloe Dalquist Our IntentAs storytellers and artists, our goal is to provide you with quality entertainment through words and images: a graphic novel. It’s a chance for us to put a smile on your face and create some laugh-out-loud moments. If Caretakers can bring joy to your life and you feel that reading our graphic novel is time well spent, then this project will be a success. So What’s The Money For?Through magic and sorcery and ghostly intervention, we have managed to put together enough funds to create the first two books of Caretakers.   Now we need your help to complete this project. Here is an opportunity for you to enjoy an entertaining graphic novel while supporting an international team of creators. We are appealing to brilliant people like you who love the intrigue of other-worldly tales, to help us complete this series. With your generous assistance, we’re looking to raise $10,000. Here’s how the funds breakdown:68% of the money will be going to the artist to create all of the original artwork in the third graphic novel plus the cover art. We feel very strongly that the artist should be fairly compensated for her hard work and exceptional talent. 22% of the money will go towards printing Caretakers Book Three and the hardcover edition. 5% of the money will pay for our costs in fulfilling the promises in this campaign. 6% of the money goes to IndieGoGo to cover their well earned fees in helping us achieve our publishing goals.  Here’s Where You Come In!We’ve created a whole cauldron of exciting incentives that you’ll receive when you contribute to our Caretakers IndieGoGo campaign. And remember, it's the holiday season! Contributing to our campaign will make a delightful, surprising gift for someone special to you. Boo!Pledge $10.00 or more: Receive a  personal ‘Thank You’  on a special page on our website and a ‘Thank-You’ printed on an acknowledgement page in Caretakers Book Three. It will also appear in the final book, which will be a combined copy of Books One, Two and Three. Delivery Date: On the website - within 21 days after the closing of this campaign                  In Book Three - upon publishing - June 2018 In the final paperback combined volume - September 2018            In the final hardcover combined volume - December 2018More Boo!Pledge $15.00 and receive copies of 3 original artworks in 8" X 11" format AND a 'Thank-You' posted on a special page on the website AND a 'Thank-You' printed on a special page in Caretakers Book Three, the combined new paperback volume of Caretakers and the limited edition hardcover edition of Caretakers. Art to be sent within 15 days of the end of the campaign. Delivery Date: On the website - within 21 days after the closing of this campaign                  In Book Three - upon publishing - June 2018 In the final paperback combined volume - September 2018            In the final hardcover combined volume - December 2018Don’t Open That Door!Pledge $20.00 or more:  A pdf copy of Caretakers Books One and Two to be delivered within 21 days of the closing of the campaign. And a pdf copy of Caretakers Book Three to be delivered in June 2018. Haunted!Pledge $30. and receive a copy of Caretakers Book One and Caretakers Book Two AND Caretakers Book Three which will be published by June 2018. The first two books will be shipped within 21 days of the close of the campaign and Book Three once it's printed in June 2018. Ghostly Happenings!Pledge $50.00 or more: A paperback copy of Caretakers Book One and a paperback copy of Caretakers Book Two PLUS a paperback copy of Caretakers Book Three AND a set of 5 original Caretakers bookmarks AND three 8” X 11’’ copies of original full color art by the artist and a digital PDF of all three books.Delivery Date: The bookmarks and the art to be shipped 21 days after the end of the campaign. Caretakers Books One and Two to be shipped 21 days after the end of the campaign.  Caretakers Book Three to be shipped in June 2018. PDF copies of Caretakers Books One and Two to be shipped within 21 days of the end of the campaign and the PDF of Caretakers Book Three to be shipped June 2018.The Original Bookmarks The Original ArtMuch Too Scary!Pledge $75.00 or more: A copy of the final paperback edition of Caretakers, which will be a combined volume of all three paperbacks, signed by the authors AND a paperback copy of all three Caretakers books AND a pdf of all three Caretakers books AND a set of 5 Caretakers original bookmarks AND the three 8” X 11’’ copies of original full color art by the artist. Delivery Date: The bookmarks and the art to be shipped 21 days after the end of the campaign. Caretakers Books One and Two to be shipped 21 days after the end of the campaign.  Caretakers Book Three to be shipped in June 2018. PDF copies of Caretakers Books One and Two to be delivered within 21 days of the end of the campaign and the PDF of Caretakers Book Three to be delivered June 2018.The final paperback edition of Caretakers will be delivered by September 2018. Bones Are Rattling!Pledge $100 or more: A limited, numbered and signed by the authors, hardcover edition of Caretakers. This book will consist of the combined Caretakers Books One, Two and Three AND  the set of three 8” X 11’’ copies of original full color art by the artist, Chloe Dalquist AND the five original bookmarks. Delivery Date: The bookmarks and the art to be shipped 21 days after the end of the campaign. The hardcover copy of Caretakers to be shipped in December 2018 or sooner. P..P..Please Don’t Turn Around……!Pledge $150. or more: Choose any character from the Caretakers graphic novels and our artist will sketch an original 9 X 12 rendition of that character for you.In addition to the character art, you will also receive the limited, numbered and signed by the authors, hardcover edition of Caretakers. This book will consist of the combined Caretakers Books One, Two and Three. AND a set of the 5 Caretakers bookmarks AND the three 8” X 11’’ copies of full color original art by the artist. Delivery Date: The bookmarks and the 8" X 11" art to be shipped 21 days after the end of the campaign.  The hardcover edition to be delivered in December 2018 or sooner.The artwork of the Caretakers character chosen by you will be delivered in July 2018 or sooner.Immortalized: The Light EditionPledge $150. and you can become  a character in Caretakers Book 3 and also in the combined paperback edition of Caretakers and the special edition hardcover. You will also receive a 9 X 12 portrait sketch of that character, signed by the artist, Chloe Dalquist. And you will receive the  five bookmarks AND three original 8 X 11 copies of original art AND paperback copies of the Caretakers Books AND a special 'thank you' on our website and the three books to be published in 2018. Delivery: Your character sketch Sept. 2018. Caretakers Book 3 - June 2018. Bookmarks, art, Caretakers 1 & 2 mailed 21 days after campaign ends.Become Immortalized (but not by becoming a ghost)!Pledge $200.00 or more:      Our artist will create a character in your likeness that will appear in the graphic novel, Caretakers Book Three. You will also receive a 9 X 12 portrait sketch of that character, signed by the artist, Chloe Dalquist.  You will also receive the limited, numbered and signed by the authors, hardcover edition of Caretakers AND a  set of 5 Caretakers bookmarks AND the three 8” X 11’’ copies of full color original art by the artist.  Delivery Date: The bookmarks and the 8" X 11" art will be shipped 21 days after the close of the campaign.  The original art with you as a character in the book will be delivered to you by September 2018 or sooner. The hardcover copy of Caretakers will be delivered in December 2018 or sooner.  Every contributor in all categories will receive a ‘Thank You’ on the special Credits Page of our website and a page printed in Caretakers Book Three and all final, combined versions of the book. Stretch GoalsWe will put our full attention on marketing and promotion of Caretakers. Part of our marketing will be attending major Comic Expos in Canada and the US. Risks & ChallengesWe are very confident that we will reach our IndieGoGo goal and will work very hard to succeed. But confidence does not guarantee success. If we don’t reach the goal, all rewards will be honored. If we do not reach our goal,  we will look to printing fewer books, thereby saving money. If we raise less than our goal, it will also mean we will have less expense in fulfilling our promises (fewer contributors to reward) and will have less in fees to pay to IndieGoGo.Our Experience in PublishingThe writers have, for the past 7 years, published a graphic novel series entitled USNA: The United States of North America. This series consists of four books and all have been published. As the creative team behind USNA, we are confident we can take Caretakers to the next step.For more information about USNA visit:  http://www.usna.ca(Please note that the artists for the USNA series are different than Caretakers). The Promise:Complete transparency: The creators of Caretakers will be ready to answer any questions and concerns you may have regarding this project during the entire campaign period and after. We'll be actively updating our Facebook Page and Twitter Feed with information regarding the artwork in Caretakers Book Three, the printing of the new books and the timing of shipping. We will  also send to you eMails with this information. Please feel free to message us at any time on Facebook/Twitter or by eMail.Our publishing company, West Ghost Publishing Inc. is a federally incorporated company in Canada. Other Ways You Can Help:The best thing you can do for us (besides making a pledge) is to share this campaign with your friends and family. Every dollar and every share helps! You can support us by:    •    Liking our page on Facebook, and sharing it with friends who might be interested    •    Following us on Twitter, and ReTweeting the posts you like    •    Visiting and sharing our website, where you can learn more about Caretakers It's the holiday season! Contributing to our campaign will make a delightful, surprising gift for someone special to you. Thanks for taking the time to visit our IndieGoGo Campaign!Independent publishing relies on the support of fans like you.

story:
After Lee Gardens, a bitter and selfish young woman learns she's been named legal guardian of her developmentally disabled twin brother Harvard, her plans to be rid of him for good are ruined after finding herself trapped within the imaginary world of his creation. 

Harvard Gardens: Volume One,  the first volume in a four volume comic, tells the story of Hailey "Lee" Gardens, a young woman who has turned her back on her family and her past. Upon learning of her mother’s death, Lee returns home, hoping to attend the funeral, collect her inheritance, and return to her life; however her plans are thwarted when she is informed that her mother has named her the legal guardian and caregiver of her younger, mentally handicapped brother, Harvard who's disability has left him with the mind of a child. Making matters worse, she forced to contend with her estranged ex-husband, Tom, and Harvard’s devoted caregiver, Clara. 

Faced with the challenge of finding the best solution for each of them, Lee concludes that a mental institution is the best option for her brother and despite Tom and Clara’s protests, Lee delivers a confused and scared Harvard to the institution upstate. Rid of her responsibilities, Lee is free to resume her life, that is, until a car accident puts her in the hospital. Once awake, Lee realize she isn’t in the hospital, but instead, trapped within the imaginary world her brother has spent a lifetime creating. 

Lee soon discovers that her brother, who has vanished, is the only one who can return Lee to her world. What’s worse; a hoard of dark creatures and an unseen force have begun an attack upon her brother’s world, consuming everything in their path. Forced to accompany Harvard’s closest confidant, the slender gentleman Nigel, a brave and icy captain named Agathon and a mysterious young Empress named Invia in their search for Harvard, Lee must find and save her brother while making unlikely connections and facing some of her darkest secrets she had hoped would stay buried.

The story is a dramatic, action packed journey through a bizarre and beautiful world. However, despite being set primarily within Harvard's imaginary world, the story and its main character, Lee, are forced to confront more than just bizarre creatures and monsters. Harvard Gardens addresses real world issues such as childhood abuse and trauma, parental neglect, abandonment, developmental disabilities, LGBT issues and mental health issues. By way of Lee's journey through her brother's imagination, the story examines themes such as the dynamic amongst siblings, the relationships between children and their parents, forgiveness, self sacrifice and ultimately, the inevitable death of innocence all individuals must face.

With this campaign, I'm hoping to raise $46,000 to cover the cost of printing and marketing HG: Volume One. Once printing is completed and pledge perk rewards are distributed, I plan to launch a hard marketing campaign to get comic into the hands of some well known comic book companies and/or publishers as well as in front of as many comic book fans as possible. The long-term goal is to create buzz and build a positive following so that, depending on it's reception, I can dive right into completing Volume Two and down the road, Volumes Three and Four which I've already written and even begun illustrating a bit.  

I realize the amount I'm campaigning for could seem hefty but after doing quite a bit of research, I came to the conclusion that the process can be expensive and it would be best to aim for larger number to combat both the foreseen and unforeseen expenses. If anyone has been to a comic book or pop culture convention as an artist or a trade professional, you're aware of just how expensive it can be. 

Big picture wise, my dream is to eventually combine and release all four volumes as a hardcover graphic novel with early sketches, concept art and a forward from myself regarding the inspiration for the story. Each volume will be illustrated in a different style. I've learned over the last few years that I tend to draw in different styles depending on the project, sometimes without even thinking about doing so before hand. I thought it would be interesting to approach each chapter of the story with a different style befitting of the current theme. 

(Examples of my go to styles below)

HG: Volume One will be a 64 - 74 page paperback comic at the standard 7x10.25 dimension and will be printed, doubled-sided, onto high quality matte paper in full, vivid color. 

The plan is to send the comic off to the printers in late January/early February of 2018.  The printing process will take anywhere from 2 - 3 months for the proofs, printing and shipping to be completed. This means I'll probably be getting the books around May 2018.  

If you're not familiar with IndieGogo or crowdfunding in general, here's how it works. 

For the next 50 days, you'll be able to make contributions to help support HG: Volume One, ranging anywhere from $5 to whatever your little hearts desire without having to sell your organs on the black market as I've considered doing. You'll be able choose from one of the perks listed on the right, corresponding to the amount you wish to donate. This means you're not only being an amazingly generous and supportive person, you'll be receiving cool stuff as proof of jus that! 

The campaign is a Flexible Funding campaign which means, even in the event that I do not meet my ultimate goal, whatever funds are contributed will still go toward making the comic a reality and perks will still be sent out!

Once the campaign period is completed and IndieGoGo and PayPal take their fees, I'll be starting the printing, marketing and distribution process as well as mailing out pledge perks such as digital volumes, artwork, merchandise, etc.  

In exchange for your support and generosity, you'll be able to choose between a number of Rewards and some really amazing Packages which are all listed on the right, so pick your favorite! 

If this campaign goes over its funding goal, I already have several ideas for additional perks: future volumes, more page, special limited editions, original artworks, posters, t-shirts, etc.

Shipping costs are already built into most of the perks. However perks that are sent out internationally will most likely require the additional shipping cost. 

If you still have questions, don't be afraid to ask: I will be setting up a Q&A tab within the next few days.  

As I mentioned, the story of Harvard Gardens is my baby. I've birthed it, molded it, resented it, shamefully neglected it at times, scolded myself for not treating it better and ultimately loved it immensely for the last 15 years. And its not just because drawing and story telling are my passions; this project is personal to me because it touches on many subjects that have directed affected my life. It deals with issues that I have struggled to understand and overcome such as depression, mental illness, traumatic childhood events, a dysfunctional home life and abandonment. In many ways, I am both the characters of Lee and Harvard. 

Furthering my career and making a name for myself as an illustrator and a storyteller within the comic book and entertainment industries are obviously very important to me but with this project, its more than that. In 15 years, to desire to tell this story has not wavered one bit. I have to tell this story it seems. With your contribution, I just might be able to finally do so properly. 

Obviously I'm not capable of promising anything regarding the fate of this comic. I'm not perfect and I'm new to the process of self publishing so I'm going to make mistakes along the way. I can only say that I care about this project and I want it to go far and I remember the people who help me along the way.

I'm lucky to have some insight and some friends and colleagues with experience in both self publishing and crowdfunding and intend to make a success Out of this project. However I realize by asking and accepting contributions, I'm responsible to my supporters as well.

If at any time you have concerns regarding your investment (because that's what this is) please do not hesitate to reach out to me and we can address your concerns together.

Even if you're unable to contribute, you can still make a huge difference and help me make HG: Volume One happen by sharing this campaign across social media.

Look for the IndieGoGo Share Tools at the top of the page. And of course there's your personal Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, Tumblr, Pinterest, good ol' fashioned emails, Harry Potter style messenger owls, black magic summoning rituals (no blood)--whatever it takes to help spread the word!

FOLLOW HARVARD GARDENS: VOLUME ONE ON SOCIAL MEDIA!

Facebook: @HarvardGardensComic  www.facebook.com/HarvardGardensComic

Instagram: @harvardgardens_comic  instagram.com/harvardgardens_comic

Twitter: @Harvard_Gardens  twitter.com/Harvard_Gardens

Website: harvardgardenscomic.com

IMDb (Christopher Ables): imdb.com/name/nm2885831/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1

YouTube: youtube.com/user/chrismarm21

I'm Christopher Ables, the illustrator and writer of Harvard Gardens. I've been working as an illustrator and graphic artist since moving from San Antonio, TX to Los Angeles, CA twelve years ago. I received degrees in Studio Arts and Digital Filmmaking which granted me the opportunity to work on some amazing projects with some extremely talented people such as Sony Picture’s Spider-Man 3 and 20th Century Fox’s 28 Weeks Later and The Hills Have Eyes 2. From there I went on to work for a television production company called Shine America for several years before branching out and creating my own freelance business which I still operate today.  

Currently I'm the Senior Motion Graphics Designer for the visual effects company, Ingenuity Studios based in Hollywood. Outside of work, I’m currently developing an animated series and writing several pilots as well as completing this comic. In my free time, I can be found drawing, sensing incoming intense weather patterns, quoting lines from 30 ROCK and The Golden Girls, carrying on meaningful conversations about Harry Potter, Jurassic Park or Lord of the Rings, finishing off an entire cake with little to no shame and falling in love with every dog I see… Every. Dog. I. See.

To learn more about my work, you can visit the following links.

artstation.com/chrisables 

facebook.com/chrisablesart

Shane McKean works within television production, is a lover of seedy history and all things true crime, and has a passion for proof reading. 

Lauren Wyckoff is a former television professional who has decided to save the world, one social media post at a time. She lives in Seattle, is a huge Chris Ables fan and an aspiring author herself. 

Finally and most importantly, THANK YOU! This comic cannot happen without your support. Every bit of your generosity and enthusiasm helps makes my dream of seeing Harvard Gardens come to life and being able to share it a reality!

-Christopher Ables

For any publication based inquiries or general information, please do not hesitate to contact me at contact@harvardgardenscomic.com or chris.ables@gmail.com.

And of course there's your personal Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, Tumblr, Pinterest, good ol' fashioned emails, Harry Potter style messenger owls, black magic summoning rituals (no blood)--whatever it takes to help spread the word!FOLLOW HARVARD GARDENS: VOLUME ONE ON SOCIAL MEDIA!Facebook: @HarvardGardensComic  www.facebook.com/HarvardGardensComicInstagram: @harvardgardens_comic  instagram.com/harvardgardens_comicTwitter: @Harvard_Gardens  twitter.com/Harvard_GardensWebsite: harvardgardenscomic.comIMDb (Christopher Ables): imdb.com/name/nm2885831/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1YouTube: youtube.com/user/chrismarm21I'm Christopher Ables, the illustrator and writer of Harvard Gardens. I've been working as an illustrator and graphic artist since moving from San Antonio, TX to Los Angeles, CA twelve years ago. I received degrees in Studio Arts and Digital Filmmaking which granted me the opportunity to work on some amazing projects with some extremely talented people such as Sony Picture’s Spider-Man 3 and 20th Century Fox’s 28 Weeks Later and The Hills Have Eyes 2. From there I went on to work for a television production company called Shine America for several years before branching out and creating my own freelance business which I still operate today.  Currently I'm the Senior Motion Graphics Designer for the visual effects company, Ingenuity Studios based in Hollywood. Outside of work, I’m currently developing an animated series and writing several pilots as well as completing this comic. In my free time, I can be found drawing, sensing incoming intense weather patterns, quoting lines from 30 ROCK and The Golden Girls, carrying on meaningful conversations about Harry Potter, Jurassic Park or Lord of the Rings, finishing off an entire cake with little to no shame and falling in love with every dog I see… Every. Dog. I. See.To learn more about my work, you can visit the following links.artstation.com/chrisables facebook.com/chrisablesartShane McKean works within television production, is a lover of seedy history and all things true crime, and has a passion for proof reading. Lauren Wyckoff is a former television professional who has decided to save the world, one social media post at a time. She lives in Seattle, is a huge Chris Ables fan and an aspiring author herself. Finally and most importantly, THANK YOU! This comic cannot happen without your support. Every bit of your generosity and enthusiasm helps makes my dream of seeing Harvard Gardens come to life and being able to share it a reality!-Christopher AblesFor any publication based inquiries or general information, please do not hesitate to contact me at contact@harvardgardenscomic.com or chris.ables@gmail.com.

story:
Hi, my name is Chase Kantor. I've had an idea to write and produce a comic about the story behind the deck of cards for the past six years. After years of painstaking work, I've been finally able to realize that dream. But we're not done yet. We're just beginning. And today, I'm going to make you believe in that dream as well.

The purpose of this campaign is to get the comic in the hands of its fans: you. You've clicked on this link, so I know you're already interested. Growing up, I loved the feeling of buying a new comic; holding the glossy pages in my hand, carefully turning them with trepidation. That's what I want to bring to our audience: the thrill that comes from owning something, putting it on your shelf, feeling it with your fingers. But like everything in life, this doesn't come free.

This comic is the definitive tale about the story behind the deck of cards. The land, once unified under a single banner, has been divided into four territories, each territory ruled by a family. The Diamonds, wealthy and corrupt; the Clubs, strong and resourceful; the Hearts, ambitious, though loyal to a fault; and the Spades, hard and merciless. All of whom desire power about all things.

Centuries of bloodshed have won a tenuous peace between the families. To prevent another war, the Four of a Kind, an order of wise and holy men, have been entrusted to keep the peace at any cost. Each King is watched closely by a member of this conclave. Though, like all things, corruption has inevitably spread through their ranks. The land, yet again, finds itself poised on the edge of total war.

Our story begins with Jack, the Prince of Spades, and heir to the Spade Kingdom. Jack, disregarding the advice of his life-long tutor, David Tell, takes on the responsibilities of Minister of Executions, a position usually followed by "early retirement". But Jack is eager to prove himself to his people and, above all, his father, the King. When a certain band of gypsies who call themselves The Euchre begin terrorizing the Spade Kingdom, Jack makes it his personal mission to see their leader on his gallows.

To cover the costs of printing and distribution, we need to raise $5000. I know what you're thinking: that seems like a lot, especially for an indie comic. If you've ever self-published a comic or book before, you understand that it's way more expensive than you anticipate. The delivery costs alone are staggering. But we've crunched the numbers on this a few dozen times already and the most cost effective option for everyone involved is printing in bulk.


Let's get to the cool stuff already: what you, the fans, get out of supporting The Saga of the Jack of Spades. Well, for starters, you can get the first issue of the Comic, signed by the artist and author. Not enough? Take a look at our perk structure. We've got lots of cool goodies lined up from posters and original artwork to custom-printed card decks. Still not excited? How would you like to be drawn into the comic? A few early backers will get the chance to appear in subsequent issues as a character - drawn in your likeness - that accompanies The Jack of Spades on his swashbuckling adventures.
Any leftover funds will be used towards creating the perks and, funding permitting, getting a head start on the second issue.
If we don't reach our goal - no, it's okay, it happens and we won't take it personally - we'll continue on as planned, only fans will have to wait a little longer for the next issue.


Here's the thing: with every dollar you donate to this campaign, you're really funding a six-year long dream. Over that time, this comic - the story and the characters in this world - has become a labor of love. I live and breathe this universe. There's no other story like it out there. It's literally one of those ideas where you say to yourself, "That has to already exist." Well, with your help, now it can.
When this campaign achieves its goal, we'll be that much closer to delivering the next installment of The Saga of the Jack of Spades. The more funds we raise, the faster we can produce comics; it's that simple.
If you loved the swashbuckling adventure romps of the 30s and 40s, Errol Flynn, or - as The Princess Bride put it - stories about "fencing, fighting, torture, revenge, giants, monsters, chases, escapes, true love, miracles... " and cards, then you're going to dig this comic as much as we do.

If you can donate any amount, you'll make the world of difference to our project. If you can't, we understand; but please share our story on Facebook, Twitter, and any social media I'm too old to understand.

We'll continue to add updates as the campaign progresses. If you have suggestions for our book, perks you'd like to see, etc. please write to us. We love hearing from the fans.



I'd like to take a moment to extend a very sincere thanks to the following people, without whom this labor of love would never have gotten even this far:

Jared Kantor

Alicia French

Sylvia Moon

Tyrel Lougheed

Erin Bouman

Daniel Schneider

Stephanie Chan

Kate Finnegan, 

Happy Harbor Comics for their generosity and use of their store, and

Vishaal Rajani.

story:
www.Hoshruba.World

To signup and subscribe for your monthly comic book or animated video please visit http://www.Hoshruba.World

Talisman of Hoshruba

WBT Productions is very excited to bring to you comic book series called "Talisman of Hoshruba". This epic story is 1000 years old and fictionally takes place in the year 600AD in the region of Persia and Caucasus mountains. This story never came to the West. It is about a magical world called Hoshruba, full of wizards and witches and mystical creatures. There is an epic war going on between the Muslims and Wizards of Hoshruba. 

About WBT

WBT Productions has been in business since 2010. Our team started working together on various media projects in 2004 and finally we established our own production studios. WBT has produced a feature film, many corporate commercials and videos for eBay, Yahoo and Paypal. We have done music videos for various bands and many TV shows over the years. Check out our work at http://WBT.Productions

WBT is forming a new team to produce comic books and 2D hand-drawn animations. Our artists have previously worked at Disney animations studios, Sony studios, Marvel and DC comics. This campaign is to bring first comic book series out in May-June 2016 time-frame.

What We Need & What You Get

We are offering, in this campaign, monthly comic books series Talisman of Hoshruba and related gift items. There are various levels but we are really excited to offer the first and maybe only time, a lifetime subscription with free shipping.


We are also giving out Mugs and T-shirts based on this comic book series:


With the money raised from this campaign we can launch our comic book series. Our goal is to bring to you the whole 48,000 page original story in the comic book form and later bring out the movies and games based on this epic story from the East. We expect this series to go on for a very very long time...

Act now and sign up for subscription level that best works for you and enjoy the special gifts only available through this Indigogo Campaign.


Other Ways You Can Help

We have already gathered a world class comic book production team. Our biggest challenge is distribution. We are going to be self-distributing initially and show the world that this story has the draw for the audience to compete with the world famous stories of Aladin, Ali Baba, Harry Potter and Lord of the Rings. This will give us the visibility in the rarefied world of Marvel Comic and DC Comics.
After signing up yourself, please share this campaign (using indigogo share tools) and tell all your friends about it. Post it on your Facebook and Linkedin wall, tweet about it, email your friends the link here, post on groups you regularly post on, tell your international friends with Whatsapp, share the poster and video on Pinterest, Instagram, Snapchat, Flickr, Tumblr, Reddit...

If you know any media people, tell them about us. Share the link to this campaign with them...

story:
A promise is a promise. But for Michael Langer, his fateful pact with the sorrowful ghosts of his past may just mean his doom.  His childhood home of Heslev Manor in Denmark hides a dark secret... a malevolent force is growing in strength and Michael may be the only one that can stop it.

From the wickedly creative minds of writer Lars Kramhøft and artist Tom Kristensen of Denmark comes MADE FLESH, a 124 page, full color graphic novel. The story of Made Flesh is a deviant tour de force of serial killer horror and supernatural terror. It has a uniquely European style that takes the reader away to the Danish countryside and the evils lurking within small town history.  The gritty and raw art style of MADE FLESH underlines the psychological dread of this dark tale. The resulting marriage of text and imagery makes for a viscerally frightening experience that has no equal.


Lars Kramhøft and Tom Kristensen are a writer/artist team living and working in Copenhagen.

Lars Kramhøft is a writer whose fiction has been published in a number of Danish anthologies. His work has also been featured in such publications as "The Lovecraft E-zine" and "Siren's Call".

Tom Kristensen is a professional illustrator that has worked with a wide array of visual storytelling. He has worked within the realms of natural history and children's books, but his darker side bleeds through in the medium of comics.

Made Flesh is Lars and Tom's first in a series of projects together. After self-publishing their work in Denmark, they were bestowed The Danish Horror Award in 2013. Since then they have toured the comic conventions of the world, finally allowing them to find a home for their hideous creation at Evil Jester.

We at Evil Jester Comics are giving this project all the love and attention it deserves. Our co-founder and lead editor, Taylor Grant, has been working alongside editor Aric Sundquist, and contributing editors and proofreaders, Erik Zagarello and Briana Onishea, to assure this creepy and horrifying comic is ready to be received by the masses when it releases. 

INTRODUCTION BY JONATHAN MABERRY

JONATHAN MABERRY is a New York Times best-selling and multiple Bram Stoker Award-winning horror and thriller author, editor, comic book writer, magazine feature writer, playwright, content creator and writing teacher/lecturer. He was named one of the Today’s Top Ten Horror Writers. His books have been sold to more than two-dozen countries.

ONE INTERIOR PAGE REVEALED EACH WEEK 

Over the next four weeks, keep checking back as we reveal four pages of this terrifying story, giving you a sneak peek at just how stunning the illustrations and story are. Here is the very first page for week 1:

 Page 2 Revealed


Page 3 Revealed:

Page 4 Revealed:



COOL REWARDS:

$5 Pledge: Receive an Ebook of our premier graphic anthology, EVIL JESTER PRESENTS #1.

EVIL JESTER PRESENTS ISSUE #1: SAMPLE PAGE

EXCLUSIVE ONLY REWARDS : 

11X17 POSTERS:



SIGNED PRINTS:

Comic Illustrator & Artist, Tom Kristensen, from Denmark, arrives in NY earlier this month. He  brought along 20 illustrated prints from the comic, signing each one for our Indiegogo campaign. You rock, Tom!!

 






EVIL JESTER'S LONG LOST BROTHER:


(L to R.) Bryan Andrew, John Whalen, Trevor Firetog, Erik Zagarello, Charles Day, Catherine Matta, Joseph Sigillo. Additional team members not shown in this photo, but most will also be a part of our dinner.


EVIL JESTER PRESS is a successful publisher of award-winning and Bram Stoker Award® nominated horror novels. Many of our fans have talked about their love of the comic medium and the subsequent lack of quality horror comics being published nowadays.  

We decided to do something about it. 

While most major comic publishers are focused on superheroes, we thought it would be a good idea to finally put the power in the hands of all the great horror fans out there. All of us at EVIL JESTER COMICS have made it our mission to work in tandem with horror fans and come together create something we all want...

Kick ass horror comics! 


WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP: As you might imagine, producing a graphic novel is both expensive and labor intensive. We at EVIL JESTER COMICS make it point to pay everyone fairly for their hard work. That includes the awesomely talented author and artist, the editors and proofreaders who edit our comic scripts, and the rest of the team, not to mention our printing and marketing costs, which for a graphic novel runs in the thousands.

We want you to know EVIL JESTER COMICS is a lean operation and we're not asking for more money than we absolutely need. We are so confident in the success of MADE FLESH that our only profits will come from sales. We invite you to see for yourself!

That said, we hope you'll join us in supporting MADE FLESH. We need your help to PROMOTE THIS INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN! In return, we will be GIVING AWAY FREE STUFF to everyone who has pledged $10 or more!!  Below is a list of FREE things that will get added to your pledge rewards as we reach our goals. Please share this campaign with anyone and everyone! Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Blogs, Websites... EVERYWHERE!! The more you share the quicker you will unlock more stuff, and of course, help us make this dream a reality. Thank you again.

Here's what's up for grabs which will be unlocked if we reach each tier: 

$5,000 -  We will add exclusive content to the MADE FLESH comic like original sketches from Artist, Tom Kristensen

CROWS


$7,000 - LOCKED- 

$10,000 -LOCKED - 

We'll add more if we reach this stage! 'Free Stuff' is only available to pledges of $10 and more. MAKE SURE TO VISIT OUR WEBSITE: http://www.eviljestercomics.com and sign up on our email list for a chance to win exclusive prizes from Evil Jester Press and be the first to get updates on our upcoming comic projects.

SHIPPING COSTS:

For our United States based backers, shipping is included in each perk. All backer packages will be shipped via USPS, and most via Media Mail (some Parcel Post).

For our backers outside of the United States, we have additional postage amounts for each respective package dependent on location. 

International Shipping Rates Based on Perk and Location

- Campaign-Exclusive Paperback: Canada & Mexico: $12 | United Kingdom: $20 | Rest of Eurasia: $20 | Australia: $20 | Japan: $20 | Denmark and Everywhere Else: $20

Risks and challenges

Evil Jester is a proven publisher of critically and commercially successful novels and anthologies. We’ve made it our mission to bring that same level of professionalism and work ethic to our comics division.

Though we are excited for the support to get Made Flesh going, we always have contingency plans for if we don’t make our INDIEGOGO goal. One way or another, we’re bringing Made Flesh to life!

As with any project that has this many moving parts and creative team members working in tandem, there is always a chance of slight delay. Rest assured we will do whatever we can to make sure you get the products included in your package in a timely fashion.

We at Evil Jester learned a great deal from our first preliminary campaign. We’ve got the process down to a science now and we’re confident that this campaign will be the one that makes MADE FLESH a reality!

Thank you again for taking an interest in MADE FLESH. We greatly appreciate your support

Risks and challenges

Evil Jester is a proven publisher of
critically and commercially successful novels and anthologies. We’ve made it
our mission to bring that same level of professionalism and work ethic to our
comics division.
Though we are excited for the
support to get Made Flesh going, we always have contingency plans for if we
don’t make our INDIEGOGO goal. One way or another, we’re bringing Made Flesh to
life!
As with any project that has this many
moving parts and creative team members working in tandem, there is always a
chance of slight delay. Rest assured we will do whatever we can to make sure
you get the products included in your package in a timely fashion.
We at Evil Jester learned a great
deal from our first preliminary campaign. We’ve got the process down to a
science now and we’re confident that this campaign will be the one that makes
MADE FLESH a reality!

Thank you again for taking an interest in MADE
FLESH. We greatly appreciate your support

story:
Hi, my name is Patrick J. Reilly, I'm a Brooklyn based Cartoonist and I need funding for a collection of my comic ME! 

It has been well received, with people calling it "Surprisingly Charming" "Weirdly honest and sweet" and "Full of funny T.M.I".


ME is a comic about me writing a comic about myself in a comic about myself. Each issue is self contained and deals with a new topic like Art, Music, Drinking, Dick Drawings, etc... 

I did 8 issues of ME and I've love to get them in more hands and the easiest way is in a trade/ collection format! 

I could sell them in respectable stores! 

Any contribution will help! The more the contribution the better the prize! Just like at the state fair! If you can't help with money, share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, Snapchat or just run up to people on the street and shake them!

When you donate you can get cool rewards like copies of the book, original art work and if you're generous enough, a complete original comic book about You!

Please donate to what CBR is  calling "technically a comic book", ME.

story:
Our Campaign

After our famous Fizzog Productions ‘Dancing Grannies Video' went viral in July 2014  with 1.6 million shares on Facebook, we are now raising funds to take our new comedy theatre show, ‘Fifty Shades of Fizzogs'  to the EDINBURGH FRINGE FESTIVAL August 2015 from 7-13 August. And we need your help to do it!

We are a professional Theatre Company from the Black Country, who specialise in comedy theatre and are passionate about bringing laughter, fun and frolics to audiences far and wide. We also work with the Black Country Museum, performing sketches of days gone by, and promote education through youth theatre.

QUOTES FROM SHOWS:

 “We all saw Barbara Nice at the Glee Club in Birmingham and thought she was hilarious. So we googled her and got a link to the Fizzog '50% Funnier Tour'. We’d never heard of them and didn’t know what to expect but we have all just spent the interval tweeting furiously about the show because we loved it so much. It’s really funny. And Jo was thrilled to win the dettol in the raffle.”

Dan Morrissey, FREE RADIO and friends.


“We saw the Fizzogs in their Christmas panto at the Black Country Living Museum and we loved them, which is why we came to the show. It was brilliant. I’m from Bulgaria and got it completely. Very funny.”

Maria Ollis, Tipton.


Fizzog Productions (www.fizzogproductions.co.uk) has been going from strength to strength for the last 15 years, and have successfully toured the West Midlands with sell-out shows. Our current offering of ‘Fifty Shades of Fizzog’, has been an absolute hit, bringing our best characters and Black Country humour to the stage. 

2014 was a prolific year with the viral video and our sell out shows across the region.  Our unique brand of Black Country humour has been an absolute hit with audiences from across the globe. 

With your help and support,  2015 will be even better. We have already raised some funds and your support to raise the remainder, whether it be through funding or spreading the word about our campaign, is very much appreciated and valued.  Please help us make our dream a reality.


What You Get

Why do we need your help? We are a not-for-profit company and generate all of our earnings from shows, educational workshops and tours. We have already raised some of the funds for Edinburgh, which has helped us to cover some of the costs. We hope that you can help us raise the necessary £3,000.00. 

Where will the £3,000.00 go? It will go towards paying for Venue Hire, Accommodation, Marketing and Publicity, photography, tour costs and travel. 

Your Perks

£10 - you will receive a shout out via social media as well as a personal Thank you via our Website. 

£25 - All of the above plus a Fizzog Keyring, Bumper sticker and signed photo.

£50 - All of the above plus a mention in the Edinburgh Fringe show programme and a Limited Edition EXCLUSIVE pair of Dancing Grannies' knickers.

£100 - All of the above plus 2 free tickets to any Fizzog Show within a 12 month period, as well as a personalised recorded message especially for you from the Dancing Grannies. 

£250 - All of the above plus a signed Edinburgh Fringe poster. 2 x VIP tickets to any Fizzog Show within a 12 month period which will include a glass of champagne and nibbles, a shout out on stage from the Fizzogs and an after show meet and greet backstage. 

£500 - All of the above plus Afternoon Tea at a venue of our choice in our beloved Black Country which will include a "private" Dancing Grannies dance. 


The Impact

Your support will help us significantly by:

  • Helping us put the Black Country on the map
  • Raise awareness about Black Country Dialect and humour
  • Promote women in comedy

We are already having a global impact; in addition to our 1.6 million Facebook shares of our Viral Video, you can also view us on:

  • Top Funniest on American Channel: TruTV on 12th May 2015 at 9pm.
  • NACTV Canada will also be airing our two pilot episodes of our comedy drama, Black by Day episodes 1 and 2 on 8th April 2015 and 13th April 2015 at 8pm

Other Ways You Can Help

 If you're unable to donate, you can still support us by spreading the word about our campaign.

campaign.

story:
Short Summary

We are raising funds for a small, diverse, dedicated, international group of queer cartoonists to travel to attend the Queers & Comics LGBT Cartoonists’ Conference: May 7-8, 2015 at the Center for Lesbian and Gay Studies (CLAGS), NYC.

In order to honor the differing nature of our backgrounds, we have set up this campaign to make sure that not only is economic diversity represented at the conference, but we will be in attendance to represent ourselves. Our group consists of Roberta Gregory, Ebin Lee, Maureen Burdock, Tyler Cohen, Annie Murphy, Soizick Jaffre, and Jiro Ghianni. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $4,500. That is: $3,100 travel costs for seven cartoonists; $900 for creating, shipping, and handling 'perks'; and $500 for Indiegogo processing fees. Any money raised over this amount will go to support the conference. If we do not reach our goal amount, any money raised will be shared evenly between the group, after processing fees and 'perk' costs.
You can donate any cash amount and just leave it at that. OR you can choose from any of our wide array of perks:
Stickers: (pick one of three B&W vinyl stickers below for $5. Or $10 for all three!)

Our Lady Grace sticker ($6, 4"x4")

BOOKS:

ZINES:


The Impact

The impact supporting these seven artists' endeavors could have on the queer comics scene is that of of camaraderie over scarcity; the strengthening of our comics communities (this includes readers, publishers, writers and artists) through the recognition of economic diversity; diversifying the comics scene through sharing the myriad perspectives and experiences that exist under the LGBT comics umbrella.
Check out this awesome comic on TruthOut detailing and questioning the demographics in the world of comics by Anne Elizabeth Moore and Justin Hall.
OUR ARTISTS:
ROBERTA GREGORY
http://www.robertagregory.com/Robertagregory/Home.html

EBIN LEE

http://ebinlee.com/



TYLER COHEN

http://www.primazonia.com/index.html



ANNIE MURPHY

http://grimoirecomics.weebly.com/annie-murphy.html

MAUREEN BURDOCK

http://www.maureenburdock.com/

SOIZICK JAFFRE

http://soizickjaffre.wix.com/site

JIRO GHIANNI 

http://www.thebosoms.com/

More on the Queers & Comics Conference: Queers & Comics will celebrate, explore and analyze queer cartoonists and their work. It will offer LGBT cartoonists, comics writers and artists an opportunity to share information about their craft, to document the history and significance of queer comics, and to discuss how LGBT cartoonists navigate the comics industry.

This forum will spotlight the veterans of LGBT cartooning in North America and internationally, and will examine how queer comics reflect and critique queer culture. Queer comics publishers, editors, journalists, academics and readers are also encouraged to attend.

Contributing to this campaign, you will be actively supporting the need to create a comics community that includes everyone, and broadening the pool of readers being given a chance to read comics by and about people like them.
This campaign is being run by Annie Murphy and Tyler Cohen, with the helpful guidance of Jennifer Camper. Annie Murphy has managed and completed several successful crowd-sourcing campaigns since the phenomenon began, totaling over $35,000. She is a double Capricorn; so your donations are in good hands.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's okay. We totally understand! However, if the spirit moves you and you believe in our campaign to support opportunities for underfunded artists in comics, please share share share. Sharing can REALLY make all the difference ;)

Finally, a great big THANK YOU to Zan Christensen and Northwest Press, Jennifer Camper and Robert Kirby for donating perks!

Sincerest gratitude,

Annie Murphy and Tyler Cohen
